review_body: Basically a La Quinta with a nice lobby. Nothing about the decor or the furnishings is 4 star. Room had cheap lamps/tables and pillows were small/flat. Linens were average at best, and general feel of room was cheap. Staff on the other hand was superb! Location mediocre. If you can stay here for $100 or under, ok, otherwise your overpaying.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I were visiting our adult son, who lives in Austin, so I booked this hotel based on the reviews and the price (which was better than the downtown hotels). I did not realize that this hotel was in the middle of nowhere! We had to Uber everywhere and it was a 20-30 minute drive any place we went. In hindsight, we would have done better to pay more for a hotel downtown after factoring in the cost of all the Uber rides. In addition, there were things we found to be quite odd. For instance, the bathroom doors (there were 2) were louvered doors meant to be closet doors. In other words, it was not a solid door. Once you enter the bathroom, the toilet was separated by a curtain. Sorry....but I prefer privacy! In addition, the second day we were there, our room was never cleaned! The first day, it was not cleaned till 3:30-4:00 pm. You can not walk anywhere (like to a convenience store) because it is located right off a busy bypass so if you wanted a Coke, you had to pay $5 either at the mini-bar or the swim bar as there are no vending machines anywhere on the property and there is no ice machine (you have to call room service). Really, the only nice thing I can say about this hotel (at least for us) was the SIZE of our room and bathroom were spacious. I did not care for the decor (tacky Italian) and the staff certainly did not go out of their way to make our stay pleasant. We will never stay here again.

review_body: Trey is the embodiment of professionalism. I’ve been staying at the granduca with my boyfriend for an entire month over the last six months and Trey has been the sole reason we’ve been back over and over again. He goes the extra mile to build relationships with his clientele and it’s something that we truly appreciate!

review_body: Fabulous location. A little out of town but it’s a short drive to downtown, malls and restaurants. If you would rather be closer to bars and restaurants then you may want to consider somewhere else as there’s nothing else around the Hotel. However, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a conference at the Hotel and while the food was good they did run out during breakfast on occasion but this was sorted out quickly. Overall a lovely place to stay.

review_body: We stayed at this beautiful hotel a couple of nights recently. It really is pretty...but the service was just not up to par with other hotels of this class. We had to ask 3 times to have our room cleaned one day. Although the pool area is beautiful, we never saw an attendant at the bar and people were having to call room service for drinks. That said, the valet/shuttle staff were excellent and as nice as could be!

review_body: Hotel was beautiful! It was the perfect mix of luxury, but without being ridiculously expensive! The little chocolates on the pillow and bottled water were an added plus.:) Our shower actually stopped working in the middle of our stay and the hotel fixed it very quickly! All personnel were very nice too. It was close enough to Austin, but far enough to be out of the craziness. We hope to be back soon!

review_body: This is a perfectly relaxing room, comfortable with all the amenities you could want. The only thing missing was the refrigerator. I'm sure we could have been moved to another room if asked. When checking in, Trey Foster was completely helpful and kind. The room had a little balcony overlooking the hills so you can get nice, fresh air. I loved every bit of this room.

review_body: Good location on a hill. Small pool, Adequate room, with an old TV. Sevice is horrible: try calling room service and you get a call center and often have to leave VM. Took multiple calls to get room service each time, and the wait was 1.5 hours on an average.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived on a Friday at 4:30P, just after check in began. The line was bit long as the staff was dealing with two women who were haggling. I watched and listened to Jeffrey handle the pair so politely and professionally. They asked him at least a dozen times, "Is that really the best you can do for us?" (They wanted rooms across the hall from one another instead of down the hall as assigned.). Jeffrey was calm the entire time - everyone else in the area was very annoyed. We went to our room, unpacked, and returned to the lobby/bar area about 30 minutes later. The women were STILL haggling with Jeffrey. I watched him keep his cool the entire time while also checking in a now long line other guests. We visited with Jeffrey later, and he was so professional. Not one negative thing to say. Jeffrey is a Gem. In the bar and restaurant, we had the pleasure of being served by Ted. We throughly enjoyed him both afternoons/evenings. Such a nice man. Have a great visit at your family reunion, Ted!Room service was fantastic when delivered by Doug. His attitude and smile are outstanding! Our daughter had just graduated from college, and her friends had given her flowers that were laying on the counter. Without being asked, Doug brought a vase with water in it for her flowers! Talk about proactive customer service!Our bed was comfy. Our room was quiet. Short elevator waits. Friendly and efficient valet staff. Beautiful pool area with nice cabanas and drinks. What's not to love?Only one fail -- I requested balloons for our graduation celebration dinner in Visconti twice, and the manager assured me balloons would be at the table. Nothing. I was disappointed.We recommend Hotel Granduca when in the north Austin area.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so pleasantly surprised by this find. Even though I had researched and read previous reviews I was still skeptical. From the moment we were coming up on the curvy driveway overlooking the beautiful hillside I could tell this was going to live up to what others had to say. Front desk: Eduardo was so authentically welcoming. Room: Clean and spacious. Loved the high ceilings. Pool area: I felt like I was vacationing in a Tuscan Villa. There is no detail that hasn't been thought about. We can't wait to come back!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is tucked up and away on a hill off of 360. I had seen it while driving thru Austin multiple times, but had never had the opportunity to stay there. Fortunately, we had a series of meetings between offices that resulted in the Hotel Granduca Austin being the perfect location and it being selected as our hotel for the week. It is a lovely hotel with beautiful grounds. My room was spacious. It was stocked well with coffee, tea and a mini bar that rivaled most others I’d ever seen. Turn-down, towel and ice service was offered every evening as well. Towels were extra stiff, but other than needing some softener, no complaints about anything in the room at all. The weather was perfect during our stay. We were fortunate enough to have time one evening to sit out on the terrace as the sun set. That could easily become my favorite pastime. Such a beautiful setting!With the exception of the doormen that were incredibly rude to Uber driver that dropped me off when I first arrived to the hotel (they were very young and it appeared they were being judgmental and that needs to be addressed), all of the staff were fantastic. My only regret is that I did not have time to enjoy any of the amenities. I will definitely return and stay when I can enjoy without work obligations!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beware. The service here is non existent. Yes the building is nice. But the staff are not properly trained, they are arrogant, and rude. When asking a bellhop named Pierce if I could use one of the three available carts, I figured he would offer to help. Instead he said verbatim, “Oh we can’t let just anyone use these carts, these carts cost 4 thousand dollars.”How rude and unprofessional?Upon seeking resolution with the GM Olivier Glattfelder he ignored both my phone call and text messages. He clearly has no problem with guests being mistreated in his hotel.I then called the hotel and was put in touch with Ryan Dellimuth. I was told this was Pierce’s direct supervisor. It was a bunch of the same, he made no effort to resolve the situation and treated me as if I was no one.If you stay at Granduca Austin, you will see for yourself. The service is pathetic. They claim to be a 4.5 botique hotel. I have had better service at a 2 star hotel.Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. There are so many better options available in Austin.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautiful, rooms are very nice. However we were made to feel like second class citizens at check in. When I went to check in and saw that we had one bed I asked if I could possibly have a room with 2 beds. I was told you booked through hot wire so you have to take the room we assign you. We have you in a handicap one bed room. I’ve never had anyone say anything like that to me when I check into a hotel. It felt very awkward. Like I had done something wrong. She said it nicely but still made me feel second class.

review_body: Charming and sophisticated, very spacious rooms. Environment reminiscent of an Italian Villa. We only stayed 1 night and weather wasn't mild enough for us to enjoy the open spaces, sitting in the internal patio nor enjoying the pool. We did spent some time playing in the game room and enjoyed a very good dinner at the restaurant.

review_body: We booked through Expedia and despite Expedia’s transparent price promise, we had to pay more than our Expedia confirmation stated. Although this has been due to taxes and fees (the room rate has been the same), had we paid in advance, they hadn’t had a chance to charge that. This is just a sign of sloppiness, either on Expedia’s or the hotels side. Upon arrival, we were welcomed with a “oh, you have booked through a third party web side!” So, does that mean; we’re less welcomed? Strange behavior. The whole “compound” where the hotel is located has no street side parking, no public parking and no means to get there with public transport. So, charging for parking is just a hidden room rate. I complained and the hotel staff took the parking fee off immediately. That was extremely nice and it shows that they do welcome our business. The roughly 9 miles ride to downtown Austin goes quick, even in rush hour. Overall, we were satisfied with the stay. Tip: once you have the Booking.com, Expedia etc. quote, check directly with the hotel. You might get a better rate by just calling them!

review_body: This is such a charming hotel and a relaxing change of pace from the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough to enjoy all Austin has to offer. I first stayed here on a business trip and it was such a great experience my husband and I returned for a weekend getaway. The rooms are comfortable and cozy, the views are fantastic, it’s close to good restaurants and hiking and other outdoor activities. Charming bar for cocktail hour and a nice restaurant for breakfast or if you want a fine meal without leaving the property. We recommend and will return.

David was at the front desk and if you see this hats off to you as well. I have never seen staff as attentive as at this hotel.

review_body: We have stayed at the Hotel Granduca several times and always been pleased in all ways with the experience. In checking out this morning, however, we were informed that the hotel will no longer provide customers with a receipt for their room(s) if they booked through a third-party provider rather than directly through the hotel (which typically charges significantly more). Very bad policy to inconvenience customers, who now have to contact the provider to get a receipt confirming their stay and the room charge.

review_body: Our stay at the Hotel Granduca Austin was short - just one night. We booked a room here for our wedding night. While the hotel may have an Austin address, once there you feel far away. The property is well-maintained with impressive views and is so quiet and peaceful. Our room was spacious with a well-appointed bathroom and separate sitting room. Upon hearing we were there for our wedding night, the manager sent champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries to the room. We spent time with our guests in the pool room and outside on the expansive deck. Later we spent some time in the bar and at each stop, we felt welcome. All areas were clean and staff was attentive.

review_body: I booked a Granduca Suite based on the website's description and pictures showing that it had juliette balconies and a soaking tub.Pictures and description on website ARE NOT accurate.What they show as the Granduca Suite is actually the Villa Suite and not what I preferred, booked or paid for.I made reservations well in advance for Saturday lunch at the hotel restaurant Visconti. I arrived to find the restaurant not busy with only about 4 tables of patrons and wondered why...... and then I discovered why.Waited 5 minutes for someone to show up at the hostess stand and then was seated at a dirty table where the half eaten breakfast dishes had still not been removed.Waited 10 more minutes for waters to be delivered all while still sitting at the dirty table.When the waters were delivered the waiter asked if I wanted anything else to drink. I requested a glass of Prosecco......which arrived 5 minutes later and was served warm.I tired of sitting at the dirty table with warm Prosecco and no menus so I decided to leave and go elsewhere in Austin for lunch.I returned to the hostess stand to find someone to tell them I was leaving and had left the full glass of warm Prosecco at the table and would not be paying for it.At the hostess stand I found 6 people waiting to be seated and an additional patron who had already been sitting in the restaurant with a group and had gone to the hostess stand to complain about their service as well.Deciding not to waste anymore time joining the other people lined up to complain -- I left.I actually live in Austin and thought that Hotel Granduca would be a great place to have overflow out of town guests stay as well as a wonderful destination for frequent in town "stay-cations"Unfortunately it proved to be a very expensive and very disappointing experience overall.I will not go back and will not be recommending it to out of town guests.The hotel is beautiful but the service is greatly lacking and at least as for as the Granduca and Villa Suites go -- the descriptions ARE NOT accurate -- so be very careful when reserving a room.

review_body: the property is beautiful and so are the rooms. i was there for a corporate event. room and tax was paid for by the company. front desk didn’t have the necessary payments on file and charged my credit card instead. the hotel should have mentioned it at check-in so i could have taken care of it before check out or simply call the company. nobody has time for that kind of operation. I wouldn’t stay here again, too complicated.

review_body: Been visiting this hotel while traveling for business every other week for the past four months. Never a disappointment, and I'm very particular about hotels, and customer service! The front desk staff, Trey, David, Mechaela and team, are the "absolute best" that I have experienced. During my recent visit, a gentleman that was checking in appeared to be stressing over not having his international charger with him, that is until the front desk clerk assured him that he would do all that he could to locate one for him, which I'm sure he did. The hotel rooms are always spotless and very nice. In my view, Hotel Granduca Austin is absolutely flawless and I would highly recommend it to anyone. Lastly, there is always a special on rates, which makes it acceptable for business and personal travel. Try it, you'll love it! Management is doing an excellent job here!

review_body: My husband and I stayed here during a weekend getaway and it was beautiful. From the time we drove up until the time we left it was nothing short of Awesome hospitality. Location isn't bad and it's not hard to find. The drive up is a little intense due to the many turns but if you drive the speed limit you'll be fine. Parking-to valet it's $34/day but you can self park for $12/day. We opted to self park and didn't have an issue. We drove up so the valet staff could take our bags and then parked. If you take the elevator on the left side you will exit the same level as the hotel, it's an easy walk up. Service-it's very rare to get good customer service but this is one place that doesn't have that issue. The check in went smooth and we were given recommendations for dinner and brunch the next morning. The staff was friendly and helpful. Room- our room was gorgeous and fit the mood for the weekend. We wanted to be able to relax and the room allowed us to do exactly that.Food-we did not eat at the hotel but went to one of the recommended restaurants for dinner one night, Jack Allens. There was a decent wait time but once we got to our table everything went smoothly. I had the 13 spice pasta and my husband stuck to what he knew, a burger. Everything was to our liking, including the warm peach cobbler with ice cream on top. Pool-not large but a decent size, it was extremely relaxing and we were able to take a nap without any interruptions. Now that my husband and I know how easy of a drive it is from Houston to Austin we plan to take many more weekend getaways. Hotel Granduca will be our preferred hotel.

review_body: Great service, over the top accommodations and great views make this hotel perfect for a couples get away! Pool is beautiful with cabanas and a play room off the covered bar. Cabana boys were good at fixing drinks but attended to nothing else! Towels piled high, empty glasses everywhere and the pools restroom was a mess... still, the atmosphere was nice. Ventured out to local restaurants to eat - Cypress Cafe was to DIE for. Check out my review there too. Great stay!

review_body: nice property and easy location if downtown Austin is not your preference. East access to Domain and Barton Creak areas. Clean rooms and hotel well maintained. Car parking is reasonable compared to other hotels, shame there are such high fee's for parking.

review_body: My children attend The University of Texas so we stay in Austin hotels 10 times per year, Last night was the worst hotel experience that I have had in Austin or anywhere else that we have ever traveled. The fire alarms went off twice and both times the fire department arrived. No explanation was given by the hotel staff about what happened. After having to evacuate the hotel at midnight and again at 2:40 am I assumed that the staff would apologize at checkout and offer some type of explanation. I was wrong! No apology was offered. When I asked what happened, they said that they were "investigating" the matter. It is inexcusable for a 5 star hotel to treat guests in this manner. The owners and management obviously care little about customer service. Austin is a great city with a large number of upscale hotels to chose from so I will be taking my business elsewhere. This "5 star hotel" certainly does not come with 5 star service. How did they get their rating???
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had such high hopes with the Granduca in Austin, architecturally tasteful, and well appointed furnishings, but the staff and service, well...that's another story. In order to be put into a room with 2 double beds I was upcharged an additional $30/night. After a long full day of meetings, the woman working at reception gave me the wrong keys to our room which meant a second trip downstairs. You can valet park for $36/night or self park for $12 a night. We opted for the self parking. We ordered room service the following morning, pancakes (lemon ricotta) which were very tasty, and a frittata and apple smoked bacon, All tasted delicious, but for those two dishes with a pot of coffee we were charged just under $90.00 USD. Extremely pricey for what what it was. Saturday night there were two fire alarms (false) one after midnight, the other at 2:40 a.m. Which required having to walk down 8 flights of stairs. I cannot image the elderly guests managing this very easily. The hotel is understaffed, and some of the staff they have are not very well trained. It's unfortunate as I'd like to stay again because of the location, but honestly there are a lot of other amazing properties in Austin that aren't overpriced and have much better trained staff.

review_body: This is really a great property! I got a great deal through Travel Zoo as well. The hotel decor is very pretty and the rooms are spacious. Like others have mentioned, the rooms are very clean, and I'm a very critical hotel guest. The pool, while on the small side, is nice and the cabanas are available at no extra charge (usually unheard of nowadays). However, I did have a few complaints -- the 1st was my safe wasn't working properly. We were gone the whole day, got back around 3:30 and my room hadn't been cleaned yet. We were headed to the pool and I didn't feel comfortable leaving iPads and my purse in there without the safe. So I didn't get my room cleaned. Granted, they left a note stating they tried but didn't since I left the privacy sign out. I probably could have gotten another safe but it would have been a hassle. The 2nd thing that was a little annoying were the door greeters or lack of. We self-parked (which is an awesome free service there) but I felt a little slighted that we weren't greeted each time we arrived and no one offered to open the door? I know, I know, 1st world problems but this is pretty standard at most high end hotels. Lastly, I thought it was weird the server in the pool area never asked me or my daughter if we wanted anything to drink or eat. The self serve water station was nice touch, but I would have totally had at least (2) cocktails if asked (!) Granted, I felt bad there was only (1) server in the entire pool area and she looked busy but there's a huge opportunity to add servers out there to make money when you have people in the pool. Especially in July. Oh, and they ran out of towels (huh?). Good thing we brought our beach towels down there. Again, these are small details. But it would have turned our experience from really good, to really outstanding. But this hotel is definitely worth staying at -- it's great and the views in that area are wonderful.

review_body: A Very nice hotel, great location for views, great, helpful staff, the restaurant service good food and wine, very clean rooms and quite, I am planning on another stay there again soon, also the pool area is nice safe clean and very relaxing

review_body: Just finished a great weekend at the Hotel Granduca. The hotel has beautiful Italian old world charm. The rooms are quaint with tall vaulted ceilings so they feel very spacious. The bathroom was large with a great big shower - excellent for couples! The self parking cost $12 which seemed odd and was not connected to the hotel but otherwise great stay. Close by within a few minute car ride is Wild Basin Preserve. It made for an excellent morning and walk - great views of the rolling hills in the area. There is also a scenic overlook only couple minutes drive that gives an excellent view of downtown Austin (especially gorgeous at night). Really romantic getaway.

review_body: Recently traveled to Vail, CO. Met some fellow travelers. Trey from Hotel Granduca Austin was mentioned for his impeccable service. We could not agree more. Our favorite place to stay while in Austin. Beautiful Hotel with excellent Service. If you stay.. ask for Trey!

review_body: The hotel was quaint. The room was very clean, spacious, and had a separate toilet. No need to valet park...it was easy to self-park. Great location! Close to most everything we wanted to do while we were in town.

review_body: If you want the Tuscany feeling, Granduca HOTEL is the place, gorgeous view, 5 start service.I love the live music on Saturday, I love the the sunset by the pool, very romantic patio with Tuscany felling.

review_body: Many thanks to the nice people at Granduca Hotel for making our Anniversary special! The champagne was a very nice touch! Overall, we found the service very good and the rooms spacious and clean. The pool is a great place to hangout and relax with a cocktail.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was looking for something within easy reach of downtown Austin, but with a rural feel. This sort of does it. Better on the inside than out, on approach its a frankly unpromising 9 story block just off the highway, on what is basically a business park with a multi-story carpark. Rural views... not really rural. But its pretty nice once inside, 4-star is about right. And staff were excellent. I booked a room with a balcony (from the description on this site actually....). But (in short) they have no rooms with balconies, unless you count a full length window with a rail on the far side. Not something you can sit out on & relax - or at all. But on asking about this at check-in, I was upgraded to a suit, so I can’t complain. The only other negative was the bar next to the modestly sized pool. Despite great weather and being the weekend, it was open only very short hours, meaning to have a drink I had to request room service by the pool - slow, and with very high charges. Why? Cutting back of staff maybe? Overall, an enjoyable stay and I would consider returning when in the area, mainly for the great staff. But I would also look at alternatives.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really beautiful hotel. Has a beautiful Tuscan feel with a really pretty courtyard, lobby, billiard room, Service was spotty. Our room was not ready at checkin (we arrived around 1pm). Instead of calling to check on when our room would be ready or offering other accommodations, the front desk personnel acted as if we were inconveniencing her by asking for an eta on when our room would be available. Secondly, it is hot in Texas and like us, many people were enjoying the pool. However, there was no service at the pool. They never opened the bar and we had to track someone down for food and drinks from the upstairs restaurant. The waiter that delivered the food was very nice and helpful and even commented how "they forget about people outside". Overall, it really was a nice stay - just some minor service kinks.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and well appointed hotel. From the welcoming staff at the front desk to the friendly restaurant staff, is is apparent they are very customer service centric. The billiard room on the lobby level is a nice touch and was a great way for our family to wrap up our night. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed with nice furnishings and the large walk in shower was a nice surprise. All in all, I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to other friends and family.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Granduca Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated ten minutes by Uber (7-10 $) from the city center just next to the highway crossing the city. There are plenty of free parking spots just outside. The hotel is shaped as a “U” with a pool in the middle which is nice. The staff at the hotel is friendly. We got the choice if we wanted a room close to the pool or with a view to the city and choose room close to the pool. We had a room with two double beds which are of good size and clean. Room contains fridge but no microwave, safe or water heater. Breakfast is included in price and for being an American hotel it is good (below average if you are used to European breakfasts). You can have waffles, egg and bacon, fruit, sandwiches, juices etc. there is also a small gym and self laundry. The pool area is nice and calm and you do not hear the high way, a small oasis. All in all we liked the hotel. If you are disturbed by a high way close or wish to live in the city center this might or be for you.

review_body: Beautiful hotel. Very friendly. Recommended. Nice restaurant with live music. Staff was friendly. Food was good. Salmon dip was amazing. Prices are affordable. Pool needs a scrubbing to remove lime buildup, but room was clean.

Relaxing and beautiful pool area! The restaurant on-site, Opal Divines, has great food and drink! Loved this place both times I’ve stayed here! Will stay again!

review_body: We enjoyed our stay here a lot. It is an older property but has been updated and looks really nice. The location is very convenient to the most visited Austin attractions. The attached restaurant is a bonus and we had a light dinner there before going out. The next morning we ate the complimentary breakfast buffet. It was delicious and lots of variety. The pool area is large and very pretty. Our room was upgraded to a suite and very spacious and comfortable. Over all, a really nice place.

review_body: This hotel is a comfortable place to stay a few nights in Austin with a few quirks: The hotel layout is pretty weird and it can be confusing to navigate sometimes. It's also an older style of hotel/motel where some of the rooms open to the outside and depending on where you're staying and who's staying in the rooms around you, can get pretty noisy. That being said, the rooms are very nice and well-taken care of. The free breakfast is pretty good and the restaurant/bar attached to the hotel is a fun place to hang out. There's road construction out front right now, but otherwise this hotel is located in a perfect place to get out around south/central Austin with easy access to downtown, East Austin, South Congress, etc. We stay here often when going to events downtown.

review_body: Was only here for a quick overnight trip, but overall a great place to stay. Friendly staff and very clean rooms. Our room was in front of the pool which was a nice view, and no problem loudness. Very convenient location for getting a lyft or Uber.

review_body: I stayed here with 11 of my friends (in 6 different rooms) & our experience was great! Everyone enjoyed the breakfast, the pool & hot tub area was a perfect spot to meet up before we went out everyday, the bar/restaurant on site was nice, & the staff was very helpful. We spent a lot of our time out downtown on 6th Street & East 6th, but getting to/from the hotel with Ubers was close/cheap enough. Would definitely stay here again!

review_body: I really like this hotel. Friendly staff, great value for the price, clean rooms, convenient location if you don't mind taking Uber/Lyft or taxis. it's not fancy, but it's got it's own kind of charm - more like an old fashioned, well-maintained roadside motel than a luxury hotel. I feel very comfortable there, and always enjoy my visits.Note: Explore to find the best route to your room! It's a bit circuitous.There are rooms with indoor hallways (any with a King bed), and those with outdoor access, but still facing the pool (two doubles). It can get a little noisy when there are people hanging by the pool - last time I was there there were teen sports teams, and other business travelers, but I like the sound of people talking and it quiets down during sleep hours.

review_body: Hotel prices in Austin can be very very high. When I booked our room here the price was quite a bit below what other nearby properties were charging. Therefore I was concerned that maybe there was some issue with this hotel. But, I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel and our room. Parking was easy although the roads in this area seemed to be busy during our entire stay. The room was clean and everything worked just fine. We had a room on the inner courtyard near the pool and that could be a noise issue depending on who the guests are. It was not an issue during our stay. The complimentary breakfast was fine as well. I like the rate we paid and would consider another stay here in the future should the chance occur.

1    Aiden by Best Western @ Austin City Hotel

review_body: Firstly the hotel ones not give clear directions (does not say which exit to come off) on tripadvisor or website on their address section. Secondly upon arriving at the hotel about 1pm after a 200 mile drive. I had requested an early check-in which I know can not be guaranteed but upon walking into reception it was evidently clear that your main receptionist really did not want to assist us and was glaring at me. She said the room was not going to be ready for another hour (given the emptiness of the hotel I really do not believe this to be true) and the other girl who was next to her was just interested in eating her snack. I said we would sit round the pool til it was ready, she said nothing. When we got to the pool we couldn’t gain access as you needed a card. When I went back to reception she said we weren’t allowed around the pool until we were guests and her and her compadre starting laughing as I walked off. So basically the hotel expects guests to sit around in reception until reception decides you can have your room. In the end I had to pay money to get on my English WiFi ( as no doubt I couldn’t have WiFi access either until I was an official guest and to be honest by this stage I didn’t dare ask)I have travelled extensively around the world and have really never felt the need to complain about a receptionist but first impression is key. She never smiled at us or greeted us once in passing during our three night stay whereby all the other three hotels in various places in Texas could not have been more different with helpful and cheery staff. Therefore I would not recommend this hotel - I do not know why lonely planet recommend it in its guidebook and I will be complaining direct to the Wyndham Group for lack of service and customer care.
hotelName:
1    Aiden by Best Western @ Austin City Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was comfortable and great location. great value. The breakfast was very good with great variety of options. The room was clean and quiet. The location is good, it is near consgress av and downtown. Best value.

hotelName:
1    Aiden by Best Western @ Austin City Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel at 5:30pm to check in to our room and we were advised that our room was not ready despite being nearly 3 hours after the scheduled check in time. We were understanding and the gentleman at the front was very apologetic. We were told it wouldn’t be long and to wait in the foyer until the room was ready. Soon after 30 minutes had passed and we hadn’t had any further update. After speaking to the same gentleman he informed me it still wasn’t ready but another 15 minutes and we would be fine to enter. We were provided a coupon for a free entree for the restaraunt next door as a result of the delay. Another 15 minutes passed and still nothing, after heading to reception again we were told the room is nearly done and was presented with our room check in keys and told we would be right to head in at at 6:50pm. We arrived at the room at 6:50pm to find the room still in the cleaning process, we waited another 10 minutes before heading back down to reception again. Finally we were given an upgrade and were provided access to another room. This room was quite nice, spacious, clean and ticked all the boxes that guest look for in a hotel. The downfall of our experience was that we didn’t get into our room until 7:15pm which was over four hours after check in was opened. We saw other guests upgraded before us and the disappointing part for us was that we were told wrong information on multiple occasions. A lesson for the future is so be upfront with guests and if there is going to be a 4 hour delay, try and offer more then just an entree to apologise.
hotelName:
1    Aiden by Best Western @ Austin City Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here over the weekend with my wife for a concert. Good location just off 35 and straight shot down Oltorff to backdoor the airport. We had debated on a car or Uber and turns out rental was best. Drive was about 6 to 10 minutes to shopping on South Congress and another 5 to get downtown. Grocery stores, pharmacies, shopping and restaurants are all close. The hotel and room was very clean. Everything is a little smaller and darker than what shows on the hotel’s website, but it was overcast during most of our trip. The room was Immaculate and provisions were the usual but good quality. The king size bed and pillows were soooo comfortable. Although just off 35, did not hear much traffic. We did not eat dinner at the attached restaurant, but complimentary standard breakfast was fresh and hot (except for the cold foods). It seemed to be pretty cool with live music and a fully stocked bar. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Starbucks is about a block away and the hotel backs up to residential areas which were nice to walk. It was too cold to swim, but the pool area was nice and stocked. The gym was nice quality and the hotel has a funky layout with a Southwestern decor. Only downsides i noticed were some of the jets in the hot tub didn’t work and the access turning left from Oltorff onto the hotel street was challenging sometimes. For the value, would stay again, especially versus pricier mid tier hotels downtown.
hotelName:
1    Aiden by Best Western @ Austin City Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and a fun place to stay at. Looking forward to our next visit. This was our third time at this hotel. Unfortunately the review require over 200 characters. Why, I don't know, third base and that my review.
hotelName:

review_body: The hotel was in a convenient location to drive into central Austin or to Congress Ave. where there are lots of trendy restaurants and stores. The room was clean and the staff was very nice. The complimentary breakfast was very good for a continental type and the staff working the breakfast were very attentive and helpful. My only issue is that we got a room in back of the hotel. A big garbage truck came to pick up the trash at 5:45 a.m. and made plenty of noise. Also the staff must have been pushing their carts around in the back area to get things ready for the day and that made plenty of noise too. However, I was already awake from the garbage truck so maybe that was why I could hear the carts so clearly. If you book a room there, I would not take a room in the back area. I’m sure it’s probably a lot less noisy in other parts of the hotel.

review_body: Had read the reviews prior to booking this for our 3 day stay in Austin. I was not disappointed after our stay. Easy location off of I-35 and close to downtown Austin. It’s a nightmare driving around Austin so we used Uber several times. About a $7 to $8 fare. Facilities were clean and in great condition. All of the personnel that we talked with were extremely nice. Excellent breakfast came with our room. Evenings were quiet. Great value compared to hotels that are closer to downtown. Definitely would recommend!

review_body: It's difficult to describe our amazing stay at the driskill. The location, perfect! Right on 6th street, close to popular nightlife and great restaurant, without leaving the hotel! The hotel has beautiful history that is well preserved and displayed! I loved our stay and highly recommend. It's a high dollar hotel with equally great service that is personalized for the guests.

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I surprised my wife by booking the governors suite for July 4th and we were both very impressed. The oversized balcony overlooking 6th street was ridiculously cool! The hotel lobby is beautiful end the artwork on display throughout the facility was top notch. We love our hometown and had a really good time indulging in a special night out. The only thing that kept me from giving the Driskill 5 stars was a somewhat disappointing but expensive dinner in the hotel restaurant. This was probably just an unusual occurrence based on how wonderful everything else was during our stay. I will add that my wife was satisfied with everything she ordered and I do plan on trying the restaurant again. One experience is certainly not enough to pass judgment. Overall, I highly recommend the Driskill for those looking for a beautiful, historic downtown Austin experience.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was very clean, front staff very professional and pleasant. Hotel restaurant breakfast delicious! Best banana bread! Coffee the best! I loved the vintage decor. Next time I'm in Austin I would love to stay here again.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Too many homeless. Hotel was great, but was surrounded by hordes of homeless. They were sleeping in the sidewalk, harassing visitors, and trashing up the entire area. Unless Austin and the Driskill get a handle on the homeless problem, would not recommend anywhere in downtown Austin.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a week with my daughter. I can not recommend it highly enough. The food is excellent and the reception staff are simply amazing. If you need a great hotel in Austin then look no further.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at The Driskill for two nights in February. The location was great for nightlife and we were close to the Capitol building. Carriages were parked in front of the hotel each night offering different tours around the city. We had breakfast in the restaurant each day and were very impressed. The meals were excellent and a good value.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the most iconic hotels in Texas, with a great location right on Sixth Street (right at the beginning of "Dirty Sixth"). The rooms are small and the bathrooms tiny, but the beds are great, the AC cranks loudly but strongly, and the bathroom vanity is more than large enough for a well-stocked couple. Love the bar, one of the great bars in Texas, live music most nights, just classy and comfortable. Also love the huge veranda/balconies on the Sixth Street and Brazos sides - great for that late-night cigar you suddenly just have to have. Fair rates in the mid-200's, but $40 to hold your car (ouch!!). The breakfast/brunch place is excellent, always have to catch at least one meal there. You know, if it's really all about location location location, this can't be beat. You're only 10 feet from the throngs on Sixth Street each night, but inside it's quiet and cozy - you'd never know it.One last thing: If you're thinking of staying here or anywhere else downtown, be aware that the homeless situation is completely out of control. I'm a big guy and I was accosted every block or two, and if you're a woman you may be a little scared to walk around at all. One guy in a wheelchair lunged at my wife and barked at the top of his lungs when she tried to walk past him, scared the crap out of her. On the way home she said, "Maybe next time we stay somewhere out in the country".
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was the first hotel I checked into flying in from Chicago. It was a perfect location on a Saturday night. We smoothly checked in. We walked outside onto Sixth Street. We enjoyed our evening.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here before and will continue to stay here when I'm in Austin. Still waiting to see the Ghost of the Texas Ladies' Man who is said to haunt the place. I enjoy the bar and hanging out in the lobby before venturing out into the night for some dinner and music.  Great accommodations, Texas deluxe.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Driskill hotel is like a step back into an elegant time. The hotel retains the opulence and details of 1886 when it was built. We stayed in a smaller petite room which was beautiful with high ceilings and period woodwork. Bed was comfy with nice pillows. The bathroom was a bit cramped but we didnt mind as it was part of the experience of staying here. The hotel bar had live music and a nice relaxed atmoshpere with plenty of places to sit and relax with a drink. Breakfast in the 1886 cafe and bakery is not to be missed. While I was initially hesitant about the valet parking, it was very efficient. When you want your car you just text your ticket number and your car will be out front in less than 15 minutes. The hotel location is perfect for checking out the capitol building and grounds, the action on 6th street and walking up and down Congess Avenue. We will be staying at the Driskill again when in Austin. One caveat is that 6th street is blocked off on Friday and Saturday nights so if you drive back to the hotel late, be sure to come from the congress street direction down east 5th to Brazos.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have never been to Austin before and the Driskill was in the perfect location for us. Very close to the river, 6th, So. Congress and Rainey St. lots of places near by for great meals. Live music in the bar. Quiet room at night
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So we stayed here on a weekend trip from San Antonio because we wanted to go to Franklin BBQ. My fiance picked this hotel because of the decor she likes the colonial style. The inside has an old fashioned colonial feel and is open and looks nice. The lady at the front desk was very short and to the point not very nice or friendly. To get to our room we had to take two separate elevators in two different parts of the building. It was like walking through a maze trying to get in and out from our room. The rooms themselves were clean but very small, especially the bathroom. The beds are very stiff and hard so unless you like sleeping on a SUPER firm mattress this is not the place to try and sleep. The pillows were just as bad one of them was so thin and soft it like split the filling when you laid your head on it and it was equivalent to just laying your head on the mattress. The other pillow was just as firm or firmer than the mattress itself. Only reason why I would recommend you to stay here is if you want to party it is right on 6th street but there are much better options for the same price just a block or two away.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 nd time staying at the Driskill and I still amazed at the place. Great decor great staff great rooms. All kinds of history and very cool unique place. Civil war era but up to date amenities for the modern traveller. Love this place
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for a personal vacation. Great historic hotel, great location and great food! The concierge (Chris) was so informative and made our stay so much fun. The access to Barton Springs Pool was definitely a "cool" experience, too.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Be prepared to pay for parking, and high Austin taxes. I am an average guy so spending lots of money on drinks and dinner is not my thing. The location on 6th street was the thing that sold me. My wife and I wanted to be right there at that spot. So for that it was perfect. I guess my rating of average means that the room was clean and comfortable, there was a tv, a coffee maker, clean towels, and good service. Thats what 300 bucks a night gets you in Austin! Seems like you should get more for that much, breakfast not included. They wanted to charge an additional forty bucks for breakfast! If your an average guy, 40 bucks for breakfast seems outrageoulsy high! How awsome could an egg possibly be?
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Driskill's history and ambiance is amazing and the hotel itself, the incredible service provided by all the staff, and the food and drinks are excellent. This is the only place I stay when in Austin.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable. it was very quiet at night. The bar was fun and lively. I would stay here again. It was also within walking distance of many restaurants which made it very convenient. The convention center was a few short blocks away.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1) Put the baby to sleep with the nanny in the room before we left at 10:00PM to go out for drinks. When we left baby and nanny were asleep with the lights off. When we returned at 1:30AM two recess lights were on and nanny said she was asleep the whole time.2) Wife and I hung out in the lobby looking at the Grand Staircase at about 1:15AM. She sees a young girl dressed in white shorts and purple shirt walking down from the top. I saw no one but heard a kid whispering.3) The nanny, who is a also a Brasilian nun, became violently sick and almost past out the next morning.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was visiting Austin for a convention. This was my first time to stay at the Driskill and hopefully not my last. Room and service was excellent. Beds are very comfortable and service in the bar area was excellent. Try the chocolate cake, you won't be disappointed.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Driskill hotel, a bit pricey, make sure you know the fees involved, my original bill was $210, final invoice over $300 with $40 parking, $6.50 water (I was told were free to a discoverist), but other than that, I love Hyatt, and it was interesting.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel right in the center of the 6th Street music scene. The double paned windows kept the ruckus outside on the street where it belonged. Fitness room was a real bonus and the bakery was filled with attentive waitstaff and delish choices!
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the Yellow Rose Suite for my girlfriend for her birthday, and the both of us were incredibly surprised. The price of room service was of course quite high, but overall the room service, response time, and experience was great. The tub has a built in Jacuzzi, there were two very comfortable robes for us to wear and incredibly comfortable furniture. My only complaint was that I booked the Bed and Breakfast, and it only covered $56.00 of the breakfast bill and our bill came to $68.00. So the Bed and Breakfast has a limit.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 4 nights here. Building is beautiful and characteristic, but service is not impressive at all. Staff at the front desk need more training in hospitality. The first thing in hospitality business is a simple smile and warm welcoming which they lack both!
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were quickly greeted by a welcoming valet who loaded our numerous wedding bags up. Checking in was quick and easy. Our room had chocolate covered strawberries and champagne to celebrate our wedding night, which we loved. The room was cozy and the bed was very comfortable. Nice sheets and great AC. The amenities were what drew us (room service) as well as the history (Lady Bird and LBJ had their first date here). We had a great breakfast in bed- strong coffee, eggs Benedict and a Texas shaped waffle. The room we stayed in overlooked 6th Street, which was (to be expected) noisy on Saturday night. Our hallway was quiet and we slept great. The staff were all friendly, quick to help, and efficient. The only negative was when we ate brunch Monday morning at the 1886 Cafe. We felt ignored and rushed. The service was poor and the atmosphere doesn't match the elegant and sophisticated feel of the hotel. That said, the food was good.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The historical hotel has enough renovations to maintain itself as a competitive quality hotel with so much charm and character! I felt the lobby and bar area had a good vibe and the dining experience was awesome for breakfast.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can read the very interesting history of this hotel in the room guide. Unfortunately I have a terrible memory so I can’t remember much of it, but it was interesting! This is a gorgeous historic hotel - I think the oldest in Austin - that has had presidents visit and even wait out their elections. There is fabulous memorabilia in the hallways on each floor, from the original owners. Also lots of beautiful paintings. The mezzanine is huge - great place for a wedding or other large gathering. The lobby is gorgeous - lots of marble. The main restaurant is sadly closed Sundays and Mondays (the nights we stayed) but the bar & grill had amazing buffalo wings, although the service was a little slow. The breakfast restaurant also had wonderful food, and great service. The main thing I noticed was the pristine condition the hotel is in. You can tell it’s been recently updated (carpets, drapes, etc), but it still has the feel of an old hotel. I believe it may have housed one of the first banks in Austin (don’t quote me on that). It has an original bank vault in the lobby with the original safe deposit boxes.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, very clean and special hotel, will love to come back. pretty quiet in the room, and I loved the comfy bed. staff is very friendly and helpful, great bar in the hotel with nice music and food.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay this week at The Driskill. Started off in advance with good communication with the property (Jeffrey) to arrange for a minifridge in the room (gratis) so we could keep our BBQ nice and cool.The place is gorgeous. Service is friendly. Room was a bit tight and ours had a view of another hotel across the alley (and they had better wifi) but we weren't staying there for the views! The location is excellent for the bars and clubs in the area and we walked down to the river each day. Great on site bar with live music, too.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our first trip to the Driskill and it did not disappoint. The room was very comfortable and the hotel was more than expected from a building 200 yrs old. Dinner in the hotel was perfect as well. The check in staff and valet were above helpful. We can not wait to return.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where better in Austin to stay to get access to 6th Street, capitol, and all that Austin has to offer. The rooms are spacious, service is over-the-top great. Food is very very special. Wonderful! We came from New York to Austin for the first time and are grateful that the Driskill was where our business meeting was scheduled. What a great hospitality experience all around!
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As many others have commented, this location is in a Very Bad area! Overwhelming amount of homeless, drug addicts and aggressive beggars! I could not find one employee that actually liked working there.There are Much better options available
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Driskill is a wonderful hotel. The lobby is gorgeous, with it’s beautiful ceiling and old fashioned safe deposit box door. The pictures in the hallways are a lovely touch, and the rooms were well-appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the valets.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This timeless, classic Texas tradition just doesnt get any better- Bar is 2nd to none, atmosphere is classic. rooms are smaller than newer construction hotels but the room is every bit big enough.will stay again and again
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Attending a wedding held in Austin and stayed at the Driskill for convenience. We got a junior suite since most activities were at night and we would be spending off hours in the room. Everything is outdated at the Driskill except the lobby and the bar area. Reminded me of a NYC hotel, all lobby, no room. The room furniture was worn, the walls marked up, hospitality and room service was archaic, and the bathroom was laughably small and cramped. With so many options in Austin, there is no reason to pay top dollar for a one star experience. The worst!
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel with great service!Its also right down in the heart of live music and night life!We ate at several of the restaurants and found the food to be great!Make sure you enjoy a great steak in their “ steak house “:
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The charm and history of this hotel is apparent with the first step through the doors. I thought it was unusual that so many reviews mentioned the wonder smell until we stepped inside. It truly does smell divine. Our room was lovely and so comfortable. Most of the staff I encountered had been with the hotel for years and spoke with great affection and pride about The Driskill. Can’t say enough nice things about this place.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience. Lots of attractions within walking distance. Staff was very helpful. It was nice to be in a hotel that did not resemble a chain. Lots of nice features to the hotel. the only thing missing was a pool.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location, location, location! The Driskill is conveniently located in the heart of the city. If you are staying over a weekend, you are in the perfect area to have the time of your life. The city closes off 6th street for a Bourbon-esque feel!The hotel in general is super cool. Rumored to be haunted, but in a good way. Service was good, and the bar area is always lively with live music.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have a delicious breakfast and stay somewhere else.The public places are gorgeous and spacious. The breakfast room serves wonderful food. But the private hotel rooms are the smallest we've ever seen anywhere. Our windows looked out on the building next door--so close you could almost touch the building? Claustrophobic.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely, renovated old hotel that is much more charming than a new high rise. The rooms feel like a throwback to the 19th century, but will modern-day comforts. The location is perfect for wandering the bustling streets of Austin.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second visit to the Driskill and we will be back. It’s nicely majestic and old world but with very modern room convenience. The staff were great, the breakfast as good as expected, we just love the place, and right there in the middle of the action in austin. It’s not cheap but if you want quality then you have to pay (mostly anyway).
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Y'all... this hotel is my new favorite Austin hotel. The location is perfect, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the accommodations were absolutely perfect. I loved walking into the hotel after a day of exploring and felt the comfort and good smell (seriously) of the hotel.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only spent 1 night here thankfully. Location is very central, walking distance to lots of bars & restaurants. Staff friendly . The hotel is old & historic but it needs some work. The noise level was unbearable during the night. Every conversation in the hallway can be heard, every door closure, toilet flushes SO loud, & air con is loud. The hotel does not feel luxurious at all. You have to take 2 extremely slow elevators to get to your room. Don’t waste your $$ go elsewhere.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You need to be careful with this hotel. Most of the reviews actually relate to the building and the bar, rather than the accommodation. Because of its "historic" nature the rooms are not all similar in quality. Rooms that end with ..01 are next to the lifts. Room 421 has huge air conditioning units outside the windows which means for people who are sensitive to the sound of a "jet engine" landing in your room, best to avoid it. Having said that the staff did their best to re-accommodate us and were fairly pleasant about it. We were shown a room that had no view with frosted windows so that you don't look out at a brick wall. Check the room before settling in. The bar is interesting and you feel you are having an authentic texan experience. As with other comments on tripadvisor the wait staff can be abrupt and passive aggressive. Would recommend it, but with caution.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel in the heart of downtown Austin. Great location and centrally located to restaurants and local sights. Food at the restaurant was delicious and the staff could not have been more helpful. Rather costly but very nice.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Parking, fees and Taxes will add about $100 to the bill, but that's not the fault of the hotel. Other than that, this place is an exceptional, comfortable and all around cool place to stay, I will recommend it every time.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From check in to check out I had the best experience ive ever had at a hotel. The room was ready when we arrived with out specifications we requested. The hotel was beautiful, the staff were helpful, the food was great.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very unique hotel that has a lot of charm. Close to great restaurants and night life. A bit pricy, but worth the experience. Has a lot of amenities and prompt service. Just a few minute wait walk to the state capital.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The building is absolutely gorgeous and the staff was mostly welcoming. We stayed in a city view the first night, and the LBJ suite the second night. The basic rooms are a bit of a let-down, and have no amenities like coffee, and water is not free. The biggest disappointment was the cleanliness; the bathrooms just weren't very clean. I'd consider staying here again, as the location is great and the building is breathtaking, but they need to seriously revisit the cleaning standards.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This historic hotel is wonderful in most respects-location, ambience, food, rooms. However, our shower wouldn’t work & even after being fixed was still very difficult to use. As Hyatt members we were offered 2 complimentary bottles of water but were charged for them on our bill. They offered late checkout which we accepted but then locked us out of our room.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated on 6th street which used to be much nicer but is now full of homeless people and the noise from the street permeates the rooms facing the street. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the street and there is daily noise (club music, cars, motorcycles) till around 2am.Service at the hotel bar is not great with servers taking a really long time to take an orderInteracted with the concierge twice and both times seemed clueless as to what to recommend for dinner etc. We did better by just looking for dining choices on pentacle or trip advisor.
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the older historic style of the hotel. Food was wonderful. Located where you can't get bored:-)) Sooo much to do right out your front door. We had a group of 23 who traveled from CA and we had a great time!!
hotelName:
2    The Driskill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sandy was our hostess and she was simply amazing, the rooms are nice and very clean. Also this establishment is pet friendly and there’s no up charge. Last but not least the pool was a really good size and clean.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sandy was very friendly. She had a nice amile when we arrived. I would love to stay here again. And will. She should was nice enough to ahow. The room beforw we got. They were very nice like she said. Im very happy we got to experience the hospitality its very nice.Hazel
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sorry for late review. We visited Austin for my son's graduation from UT in May and this was a perfect stay. No problems and the girl at the front desk was kind enough to order pizza for my husband who was pooped out and did not want to go out for a late dinner. Will stay here again if the chance ever arises.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at midnight to find booking.com had cancelled our reservation for no good reason. The receptionist recognised what had happened, rebooked us at the same rate, and took really good care of us. She also knew my husband was disabled and found an easy access room for us. She also upgraded us at no cost. A simple place, no glam, but if the location is right for you, I highly recommend.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived without a reservation and desperately in need of a room that allowed dogs. Sandy was so kind and incredible, in fact all of the staff I interacted with was very friendly and helpful. Traveling with animals can be a hassle, but they made my emergency night in Austin super easy and I felt well taken care of. I love the beds and sheets, the location was clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Monica, Sandy, Gabby and all of the Management and employees have treated my dog and myself like family ! I will continue to stay here whenever I am in Austin. I have been in involved in 'award winning' customer service, management,and training employees how to do it right most all of my working life; so If I say so, I know. : )
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were so amazing! I loved everyone especially edgar and gabby they treated me like family as soon as I walked in! I will definitely be coming back every time I stay in Austin! The room was so clean and well taken care of also!
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay here regularly. There are some dumpy hotels in S Austin, but this is not one of them. Yes, it’s an older property, but the rooms are clean, hot water in the shower, the pool inviting and onsite security in the parking lot at night. Very pet friendly. Safes in the room. Close to all Austin has to offer and priced right. The staff...Sandy, Edgar and Gabby are some of the best hotel employees EVER.....always helpful and open to accommodating reasonable requests. I look forward to checking in and relaxing. Motel6 may keep the light on, but Red Roof Inn rolls out a huge welcome mat!
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sandy is very professional, diligent in her work. She has good customer relationship and approach to resolving issues is exceptional. Sandy is my go to girl while visiting. We are here for an important conference at the convention center and I will return every year. Thank you Mr. Juan for having Sandy here to answer any questions we have.Sincerely,Emmanuel
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sandy was extremly helpful, nice and the go to gal! When I arrived phones were ringing and she had just checked in a gentleman but she still greeted me with a smlie and gave me the information i was looking for. The a/c in the room didnt work that well but the view was OUTSTANDING .....THANK YOU Sandy!! I would definantly be back just for the customer service.Love, DALLAS TX
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was trying to finish up my reports for the day and Sandy went of her way to make it happen despite being busy she made time for me. My room was clean and actually very comfortable. For being a faithful Hilton owner I was very surprised.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sandy was the best come in late at night help me out fast got me to the room the room was awesome the air was nice and cold room was really clean the coffee was awesome in the room they always give me extra pillowsEdgar makes great coffee the pool is very clean Albert does a great job cleaning it highly recommend anybody come to Austin to stay hereThanks guys I look forward to staying with you guys again. Very clean hotel compare to the other location in north Austin. It’s night and day. This hotel wins best in Austin hands downs
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: THE above ladies (Sandy and Isabel) were so welcoming and friendly--and very helpful from the room to the key to the internet--always with a welcoming smile no matter what hour or how busy. You are lucky to have such ladies! I plan to stay at Red Roofs due to your wonderful people!
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay started off a little shakey. But, Sandy was very helpful and turned my opinion about the Red Roof Inn completely around. I went from never wanting to return to the Red Roof Inn, to this is the only place I will stay when I return. Sandy has been such help and a blessing to my trip. I hope all of your staff displays the same great attitude and genuine concern for the guests as she does.Kind Regards,Randy Castro
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sandy and the rest of the staff (day & night) here were fantastic! Helped me out BIG TIME for the week I needed to stay. They provided free bottled water and extra towels whenever I needed it & got me an excellent discount for a weekly stay. Thank you! (:
hotelName:

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was great! The staff are beyond helpful and super accommodating. We arrived in Austin a little earlier than check-in time and I called to ask if they had toiletries because our luggage was left behind. They told us that they did and that we could check-in at the time of the call if we liked. I use a wheelchair and when we got there, the room wasn't accessible because I booked through a third party and they weren't notified that I requested an accessible room, however, they looked in the system and found a room that worked for me. It was close to the elevators and the entryway was wide and the bathroom had a ton of turning space. The space on side of the beds were also wide. Overall, wonderful experience here!

review_body: We had a nice room, but during night the air conditioner broke, and water leaked out onto floor, and soaked my suitcase. review_body: I loved the style and set up of the room. The sink and mirror was outside the bathroom which was nice if you wanted to get ready while someone showered. It also had a nice corner desk set-up and I appreciated the fridge. Now, for the part that sets them apart. We had arrived in Austin at the beginning of our trip and stayed here for 2 days. We then went to dallas and fredericksburg before returning for our flight in Austin. Thankfully it was a later flight, because on our return, I realized that I had left TWO tablets, one kindle, and $100 cash envelope in the safe!! I called them immediately and they sent someone up to the room. Three guests had stayed there and apparently, my safe was unlocked, but ALL my items were returned to me. I am forever grateful and would definitely stay here again next time we visit.

review_body: We stayed here for one night while hitting some “horror” related stops on our road trip to Texas Frightmare Weekend. We arrived late and we checked in quickly. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Parking was easy to get and was included in our stay which is a plus. However the toilet in our room ran constantly but as we were exhausted from being on the road we didn’t bother to call down as being moved was more trouble then we wanted. We just closed the bathroom door and blocked it out. The wifi was poor and barely worked but again it wasn’t an expensive stay but seems in 2019 this should’ve been better. Room also had no fridge, or microwave which makes me wonder what the plus stands for over a standard Red Roof. Free coffee in the lobby was the extent to a breakfast available though I no none is offers at this hotel seems strange not even muffins. If you just need a warm bed and free parking this is a good option. Long stays? Definitely not.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the red roof during a crazy storm where every hotel was booked and every flight was cancelled. The staff I encountered was not only patient and kind. They really took the time to make sure that all their guests were settled in nicely. Sandy greeted me with a smile even though the desk was hectic she made it a point to ensure I was checked in and ready. Then there was Tammy I saw her jump in as soon as her shift started to help the other ladies out with the long line of guests. And lastly Gabby she tried to make her guests laugh and had great interactions with each one of them. These ladies really held down the fort when times were tough and you should be proud to have such a lovely team.
hotelName:

review_body: Initially I was a Stayed here for four nights late April/ early May. I was served at the reception by Sandy, she and the other staff at reception were very lovely. I was upgraded when I arrived and this certainly helped a lot! Thank you. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and were all fitted with ACs, so it wasn’t too hot whilst I was here and my room was serviced daily, so I always came back to a clean room with fresh towels in the evening. Overall good value for money, not too far from downtown and very close to amenities. If you’re staying in Austin, definitely consider staying here! Red Roof Austin South, thank you for a wonderful stay.

review_body: It was a lovely stay for the week we were there. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Monica who would greet me with a hug and huge smile. She would help me decide the place of interest to visit for the day. The location is great,near I35 that takes you north into town and beyond. South takes you to San Antonio, a charming place to see the Alamo and take the river walk. West takes you to the Hill Country and Fredericksburg.The hotel is kept very clean and the price is reasonable.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South

review_body: I was here Early April 2019 and stayed in room 129. Nice clean Room. Comfortable with temperature. Beds were very comfortable (I had two - even though just me in the room).And even though I don't have a pet, I liked that it was pet-friendly and easy to clean with the laminate flooring instead of carpet. Shower worked well and lots of Hot Water. The room has great height - like 10 ft ceiling.The price was far better than many other hotels nearby and I think this hotel is just as nice. The swimming pool was well cared for and warm enough.They don't have breakfast here and that helps keep the price down. There are many breakfast places nearby so that is not an issue.I did not order any food yet they have a reasonable price menu for room service in the room.I really liked the way that the TV has a wake-up feature on it. Instead of using the old style alarm clock which is in the room, I used the tv wake up system - it just turns on the tv when the time is reached that you set. And Free Parking - with what I saved by staying here - my rental car was covered with those savings.I plan to stay here again when I come back to Austin.

review_body: Got in late from a 20 plus hour road trip only to find out that the room I booked 3 weeks in advance was given away due to some "discrepancy" with my credit card. (There's nothing wrong with my card)Lucky for me Tammy was working this night. She was very gracious and determined to right this wrong. With a few keyboard strokes I got a way better room than the first one I booked and for not much more money.The room itself is immaculate. I have a small black light I use to check out the beds and pillows and all were nice and clean.(you wouldn't believe how gross some of the other comparably priced hotel rooms I've stayed in)The hotel industry could really use more people like Tammy
hotelName:

review_body: Tammi was awesome. She got me a great rate on my room and went the extra mile to get us towels since we had a large party when we checked in. Would stay again. Even though we arrived late at night Tammi was still helpful in getting our room setup.
hotelName:
