review_body: I booked a room through hotels.com. I was sent a confirmation email and my credit card was charged. I showed up and was told they have no record of the booking. I showed them the confirmation email and the only help I was offered was to use their phone to call hotels.com. I'm not sure who's at fault but I don't appreciate having my money taken and then handed a mess to sort out, especially at the end of a travel day. I ended up going down the street to Ramada. Just wanted to send-out a warning: if you see an online 'hot-deal' for Red Roof PLUS Austin South, there might or might not be a room waiting for you when you get there.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shout out to Gabby!! I partied a little too hard my last night and left my rental car key in the ladies bathroom of the lobby (stupid right? Lol). Luckily a guest handed it in to the front desk and I was told Gabby went through ALL the parking permits to find out who it belonged to! That's a great person with a wonderful work ethic! The hotel itself is pretty basic but checks all the right boxes - clean sheets & towels, comfy bed and friendly staff. Keep up the great work RedRoof.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nowhere have we had more considerate care or attention than what we received from Sandy (front desk supervisor) with sorting out our arrangements! Very pleasant, caring lady that makes a customer feel welcomed and wanted. Nothing was too much trouble.As a result we have bookings for 2 more nights before returning home.Thank you Sandy and Red Roof PLUS - Austin!Connie Hucul
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Monica made us feel welcome and was as helpful as could be. Thank you for your hospitality. We will definitely consider returning to this red roof in the future. Clean rooms, happy employees, great stay.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here and was shocked how Inexpensive it was. The staff was fantastic. Why pay 150 per night when you can get the same thing for half. Met The hotel manager and we talked for 30 minutes about how he came a year ago and really fixed up the property.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Once we arrived at the hotel, we became a little hesitant upon seeing a homeless man with his grocery cart outside rushing in to grab coffee. Then when we checked in we noticed a sign that said water would be shut off the following day from 8am-5pm, due to the city of Austin shutting it off. When walking to our room, the stench of marijuana roamed the hallways, so we immediately went downstairs to voice our feelings. Sandy jumped into action and heard everything we had to say and handled the situation so positive and professionally. She apologized for the inconvienance and offered us accommodations in a different room. If it wasn’t for Sandy I probably wouldn’t have gave a 5 star review. All in all, our hotel room was nice and clean, and we didn’t have anymore additional problems. (Well until the water shut off).
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Monica waz great in assisting us. The hotel is clean and there was nothing we could really complain about. Monica at the front desk also made us feel at home and had excellent customer service because of her will definitely be coming back
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was wonderful,will recommend it to all my friends. I love the service I received from Juan aswellz very professional staff and great assistant sandy. Albert is very funny as well . Nice and welcoming location
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best service ever. It's even my dog luke's favorite hotel. I've been staying here whenever I get a chance for the last 5 years. I'm always happy with my stay and always happy with the prices. Only hotel for me when I'm in austin.
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love sandy she always goes out of her way. I’ve been staying here about a month off and on. I will continue being a loyal guest due to the customer service that sandy gives and the room is very spacious. I like this location a lotRobert Trujillo
hotelName:
3    Red Roof PLUS+ Austin - South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First the Archer Hotel is gorgeous! The staff is so kind and helpful that I would take them home for thanksgiving dinner! The cherry on the top was Reggie! I (accidentally) ripped the curtain off the rod. Reggie was there in two seconds and was so gracious. He told me it was no big deal, popped the curtain right back on. Super star Reggie! We have already started planning our trip right back here next summer.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great 8 nights stay here on business. It’s a beautifully decorated Hotel, in a great location with everything you really need on a business trip. The rooms are perfect though not sure why I needed two king size beds just for myself but ok! The pool area is lovely with great service and a huge screen for watching Sport in the sunshine. The restaurant is nice enough although I wasn’t so keen on the layout and positioning of the bar and I think this could certainly be looked at to enhance the overall atmosphere. There’s a free car park within walking distance which is extremely handy. The hotel is also walking distance to all local bars and restaurants so ideal location. All staff are very friendly and I would highly recommend this hotel over the Westin Hotel and definitely over the Aloft if not significantly more expensive. Will definitely stay here in future returns to Austin.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a great experience! I stayed at the Archer this weekend for a girls trip, and we will definitely be returning! The staff was incredible and so friendly. Barbra and Shelby at the front desk were so accommodating, and Cam at the pool was very attentive. The Archer is a beautiful and clean hotel - I would definitely recommend it!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We happened upon the Archer Hotel last year when we came for dinner at Second Bar and Kitchen. When we needed to travel this year for a baseball tournament, I immediately decided to book the Archer. The location is fantastic. There are so many shopping and dining options located right outside the front door (and inside, too) that we enjoyed during our down-time. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. The room option of a Double King is ideal for our family of 4 (I wish more hotels offered this type of room), and the beds are SUPER comfortable. A special shout-out to housekeeping: I needed a baseball uniform cleaned, and they did a great job of getting it clean (no easy task) and promptly returned to our room, pressed and hanging in the closet when we returned from a day of games. I will most definitely choose the Archer every time my family travels to Austin. Thank you, Archer!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an astounding place from the lobby to the grand rooms. Just beautiful decor, clean and well planned, spacious and bright.Lovely people watching from balcony and handy for so many ameneties.Lovely down to earth friendly staff too. A real treat
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent in every way. We held my daughter's wedding reception here and the staff and management of the Archer Hotel Austin tended to our every need in a most efficient manner, Restaurant was very good and the food was excellent for the receptiion. Overall a five star experience.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a warm welcome from the front desk! My kids loved their feeling like VIPs! One of the coolest pool/patio areas of any hotel I've stayed in. Thank you, Archer, for a great family staycation in Austin!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on a Saturday night for a weekend surprise getaway. The classic room was very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Even staff in the hallways were friendly and helpful or greeted you. It is refreshing to stay at a hotel where you can tell that the employees enjoy their job! My one suggestion if you stay here is get a room on the front side of the building. When we stayed our room was on the back side of the hotel. The back side of the hotel backs up to nightclubs and bars down the street. The noise and music from those nightclubs was so loud! The bass from the nightclub music felt like it was hitting our window until 2 am. I don’t mind noise and we didn’t go to bed early but 2 am was late for the noise. I imagine if you stay on the front side the noise would not be a factor. Great hotel overall excellent staff.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is long overdue. We’ve stayed multiple times. Most recently, my mom, two kids and I stayed at Archer in December for a holiday kick off. This is hands down the best hotel in Austin ... and that’s coming from a native Austinite who loves a staycation. Exceptionally friendly team who goes out of their way to make everyone feel like a VIP - including my two littles. Warm welcome, nightly turndown service with delicious treats, stylish accommodations in a suite that will rival any top hotel. Nespresso makers, in room games, rubber duck in the sunken tub, cozy throws to snuggle by the patio fireplace and a well stocked mini bar. Whether in town for business or pleasure you’ll love your stay here. Domain NORTHSIDE also offers excellent dining options (recommend Perry’s Steakhouse for dinner or Bakery Lorraine for a treat) and a wide array of shopping. Archer Hotel is inviting, luxe and a perfect escape from downtown. Sit by the fire in the lobby and enjoy a nightcap before retreating to your room. After sinking into your plush bed, you’ll wake well rested and be ready for the day! Thank you Archer for always exceeding our expectations!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 girlfriends and I chose the Archer for our stay in Austin and we are so glad we did. We have traveled all over the world and we stay at luxury properties- Ritz, Waldorf, W, etc. The service at Archer, starting with a text the morning you are to arrive offering any assistance, is fabulous! Helpful, genuine and designed to please. The restaurant is reallyyyy good! The rooms are modern and tasteful (not awe shocking luxury) but great for the price point. Of course the area where the Archer is, The Domain, also helps the ambience as well but I would highly recommend this property. I am going to try the one in NY next.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Much like our other experience with Archer Hotels, this is a great property with an excellent staff. We would only stay here if in the Austin area. Close to downtown and several dining and retail options.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved everything about this hotel! The location is perfect. I loved all of the little details such as the Fiji water and caramels that are included in your room. Staff was very friendly and I can't wait to come back and stay here again!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel. Would defiantly stay here again!!Room was big and spacious. Hotel went above and beyond to make our stay as great as possible. Everyone from Front desk, Bellhop and housekeeping were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I booked a room here through their website. There was an option to "let the hotel pick a room" for a lower rate. I rolled the dice hoping we would like "their pick". Upon arrival, we were given one of the nicest rooms........we were thrilled! The room was clean as a pin, roomy and it had a balcony. The tub was huge!! Frankly, it was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. The customer service was excellent, everyone was so friendly and helpful. We were there celebrating my birthday. Much to our surprise, they delivered a bottle of wine and a cheese plate to help us celebrate! Thanks again to all the staff at the Archer.The location was very good too. There is a Whole Foods store just a few blocks away, lots of unique restaurants to choose from, a Nordstrom and other really nice stores, all within walking distance. The parking arrangement worked well for us. They do have valet parking available but guests also have the option to park their own car (for free) in the parking structure nearby, which we did. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. Thanks.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful hotel! From staff, to the rooms, to the pool area to the restaurant and bar - this is a top notch hotel. My wife and I stayed for two nights in April 2019. The hotel is small, but offers many amenities of a larger hotel. The staff was friendly and efficient. The pool area was pristine and the pool was one of the cleanest I've ever seen at a hotel. The poolside staff was also excellent. The bar and restaurant were also very good. My wife commented that the bed in our room was the best one she's ever slept on. I would agree. The location of the Archer is ideal for anyone who wants to eat and shop, too. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the Viva Spa. They took excellent care of my wife as she enjoyed a spa day during the trip. We will definitely be coming back to the Archer. I can't recommend it enough.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Luckily enough I was able to stay a second time in this wonderful hotel and wasn’t disappointed at all. The room was, again, spacious and well appointed. Staff was really friendly, they even brought a tray with nacho chips and guacomole up to my room as a special welcome (and ‘thank you’ since I would be staying with them in NY too). Breakfast and diner are delicious. Location is perfect.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service is excellent. Rooms nicely appointed.Location is superb. Slightly louder than I would expect from a nice hotel, not from people but doors, toilets etc. still worth booking and we will be back.Pro Tip: Sit by the pool, order food, drink and watch football on the huge TV.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a nice hotel and great location. A must!!! This place is like a small version of Beverly Hills. Everything with in proximity. Will definitely be back! I highly recommend. So many nice shops to choose from.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Archer Hotel is absolutely stunning. The employees are kind and welcoming. I work in hospitality at another hotel here in Austin. My fiancé (now husband) and I chose this hotel because it was number 1 on Trip Advisor. With both of us being in the business, we wanted the best of the best for our wedding night. We booked a gorgeous suite (for top dollar and booked directly as we prefer). The suite had a large soaking bathtub and canopy bed. I’ve never had the luxury to stay in such a stunning suite!I truly wish I could have given a better rating. The reason I’m giving this rating is I’m disappointed that there wasn’t any champagne or chocolate covered strawberries - something tasty and extravagant to welcome us on our Wedding Night! When I booked the reservation, I added notes that it was our wedding night. Then I called the hotel to confirm and I stated that it was our wedding night and I work at another luxury hotel; however, I chose the Archer because it was number 1. The agent I spoke with said that they would doing something for our special occasion and because we chose their hotel over another or even my own hotel which would have been for a minimal discounted cost. At my hotel where I work, when a guest calls about any sort of celebration, we always send champagne or chocolates to the room and include a personal card. We work hard to make last memories. Once again, it was just disappointing to not receive this same service when I expected it from another top rated hotel. All in all, the hotel is still stunning and the people are very warm, but if you’re looking for a “Wow” moment then I am not sure you are going to get it here because I didn’t.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was excellent, and the location in the Domain meant we had lots of shops, restaurants & bars in easy walking distance, and if you don’t want to walk there is a free valet shuttle service so you don’t need a car. If you do have a car all the parking in the Domain is FREE! Room was exceedingly comfy (but be warned, the beds are very high). All the staff were so helpful. We had a great recommendation for dinner - a Thai restaurant called Sway. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very welcoming and helpful. We were traveling with a 7 and 4 year old, and they offered them toys at check in. The pool is small, but very nice. My kids loved it. Rooms were immaculate. I just wish this hotel was closer to downtown. It’s about 20 north of downtown in no traffic. At 6:00 pm on a Wednesday. It took us 65 minutes to get downtown. The only thing I would change about this hotel is the location. Everything else is perfect.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel is fantastic. From the time you pull up to valet greeted with a cold Fiji water..Then off to a bubbly front desk staff.  Our room was lovely & then off to the pool for a couple of wonderful beverages..... The Happy Hour is great , super relaxing and the staff again was super friendly.... Everything at the Domaine is in walking distance so no need to use your car..There were so many shops& restaurant's in the area with rooftop patios, outdoor seating and much more.....
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful from floor to ceiling! Great location in the Domain, where lots of good restaurants and shops reside. The customer service is second to none and the food and service at the restaurant were exceptional. Can't wait to go back when it's warmer, so we can hang out at the beautiful pool and drink from the outdoor bar in the cabanas (which are first come, first serve, not $200, like so many other hotels!).
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Luxury hotel that hit all the right notes. My girlfriend and I stayed here during one of the weekends of SxSw. We weren't in town for the festival but rather to celebrate a special anniversary. From before we arrived the staff were friendly and helpful with email and text reminders. Check-in was easy, room was great (everything was clean, well stocked, and comfortable). The bed and pillows were really comfortable and the bathroom decor is a little above traditional hotel bathrooms so that was nice. The only problem which is nothing against the hotel but we had a bit of a noisy neighbour (likely due to the festival and wanting to keep the party going in their hotel room). When we asked to switch rooms the staff was exceptional. They made sure we were fully satisfied with our stay that they moved us away from the noise and even bumped us up to an upgraded room at no charge. On top of that they comped our breakfast the next day (a $50 charge for free). I was very pleased and so was my girlfriend. It made for a great and memorable stay. I'd definitely stay again and it's a great reflection on how this hotel values customer satisfaction. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was my 3rd time at the Archer and unfortunately this time was not so great- very loud music probably from the restaurants around up to 2 oclock in the morning, had almost no rest, and ended up having to wear earplugs. the hotel should do something about it- the pressure in the shower was low, take forever to wash your hair- shower gel was not always replaced so ended up using the shampoo- got not so clean towel a couple of timeThe hotel location is great, the decor is nice and the room is very confortable, but seems like the hotel is losing quality with the time.Also be aware that odd number room are on the side of the aircon system, if your room is located above it, the sound makes you feel like your are in a plane. i asked to change room, and the hotel accommodated my request.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It will sound like I work here but I don't. Was here on a short three-day trip and managed to be impressed by everyone who works here. Although a stunning hotel - its staff makes it what it is. I'd like to start with the incredibly approachable and helpful John Magnussen, then Shelby, Sarah, Dakota, Jeff, Caitlin, Drew, and poor Austin who handles too many lame jokes because of his name. The only regret I have is not remembering everyone's name. Looking forward to stopping by again, and hope this makes an impact.Best,Vlad Filipovic.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful Staff and very nice rooms. Perfect location for shopping and eating in the Domain. Will stay here anytie we can on trips to Austin. It is not downtown but if you don't have business downtown, stay here, Great place.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a true Marriott person. But someone put me up in the Archer and I must admit we had a great time. The bed was very good with lots of very good feather pillows. Had all the amenities you would need with the best mini bar I have seen in years!! Breakfast was incredible and the people were very nice and professional. I would have to stay there again!!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the Archer to find all of the staff, yes all of them, to be attentive and polite. The room was gorgeous. Everything was perfect. We couldn't have had a better experience. We will be back!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Archer provided an absolutely fantastic professional and personal experience. Thank you to the entire staff and management. We enjoyed the beautiful guest room, Second Bar & Kitchen and the excellent service delivery by all of the staff members. Look forward to our next visit.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s an overpriced hotel in the middle of a shopping center. Review in CN traveller was very misleading. Decor, bar, restaurant and rooms very bland. Staff don’t seem overly enthusiastic to be there. Would waste your money.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time to stay at the Archer and we were highly impressed. The hotel was new and clean. All of the people we met were friendly and went out of their way to say hello and try to help us. The room was very nice, and the bed was very comfortable. We loved having the Domain shopping right across the street. We will definitely return to the Archer.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this pristine property in the Domain. Lots of amenities with a boutique feel. You won't be dissappointed. We traveled to Austin to look for an upcoming wedding venue for our daughter. This property would be an excellent choice for wedding guests and the adjacent restaurants and shopping are a bonus. The turn down service and treats are amazing, and so cleverly presented. See you next time we are in Austin.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here after a very bad experience at another hotel nearby. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by Caitlin, she went above and beyond to assure our stay was as comfortable as possible. We are traveling with 3 kids, they gave them all toys (mini etch-a-Sketch) when we checked in....kids LOVED them! Rooms are luxurious, pool is small, but nice, and excellent location. We are raving fans of the Archer hotel!!!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the first Archer hotel I stayed at. Great hotel! I would recommend. The high level of service from Nate, front office supervisor really made the experience. I look forward to visiting other locations in the future. Great job!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location has everything within walking distance, the hotel is very clean and their staff is completely friendly & helpful. Their on-site restaurant, Seco2d/Second, was also really good, with delicious selections and very welcoming staff/servers.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a premier hotel with incredible customer service in Austin, this is it. Where can you find a fireplace on the outside deck of your room? Very modern finishes and done very well. Clean and comfy. Service was top notch
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top notch hotel with great products and amenities in the room! Very nice room and it is quite new and well appointed. We were disappointed in the restaurant; especially the bar service which seemed disjointed, short staffed and frankly uninterested in taking care of us and others around us we observed. Was a nice overnight getaway and if restaurant/bar was more accommodating this would have been a perfect review.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose the Archer based on its reputation and location and were not disappointed. We were celebrating a birthday and were so very impressed with the staff, the food, the service and the accommodations.....
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel in a nice location. Walking distance from great shopping (my wife says ;). Bed excellent, room was ample and all very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Special mention for Caitlin in Front Desk and Steven, the concierge whom was extremely helpful to get last minute reservations. Same experience with the valet service. I usually do not write reviews but felt a job well done needed recognition so I took the time. If back in Austin, I would certainly make reservations there, no hesitations. Very chic indeed.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best hotel I have stayed at to date and I travel for work frequently. From the moment you walk in you know that it is not your normal hotel. The fireplace on the balcony was the icing on the cake. Hope I get a chance to come back soon.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We go to Austin several times a year but this was our first stay at the Archer. This will definitely be our go to hotel in Austin. We stayed at the Archer Hotel in NYC and really enjoyed our stay there so we had high hopes for this hotel. We were not disappointed. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating with a level of service that unfortunately is becoming a rarity. The hotel is beautifully appointed and our room was spacious, modern, and very clean. We stayed in a King Suite and the space was perfect for us with a small sitting area to relax in. We will definitely be back and look forward to our next visit.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can find nothing bad to say about this hotel. From the staff, to the decor, to the location - it has everything we want in a hotel!Before I get into the review, a huge thanks to Nate on reception who was outstanding. We saw him as we checked-out to continue our Texas adventure, and he gave us invaluable advice for our mini road trip. We had a great chat with him, and his passion for Archer hotels has definitely put the brand to the top of our list when we next stay in the US. We were sadly only there for three nights but would have loved to stay longer. We checked in fairly late on the first night after a long flight, and it was wonderful to get to our room after it had been "turned-down" - it felt so warm and cozy, and we had delicious treats waiting for us. The bed was incredibly comfortable and had exceptional linens, the bathroom was perfect with excellent Malin and Goetz toiletries, and it was so lovely to have slippers and bathrobes to wear in room.We didn't get an opportunity to eat at the restaurant, but we did get room service which was outstanding. It was also far too cold to go out to the pool, but we could see it from our room and it looked great! We chose the King Suite which we found very spacious with an additional seating area - I definitely recommend this room. There is plenty to choose from in the mini-bar, and a Nespresso coffee machine if you don't feel up to the walk across the road to Starbucks! There is turn-down service which, as already mentioned, comes with curated treats (although we did only get turn-down service for two our of the three nights, but this is literally the only negative from our stay, and is such a minor thing!). The 'gift shop' was so unique, so make sure you check it out - right by the main doors, the cabinets are full of local Austin souvenirs, but not the normal items you'd find in any other hotel. Such a creative idea. The whole Domain Northside area is great, with easy free parking on the 3rd floor of the Nordstrom lot behind the hotel, or valet parking if you prefer. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in the area if you don't feel like driving downtown. You will not run out of things to do here very quickly.We had such an amazing stay - the Archer is definitely our number one place to stay in Austin.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OMFG! To all travelers! I was amazed by the staff how helpful, professional, and attentive they were. The hotel has a decked out decor. I felt relaxed in my room. It has an easy commute to my favorite shops and restaurants so no cars needed. Even if you are not a guest at the hotel, try the food ...it isn't bad. Also the bar is nice for a drink in the evening.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Archer is the absolute best! I didn’t consider any other place to celebrate my birthday. Everything thing was perfect from the moment we pulled up to the valet all the way through checkout! I wish we would have extended our stay! This was our second stay in 3 months and hopefully we’ll be back soon!!! I wish I would have written down the name of every person I encountered because they were all outstanding and only enhanced my birthday weekend!!!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a special gem. Archer exudes Texas spirit and pride, but it is the thoughtful and accommodating staff that leaves you with a special warm feeling. Upscale urban oasis in an incredible location. The hotel does the most special things. It is truly a unique experience. We love it!!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel! The staff were all friendly and helpful. The Domian is really awesome. Fun restaurants, bars and shops within walking distance. Most bars have outdoor and rooftop seating. Eat at Paul Martins and drink at Redwood.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms at the Archer are just about perfect. The decor and design are modern, beautiful, and just plain fun. Make sure you get a room with a patio so you can enjoy the outdoor fireplace (they even have a blanket for snuggling by the fire if it is cool out). The bed and linens were very comfortable. Frankly, the room itself is one of the nicest I've experienced. As far as the rest of the hotel is concerned, it is very nice but nothing extraordinary. When we arrived I had unloaded my bags before I was approached by anyone for assistance and when we left getting our car from the valet took a long time.The hotel is located in a very cool area with many good restaurants and bars to choose from. It is a great place to get away with a SO for a long weekend.However, if you are planning on going to downtown Austin for anything this is not a good area to stay. It took us an hour and a half to get from the hotel to the Odd Duck (S. Lamar) for dinner on a Friday afternoon (we left at 4:00). I suppose if you work around traffic hours you could make it work but traffic in Austin is dumb anyway so why waste any time in the car if you don't have to. In summary, the rooms are really the highlight of this hotel and if you are planning on staying/playing in the local vicinity it is a great choice.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Great area. Our new Austin go-to place. The customer service is over-the-top. You know that the hotel is awesome when the HVAC repairman uses himself to keep the elevator door from closing so you do not have to wait a few minutes for another one to become available. And, they love dogs ! Their menu prices are very practical, including the mini bar pricing. FYI, the hotel charges $150 for a dog to stay, but they load you up on treats and pet knick-knacks.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin

review_body: Its was good located Apple Store just in the corner. Room was clean and well attended. I not even use security to save documents or my personals . Very secure hotel. Breakfast and Lunch was good in the in site restaurant
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin

review_body: Disappointed to see dirty towels. The check in process was easy but dirty towels when you are spending $200 a night.. Location is great. Right in the shopping center at domain drive. Closer to few bars and clubs
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful hotel. Could not have asked for a more comfortable room and bed. The shower was terrific. Extremely clean. The staff was very friendly! Although we didn’t shop, the location (The Domain) is perfect if high end retail is your thing. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Also a movie theatre. The Archer is directly across the street from Starbucks and a Cupcake shop!
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin

review_body: We stayed here for a wedding and 10 year anniversary trip. Excellent service by all staff. Super clean. Pool and gym were great. Rooms are fantastic. You can't beat the location. Service and food were both great too. Can't speak highly enough about this place .
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our girls weekend to the Archer in Austin. Excellent location~so many great restaurants and shops right outside front door. Room was amazing. Two king size beds that were so plush and dressed with high end linens. Bathroom was modern and well appointed. Already booked return visit with husband for next month. Perfect for a quick getaway. Wouldn’t choose another hotel over the Archer.
hotelName:
4    Archer Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a pleasant hotel that was not far from the places I wanted to go. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The breakfast offered a number of choices and the food was reasonably good and offered a number of choices. Loved the pancake machine! The pool area is very pleasant and comfortable.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...

review_body: Nice hotel for bussines and by the way James is very kind.Jacucci always hot, good for phisiteraphy.Service room is awesome and clean.Breakfast have tasty cinnabon.Nice selecction of beers in frontdesk.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Derek and James are hospitality. They excel at anticipatory service and made my business stay better than most business stays. Derek was friendly, he's knowledgeable, and informative. He also takes time to ensure the location of my room is comfortable for me. James has great conversation and was on time to shuttle me to and from work... even when I forgot to tell the front desk agent of changes. Today, I'm in town for my 2nd business trip in the last 3 weeks and when I arrived, Derek had my favorite jacket (that I'd left here 2 weeks prior). Both always had a smile on their face. Oh, and one night I needed my food reheated and the microwave wasn't working properly in my room, Derek urgently took care of it. In addition the service, the hotel is clean!! The breakfast was fitting, organized, and clean. I forget that gentleman's name that was manning it, but he was super polite. He looked to be doing a lot, even dumping large bins of garbage. Everyone seemed to be on their game. I'm looking forward to 2 more stays in the coming weeks and more later in the year. Thanks all!
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This room and the service are exactly what I expect from Holiday Inn Express. Yummy breakfast. Cinnabon cinnamon rolls. Comfortable beds and pleasant service. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Seaton medical center (on 38th) was only a 10-15 min drive.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a quick business trip. The hotel was really clean, staff were super friendly and accomodating, and they had some nice perks like a free happy hour that I wasn't expecting. Bed was comfortable, hot tub/pool area was clean and nice. The breakfast in the morning was actually really good as well. I would definitely book this hotel again!
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this location during a convention with some friends, even with how busy it was the staff was very much on top of everything and was very friendly. They complemented my costumes even though I’m pretty sure I looked weird. It was a great experience will stay there again next year during the convention.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with two friends for the weekend where the hotel was across the highway from the convention. The room was a perfect size for the three of us, with a microwave and a small fridge which came in handy cause I had cold snacks with me. the bathroom had everything we needed although the only small thing that got me curious was the water from the sink felt slick but left that alone. The breakfast got me energized which I had the mini cheese omelets, oatmeal, mini Cinnabons, etc. Even has a mini pancake maker. The staff was very friendly to us and enjoyed some small talk. I, of course am going to stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Austin on Christmas Eve. Ever compulsive, I had my reservation/itinerary number printed out, ready to give to the front desk. I mumbled my name and handed the paper to Lupe, but amazingly enough he was listening to me and found my reservation without the number. Lupe was very polite, friendly, knowledgeable (my wife is disabled) and professional, making our experience top of the line! If I had owned hotels, I would have hired him away in a heartbeat. The hotel was spotless and smelled good and the breakfast was great! Highly recommended!
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in April while in Austin for the Bob Marley Festival. This hotel is very nice. We had the one bedroom suite and enjoyed it very much although we didn’t spend too much time in the room during the stay. Hotel was very clean and had everything we needed. Breakfast was delicious
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prepaid in full on Orbitz. On arrival the desk clerk told us there were no rooms available and just stared at us. We asked to talk to the manager he said the same thing. Seems they just wanted us to leave? They new we had paid in full on Orbitz. After some dialog they found another hotel in the area (30 minutes away), and told us to come back tomorrow for the remainder of our stay, so we did. This hotel is loud. Caters to large events (corporate, weddings, etc). The bar is overflowing, large groups walking past our room all night. Before booking a hotel look at its location on a map. This hotel is next to Costco. Trucks and backup alarms all night. We will not stay at a Holiday inn or use Orbitz ever again. Note: I am 57 years old and have traveled all over the world. This is by far my worst experience at a hotel.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quick weekend getaway. Great staff at check-in, don't remember the young ladies name but she was very friendly and gave great suggestions on places to hang out. Hotel is located right off freeway, very easy to get to. Room was modern, clean and looked out at the pool. Weather was raining on and off but we made the best of it. Would stay again.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern, clean hotel in good repair with a nice outdoor pool, but the excellent front desk staff really made the stay. Alexis was extremely helpful, gave great recommendations on restaurants and directions to nearby stores, and handled a long line of guests all arriving at once with aplomb.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got in early, just stopped to see if I could check my luggage and the front desk said no I could check in since they had a room ready. (it was 1100 am) Very friendly and helpful front desk. Got to the room and was surprised at how spacious and well laid out the room was. Couch TV, Wet bar micro wave, Fridge, then a closed bathroom, a closet, separate bedroom with it's own TV , chest of drawers. All nicely decorated and clean. Tue through Thurs there was a mixer in the lobby and every morning the Hot breakfast was quick, efficient and tasty. Out back there is a nice pool (it rained the entire time so I did not use it) and a grill area. The room were quite could hear road noise.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this location several times over the years. My last review in January 2018 was favorable. My last 2 stays have been even better. I stayed last night (08/01/18). Check in was quick. The manager on duty was extremely friendly and helpful. They have a simple happy hour reception which is very nice. They had some small appetizers, wine, and beer available. The manager went out of her way to make sure everyone was served. I had a special request for an ice bag and she dropped what she was doing to assist. The room was spotless and comfortable. The breakfast was good. I must say that this location has improved on their level of customer service (it was not bad previously). Keep up the great work.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is not in a good area. We are fairly seasoned travellers and we were really uncomfortable going in and out of the hotel. There is a homeless shelter next door and there were people around off their heads all the time. Not worth it for the price.....stay closer to 6th street area if you are looking to party in Austin as we were
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four night stay. Very comfortable hotel. Nice appearance in lobby, lounging, and breakfast area. Great big screen TV in lounge. VERY friendly front desk staff, like super Texas friendly; being from Los Angeles...it is just a breath of fresh humanity air!!! Two Queen Bed Rooms are comfortable for family of four (two adults, two teenage boys). Nice 42 inch TV with good channels. Bathroom clean and good. Desk for writing or laptop work. Perhaps only short is no real place to put luggage other than on ground. There is a low bench with a soft foam top but wheels on our bag would leave dent so we didn’t use; guess if you have a smooth bottomed suitcase or bag it would be fine. Nice, free Happy Hour Monday to Thursday 5-7pm albeit no drinks for the kids. Pool area comfortable and enjoyable and has a couple gazebo spaces with outdoor TV’s if you fancy. Pool temp great in this sweltering July Austin heat. There is also a jacuzzi. Alcohol and smoking is allowed in pool area but inside hotel it is a non-smoking facility. Pool area has lots of lounge chairs, tables, and a bathroom. No outside shower. Greenbelt behind pool area makes area feel more rural and relaxing. North Austin location is good with close proximity to many restaurants including BBQ, steak house, Mexican, Indian. Close to Lake Travis, about 23 minutes from here. Hotel is located in back of a small strip mall with Costco next door (cheapest gas) and a Wendy’s and a pizzeria in front. On other side of 183 are lots of restaurants too. Parking is free but it is part of the strip mall out front. Overall, we like this place, glad we chose it, and have felt welcomed and comfortable. Would recommend.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 days with my main girl. The room was very clean, and even though we were beside the elevator it was quiet. Close proximity to downtown and lots of fun stuff. Even has an Orangetheory (my fav gym) in the parking lot
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had stayed at Holiday Inn Express's before and always had a good experience. This one didn't let us down. We were glad we were in a room that was not looking out on any traffic. The room was real nice and the bed was very comfortable, which we needed.We were very pleased to see that they had a very nice breakfast. There were plenty of items to choose from and everything was delicious. We noticed that one girl was handling the breakfast all by herself, her name is ZARI, she was so busy and totally kept up with everything. That was Awesome.We will be staying at Holiday Inn Express in the future.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice,newer Holiday Inn Express. Great location. Everything in good working order. Very friendly and competent front desk staff. Definitely recommend this place. Russo’s pizza located in same parking lot was good for quick carry out.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the enthusiastic, personable check-in with Reggie all the way through to a clean, modern room and hot breakfast in the spacious breakfast room this is a wonderful hotel. The room was exceptionally quiet, no traffic noise at all, could be totally darkened with the drapes, I slept great. Sparkling clean room, actually a nice suite to get some work done. Breakfast are is roomy, with a variety of seating choices, and a pleasant view out into the patio area with a whole wall of windows. My favorite breakfast area ever.Reggie was great at check in, it's nice to be treated as welcomed and appreciated. Later I needed to borrow a tape measure for an item in my vehicle and he quickly located one and loaned it to me. The breakfast staff were pleasant and worked steadily to keep a large group supplied with hot food. Staff here just really seems to care! I'll be staying here next trip for sure.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall my stay was decent. The room was clean, and smelled fresh. The bed was comfortable and breakfast was decent. My only complaint is the noise coming from the room above me. It could’ve been a ballerina, but the person sounded like an NFL offensive lineman stomping around. The person stomped around until late, and then it started early the next day. It affected my sleep as I’m already a light sleeper. I don’t know is problematic of all the rooms, but any times I stay there I’m the future, I want a top room.
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...

review_body: When I go to Austin, I always stay here. It is clean, comfortable, safe, and the the team that runs the hotel is always very professional and helpful. Reggie is a great example of their outstanding team. I highly recommend you stay there.
hotelName:

review_body: The hotel itself is fine, however, the people in the room next to us had their TV up almost all the way until 3:30 AM!! We finally contacted management at 12:30 in the morning to complain, the manager called the people (probably couldn't hear the phone but we could next door), came and knocked on the door but nobody would answer. He says the hotel was totally booked so he couldn't move us to another room. My husband asked for a discount but I think they should have comp'd us the room 100%. Totally awful, we got zero sleep that night. We finally turned on the AC to try to drown out the noise altho it was in the 30's that night. Good grief!
hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...

review_body: This is my third time staying here. My man Reggie was outstanding!! The best hotel I've ever stayed at for sure!!!!! I will be sure to return on my next time in Austin. Pool was great, Reggie was at our service for our whole stay. He was present and extremely kind even though he was working over his long weekend!!!!

review_body: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times for business and always have a great time. Front desk staff is great and they even offered to make us breakfast early on the weekends. review_body: I work in Austin twice a month for a few days and ALWAYS stay here. The rooms are nice and clean, the staff is Phenomenal, breakfast is good, the pool area is nice and they are in a great location. I usually bring my husband and daughter with me and they really make us feel welcome, (our 3yr old loves staying here) this is literally our home away from home! Thank you guys so much! Special thanks to Arianna and Dj for helping with the baby announcement, AJ for always being so nice to Autumn and such warm welcomes all the time, and Reggie for just providing great service! Every single one of them remember us when we come check in and go above and beyond fantastic guest service!

review_body: We stayed at this hotel when we evacuated Corpus due to Hurricane Harvey. We couldn't have picked a better place to stay! The hotel is so nice and our room was really awesome! We had a living room area with a kitchenette and separate room with it's own door, which was great because we had our one year old and it was easy to put him to sleep in the room. They also had a crib for us! AJ (front desk) was outstanding. Anything we need, he did it for us. Next time we hope to stay for a vacation and not an evacuation!

review_body: Came for a business trip. Walked in to a staff that was friendly and very professional. The room was very clean. review_body: Arrived for a short stay. Rooms were clean and spacious. Hotel was very well kept overall.Staff were very friendly. hotelName:
5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...

review_body: We go there, checked in, and went to a movie - we got back, and I went for a swim (nice pool). When I got back to the room, someone was trying to get our TV to work and had been attempting to fix it ever since I left. We requested another room, and were given keys to a comparable room (but of course, we had to repack, and relocate, which was a pain) - the 'new room' stunk badly of carpet fresh, but it did have a working TV.We stayed two nights. The 2nd night, the folks directly above us apparently brought a herd of elephants that were about to knock our light fixtures out of the ceiling - you think I am exaggerating, but this is a pretty accurate assessment of the noise level. Anyway, after about an hour of this, I picked up the phone to call the front desk and guess what - we might have had a TV that worked, but we didn't have a phone that did. Anyway, the elephants left for several hours, only to renew their efforts to dislodge the light fixtures well after bedtime. I just don't know if we will stay here again or not.

review_body: The hotel building is located a bit off from the main street, so even when Google map finished the navigation, i could not see the hotel. However, there is a big sign so you cannot miss. Staff is nice and friendly. They welcomed me with big smile. kindly explain everything i should know. The room is big. The room was well ACed, it was a hot day, so that helped me to cool down. Bathroom was clean. Towels were like brand-new. The breakfast is decent not fancy but good enough. Closed to many restaurants, but you need a car (don't forget you are in Texas).My room was not facing to the freeway, so it was quiet. Yes, i would recommend and i would stay again if i have a chance.

Very well-run, friendly and honest staff - we look forward to our next visit!

The rooms are clean and modern with a great desk for catching up on work. The hotel offers a lovely happy hour with free wine or beer and appetizers. Excellent property - will definitely return.

5    Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Austin NW -...

review_body: This Fairfield Inn has nice appeal without the downtown prices. The modern rooms were clean and comfortable, but on the small side. The bathrooms are large with large walk-in showers. The hot breakfast met my needs with scrambled eggs, omelets, vegan and pork suasage, fresh fruit and cereals. The hotel website advertises Asian entrees, but I only saw white rice as an Asian entree (side). Instead of regular HBO, the hotel has HBO GO where you can browse HBO series and movies for replay. My only problem was that the hotel sits along side of I-35 and the road noise kept me up throughout the night. I tried using the hotel ear plugs supplied in the bathroom, but the low rumbling noise on semis going down the freeway woke me up consistantly. My recommendation would be to request a room furthest from the freeway.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very nice. I enjoyed my stay there and I thought that the breakfast was very good. I thought the staff was helpful and I definitely enjoyed my stay there. I would definitely recommend thishotel.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was hot and AC doesn't work, my kids are found blood from the bed sheets. Sure they didn't washed good. And the front desk wasn't nice. Maybe needs more training. Would not go back again. Not worth it to pay that much money.

6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane

review_body: Without exception, entire staff was very professional, pleasant and very helpful. Room was terrific and was well suited for getting my work done. Only complaint, business center has one computer, not the usual two found at Fairfield Inn and the one computer froze multiple times when I used it.

review_body: Nice, clean and updated hotel. It’s about 12 miles from downtown so plan for a 25 minute ride to downtown with the traffic. Breakfast is served. It’s not great but it’s hot and there’s variety. All-in-all a great value for the money.

review_body: My family and I weren’t completely blown away by this hotel, but it was ok for what we needed. It has been recently renovated and there were nice finishes, but some things that were frustrating. We kept hearing a ringing sound all night that wouldn’t go away and I did notice some dead bugs in the window sill. We liked the fact that the TV had Netflix. The shower was nice and big. The breakfast was fine and gave us our fill. We probably wouldn’t stay here again if given the choice.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to drive up to Austin for a weekend getaway we called ahead to let them know that we will be coming in on Saturday instead of Friday lo and behold they charged us for Friday as a no-show and then charged me three different rates one outrageous rate for Friday another rate for Saturday and then another crazy rate for Sunday. When I called on Monday the young lady who answered the phone pretty much called me a liar I told her that I had the email confirmation and she still didn't believe me. My brother told me just to leave it alone they they may need the money more than we do. Never once did they try to offer anything to us not will take a lot to take off a night stay. I wasn't looking for a thing for free. But to be called a liar I have a problem with that I have a huge problem with that this Fairfield needs to step it up I will let everyone know never to stay at this property and to all of those who read this please make sure you check your accounts because they will take your money and not refunded.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay. Very clean and a wonderful staff! We were in Austin for our granddaughter’s birthday. The staff went out of their way to make all of us feel welcome. We will return on our next to this wonderful city!
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is renovated and looks great. New mattresses and décor. Staff is always nice and helpful and they offer a very nice breakfast with lots of choices. I stay there for business monthly and am always pleased.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane

review_body: I was invited to speak at SXSW at the very last minute was able to get a room at Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North. Understandable, due to SXSW, most downtown hotels would have been fully booked, so this was the next closest option even though it is about 10miles from the Austin Convention Centre. The room rate was at its peak pricing due to the event but on the positive side, the room was clean and a decent size. It has a large shower but shower lacks pressure. Breakfast was provided but had a limited selection. Coffee and tea was provided all hours of the day. In the morning they serves the better quality Davidoff coffee which is which a pick me up for my daily commute to downtown Austin.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is under construction. We recently stayed in room 227. The room smelled like mildew and was in the 80s when we walked in. There was an old soap in the shower so i assumed it hadnt been cleaned properly. My boyfriend went down for breakfast the next day and it was empty and had a funny smell. He asked the lady if they were going to add more or refresh and she said it shuts down at 9 am, which was a lie, it's 9:30 am. I had to request new blankets because ours were dirty. My boyfriends parents were staying in the same room, but they had the 4th floor and it was newer and smelled better. So if you are going to stay request the 4th floor, it was the same room with a microwave and updates. We had loud banging from the construction that began at 8:30 am. It was directly on top of us from the floor above. They should warn the guests of this. We had no warning. I also requested bags which were never brought up. I had to go down and get them, but the manager did refund me little points. Overall, I would never stay here again.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: when we travel to austin to see family. we always stay at Fairfield in. the rooms are comfortable and very clean but the most important is the beds feel like our bed at home. safety is very important ...

review_body: Best experience I’ve had with hotel staff. Phil was at the front desk and he was always so excited to see you and would share a big smile and light up your day even if you didn’t know him! Overall, good visit and clean room with a comfy bed! My only complaint is the AC unit in the room wouldn’t continuously run when I would set it but I never asked about it since I was only there two nights so maybe I just didn’t know how to work it right.

review_body: Came to town to visit a friend and go to the West Virginia @ Texas game! Enjoyed the stay completely the complimentary breakfast was a plus, Stormy was a great front desk clerk, just wished the pool heater wasn’t broken during the stay, oh well still great time!!

review_body: Staff members were great. Location was not to bad, but a little difficult to get to during high traffic times. My room was fine, but bathroom, toilet, had something left behind on the seat. I don't usually have a need for ice, but this one time I did. Each of the five floors had an ice machine. However, only the one on the 5th floor was working. Additionally, the water pressure, in the shower, was the worst I have ever come across in any hotel. That would have to be my biggest issue. The Overall experience was fine considering the price of the room.

For the price we were treated like Royality. Will definitely be coming back here next time we visit. Thank you Fairfield, you all should be proud of this location!

review_body: Enjoyed the stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suite, personnel was very cordial & welcoming. Breakfast buffet caters to everyone's taste including very healthy options. Rooms and beds are very comfortable and with lots of light.

review_body: The location, the attention, the good mood with which they greet you, the room, security, breakfast included, no noise, rested after a long trip from new York, I'm from Monterrey, Mexico and we definitely came back to stay, on our visit to Austin, the Most beautiful city in the USA.

review_body: I would personally like to acknowledge the outstanding service of William "Will" King at the Fairfield Inn Austin N location. He went above and beyond the service levels we've been experiencing these days. I did completed a survey and shared with Marriott.com so please read those comments and recognize Will in a positive way.My sister, almost 88 yr old mother and my 23 yr old niece decided to take one last summer trip to visit our 95 yr. old cousin and to go outlet mall shopping in San Marcos after a morning of shopping in Wimberley so as you can imagine our hotel budget was small to allow more $$ for our shopping excursions. When I booked the room online, it was described as 2 queen beds, when I was reviewing just before booking, it said "double room, double beds" so I called the number provided, reached Fairfield Inn and verbally verified beds were indeed queen sized. I even asked for the mattress measurements and was told 60" X 80" (queen). When we arrived and checked in, the beds were indeed full and not queen. I'm 5'8", 235 lbs and am smallest of our group with exception of my mom at 5', 145 lbs so you can understand our need for the bigger beds if we're sharing! Anyway, Will came to our rescue after a long/hot day of driving and visiting family - offered several alternatives and then since something was wrong with the agreed upon roll away bed, he offered us a second room complimentary which we graciously and happily accepted. Best stay ever!
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks for your excellent service. Come o guys seriously 200 characters.. the service was outstanding.. I found the rooms to be clean and comfortable, although the ac was a bit loud at times. The front desk clerks were extremely courteous and helpful. It seemed as though they all loved what they do and understand the importance of excellent customer service. They all deliveredexceptional customer services..

6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane

I also had asked housekeeper Meche questions and for help who was very willing to help me. I will definitely return here my next trip to texas.

review_body: This location was very clean & had very professional, customer oriented employees. Front desk person who checked me in, Phillip, was very helpful & took the time to find the best rate. He never showed any irritation regardless of the number of questions asked.

review_body: Zoe killed it on customer service and professionalism. review_body: The staff was great; nice rooms; location wasn't that hard to get to. They gave us good directions, too bad that Austin is so congested. I would recommend this location to everyone. It was interesting to see the noodle soup, look like just noodles and the rice for breakfast. Never thought of that, but with the variety of customers, great idea.
