review_body: I have never met a more friendly staff. I stayed 5 nights and was treated like gold. The room was clean. The breakfast was good and fresh. Plenty of fruit meats, cereal, and coffee. There is nothing I can complain about.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stay at this location. There are a number of restaurants and shopping in the area. Fairly easy to get out on N. Lamar Blvd and I-35. We had some air conditioning issues on the our first room on the 5th floor, but the staff was quick to move us to another room on the 4th floor. A/C worked great there. We previously stayed on the second floor and the room seemed to be a little more up to date with lamps having USB adapters for electronics. It also seemed a bit more noisy with traffic on the 4th and 5th floor. We plan to ask for a lower floor and stay on the south side of the building in the future as we stayed on the 2nd floor, south side the first time and found it quieter. We did enjoy the new television that allowed to log in for streaming videos on Netflix and Hulu. Overall a comfortable stay.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m always on the go with my children and their sports. This was a nice place to stay. Next to almost everything. Food fun and shopping. This was a AAU basketball trip. The hotel staff was awesome. The amenities kept everyone busy.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel/motel location was very accessible to all my travel within proximity and convenient to restaurants and shopping. The daily breakfast was outstanding serving hot/cold choices. I will certainly return to Fairfield Inn & Suites on my travel in the Austin, Texas area. I highly recommend this motel.
hotelName:
6    Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin North/Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service is always very friendly and polite from the Valet peeps to Front Desk, Housekeeping and the onsite restaurants.I'm a regular Marriott visitor but the the fun vibe and friendliness at this Aloft stand out. There are many, many Downtown activities within easy walking distance of the Aloft but if you want to stay on premise they have you covered with a restaurant and coffee shop and even an indoor/outdoor bar! They will even lend you a pair of Cowboy boots for the evening for the full Texan experience!The same building also houses an Element Hotel (I haven't stayed there). Great views of Downtown ATX.Valet parking only although there's a public lot across 7th Street.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed June 2019 for a conference. Hotel is new, nicely appointed for millennials. No pool. Titanium member breakfast voucher to Caroline coffee shop for breakfast for $20 a person up to two people. Breakfast was very good with several tasty options. The Caroline bar on the second floor is awesome. Great happy hour deals. Always very busy after work. Hotel needs a service elevator. Highly annoying how many times the elevator stops on each floor and most of the time I was on the elevator it is full of hotel employees. Too late to install the service elevator, but poorly designed in that sense. Almost wouldn’t stay here because of it, but Caroline coffee shop and lounge would be the only reason to entice myself to stay again. Austin has a severe problem with the homeless. I travel all the time for work and in my short walk to the convention center each day, I was aggressively approached by homeless asking for money. I never experience this in any other city to the magnitude that it happened in Austin. Nothing against this hotel or the location of the hotel as it’s a city problem. I would not come back to Austin until this homeless issue is figured out.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone at this property was very friendly and wanted to do everything they could to take care of you. Specially, the management, front desk, bartenders, servers, valet had a great sense of humor and wanted to make your normal generic hotel stay a memorable one.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Aloft during SXSW. Having never been to Austin, we didn't know the area at all, but did know this would be central to most everything we wanted to do, and we're fans of the Aloft brand. It was more perfect than we could have imagined, and we were able to walk to just about everything! We only took Lyft twice, when we were going a few miles away.The staff here is amazing, extremely friendly and helpful. Both Caroline, the on-site restaurant/cafe/lounge, and Upstairs at Caroline, its more trendy counterpart upstairs, are much-better-than-average hotel bars (I reviewed them both separately) also. Aloft hotels always have fun touches, and this one offers Bliss toiletries in a convenient dispenser in the shower, as well as "Boots to Borrow" down in the lobby, which I loved.Some reviewers disliked the location because of noise and a large number of homeless people. Personally, when I'm staying in a large city's downtown area, I'm not looking for a quiet stay, so street noise wouldn't bother me a bit. Having said that, we didn't hear much actual noise, outside of occasional sirens, and we were only on the 8th floor. We enjoyed looking down and people watching when we were in for the night, and there was a lot of activity to see, but noise was not an issue. Our room also had amazing blackout shades that we used when we went to sleep, maybe that helped. As far as the homeless population, maybe the police were more on top of it because it was SXSW, but we didn't see more than just a handful.Overall, if you want to be close to everything in this part of town, stay here!
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the things I like most about the Aloft brand is that you know exactly what you're going to get. Aside from common spaces, the hotels are outfitted in almost exactly the same way. The rooms are modular and slightly dorm-roomish, but here, as in other Aloft hotels, the vibe is modern and a little chic and there's plenty of space. The bathrooms will not appeal to the luxury-crazed, but they're perfectly serviceable. And that's what I like most about this Aloft (and others)--when you reserve a room, there will be, for the most part, no surprises. This hotel has buzzier common spaces, and the dog-friendly policy makes it ground-zero for pet-toting travelers. None of that bothers me, but if you're looking for a more serene, or dog-free travel experience, you'll want to check other options. The elevator situation (lobby is not in the first floor) is slightly irritating, but we never had to wait long to get upstairs, so, all in all, it wasn't bad. The location is great--very near the capitol. We'll be back.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The team at the Aloft Austin (Downtown) was very accommodating. Friendly service (both in person and via sms platform) from the initial welcome to the check out process has this hotel on my list of top places to stay when in town. The coffee shop on the first floor is an absolute must visit, and the location of the hotel is within walking distance of some wonderful bars and restaurants (only 4 blocks from The Roosevelt Room)! Be back soon!
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in Austin at the Aloft. Great location, walking distance to everywhere. If you don't want to walk less than a $10 Uber ride to everything. Small rooms, but we were never in our room except to sleep. Comfortable bed and pillows. We bought the breakfast with our room rate and it was worth every penny, delicious. The hotel has a young vibe as does all of downtown Austin. Will definitely stay there again when I am in Austin.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My favorite hotel in Austin. Conveniently located downtown with a fun outdoor lounge in Caroline. If you are in a rush, the restaurant is great and I always find my creativity sparked sitting Upstairs at Caroline with a Pearl Snap.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place. Has that funky, hip feel to it and it is a well maintained property. Only issue is that it is in downtown Austin and unfortunately there are homeless people and beggars littering the streets on both sides of the hotel. The place is outstanding, but just be prepared to step over folks lying on the sidewalk. Not this issue of the hotel, but rather the city's policies
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our experience. The staff was fantastic. They were friendly and clearly service oriented. The rooms are nice and modern with a big comfortable bed. We also really enjoyed the restaurant and bar on site. Great drinks from coffee to adult beverages. Location was great with easy access just around the corner to 6th street. Would stay again.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice little hotel that coexists with The Element. Rooms are smaller, but I was flying solo in town for just a few nights for a bachelor part so I did not spend much time in room/hotel. On site bar and restaurant with games, but I did not use. It's one bock up from all the 6th street action, so no need for a car. Bed was comfortable, JBL bluetooth alarm clock/speaker to stream all your music was nice. Room also equipped with refrigerator and small safe. Only complaint, I could not locate the ice machine and when I called front desk, no one answered.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice property for an in and out weekend stay. Good location to all things downtown. The ALoft room is basically an upscale dorm room with very efficient use of space. Nothing fancy, but effective. This particular property has a very nice indoor/outdoor roof top bar scene going on. The kind where you play bag toss, drink a few beers, and bring your dog if you’re a guy who needs help meeting the ladies. Full service restaurant on site. Would we stay here again? Sure.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is perfectly located and has the right vibe for Downtown. You wouldn’t need a car as nearly everything is within walking or scooter distance. The staff is very attentive and professional and the rooms are good sized and laid out well-also very clean. I used the fitness center which is good sized with a good assortment of equipment. The restaurant, Caroline’s is outstanding as well...had the chicken and waffles and cauliflower chorizo tacos- both were excellent! Stayed here for business but this place would be equally good for families, couples and anyone wanting to soak in the vibe of Austin.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. We were up on a higher floor and the views were awesome. Location is great. Cool bar on the second floor that is worth checking out at some point. Amenities are more basic (no robes or fancy bathroom items) but that doesn't bother me. We will stay here next time we come to town.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights for a business trip and this hotel met my needs. It was par for the course Aloft with better then usual food and nightlife options. The coffee bar with Togo breakfast tacos and TO DIE FOR nutella buns was a big highlight. In downtown Austin there are so many options, and for a hotel coffee bar to have a constant line says a lot about the quality. Took a star off due to excessive time spent waiting fo elevators (they are used for service/employees as well) and especially horrible pillows. My room was quiet but some colleagues had sleepless nights due to noise. Otherwise it was a comfortable stay and I would stay again.Shout out to Justin for being especially pleasant at check in!
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good visit for a Saturday night stay. Great staff, very helpful! Great location. Close to everything we needed. Nice bar with good ambiance on second floor. Seems to be very popular. Good gym to do lil workout. Lil expensive for the aloft is only downside. Other than that, was a nice stay.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Aloft is a bit unique. It is different than run of the mill hotels. The decor and ambiance are refreshing. The rooms are clean and simple and nicely decorated. The views were great from the 29th floor! The service was very good. The restaurant and bar were very convenient and refreshing and nice! The coffee bar on the first floor was nice. 4 of us adults stayed in a room - and my only complaint is the room is not big on privacy. The "doors" to the bathroom are not meant for privacy - so beware of that! The location is just perfect - a half a block from 6th and close to everything.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have platinum with ambassador status, so I stay at a lot of Marriott hotels and I have to say I was stunned by the care that this property provides: concierge texting, welcome amenities, delicious breakfast, walk to the elevator from checkin, and the high quality decor (amazing shower)! Kudos to Yuriko, Cole, Emily, Drew, and Tucker for making this one of my best stays in the last 12 months.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has the best service I have had! The team goes out of their way to make you at home. The location is perfect and walkable to everything !! The hotel food is outstanding and the bar is a very fun scene
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location to walk the downtown area. Close to lots of great restaurants, the capital, the convention center and the visitors center for lots of different tours. Nice second floor dog friendly bar. Very clean and friendly. A great home base in a bustling city.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose the Aloft downtown for my daughter and friends to visit Austin for the weekend due to its’ central location and being a new Marriott property. Due to the SXSW crowd building and the political speeches in action, downtown was quite busy. Yuriko contacted me to see if there were any special requests before arriving. I requested a 2P early check in knowing the hotel had a 3P published check-in hoping they might be able to accommodate. Their room was a bit delayed, as they received the keys at 3:20P, however, Yuriko and staff did upgrade the room to a corner on the 28th floor with great views of the city, extended a $20 credit for the bar and hand delivered a gift bag to their room after they were settled in. My daughter and friends texted and said the hotel had a great atmosphere, well decorated and energy due to the staff. Tucker texted me this morning to ensure her stay was going well and asked if there was anything he and the staff could do this morning to ensure they had everything they needed. Yuriko, Tucker and staff extended a 3P late check out and went above and beyond. I will choose the Aloft downtown location the next time I visit Austin!
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before I arrived the team at Aloft connected with me via SMS to see when I would be arriving. My check-in process was great (even at midnight). They followed up with me the following morning to see if my stay was going well. The whole experience has been very welcoming and nice.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think a lot of people would enjoy this hotel, very hip place. It's close to 6th street and many downtowns restaurants. The rooms are modern and clean with an excellent view of the city. I would visit again in the future.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. Great vibe and very cool bar. Caroline's downstairs is a wonderful restaurant as well. Walk to capital,restaurant s, clubs,live music venues. Definitely back to Aloft again on future trips.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to Austin quite a bit for work, will pay almost all price points, so I'm well-acquainted with Austin hotel properties. My #1 preferred hotel in Austin is hands-down the Aloft Austin Downtown (which shares the building/floors with the Element hotel, a sister brand, so my common-area review could apply to both). The rooms are consistent with the Aloft brand. Not huge or luxurious, but always comfortable and practical. I jokingly refer of Aloft rooms as "luxury college dormitory" style, but this is said with complete affection.The Aloft Downtown Austin differentiates itself by the experience. A stay at the Aloft is truly an Austin experience, of the fantastic kind. While a trip to Austin might be for work or other responsibilities, almost everyone also wants to experience the famous Austin vibe and experiences. The Austin vibe is alive and well at the Aloft Downtown Austin, you almost don't even need to leave the property in the evening (but eventually you should, of course!). The property is the epitome of cool, in the fun not obnoxious way (I'm too unhip for obnoxious properties).Caroline (1st level) and Upstairs at Caroline (2nd level) are great places to dine, drink, relax and have fun. Tellingly, both are filled with locals. Caroline has great coffee/baked goods/breakfasts, and then offers great food and drinks during the lunch and dinner hours. Upstairs at Caroline opens late/mid afternoon, depending on the day of week, and is a playground of fun, with great outdoor space and game tables by the bar - and they have great tacos (!), and I'm picky about tacos. By the adjacent reception desk area, it's a quieter but still very fun place to sit with your work emails and enjoy a scene - if work emails can be described as fun. The staff is unfailingly polite, friendly and service-oriented. A really impressive team. You can even rent cowboy boots at the reception for a night out at the country bars and dance halls (hello, Broken Spoke)! That sorta says it all about the Aloft Austin Downtown.While you're in the heart of Austin's entertainment areas, try to visit the city's great cultural experiences. The new-ish Austin Library is extraordinary in design and experience, and you will feel like you're really part of the Austin community - it's like a community center for the locals, just brilliant. The University of Texas museums are world-class and not to be missed if you have the time: the Harry Ransom Center (amazing! the 2nd largest archive only to the US National Archive in Washington DC), the Blanton Museum (largest university museum in the USA, largest Latin American art collection in the USA, and second largest European art collection only to the Smithsonian), and the LBJ Presidential Library (stunning, and make sure you take the elevator to the top floor for the Oval Office experience, plus great views).
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WOW ... Aloft Downtown Austin "knocked it out of the park" !!!!!As a frequent business traveler, Marriott is my preferred hotel. With those benefits, my wife and I took a short weekend getaway and chose Aloft Austin Downtown.While it is an excellent property, our experience was made extra special by David, Drew, and the entire Aloft team. Their attention to detail and extra touches made our combined birthday and anniversary weekend spectacular.Aloft Austin Downtown will always be my "go to place" whether it be business and/or fun getaway !!!
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first time staying at Aloft downtown in Austin and we loved it! Great location to walk to so many restaurant and bars. The place was clean, the staff was nice and friendly, the bar and restaurant were fun. From morning coffee and baked goods (they even have gluten free delicious baked goods) each morning to a drink on the rooftop at night (with over-sized games to play) it's a great place to stay. They recommended lots of places and all of them were fantastic. I'll stay here again next time I'm in Austin.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent property - extraordinary service/people. Just had a company event here and everyone was so happy - with the rooms, meeting space, food and incredible service. Special thanks to Kim in events and Matt who helped make sure we were always taken care of. Awesome experience.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2nd trip to Austin and will not stay anywhere else. The rooms are clean and they have everything you need on the property with restaurants to fitness center. The staff is the most helpful and friendly that you will find.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Great vibe. Amazing service. Restaurant and cocktail lounge inviting and top notch. Dog friendly too! We were blown away by the staff, room cleanliness. All details were taken care of.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prime location, and tons of entertainment around it, room is decent with modern design, and front desk is super friendly.I have a inquiry for trip advisor, “don’t force user to type minimum character” it’s so anti-user friendly feature.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Aloft for three days over MLK Jr. weekend. My husband and I are legacy SPG customers and used our annual free night for two nights and points for the second night. However, Marriott's booking system is terrible - I had to call customer service only and they had to book 3 separate reservations. When we arrived at the hotel, they could not merge all 3 reservations, so I had to go down each morning to "check-in". I don't blame the hotel but Marriott's poor IT integration due to the merger - it's been months and there are still issues on that front.The Aloft is great - we had a standard room with double beds and it was enough for this small family of three. The bathroom was a nice size with a large counter - the water pressure needs some work; shower worked fine but the sink was horrible. The room (and hotel) were spotless. Had a wonderful view of the State Capitol on the 31st floor. The only two complaints: Caroline's is a fantastic spot - breakfast was great but if you want coffee and a pastry to go, the line can get really long. This building also houses Element and I think the to-go area is too small and can't accommodate the influx of guests. The second complaint, parking is outrageous at $47 (incl tax) a night. I'm from Los Angeles and hotels DTLA don't even charge this much - these prices are San Francisco and NYC prices. While Austin is a lovely town, it's nowhere near these two metropolitan cities. There is a parking garage to self park down the street but that was even $30 a night.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service I received was outstanding! I booked at a very busy time and needed some adjustments. Justin and Cole went out of their way to accommodate me. This is the first hotel experience that I truly believe the staff cared about my well being. Next time I am in Austin for business I will be going out of my way to stay at the Aloft.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right in the middle of downtown. The room is very nice, I think almost brand new, better design than other aloft hotels. Frond desk staff Tucker very helpful during check in and check out processes, which made my stay very pleasant.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely amazing service! Cole and his associate were wonderful while checking in and the woman in the morning (I didn’t catch her name) was awesome and gave me great recommendations! Housekeeping staff was also super friendly and my room was pristine! So happy with how everything went.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in Austin at the ALoft. Great downtown location. Easy walking to the action. The room was very European and had a great view. No bath tub or conditioner for your hair. I’m not a fan of 2 in 1 shampoos. The water was softened, so it did help a bit. Beds were super firm, pillows mushy and unsupported. Needless to say I didn’t sleep well. Valet parking only and $45 per day! Kind of a cluster to get in and out. The second floor bar was happening. It rained for a few days so all the fun stuff on the balcony area was closed. Bummer. It looked super fun. Breakfast on the 1st floor was good. We had vouchers to eat, otherwise super pricey for breakfast. Unique and tasty, but $$$. All in all it was good. Austin was super fun and we needed more than 2 1/2 days exploring.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went for to visit a friend and ended up staying at this hotel. We were amazed by the service of the working staff there.The rooms were also incredible. Amazingly comfortable beds. I'd gladly stay there time and time again if given the opportunity.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a wonderful experience staying at this hotel. It was our first night away from our 14 month-old and when the staff found out during check-in they put us in an amazing corner room on the 31st floor with a view overlooking the entire city. Also they left a bottle of champagne in our room while we were out. Everyone of the staff members we encountered were extremely friendly and kind. I have never had such amazing service at a hotel and will not hesitate to recommend Aloft in Austin to anyone.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Full disclosure: I am in the travel business. Stayed here on Nov 16th for 2 nights. The hotel exceeded expectations in some areas, fell just a little short in others; but on the whole….two thumbs up. Check-in and check-out were quick and very efficient. Our room, as well as any public area we saw, was immaculate. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and professional. Lounge area is very popular, so much so that it was extremely noisy. Hotel has a nicely equipped, and really not too small, fitness room. Room service arrived quickly and food was hot. However, our request for extra napkins was overlooked, forcing us to use bath towels when eating a (generous) order of wings. (Hope the laundry was able to get the stains out!) Complimentary newspaper and bottled water in the lobby were most welcome pluses. We thought it odd that we were told the hotel has no ice machine, and that ice would be delivered to the room upon request, since we found an ice machine ready for guests’ use on the second floor. As our stay was quite brief, we did not use the Housekeeping service, so cannot comment on this. Had a lovely corner room on the 29th floor with a great view of the state capitol building. Being so high up, we heard little street noise, but think lower floors might be problematic in this regard. This is, after all, a downtown hotel! Location is outstanding. Used car service to get to the restaurants on the south side of the Congress Ave. bridge, but took a leisurely walk back from there to the hotel without any problem. Plenty of nearby places to dine. One design flaw we take issue with (here and in other properties) is room lighting that requires way too much light to be on in order to have any light at all in the potty area. Very disturbing to sleeping partners. On the whole we consider this a fine property, and I will be happy to recommend this hotel to clients going forward.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cole and Samantha and the entire staff in the bar and restaurant provided excellent service. We really felt like the staff welcomed us, and want to welcome us again. Great work! We cannot wait to return to this property.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great find Aloft was for our trip to Austin with friends. Everyone was very friendly and helpful during our long weekend. The views were great from our rooms and the rooms are very clean. We would definitely stay here again. I/we loved the Coffee Bar in the lobby area, Caroline's on the second floor for drinks after our evening out and we also loved the area on the third floor lobby (Elements) for just hanging and playing cards after our full day and before our evening out. We didn't eat at either of the places here but they were very busy so I'm guessing that they are good. So happy we found this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My company hosted a group of 25 people for a conference in Austin. We enjoyed the location, and the staff is courteous. The rooms are small but clean, and fortunately, the elevators are fast. I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't have to wait long for an elevator, as the hotel is over 30 floors. It seems that the Aloft and Element should combine into one property instead of keeping them separate, confusing people checking in and figuring out where to eat. Not a huge deal, but it seems unnecessary now that Starwood and Marriott are merged. The food in the restaurant (Caroline) was good, the service not unfriendly but not overly friendly either. The Rise breakfast was perfect my needs.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel - great location, good amenities, nice restaurant and humble staff. The location is a dream location with all the nice places around - walking to a lot of must see. The rooms are modern and comfortable. Definitely staying at this place again.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Entrance is confusing to everyone when they first arrive and try to figure out where to go. Restaurant is on the ground floor. Aloft tiny lobby is on 2nd floor. Element lobby is on the 3rd floor. Go figure. Only an issue when you first get there, but very odd.Location - if you're there for the food on the next block over, then location is good for you. Rooms - I'm not Aloft's target audience. It was one of the only places I could get so I didn't have a choice. Rooms are really small!!! Luckily the floor to ceiling windows help to lessen the clastrophobicness of the room. Mattress is good enough to get a decent nights sleep. Pint sized closet. If I was only paying $100-150/night, I wouldn't be so critical, but I was unlucky and everything was sold out. I got shafted in having to paying $350/night for 3 nights. This is NOT a $350/night hotel by any means! The service, quality, decor, and room are not at that price point by any means! If I was at the higher end property ~4 blocks away then it would be different. Elevators were fast, but the interior doors had huge restaurant advertisement...really tacky! Bottom line: If priced right, property is acceptable for a short stay.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a corner room on the twelfth floor I wanted to live in. The room was exceptional with its comfort and views. Caroline's, the hotel's restaurant and bar, was a wonderful place to hang out and relax.From front desk personnel to bar and wait staff, everyone was approachable, professional, and friendly.The only issue - and not the property's fault - the homeless and junkies are quite assertive and I do not recommend walking around this part of downtown alone.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights over the Formula 1 weekend. The room was fine, a little small and nothing special. Comfortable bed. The hotel is centrally located and has a fantastic bar (Carolines). Recommend for a place in Austin if you won't be spending much time there.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was quick to reach out prior to check in and made the process a breeze. Shower was heaven after a long day at COTA and the bar had excellent food and drinks. Breakfast in Caroline's could not have been better. All around great trip!
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Funky decor, floor to ceiling corner room windows and a very, very vibrant bar scene combined with killer location makes this hotel a star. The restaurant is excellent with some of the best Huevos Rancheros I have ever had. Try the Peppered Bacon Bloody Mary. Recommended highly.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great simple accommodations in the heart of the city. twenty minutes from the airport. Modern decor which we love. Valet parking is a gem and customer service is on point. Definately would return next time I am in Austin.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome hotel in downtown Austin!! Can’t beat this location - in the middle of everything!! Great rooftop bar and awesome restaurants downstairs in Caroline - highly recommend for dinner or brunch on weekends!! This hotel will even outfit you with cowboys boots to wear for the weekend, at no cost!!! Do Austin the right way - aloft or element hotels in downtown!! Great staff and super accommodating on all requests!!!
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect, you are right in the heart of Austin with all its nightlife and live music. Easy walking to anything or pick up a Lime or Bird e-scotter to jet around town. As for the hotel, it is split building plan with an Aloft hotel. My Element room was modern and cozy. The bed was extremely comfortable. The service was very friendly and professional. There is a restaurant/bakery/coffee shop (Caroline's) in the lobby. I did not eat there but they also have a second floor rooftop bar, I did visit that and it was very relaxing/entertaining for an evening drink and conversation with co-workers. The complimentary hotel breakfast was above average, I suspect the Caroline's restaurant downstairs supplies some of the egg burritos and pastries, all real good. Also for right after work the hotel has a complimentary cocktail hour from 5-6:30 providing wine and a selection of local craft beers, as well as light snacks of bread, olives and cheese. This is great before venturing out for dinner and then coming back for a nightcap at the rooftop bar. All followed by the comfy bed to charge up before another day of work. In closing, work brought me on this trip but I would also stay here for a vacation.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were traveling with our cats and booked this hotel specifically because it advertised itself as "pet friendly" on its website. We had stayed at Aloft in Asheville, NC with our cats before and loved it. However, when we checked in to this hotel, we were told that "pet-friendly" meant "dog-friendly" only. We were allowed to stay, but we would not receive any housekeeping services and would have to take out our own trash. Additionally, the corner room we had paid for was not ready by the listed check-in time, and we were given an inside room (which has a lower rate) instead without any compensation. Very disappointed with my experience.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My work brought me to Austin and I tried a number of hotels downtown until I checked into Aloft/Element. Immediately I noticed a different energy. It felt like I was home. People were friendly (but not necessarily professional friendliness), they welcomed me as if I was their long lost causin!! In the past two months, every week, I decide to leave the Elements Downtown and try a new hotel, but I come across something that keeps me here for more and that is genuine care with personalized touch. Though the coffee is excellent at Carolines, or the 600 count goose feather pillows are comfortable, and bathrooms are futueristic and Zen, while the entire hotel is open, airy, super clean, and feng-shui for me it is the genuine smile on the friendly and professional faces of the staff in their hotel that keeps me for more… Element hotel is also capable of serving Vegan clients like me with healthy breakfasts, bicycles to borrow, and a well-equped gym. There are lots more and I will share later…. I got to go walking on the near by lake…
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We usually stay in Marriotts, but this was the first time in Aloft. We really liked it! The room was small, but the space was used efficiently. Nice bathroom and comfy bed. Each staff member was very friendly and helpful! Always offering bottles of water. Just all around great customer service! The cafe in the lobby had Bulletproof coffee, so that was a nice bonus! And the snack shop had plenty of healthy options like GF goodies, kombucha and Chameleon iced coffees. Def recommend this hotel right in the heart of downtown Austin.
hotelName:
7    Aloft Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We brought our daughter to orientation at UT and chose to stay here because of the proximity to campus and where we needed to be on the first day of orientation. Hotel is good--room was clean, beds comfortable, AC cold, plenty of towels, decent coffee for breakfast. Water pressure was meh, but I can look past that. Pool could've used a sweeping or two, but it wasn't terrible. There aren't any restaurants in walking distance, so know that you'l have to drive or Uber to get places. It was a 15-20 minute drive (in morning Austin traffic) to the UT campus. Workers were friendly and readily available. They have a little mini-mart store that you can purchase snacks, drinks, etc. We have many trips to Austin in the future, and we will look to stay here again. Advice to management: with how the pool is situated, get some tables with umbrellas to block the scorching afternoon summer sun.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bed skirts is molded, the bedspread is full of stained, the carpet is molded, the room is musty smelling. Wifi is terrible. Lost connection every 5min. I can't believe seeing cockroaches in the room.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I felt the room was overpriced after nothing but either cereal or waffles were available for breakfast. Instead of checking to refill empty food choices, employees got coffee for themselves then sat down to visit until time to clean up & close down the breakfast. I stayed at a different hotel chain the next night for about $25 less and was privy to a full breakfast choice with an employee checking to see if anything needed refills.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel because of the Sleep, Park, Fly feature. I'm from Waco and had an early morning international flight. I requested the 4 a.m. shuttle the night before as is requested by the hotel, despite having everything squared away I woke up the next morning and was told the shuttle wasn't running that morning and that I'd be reimbursed for an Uber. The Uber ended up being $12 and some change -- the clerk offer me $12 -- which is no big deal, but I have a feeling that would not be acceptable if our roles were reversed. I ended up leaving around 4:15/20 -- not too far off schedule, but sometimes that slight difference does make an impact -- next time I will come down earlier just in case it happens again. Upon my return, I called for a pick-up and it was quick and easy -- no problems.It was conveniently located close to the airport. The room was fine, but average. Water pressure was lacking in the rooms, but could be fixed easily. I would book again because its the only Sleep, Park, Fly hotel near the Austin airport.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was ok. Clean bed, mostly clean room. Upon arrival and check-in they requested $100 deposit even though my room was already paid for in full. I honestly did not have the extra money, all I had was the cash on me and that was to eat on. Thankfully, She waved it and let us check in.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean property, comfortable room. Like everywhere in Austin there is road construction so doing u turns when leaving. A lot of activity in the parking lot, cars pulling in and out, people standing outside, etc. did not feel unsafe however

review_body: Everything was great! Great service, really clean rooms, everyone was super nice! Only bad thing is the construction happening on 183 right next to hotel, other than that everything was perfect! Will definetly stay again for sure!! For couples try the suite with jacuzzi tub!!!❤️❤️

review_body: Stayed for two days during ACL. Good place. About a 10-15 Uber ride. Had breakfast, good sized room, front desk was very nice. There was alot of construction at the time, but still easily accessible. Would stay again.

review_body: I placed a reservation online through Booking.com and when my request were not correct. The staff and manager said it was because I place it the website and not direct with them. After arguing with him, he finally decided to make it right. Come to find out, they over charged me from the price that was quoted to me online. Will not be staying here again.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North

review_body: Good job , Check in was easy . Computers in the lobby worked great . The morning breakfast was a great bonus . The only mishap was my room keycard would not work after the maids cleaned my room . For some reason this happened two days in a row. I had to go downstairs and wait in line to have the desk reset my keycard. Check out was a breeze .
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very impressed by service at the desk when I arrived. I had several issues with my first room, and she kindly gave me another room. There were issues with the next room, which she took care of except it was very musty smelling. Breakfast was not great, and there were no plates. The attendant at the breakfast area was on the phone the whole time so I couldn’t ask her. The area the hotel is in has major construction and it was hard to navigate around, so location was not good. For the price it was an ok stay.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall good stay. Construction was a mess in the area. Fridge was unplugged and the tv had glitches and had to work to get the picture every time we turned it off. Lauren at front desk was very helpful and nice to talk to.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first let down was the smell, in the hotel lobby. It totally took your breath away when you entered from the outside. We stayed there a couple of days, so it got better or we just got use to it...lol. The second let down was our room/reservation, I originally made the reservation here on TripAdvisor, but called the hotel, because I needed to make a change & wanted to make sure I got the correct room. I reserved the larger 2 queen room, but was given the smaller. This was after getting there and them giving me a king room. The pics on the site are totally different also, I was expecting a room with a full kitchenette, like the hotel site shows. The room had a mini fridge and microwave, so not sure if they have rooms shown on the website. They do have themed rooms, our first room had a swing in it and it had been used extensively....lol. The overall hotel needs to be updated, it was fairly cleaned, but it showed age & wear/tear. The complimentary breakfast was just ok also. I would definitely look into other hotels before choosing this one, but if the price is super low, I might give them another try
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They charged my personal account before I got there after I specifically requested pay at hotel because I was waiting on my business debit card. I wouldn't be so upset now but the only employee that seemed to care about the gravity of the situation couldn't fix it. Now by the time it is all said and done with I'll spend a week with that account drained over an incident that never should have happened in the first place. Kind of ruins a perfectly nice stay.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We planned to stay here for 3 nights but left after one. We checked out 3 different rooms all of which had bad odors. We chose the least worst but wish we had just left. Not only did the dirty carpet smell but there was considerable mold around the bath tub. The breakfast was only fair. The location was on a busy congested highway with all restaurants a ways away. The pool was closed as was the jacuzzi. I would not recommend this motel.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decided to get away for the weekend and got the Jacuzzi room. I must say it was a great choice. Was able to enjoy and relax myself. Just wish they had a better breakfast in the morning. Other than that everything was perfect!!! ☺☺
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North

review_body: Enjoyed my stay at supper 8. The people were all terrific. Helpful and really trying to do a great job. The bed was comfortable and the towels were almost new. The room and the hotel were comfortable and clean. If I could say maybe some improvement on the eggs, bacon and sausage in the breakfast menu. Overall a good stay!

review_body: Smelled old, if that's a thing. Very disappointed in the location because I had asked for something closer to downtown. there was construction so it made it hard to go in and out of the hotel

review_body: Hotel was nice, but our booking was for 2 Queen beds and we got 2 Full sized beds. Also, we booked online for a total price & when we got to the hotel, there was a different charge for Friday vs. Saturday night.

8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North

review_body: this is what they have agame rtoom with no tv and no games. a dessert bar with no dessert... and a hot tub with no water. an exercise room that has an eliptical machine that is broken and a treadmill that dont turn on... i spoke to the staff and this hasbbeen the case for more than 6 months i emailed them and they do not even reply. dont stay here!!!
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got to the front desk and the receptionist told me my three day reservation had been “cancelled” by someone claiming to be me (story changed changed to it was someone claiming to be my husband) an hour before I had gotten to the hotel. I had to pay $150 for one night instead of the $80 I was promised in my reservation. The only people who would have known that I was staying there and that I hadn’t shown up yet was the hotel and myself...(do not trust this hotel!) I will NEVER stay at a Super 8 again. They were just trying to get more money for my room during a very busy weekend of Austin City Limits. I am incredibly disappointed.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice visit. Sonja was a very nice host. This has been the best visit we have had at a Wyman hotel. We will be back for another stay. Breakfast offered a variety of options. The coffee machine was a huge hit in our book.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I reserved a wheelchair accessible room, although it had a bench it had NO handheld showerhead to shower PROOERLY being I could NOT stand under the original shower. This was a major inconvenience and NOTHING was done to make it right.The bathroom door was falling from the wall difficult to close door for privacy. The condition of this stay were not what I PAID for. Made several attempts to contact manager ALL 3 failed she was NEVER available. POOR CUSTOMER SATISFACTION.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at your hotel was very disappointing. Although the room was nice and I was comfortable my interaction with the staff as less than than I had expected. It all centers around being double charged for the room. The company I.work for ( MOT) booked the room for me through expedia and pre paid for the room so all I had to do was check in on arrival. When I arrived the desk clerk asked for my drivers licensed a credit to put on file which I did. After getting to my room I received a text alert from my bank Well Fargo that sper 8 had charged my card for the room $69.20. Not understanding why my card was being charged since the room had already been paid for I called the front desk and asked what was going on. I was informed that my card had not been charged and I was mistaken. So being confused I. Called my banks. service line and was told that yes super 8 had charged me for the room so I went to the front desk and shoed the clerk the alert from wells Fargo and explained to him I had called the bank to verify. He told me I was wrong and asked him to look into it further. After a couple of hrs with no reply I called the front desk to find out what was going on and was told that he had spoke to his manager that there had been an update on the computer system that sometimes charged a customers card but that when I checked out the next morning that the money would be returned to my card. The next morning at 4:30 am I checked out to catch a plane back to Tucson As and spoke to the new clerk at the desk about the double charge issue. She told me she had been made aware and called the company to fix the problem. I had a early flight so she said she would e mail me as soon as she took care of the issue and had my money returned. After arriving in Tucson several hrs later I checked my e mail and found no response so I called the hotel and asked to speak with the manager. After being connected to her she was not all resposive to my issue going back to the line that my card had not been charged and there was nothing she was going to do to help me. I felt she was very rude and could care less. I asked for her supervisors phone # and was told she was it. After that I called wells Fargo and filed a claim against super 8 for double charging us for the room. The service member at wells Fargo once again checked and verified that I had indeed been charged for the room and intiated an inquiry which is suppose to take 10 to complete. The company I work for rents 400-500 roo
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North

review_body: The room decor was a little odd. I had the Asian theme and there was a swing in my room. I wasn't sure what to make of that. Nevertheless, the room was very clean, and the staff friendly. Had some nice food for breakfast and Starbucks coffee!

review_body: Room was not clean, teddy bear had, um, crusty spot on back. Was taken to front desk, but nothing said about it. Staff is definitely not overly friendly. Very limited hot water. Breakfast buffet was pretty tasteless. Hotel was way over-priced! Was a king suite with hot tub, but was not a suite. review_body: stay was great. room was very clean. right down the road from the concert we attended. room was pricey for that weekend but all and all no issues.

review_body: Very nice hotel rooms were very clean. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Would definitely stay there again. The only thing I didn't like was that the coffee maker was set up in the bathroom.

review_body: Booked through Trip advisor or hotels.com and because we did they charged us a $100 deposit for incidentals. Turns out they load their rooms with crap that they charge for. BS

8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North

review_body: Loved the location. It's amazing that I got such a great room for half the price of comparable hotels!
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like my stay there and I enjoy the breakfast there. I would like to let anyone know that it is a great place to stay for the right cost.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good hotel for the price. The Super 8 affiliation really does not do this place justice, as it is more of a hotel along the lines of a Best Western or Holiday Inn than it is a typical Super 8 "motel". The room and hotel itself were quite nice. As other reviews have mentioned, free gift baskets containing water and snacks are in the rooms (although they are not refilled). I didn't try the breakfast. Unfortunately I did encounter some problems while staying here. I came to check in at 3:00 PM, checked in with the front desk and was given my room key. When I got up to my room and was about to enter it, a maid in the hallway told me that it wasn't ready yet and I would need to either wait or get a new room. This was not mentioned at the front desk at all. In addition, the screen outside my room's window was detached and so wind would blow it against the window making a tapping sound which was somewhat annoying at night. There was no shampoo ever placed in my room (just two bottles of "lotion") so I had to go down and get shampoo from the front desk, and lastly the wifi would frequently go down temporarily, sometimes for periods as long as 15-30 minutes.While this is a very good hotel for the price, the issues I had above have convinced me to look elsewhere for the time being for a cheap yet high quality hotel in Austin.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, clean, average motel breakfast fare. We stayed in a handicap access room, with a roll in shower. The two shower heads needed to be replaced. Hardly any water came out of the fixed sprayer, while the hand held sprayer had water spewing out of the top of the hose toward the ceiling. It was so out of control, it would spray onto the floor outside the shower, which made the tile very slick, like stepping onto wet glass. We had to use all the towels each day, to put down on the wet floor, to keep from falling. Outside of this problem, the stay was okay. We didn't complain to the desk because the motel was fully booked during our stay due to motorcross races. We knew we couldn't get another room. I also felt the room prices were over rated for what we got, due to this being a busy time for them, they were able to do that. I should also mention there was a spa tub in our room, which was very nice, but noting the fact this was a handicap room, there were no grab bars around the tub, which made it almost impossible to get in and out of. This facility is leaving themselves at a huge liability for that, plus the out of control shower and wet bathroom floor.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was basically a place to stay for the night. It was not horrible but definitely not the best lace I have ever stayed at. This placemail had a very good ratting of like 4.8 out of 5. I would rate at more like 4 out of 5.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We counted up and this is about our tenth time to stay here. Yes, we enjoy staying here THAT much when in Austin! This HAS to be the best motel we're stay in EVER!
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel to be very nice. It's convenient to the airport. Most importantly, it was very clean, roomy. Staff was helpful. I would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was pleasantly surprise when I entered the Super 8. I was graciously greeted, my reservation was confirmed and I was given my key to a totally smoke free pet free room. The room was beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable. I stayed in several Super 8s through the years and this was the BEST. I hope to return to Austin and will definitely stay there again
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights on my cross country bicycle ride. I was taking a rest day in Austin so that's why we stayed the 2 nights. In Texas the frontage roads are all one way so you often have to drive miles out of your way to get to someplace that is 2 blocks away. This is the case for this Super 8. This hotel is significantly nicer than most Super 8 hotels. There is no pool. With this once exception it is comparable to the Best Western hotels we have stayed in recently.Austin can be expensive and this place is more expensive that we like to spend but it was nice. Large clean, modern room. There is a Jack-in-the-Box next door. I'm not sure that is a plus but at least you have one option for food without leaving the hotel.The breakfast had protein not just carbohydrates! Always a plus for me.Bottom line, much nicer than your average Super 8.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A bit of construction going on two sides of the hotel, but sleeping was quiet. Check in was fast and courteous. The lobby design was a bit confusing. First look, beautiful then it looked like a few pieces were left over from someone college days and randomly put in the lobby. The few pieces really take away from the initial design. We had a king sized bed for two. The room was very large and spacious. It had a large screen tv and a sitting area with desk. They even offered a lap desk, if you wanted to work in bed. The bed was VERY comfortable. You had a choice of pillow comfort too. Only down side to the room (205) was the plugs on the lamps did not work or were to loose to even hold the plug. So, we couldn't put our phones by our bed. The desk lamp wasnt working either. Shower in our room had water saving shower head. So, for someone like me who has a lot of hair, I believe I wasted more water than saving water. The breakfast area didn't feel clean. It wasn't dirty but it didn't feel clean. The tables weren't wiped down. The milk I used had been sitting out to long. The decaf coffee button had a special technique needed to use. I had to ask the breakfast attendant, who didn't seem happy to be there that morning. On the flip side, coffee was good once it was up and running. Lastly, a door binger kept going off the entire time we ate. It was rather annoying. We actually cut our breakfast short and headed back to our room.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: THE RESERVATION I booked my room online at super8.com. Because I have dietary restrictions, whenever I am staying in a hotel more than a night or two, I prefer to book a room that includes a kitchen area so I can prepare my own food. I was booking a room for 9 nights during SXSW in March so I definitely wanted a room with a kitchen. I made a reservation on their website for a One King Bed Non-Smoking EFFICIENCY because it included a kitchenette area. The photo representing the room that I booked showed a small kitchen area in the room. When I arrived on a Thursday night to check into my room, I was given a key to a STANDARD One King Bed Room and NOT the EFFICIENCY that I had reserved. I went back to the front desk and told them that there must have been a mistake. The woman working the front desk looked confused and then picked up the phone and walked into a back room (so I couldn't hear) and called the manager of the hotel. However, I have very good hearing and could hear everything that was said on this side of the phone conversation. The manager told her to tell me that my room was not available when it was booked. Can you imagine???MY ROOM WAS NOT AVAILABLE WHEN IT WAS BOOKED. How is that even possible? How do you let someone book a room in a hotel when the room is not available in the first place? That is pure false advertising and a bait and switch scam because I would have NEVER booked a room in this hotel in the first place if one was not available with a kitchen. In addition, I booked this room TWO MONTHS in advance. The hotel had TWO MONTHS to contact me about the reservation and tell me that the room I booked was not available. They never did. They even called me the DAY BEFORE I was to arrive to confirm my stay and again they said NOTHING about the room I booked not being available. That is a COMPLETELY unacceptable way to do business. I told the woman at the front desk how unacceptable that was and that I wanted to stay in the room that I had paid for and that if I was not going to stay in that room then I wanted a severe discount on the room that I was staying in. She crunched some numbers and then told me that what I was paying already included the discount. I told her that what I was paying for was an EFFICIENCY room and not a STANDARD room and because I was not staying in the type of room that I had reserved, I should be provided with a discount. She told me that I would need to contact the manager and that the manager is not in during nights or weekends. I told her that I should not have to be inconvenienced by having to go out of my way to track down the manager because it was not my fault that they screwed up my reservation. They were the ones completely at fault and as such requested that the manager contact me instead. I left my name and contact information. Needless to say, the manager NEVER made any effort to contact me at all during my stay.My schedule was so tight and fully booked because of SXSW that I did not have any time to try and find another hotel to stay in nor would it have been easy or even possible considering that all of the hotels in the area are booked to capacity during that time.THE ROOM There were some stains on the furniture as well as on the decorative pillow on the bed. The rug was old. The vanity in the bathroom was 37" high. A standard bathroom vanity is about 32" high. This bathroom was made for someone about 7 feet tall. I'm 5' 7" and felt like I needed to use a stool if I wanted to brush my teeth or wash my face in the sink. I can't imagine how someone smaller than me (like around 5 feet tall) would ever function in that bathroom. Forget about trying to get close to the mirror to put on eye makeup or anything, there's no way with a vanity that tall. They did have a pull out makeup/magnification mirror on the wall but that was mounted at a height of more than 6 feet which was way over my head so that was totally useless also. The water pressure on the shower was so bad, it felt like standing under a dripping faucet. I would NEVER stay in this hotel again. CLEANLINESS: PoorBED: ComfortablePILLOWS: All small. All the same.WATER PRESSURE: NoneTOWELS: OkayLIGHTING: PoorOUTLETS: OkayREFRIGERATOR: Good size.HELPFULNESS OF STAFF: HorribleI contacted Wyndham about the reservation issue during my stay and Wyndham did not respond to my email.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Seems a little out of the way til you get there. Its on the fringe but easily accessible to major points. Nice breakfast, but get there early. Replenishment is slow. Surroundings are a bit sketchy but experienced no issues. Staff was pleasant and responsive to requests. A little light on safety (wet, slick floors and no signs) nearly fell on two occasions not being able to tell the transition. $4 for a bottle of water in the room is out-of-line, I'd say.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean room, lobby, and breakfast area. Friendly, efficient front desk staff. Ask to have the room safe charges removed from you bill when you check out. This is good value for your money. We will stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Super 8 hotel in Austin @5606 East 51 street, my stay was only one night, the service was great, I had to leave and fly out of town the next day, didnt want to leave my car at the airport, because it was broken into the last time i flew out of Austin. i spoke with the hotel manager, she advised I could leave my car on their property for the days i would be out of town, their kindness was so very nice and thoughtful. Thank you Super 8 Hotel.
hotelName:
8    Super 8 by Wyndham Austin/Airport North
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were clean and comfortable. Great quality for a relatively budget hotel. We really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. It had a nice variety of hot food (eggs, potatoes etc) as well as other hotel breakfast standards. Nice indoor pool (does close late at night). Internet was a bit slow. Longest check in process I’ve ever experienced (though to be fair, I was checking in for 3 rooms). Overall I’d definitely stay here again. Good location near Round Rock and Pflugerville north of Austin
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was hard to find as no signage on the highway. Check in was quick and polite and hotel looked new. Room was clean with a king bed,desk, chair,comfy chair and large wardrobe. Also had the usual coffee maker,fridge and microwave. The only thing it didn't have was a safe and there were no deposit boxes at reception. The shower was walk in but had no door so some water did sprinkle the floor. Breakfast had lots to suit all including fruit,toast,waffles,eggs,corned beef hash,cereals,biscuits and gravy. The lady who manned the breakfast room was always happy and polite. House keeping came in every day but never left us any coffee or cups after the room was made up. They have a laundry room at $2 wash and $2 dry. Pretty good hotel for a good price.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were welcomed by a really sweet lady at the front desk. Check in was a breeze. The room was nice and clean, except for the shower floor.The hotel is close to I-35, so it was a little noisy (road noise to be expected). The breakfast was the best we've ever had in a hotel. Very good...eggs, sausage, hash browns, gravy, biscuits, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, fruit and waffles with juice and coffee. Something for everyone.Check out was a breeze. Traffic around this place was awful. I don't visit Austin much, but from what I've seen, that is the case everywhere.All in all it was a nice place.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice place. Dog friendly. Building is new as of 9/18. Breakfast was good everyday with a different selection. The room was clean. We had no problems at all. Very, very close to the outlet malls. Walking distance.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our flight into Austin was a bit delayed due to the weather. With that said we arrived at the hotel somewhat later in the evening. The receptionist was a very friendly and helpful young lady. She gave us a few dinner recommendations that we decided to explore.Once in the room, we found it rather small; however, with just my husband and I more than adequate for our three night stay. The room seemed clean, my only gripe was the shower floor did not appear clean. Rather than complain we opted to wear a pair of flip flops (shower shoes) while bathing. This is the main reason the hotel received a "good" rating rather than a "very good" rating. Other than the shower, the bathroom appeared to be well maintained.The breakfast each day was great for meat eaters, two different types eggs, bacon, biscuits with sausage and gravy. A variety of pastries, the infamous Texas waffle irons- which my hubby couldn't get enough of . Lucky for me they also had fresh whole fruit i.e. bananas, apples along with cut fruit like various melons- watermelon, cantaloupe etc. Also included was tea, coffee, apple and orange juice. The kitchen staff spoke to us each morning and was also friendly.My husband used the gym. It was very small but he was able to accomplish what he needed for a workout. We swam in the pool, which was also small but nice because it was indoors and we did not have to tackle the Texas heat ☀️.Prior to our departure we washed our clothes in the onsite washer which was $2.00/ to wash and $2.00/ to dry. The dining room was a cute little area to watch television or to borrow one of the books from their cute library.If we were in Austin, we would probably stay here again- just be sure to take shower shoes.One item of note is for traffic for downtown. Getting in and out of the area is very confusing. Going the "back" way was so much easier otherwise it feels you are driving around in circles.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location close to highway. I had a bit of a hard time finding it. If you like to walk in the mornings or after a long drive, there is a Frisbee park next to the hotel with some trails for walking which also connects to trails through some nice neighborhoods. The hotel is clean and the room nice, but the AC was quite loud. Breakfast OK. Lots of restaurants close by. Friendly staff. We stayed in various Choice Privileges Hotels for 4 nights total during a move from Phoenix, AZ to Delray Beach, Fl. Good hotel but we stayed in a couple better ones along the way.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t say enough about this wonderful hotel. It’s not the best location but the staff make up for it, very dedicated bunch and it makes a big difference. Good WiFi, clean lobby, comfortable rooms, plenty of hot water, etc. Breakfast is real eggs plus waffles and various other goodies.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights here at a recent visit to Austin Texas. We found the rooms to be clean and quiet and very comfortable. The staff went out of their way to make sure your stay was enjoyable. I highly recommend this property if you are staying in the North Austin area.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The breakfast was one of the best motel breakfasts I’ve had in a long time. The room was on the small side but quite adequate. Staff were very helpful. The area was nice with restaurants within walking distance. We did hear noise from other rooms one night. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel for a quick overnight stay. My husband had to be in town for an interview and I accompanied him. The hotel is very clean, and our room was adequate and nice. Decor is good and not cheesy. The hotel is convenient to I-35 but also sits back off the interstate enough that road noise isn’t really an issue and we stayed on the side facing the interstate. Breakfast was hot and options were plentiful. Plenty of seating in the breakfast area which was very clean and well stocked. The staff we encountered were all friendly. I would stay here again if the need arises.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean and good room 201 had few spots of paint peeling in the bathroom wall please put curtain on those shower stalls other then that the hotel is nice the colors are nice touch the bed was comfortable as well hotel is quite love the free breakfast as well anyways I would come back definitely!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you first pull in it looks okay. The lobby is modern with a a lending library of books. and places to sit.Check in was quick. The young lady seemed to take it to the next level with no effort making me feel very welcomed at the hotel providing all the pertinent information concerning me stay there.Breakfast was very good. Two types of eggs and a meat along with waffles, cold and hot cereal and assorted pastry. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds and refrigerator. Wifi worked well.Check out was quick.Would definately stay here again
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this motel for a week during a business trip. Room is nice with plenty of desk area and good number of outlets. The bed is comfortable, on the firm side but good. AC works well. The bathroom is a little small and the shower is a bit different - it doesn't have a door or curtain. You just step in and there is a wall between the shower and the entrance to keep the water in. It works. No lid on the toilet - didn't like that. Just the horseshoe is there. Hot water takes a while but it gets there. The breakfast is really good. They use real eggs for the scrambled eggs and have a second egg dish that is kind of like a scrambled omelet. They also have fruit, waffles, cereal, bacon or sausage and biscuits and gravy. Coffee never ran out. Big room for eating, too.For the price, this is a nice place to stay. We'll be back when in North Austin.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I travel I either stay at a Marriott or Club Carlson property-- because I'm a rewards member with both hotel chains I get lots of benefits & rewards such as "late check out". However on Aug. 19th most of the properties in Austin were booked so I searched for alternatives and since I had never stayed at a "Sleep Inn" I decided to try them. After a long 4 hr drive from Dallas I was super tired so I couldn't wait to get checked into my room, upon check in I was very impressed by the professional and friendly customer service I received from "Blair". Unfortunately the ac in the room was not working properly and as we all know in Texas cold ac is a MUST! Blair was kind enough to change me to another room and he kindly apologized for the inconvenience. I slept like an Angel in that comfortable bed, breakfast was great with plenty of choices. After such a great breakfast we ended up laying back down and didn't get back up until 12:00 noon. My husband asked the front desk for a late out and was told by the lady at the front desk "you're already past your late check out" and it was only 12:00. My husband was shocked at her comment as well as her attitude and tone. We're not use to that kind of rudeness so we will NOT be staying at another Sleep Inn again. We will take our money where it's appreciated....at the Club Carson's "Country Inn & Suites" or Marriott.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has been one of the cleanest and nicest run Sleep Inn and Suites that I have been to around the country! There's some other ones that could learn from the management and employees of this one! When we first got here the front desk person had fresh cut roses around the lobby! This added to the experience! The room was clean and quiet! Very friendly staff! I'm a picky person so I'm saying I would recommend this one!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Since we stayed 5 days in Sleep inn in orange beach on the way home we stayed in Sleep inn in Austin. Free bfast better selection with hot items like scramble egg with ham, plain egg, sausage patty, potatoes fries etc. Room is nice with double queen size and quiet we stayed on 3rd floor. Fresh water and juice at the reception. We will come back for sure
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 days in Austin after a camping trip didn't pan out due to weather. It was a good rate but had an indoor pool which my 3 kiddos required. Hotel was clean and John checked us in super fast. Our room was a king with sleeper sofa and had lots of counter space and drawers. Big bathroom. We immediately went swimming. No hot tub, but the pool was perfect for my family. Later I went looking at brochures in the entry and John volunteered that if I was looking for kids activities, we should hit Mt. Playmore. He named some others but suggested MP due to the kids' ages. I thought it was super nice of him to volunteer that, but I wanted to kiss him the next day when we went! It was amazing and my kids died of happiness. Breakfast was a little different every day but always had eggs and meat hot as well as biscuits and gravy, muffins, bagels, fruit, yogurt and waffles. Lots to drink. Worked like a dream for my family of 5. I had an issue working the dryer one morning and the front desk staff ( a young lady) immediately refunded my money and called maintenance. It was my fault -- I didn't know to pull the money mechanism back out, but she helped me without delay. Can't say enough about the staff, especially John. He made our stay go from Good to Great!!!!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I were traveling cross country. After not sleeping well and driving 5 hours, we called this Sleep Inn. Not only did John accommodate us with a king room, he made a special request to have a king room ready for us upon an early arrival to the hotel at noon. MUCH APPRECIATED! We checked right in and caught up on our sleep, John was also in the midst of training a new desk associate. I was very impressed with his patience, tone and sharing of his experience with the new employee. The hotel was everything the website said it was. We had a comfortable, enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
