9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a King Suite and was pleased with the size of the room and bathroom. Besides the bed,they managed to get a small sofa, a reading chair and lamp, a very long dresser/ desk - with an office chair, microwave and fridge in the room. The bed could have been a little softer for me, but someone in another room said that there's was perfect. There were fresh flowers and a lending library in the lobby. The breakfast area was very clean and had many choices - from fresh fruit, bagels and yogurt, to waffles, bacon, eggs - even a veggie omelet. And you could choose between paper plates and stoneware. Every table had fresh flowers on it. Staff was polite and worked quickly.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed only one night, for the Austin 10/20 race. Arrived early and room wasn't ready, so went to the expo and when we returned, still a little before check in time, we got in. Room was very clean and quiet. AC worked great, and the bed and pillows were very comfortable! Left early for the race, but stopped by breakfast for a quick bite. I've stayed at many Comfort Inns, Sleep Inns and Quality Inns all over the country and this one had the best breakfast by far. Lots to choose from and a big space for dining. Doubt I'll be back in Austin anytime soon, but would stay here again.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at this hotel but the experience was the same. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. Hotel has easy access to I35. I did not get the chance to take advantage of the breakfast but it looked excellent. Sleep Inn has become my "go to" hotel in Austin.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here during Spring Break and SXSW (which was not intential). The hotel was vert accessible from several highways which eased dealing with Austin traffic. Lots of restaurants close by. The pool was small but functional and there is no hot tub.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed in a king size bed room. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The shower was different than I had seen before It was like a little alcove. No shower curtain It did have a very good multi setting shower head. The negative was the space between the furniture and the foot of the bed. and the location of the chair in the room. When my wife drove her mobility scooter in there was no place to park it without being in the way. This is the first room we have stayed at that we had that problem. The chair was in a corner but you could not oben the night stand drawer because the chair was blocking it. They offered a really good breakfast each morning with eggs and sausage and biscuits and gravy as well as make your own waffles. The staff was very friendly.But the way the room was arranged and the lack of space was a never stay at a Sleep Inn again from my wife.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother booked a room for herself, my sister, my daughter, and myself. Our reservation was for 2 nights, booked at a prepaid discounted rate. Everything was fine until the day after our first night. While out for the day, my mom received a call from the hotel informing her that she would be charged an additional $60 for "dye stains" that were on some of the towels. None of us dyed or have colored hair. Upon arriving back to the hotel, we were shown the items which were not dye stains at all but makeup! It also included two pillow cases which had makeup and one with a head stain from hair product. She was told the towels could not be cleaned and could no longer be used. The front desk associate said that this was damage to hotel property! My mother is a world traveler and me domestic and NEVER have we heard of a policy such as this! After receiving the initial phone call, we called Choice Hotels customer service who said the properties are individually owned and have their own policies. To avoid any further issue, my mom purchased towels from Walmart which we slept on and used for showering. Upon checking out our invoice did not reflect any additional charges. However, the anxiety and frustration the situation caused was irreversible. It spoiled the remainder of our outing and caused us to skip a nice dinner. We feel as though they were using this as an excuse to get more money or racially motivated. This was completely unacceptable and we will NEVER stay at this establishment again or recommend it to anyone!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: found this place on TA mostly because we did not want to pay downtown prices and what a nice find ! staff is very friendly and informative , rooms were clean and at a good price ! ,breakfast was one of the best we have ever had for FREE ! getting in and out of downtown was easy . we would recommend staying here .
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although this hotel is about ten miles north of downtown I would highly recommend a stay here. Very clean, great breakfast and a great, accommodating staff. The only negative is there is only a small sigh marking the location off the frontage road, so we nearly missed it. The road is just before the storage place!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Without a doubt the best breakfast I've ever had in a hotel, BY FAR!! Nice hash browns and fantastic eggs! Awesome arsenal of good-quality foods to choose from. Cozy stay, friendly staff, and an excellent experience
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brand new, clean, great breakfast. Waffles YUM ! For the price could not be beat. It had everything you want in a hotel, indoor pool, good bed, flat screen TV, and centrally located. It's just off the highway enough to be quiet but close enough to be convenient.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I had 3 days to spend in Austin. We were very pleased we stayed at Sleep Inn. The rate was quite reasonable and we were greeted courteously. Our room was very spacious and had a warm feel. The pillows were soft and plump, the sheets were smooth and satiny, and they smelled so clean and fresh. The color of the walls and decor were quite pleasing to our senses. It was quiet and located conveniently to where we wanted to go. The room came with a great free breakfast from 6:30 to 9:30 am which was a big plus for us. The kitchen staff was efficient and eager to please. The breakfast area was also very comfortable, well decorated and had a nice sitting area with books to read at our pleasure.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here while we attended a concert in Austin. Affordable, very good breakfast both days, something different each day. The room, common area were very clean. Edgar at the front desk was nice, made us feel right at home.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here a couple of weeks ago when I was attending a one week course @ UT - Austin.The front desk staff were friendly. The hotel was clean. It is just a couple of blocks off of I-45 but there were no noise issues in my room.It takes about 45 minutes to get to UT in the morning if you leave the hotel by 0700. I came back late (1900) in the evening and it was a 15-minute.There are not many places to eat within walking distance. However if you have a car there are several good options within a 15 minute driving radius as well as an HEB, drug stores, etc.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel because of the upgrades / renovated rooms. The rooms were huge, clean. It had a microwave, small fridge and TV. Instead of a tub, you only had a shower stall, which I personally prefer. The staff remained cheerful and welcoming despite the late night check in. It was much appreciated after a long day
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This motel isn't in a great location, well out to the north side of Austin and just off I35 on the left when heading north from the airport but it represents great value for money, the staff are excellent and it provides one of the best breakfasts that I've had at any motel. Our room was quiet and comfortable, although it only had a stand alone shower and no bath. The motel has an indoor pool, which has access to an outer patio with sun loungers. I would highly recommend this place for a one or two night stay if you are passing through or don't mind driving to the main points of interest in Austin.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's in a nice area with plenty of places to eat around it. My boyfriend and I arrived earlier than our check in and were relieved when the manager asked the cleaning staff to prioritise our room so that we wouldn't have to wait. The room was perfect and very clean. When I return to Austin, this hotel will be my first choice.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was clean, easy to find right off I35, good breakfast with waffles etc. Beds were average so as a middle of the road place to stay it was adequate. The only negative is its a ways from the airport and downtown, so its probably a 20 min with little traffic drive. Other than that it was great.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here back in October and am just now getting around to reviewing it. The location was great and quiet, but not too far from the city. It was super clean, which I really appreciated. And the breakfast buffet was pretty good. The prices were very reasonable and I would definitely come back. The only thing keeping me from giving this place 5 stars are two things: upon arriving, the front desk person just gave us the key and did not tell us where the room was. We just looked at the other room numbers to find out which one was ours... And I had a random $15 charge on my card a couple weeks after leaving. Other than those things, the hotel was very good.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my mom and sister for one night. Easy access to I35 and very friendly staff. The hotel looked brand new, rooms were perfectly clean and comfortable! Not a lot around the hotel, but with such easy access to the interstate there was no problem finding restaurants, etc. The continental breakfast was great! A nice selection of hot items (biscuits and gravy, bacon and eggs, even omelets!) The fruit and fresh bakery items were also a plus! We will definitely be staying here again!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is a little tricky to get to. Check in was quick and efficient. The room was nice and clean, however, there was a musty smell to the room. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of pillows! The pool was not heated as advertised. There were plenty of options for breakfast and the food was good. Staff was professional and efficient!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was really nice and the complimentary breakfast was a nice addition to the stay, the rooms where really nice and clean, there isnt reall much to pick on overall i would definitely would come back if we ever came back in town
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great, comfortable stay. Actually a little better than a Sheraton that we stayed at the previous night. Clean. Had a TV guide on the TV, too, which I haven't experienced in a hotel. It's the little things :).
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel - well located North of the city - took us around 10 minutes to drive into the centre. Room was clean, we had free wifi, free breakfast, great laundry room. Slept well, bed was comfortable and location quiet.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel! It was clean and spacious! The only main issue is that it is a bit far from the main Austin area but you get what you pay for it and it was a steal for what it was. Would stay again in this property!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean, comfortable, and modern. The staff was friendly. Great fine! Breakfast was adequate as well. The only problem I had was that the drink machines all seem to be out of drinks. The desk clerk was very helpful in finding something however. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very pleased with my stay at Sleep Inn. I was looking for a place away from the downtown Austin area and this hotel was the perfect choice. The room was very comfortable, the service exceptional and the breakfast very good. I look forward to staying here again the next time I come to Austin.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first time to stay in Sleep Inn and this location is the perfect place . Quite and it smells really refreshing and the room is super clean. The breakfast is great! They scrambled eggs with mushrooms, tomatoes and fresh spinach so yummy. The manager was so kind .
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Sleep Inn & Suites is a great value while you're visiting Austin. It was a little further out of the city than we would have liked to stay but still only a 10 - 20 minute drive to downtown attractions. The money we saved staying here versus downtown was well worth it!The staff were rockstars, the night before we left I used the lobby computer/printer to check into the flight online. Silly me forgot to take the boarding passes out of the printer but when I woke up the next morning they had been slid under my door with a note from the Front Desk! Room was clean, breakfast was great. My only little, little complaint was that the fitness center was very warm. I am a runner and I like to put in a couple miles before starting my day, I think since the fitness center was located right next to the pool it got a bit muggy and warm in there. Even with the hot fitness center, this hotel is still 5 starts in my honest opinion.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The overall hotel is fine. Nice rooms. Fair price. Friendly staff.However, the shower design is the worst ever.Everyone knows that when you first turn on the water in the shower it is cold. It takes a minute to warm up. This shower requires that you face the shower spray as you turn it on. This is not a tub with a curtain - it is an open shower with a solid wall on three sides which you must approach from the fourth side. Take your clothes off first and expect to wake up immediately when that cold water hits you.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is conveniently located around 20min north of downtown Austin - The room and hotel lobby are clean and the breakfast was plentiful. Good warm continental breakfast with eggs, bacon/sausage, waffles, muffins/bread, juice/tea/coffee. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There were sufficient parking spots and the lot was well-lit. However, on our first night, my partner was stuck in the bathroom as he could not open the door. Took 15min for the maintenance guy to come help break open the door. The maintenance guy used a few tools but the door was still locked. My partner ended up breaking the doorknob himself by hand and found his way to unlock the door. The hotel manager gave us an "upgrade" to a suite (which basically was the standard room but bigger and included a couch) but did not offer any free nights or discounts.Overall it was a good stay but would recommend anyone who stay there to check if the bathroom door works (our upgraded room's bathroom door could not lock). It was a good value hotel but had to only give 4 star with the unpleasant lock-out for over an hour and hotel's limited help and offer afterwards.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here for four nights traveling alone to do research in the Austin area. I chose this hotel based on the great ratings, the price, and the location. It's fairly convenient to get from here to downtown Austin even during the height of Austin rush hour. Just a simple turn or two and you're on the interstate in either direction, since it's located on an access road. You can get to many food options via surface roads, as well, which is nice during high traffic times. Overall, I found this place quite nice, especially considering I've never stayed at a Sleep Inn (or any Choice brand franchise) before and had no clue what to expect. The bed was comfortable, the room clean, housekeeping consistent and careful, common areas neat and well-maintained, shower decent, plenty of room to create a workspace in the room when needed. The breakfast was a pleasant surprise, as well. Lots of options that rotate each day, constantly replenished, and I loved the Texas-shaped waffle maker! Adorable. There was free, fresh coffee available all day and evening in the lobby, too, which saved me some money and time that would've otherwise been spent going to buy coffee elsewhere. The staff was also nice and accommodating across the board, too. There were a few issues, however, that I feel warrant mentioning here. The first is that I booked a King Standard room, and requested a quiet room on the highest floor. I got the highest floor no problem, but my room was about as close to the interstate as you could get in the hotel. I could've dealt with it, though, to be honest: the hotel is far enough off the road that I don't think the noise would've been too troublesome, and I'm very sensitive to noise. But the real issue is this: the room I was assigned smelled. Like, BAD. It was kind of a mix between smelly leftovers, musty air conditioning, and old vomit. That's the best way I can describe it. I stayed in there about an hour, got unpacked, and told myself it wasn't really as bad as I'd initially thought. Well, it was. After an hour in there my throat started hurting. So I went downstairs and told the front desk clerk, who said I could switch rooms to a Double Queen across the hall (apparently the King rooms all face the road in this hotel, and the double queens face away). He even made sure he got me a room right across from the smelly one so I wouldn't have to walk too far to move all my stuff. I appreciated that. I did, however, get charged an additional $10 a night for the new room since the Queen rooms cost more I guess. Personally I kinda think I shouldn't have had to pay extra since the old room was so gross, but whatever I guess. The new room smelled clean and fresh, which it should've considering I was paying more for it. Also, I will note that the walls between the rooms are pretty thin. I didn't have any issues with neighbors until my last night, when the World's Loudest Couple checked in next door and I had the privilege of hearing them argue with each other and on very lengthy phone calls with others until around midnight. I would've asked to switch rooms again at this point, but it was my last night and I was ready to just leave so I dealt with it. If it'd been any other time during my trip, though, you better believe I'd have requested to move. This was not, of course, the hotel's fault, so I mention it only so other guests can be aware that noisy neighbors can potentially be a bit noisier than normal in this hotel. Lastly, if you're using a personal credit card to pay for your room here, a word of caution. I've had about $250 of pending extra charges show up on my card over the past couple days from the hotel beyond what my invoice said I owed and what I originally paid. I don't know if it's for incidentals or something and the charges will disappear, but if not I'll have to call and get some answers soon cause it's a bit excessive. We'll wait and see I guess.Overall, this is a nice updated hotel in a safe area. The staff were all friendly and it had several perks that other places in this price range wouldn't offer.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time we have stayed here and we picked it because it is slightly away from the busy goings on in Austin and close to our destination in the north side of Austin. The breakfast continues to be exceptional. There are good hot items including sausage, scrambled eggs and yogurt. Coffee, of course, along with cook your own waffles which I find not healthy and fresh fruit selection. There are china dishes available for eating at any of many tables each with flowers and silverware, not plastic. Plastic is available but we never used it with china and real cutlery available.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was very tentative and friendly. Room was nicely decorated and vey clean. Would recommend a stay here to friends. Good location, not to far from downtown Austin. Great complimentary breakfast provided
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited this Sleep Inn and Suites located in north Austin for a business trip and needless to say the rooms are a bit crowded however not bad for only 2 people. The king bed was spacious and comfy, featured a walk in shower to my surprise, clean and comfortable and even received a little welcome treat filled with chips, cliff bar, chocolates and a water for just being a Choice Rewards loyalty member, thumbs up to the staff for their hospitality! The breakfast was ok, expected for any Sleep Inn & Suites. OVERALL: Good rates, exceptional service and clean and comfortable rooms, will consider next time I visit the outer downtown Austin area.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Usually If I am late on posting a review I just let that one go. My stay was way back in Nov 2015, however I was so pleased with the staff at this hotel that I had to post a review. The night staff Jared was exceptional, the day staff John.E was fantastic when he helped us continue our stay at the best lowest price after our flight was cancelled. Great location, very clean, obviously new and an experience of total comfort. I would suggest that everyone stay here.
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very impressed with this hotel. From check in on, this hotel did everything they possibly could to make our group's stay as pleasant as possible. Front desk staff were most helpful with all inquiries and with the set up of our meeting room. Bedrooms were very clean with comfy beds. The meeting room has windows.I was so surprised at breakfast. Besides all the standard options, each day a special dish is offered - along with nice plates. (We loved the scrambled eggs with peppers, onions and cheese.)I would stay here again in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
9    Sleep Inn & Suites N Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I showed up at the Four Seasons after my site tour at another hotel was a BUST. :((( Rene from events took EXCELLENT care of my and I really appreciated that because I was very discouraged and had no plan B. The rooms are very pretty and newly renovated. The service at the lobby bar was great and our breakfast downstairs was delightful. The downtown location is really fun. The hotel is right on the "lake" and we did some paddle boarding and walked along the lake. This Four Seasons did not disappoint and I'm grateful for the high caliber service!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whenever my hubby and I stay at a Four Seasons resort, we know we are gonna get excellent service. And we Did!!! Beds are soft and lovey, room is cold in the July heat, quiet, and the food is always excellent. Everybody is willing to help in any way. The pool was nice and busy - but a great way to cool off. The concierge was so good at helping us with restraunts close by. I can’t say enough about these hotels! We stayed 4 days...Bravo!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel, nice rooms great location. Property well maintained,clean. Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful, nice tioletries. Nice view of the water from the rooms. Security thru out the hotel was great.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The newly remodeled Four Seasons in Austin is fresh and modern. I spent 3 days there for a work conference and they made sure I had everything I needed. Service was excellent and the food was better than ever. I can’t wait to go back!!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very average rooms for price. In addition, the pool area is extremely outdated and not up to luxury status at all. Lobby and staff are very good. The greatest value in this property is the grounds area giving a natural feel to a downtown location.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was recently in Austin for a friends birthday and we celebrated at The Four Seasons and the staff and lobby bar was perfect for catching up! The fresh flower display in the lobby was amazing and smelled terrific! Kudos to your florist!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I were meeting for a fun 3 night stay in Austin. I was shocked when I was told the self park rates were $45 per night. Since we had two cars, that was $90 a night for a total of $270. Totally ridiculous especially since their communication with me confirming my stay made no mention of these additional fees. Since these parking rates are so high, I believe they should be disclosed up front. Have to say it ruined my weekend!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night on 6/21/19. I hate having to write this review. I love the Four Seasons and have stayed at the Four Seasons in Houston, NYC, Chicago, Orlando, etc. and have always had a wonderful experience. I can't say the same for the Austin location. A few things really stick out about my sub-par experience. Upon arrival we walked over to the reception desk. The women working the desk appeared friendly but I soon realized she was not trained to run the front desk. The best example I can give is when she said "sorry I'm just not that familiar with reservations". It all went downhill from there. She kept apologizing- literally apologized 7-8 times. It was overkill and made me uncomfortable. After a brutally long check in experience my boyfriend and I were ready to go upstairs with our luggage. The bellman had placed our luggage on a cart. They pushed the cart into the building from the valet and expected my boyfriend to bring the luggage cart upstairs himself. Weird. Having just had such an uncomfortable experience with the front desk I didn't want to deal with them again so my boyfriend and I just pushed the huge cart upstairs by ourselves. I should mention we had a great experience at the pool. The waitress was friendly and kind- she was wonderful. Brought us water without us asking. Also a great experience with the valet and breakfast service at the restaurant. Later that night we ordered dinner for 2 to our room. No waters were brought up for us. The kids pizza was not good, tasted like it had been made hours before and just recently reheated. No turndown service. Just overall we had a crummy experience. Such a shame especially for paying 600+ dollars for a room per night.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While in Austin for work, I stayed at the Four Seasons Austin and it was everything I have come to expect at this chain. The service was second to none and the rooms were very comfortable, especially the bed. They have remodeled it since I was here last and it is absolutely gorgeous. The convenience to downtown and the conference center is a big plus as well.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff and property were at the leave of average to poor hotel. Fitness area is old and tired. Half the time knowone answer phone for room service. I would suggest looking at a diffrent Four Seasons hotel or another hotel.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The four seasons is such a beautiful property in the best location. You can explore the Colorado river right out off of the back lawn of the hotel. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. The bar and restaurant are wonderful.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Four seasons twice within the past month and have absolutely loved it both times. The first time I was in town with my mom visiting my sister and the second time was for a couples trip. Would highly recommend this hotel due to the extremely comfortable rooms & very kind / attentive staff. Everyone is super welcoming and helpful. The happy hour is one of the best parts of the hotel, the back patio area is beautiful and we had great $20 bottles of rose. The queso at the bar is also very tasty. For people who like tequila, the margarita cart that comes to your room is a fun touch.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great property within walking distance of 6th Street and other restaurants/bars. Fitness center has been upgraded. It's not huge, but nice for a hotel. Very dog friendly too. I understand they intend to renovate the pool in the near future. That will really transform that area of the property as the pool area is a bit dated.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel sent text immediately after I on-line checked in to confirm our early arrival, really set our minds at ease! And we were blown away that the valet knew us by name and had our key waiting for us the second we pulled up in our vehicle!!! Plus the pet friendliness was outstanding!!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The recent renovation perfects what was already an extraordinary hotel! I’ve spent countless days and nights at Austin FS and have always been treated like family there. It’s why I’ve chosen to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, graduations and even had a couple of my children’s weddings there.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing property. Amazing service from bell staff to front desk to room service to the restaurant? The grounds are stunning. The Hotel is immaculate and beautiful with attention to service detail. We were diverted to Austin due to weather. We had never been to Austin so didn’t know what to expect. The Four Seasons Austin was so welcoming. We want to come back and stay at the property again, and we plan to visit Austin just to stay here!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The highlight of the hotel was the staff. They were exceptionally polite and courteous, as seems to be the difference between nice and very nice hotels. The hotel restaurant, Ciclo, was a pleasant surprise. The meal was excellent and the service was also very good. The hotel facility and the room were adequate. The lake view from the balcony was a bit disappointing as would have been the construction views from the city view rooms (but perhaps we'll try that view on the next visit).It seems that the additional cost of nice hotels primarily delivers exceptional service from their staff - and that is the value comparison left for the guest.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect in every way. Clean. comfortable. A staff that cared. In a rarity to most hotels. I didn't experience even one slight issue; not a stray piece of dirt or hair, not a missing or non working item from my room, nothing.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, very nice lobby and grounds, good A- staff. My room was on the small side for a luxury hotel. If you book here, it's worth the ~10% upcharge for a “lake view” room (request floor 4 or higher). Otherwise you'll get a “city view” which overlooks the parking lot and a construction site. Worse yet, there are several tall buildings just a few feet away, and it seemed like “city view “ meant “city views you.” I don't understand why rooms don't have a set of sheer drapes to afford some privacy while letting light in— the only drapes are the heavy ones. Also, the FS seems to host lots of outside events (weddings, benefits, etc) which can pose an inconvenience to hotel guests.There are lots of good hotels in Austin.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had another great stay here over Easter weekend. Our first since they completed the renovations. The rooms have been nicely updated and the lobby area, bar and main restaurant have all been completely updated. They also added a large balcony from the lobby bar which is great for outdoor seating and views of Lady Bird Lake and Four Season grounds. My favorite is the back lawn area were the kids can run and play and you can dine casually out here. They are also dog friendly which is a huge plus. Staff was Superior as always. Thank your FS Austin for another wonderful trip!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff provides excellent customer service, upon check in the agent explained where things were, such as resturant, lounge etc. When calliing for in-room service it came promptly, when asking questions the staff was always helpful and greeted me with a smile
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved staying at the Four Seasons in Austin! I was there visiting my daughter who is a student at UT. The room, with a view of the lake and the Bat Bridge was awesome! We enjoyed in room dining, time at the bar as well as the restaurant. Top service as you would expect from the Four Seasons.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didnt apply my deposit and charged my card numerous times without permission. After countless emails very little done to make up for this. Understaffed, no pool attendants, not enough capacity in restaurants to handle guests of the hotel cared more about people that were not guests.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is about the outdoor restaurant. Many friends said its incomparable and they were correct. I’m staying at nearby hotel and walked over for glass of wine and easy dining. Sat outside looking at the river and the atmosphere was very peaceful yet vibes. Excellent wine by the glass and had fantastic fish tacos!I was alone and felt totally comfortable. ILiked it so much that I’ll venture back tonight!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is everything that the name has come to mean. Service is perfection. Food is great, drinks are great. The rooms are a true getaway with comfort and everything that you could possible need. It really holds up the end of the bargain that is expected from The Four Seasons.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Four Seasons in Austin is a treat! It's nested next to the lake and is a slice of serenity in downtown Austin. The view of the lake is stunning and while you are in the midst of the bustle of downtown Austin, they've done a fantastic job of making it feel quiet. It's worth upgrading to a lake view to wake up to such a gorgeous view! I would also highly recommend brunch at the Four Seasons. They have a variety of options spanning from sushi to your classic breakfast dishes and the service is unparalleled. Plus, you get $1 mimosas and a fantastic view of the lake! My husband and I stayed here the night of our wedding and they did a fantastic job of making the evening feel extra-special.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Four Seasons truly provided an "individual" feel to my stay and the quality of the experience was fantastic. The rooms were exquisitely appointed and the fitness facility was top-notch. Will absolutely stay again at this property!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: quick 3 night business trip to four seasons austin in february. hotel was redone on the inside but not ultra-modern. outside, especially pool area, needs a major refresh. bed was very comfortable, room was spacious.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four Seasons Austin always seems to meet my particular expectations regarding quality, service,comfort and value. Very attentive and unobtrusive staff and management. Beautifully sited on the banks of the Colorado River. Great experience there!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came for a college visit for my son. Fabulous hotel. Great location. The lounge area is nice inside and out. Will definitely stay here every time we come to Austin. Nice quiet room with great view of the lake.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The lovely four seasons hotel in Austin Texas is hands-down one of the best properties that I have ever visited. I’ve stated five star properties all over the world. What stands out at the Austin four seasons is the amazing service and customer experience. The food as well as the room comfort were sublime. The leadership team as well as all of the staff at the Austin four seasons should be congratulated on their amazing accomplishment!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our only choice for accommodations while in Austin! Beautiful property located on Lady Bird Lake. Great food, rooms always perfect, walkable to all restaurants and downtown Austin. Staff is second to none!! Friendly and professional always.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend the Four Seasons Hotel in Austin, to anyone seeking a relaxing stay with excellent accommodations that is centrally located hotel with easy access to all the cultural & flavorful venues the city has to offer.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved being in Austin Texas and the hotel and staff were great! There is a wonderful path right by the hotel and was perfect for a walk or run. Rooms were extremely quiet, and the bed is the best that I have experienced in staying at other 5-star hotels.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has gone through and is still going through a renovation, although you don't hear or see the renovations.As one would expect the service is exceptional at the Four Seasons. The location is perfect in every way, the staff go above and beyond. Sitting in their restaurant overlooking the lake (partial view) is very serene.The actual room was spotless and had all amenities that you would expect, but no tea/coffee machine, come on now, some of us live on coffee. L'occtaine products in bathroom are really good.Gym is great and spa services are exceptional. One major downside is the access to the outdoor heated salt water pool; you have to walk in your robe from the spa which is on one side to the other side as there are no separate changing facilities such as a pool house to change into your swimsuit. That was a little odd.The bar and restaurant are your typical hotel fare. Bar has some rather loud bands playing, but this is Austin, music capital of the world!Enjoy!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gym has brand new equipment kept in perfect condition. Room was quiet, spacious, and comfortable. Food is exceptionally good, and consistently so, at this hotel. I stay here often and this hotel delivers a perfect experience unfailingly.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I reviewed this hotel awhile back and called it a Two Seasons. It was very aged at the time, but the service was good.Having now stayed at the property several years in a row, I must give credit where credit is due. The property has done major remodeling, with a gorgeous new lobby and much improved rooms and fitness center. Once again, the service was typical Four Seasons outstanding. Bravo to the team in Austin for all their efforts to improve their hotel!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel Austin on two occasions. Both times we've stayed in a river view room, which had a beautiful view of the river and the trail where you can take a run or go rent a kayak or paddle boat. The hotel is modern and clean, in a great location, right on the river, close to shopping, restaurants, the capital, and the absolute best customer service we have experienced in a long time. Everyone from the front desk to the valets know your name and are so helpful and warm. There is no pretension or snobbery to be found in this hotel. And if you need anything you can text them and your wish comes true. We won't ever stay anywhere else when we go to Austin!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Subdued, maple toned and utterly Texas, the Four Seasons Austin is a robust luxury property right on the river. The lobby cocktail bar is always hopping, and the restaurant downstairs offers a sophisticatedly restrained take on American cuisine with a strong Texas undertow.The rooms continue to the butterscotch palette. The beds are firm, the linens luxurious. The bathrooms provide plenty of room for two people to get ready at the same time, or one person to have an unwinding time before getting ready to face Congress, Sixth Street or the State Capitol.Beyond a state of the art workout room, there is a walking trail along the river that passes by the hotel for a beautiful run/jog/hike. There is also a boathouse within easy reach. AND at sunset, watch the bats fly from under the bridge.As a respite from Austin's go-go-go pace, this is the old school brand of luxury. Many newer properties have been built, but none matches the Four Season for elegance that's as cozy as it is sophisticated.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great experience staying at the Four seasons Austin for their special Valentine's day package. It was definitely a memorable experience and the staff went out of their way to personalize the visit. We will definitely be staying there again.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice place to stay for a wedding in Austin, Texas. The restaurant had great breakfast options. The service in general was very good. The bar late evening was busy with some delay in service. Austin is a growing city and great destination for a weekend.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, son and I recently stayed for three nights at the Four Seasons in Austin. Although we frequently stay in high-end hotels, I cannot say that we’ve ever received better customer service. Absolutely everyone was super friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Juan at the front desk was a gem and knew that we would have more comfortable accommodations after the first night and showed us different rooms to meet our needs. We did end up changing rooms and had an incredibly pleasant experience. We will absolutely recommend it to our friends and stay there again, especially if our son attends UT. Thank you for making our stay amazing!
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice place. They are service oriented, and very pleasant and helpful. They have amenities I would have used, but it was a short stay and I only found out about them too late to avail myself of them. It pays to research a bit in advance.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was family wedding destination. Facility, Food and Staff 5 star!! Easy to walk around downtown. Staff handled all our needs promptly and efficently. Food in Restaurant and Bar was great. View over the lake/river spectacular.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My spouse and I spent 3 nights at this hotel because she had a conference here. The service was outstanding; our room had a beautiful view; and the location was perfect. I would absolutely return to this hotel if I were in Austin again.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Austin for a friend’s daughter’s wedding. The wedding was held at the Four Seasons. The hotel excelled in all areas. Beautiful room overlooking the lake - they gave us an upgrade on arrival- VERY comfortable bed, immaculate room, quiet . Every staff member was helpful and polite, Lovely public areas , great location. We did not eat in the restaurant, but had delicious breakfast from room service - pancakes were fabulous- and coffee was located in the lobby area but right by the elevators , so you didn’t have to troop thru the lobby in your morning disheveled look. Excellent bar service and we heard some great music by 3 very young musicians there one night. The wedding was a seated dinner and they pulled that off well. Four delicious courses. The hotel is in a great location. You can’t go wrong here.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel! The staff was very attentive and friendly. Sunday brunch was phenomenal. My 4-year-old loved her gifts! The recreation in the area was plentiful. The fitness room was well maintained and clean. We will definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large room, clean and comfortable with amenities. Newly renovated and tastefully decorated. Staff was friendly and helpful. Restaurant had good menu - great bread! The bar was large and comfortable with nice deck to outdoors where service was available too.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is beautiful, staff is extremely helpful, location is great- walking distance to downtown, We had a great couple of day stay in Austin at the Four Season. Can't really go wrong with Four Season.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Favorite hotel,stayed with my family in two rooms. Very good location next to Town Lake. Service, and food was excellent. Every need was met with great Texas hospitality. Rooms were comfortable and well maintained
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Four Seasons Austin is an extraordinary property. From the customer service to the charm and newly renovated property, I would recommend anyone stay there for business and/or pleasure. They went above and beyond to make our wedding weekend magical and treated every one of our guests with the kindest of care.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Austin trip for pleasure over New Years holiday. Hotel was exceptional. Service was exemplary. Food and bar service excellent. The music in their bar was better than generally available in music venues. We will stay at another Four Seasons soon
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent experience all the way around. Even housekeeping personnel went out of their way to greet me every time I encountered them. Concierge personnel were knowledgeable and provided excellent information and recommendations every time I needed them.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time to stay at the Four Seasons Austin and I was completely blow away with the room and overall service. I travel to Austin on a monthly basis and are planning to make the Four Seasons Austin my primary choice of hotel when coming to Austin.
hotelName:
10    Four Seasons Hotel Austin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel room was spacious and very clean. This is very important to me. The entire hotel was clean. The staff was courteous, nice and helpful. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. This trip was my second time staying at this hotel. The value is good since I stay for several days. The internet was spotty and kept going in and out, but I was there to sleep. I really like this hotel and will be staying there again.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at Home2 across the country. We keep coming back because we know what to expect- spacious accommodations, a clean, safe room, a pool and a great breakfast. Staff are friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re not traveling with kids this is not the hotel for you. There were kids playing around in the pool all the time and very loud kids messing around late at night. The hotel staff can’t do much to quiet them down.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a place that is probably the bottom of the Hilton line. It was clean but not fancy, the furniture was econo level but servicable.We had made the reservations a week in advance (we are Hilton Diamond Members) with a king size bed only to find out when we got there that the room was overbooked and not available. They upgraded us to a "suite" with 2 queen beds to make up for their mistake, it was quite spacious but not what we wanted. There were packs (6-9 kids) of children running in the halls after 9pm making loud noises, yelling at each other & slamming doors for at least an hour, we were about ready to call the front desk but they finally quit at about 10:15. The parking lot was very dark, there were no parking lot lights on when we returned from dinner, even though they were available, the hotel is set back from the street so there were no streetlights shining through. Very creepy getting out of the car in the dark, with the only light available coming through the trees from the neighboring businesses. They have a very small pool that is built in some sort of atrium like place that was in the shade of the building by 4pm.I think the biggest thing that really turned me off was the fact at breakfast the next morning and even though it was getting somewhat crowded someone had left their small terrier dog taking up one of the chairs while they went and got their food! It was pretty well behaved but even if the hotel allows pets I do not believe they belong on a chair sitting by themselves for 15-20 minutes while there are guests waiting to sit down and have breakfast! We will most likely not go back.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice folks here with clean rooms and a great location make this a very good hotel. They are having problems with the WiFi so do not try to use the normal Hilton network. Breakfast was adequate but consisted of yogurt, bread and cold sandwiches that you can throw into the microwave. Not terrible but the microwave thing is not my cup of tea!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awsome motel. No issues at all, hotel staff very friendly. Close to shopping and restaurants. Motel in a very nice area and close to other metropolitan areas. Neighborhood is very nice, and experienced no road or other guest noise.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing accommodations, staff, breakfast bar and service. One thing in particular that stood out for me was how quiet the room was with minimal, if any noise, i.e.: traffic, other guests coming & going, doors slamming, etc. Absolute quietness you don't normally get with many other hotel/motels.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff always makes me feel comfortable and welcome. I appreciate the on-site laundry facilities, comfortable beds and outdoor spaces to relax. As a frequent visitor, the staff always greets me by name, and makes a point to thank me for my business. I always feel welcome and appreciated as a guest.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I reserved a two bedroom suite for my family of 7 as we are military en route to our new duty station. Upon arrival I had been downgraded to a one bedroom. I paid the same price for half the space! I also was told no discount for a second room or for the smaller room and to “be glad we’re allowing you to stay because it’s against codes for that many in one room” I will not be booking at one of these hotels again. Poor customer service!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is now the third time we have stayed at this particular hotel because we love it so much. We are a family of 5 and the room was perfect for our needs with tons of counter top space along the wall to put suitcases and a place to hang clothes. The air conditioner kept us very cool and we slept well with the blackout on the window. Their staff are very friendly and helpful and attentive, making it obvious they care about customer service and have made it a top priority.One of our most favorite features about this hotel is their breakfast. It is by far the best breakfast setup I've seen in a hotel for a complimentary breakfast. You get to choose from a variety of tasty microwaveable egg sandwich or bowl or burrito type entrees, fresh fruits and yogurts, fruit juice, pancakes, and very decent coffee. We save money just on breakfast because even our most picky kids can find something good to eat here.We will definitely recommend this place and continue coming back to this hotel!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice newer property. The rooms are the standard affair with the Home 2 typical amenities. The staff is really helpful and the location is easily accessed from the 183 toll road. There are restaurants within walking distance. I would stay here again
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. It was a last minute booking because some relatives became sick the night we were to stay with them. I was telling my story to someone at the front desk (I think it was Manny, the assistant general manager). He made sure we had a room with a separate door between the main room and the sofa bed because our daughter had been waking all of us up in the middle of the night several nights in a row. Then he offered our little ones some sweets, for which they were VERY grateful after the long drive. Their staff really went above and beyond. I’d highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel staff did an excellent job of making our stay enjoyable and accomodating. We enjoyed the location of the hotel and the convenience of the grocery stores and restaurants near by. We will definitely be staying at Home2Suites on our next family vacation.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not have asked for a better stay at a hotel. The staff were great. The woman that checked us in was pleasant and helpful. I asked for a quiet room so I would be able to sleep. She gave me exactly that. The hotel was very nice and clean. It is in a great location, close to shopping and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Manny and Jess, Were great when I locked myself out of my room. They gave me a extra key to keep. The free Breakfast was amazing and not your ordinarily continental Breakfast. Will def come back and stay .
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding experience with the room and amenities: pool, fire on the patio, complimentary breakfast, and fitness center. Service was second to none. We had everything we needed as soon as we asked for it. The only hindrance was that the fridge did not keep cold.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the cleanliness quiet and comfort of this hotel. Everything you need is so close. Breakfast very very good. Front desk service was 5 star. Especially Manny. Who made sure my elderly mother got an extra blanket right away. He delivered it himself!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff overall were great. The room though designed like other Home 2 Suites, was just not as comfortable or clean. It may not be a big deal for others, but I really like a bathroom with a tub since I travel with kids. It wasn’t an awful stay just did not live up to my previous experiences with this hotel chain.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decided on an overnight trip to the Austin area. The accommodations were great and the staff (Manny and Melissa) were so personable that I felt like I was staying with friends. I had issues with my digital key and Manny was extremely nice in looking into the issue. Will definitely return to this property in the future!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, very clean, very nice and attentive staff, everything we wanted or needed from a quick weekend stay. Conveniently located near retail and the freeway for easy access around town. Rooms were clean and stocked. Quiet and easy stay!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super clean rooms that don’t reek of chemical cleaners. Rooms stocked with plates, silverware, and other supplies already in the room. Free washer & dryer and great workout area. Staff was class A! Easy walk to grocery store and other strip mall stores. Easy access to highway. Great breakfast and 24/7 lobby coffee.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed @ this hotel previously & feel it is convenient to visiting our son & his family who live in Liberty Hill, Tx. It is well maintained & very clean ! It offers very good value for the money. Manny Singh, Assistant General Manager & his staff greeted us enthusiasticly upon our arrival !. The cleaning staff were very friendly & greeted us! My wife forgot her tooth brush & when I asked the lady maintaining the breakfast area if they had one available, she imediatly went in back & brought one out including tooth paste without charge ! My only negative is the pillows need to be replaced ! When returning to this area in the future, we definitely will consider staying here again !
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first choice of hotel for stay every time I visit Austin due to its clean rooms, friendly staff, close proximity to almost everything and decent breakfast. Manny at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and made me feel like I was at home! Highly recommended!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff and clean hotel. Location was good. lots of places to eat around the place. Cleaning crew is good. Coffee, tea, is available to guest 24/7. Friendly Staff smiles and makes eye contact. Manny at front desk treated us as a family.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay. Hotel is in a great area, close to everything! Room was very clean. Staff was very pleasant and helpful! We would definitely stay here again if we visit the area in the future.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: eat amenities, clean, comfortable bed, nice full service kitchenette, central location for north Austin, great breakfast. Staff very friendly & helpful. Enjoyed the stay & will stay there again when I visit Austin again. Its next to a mall & many restaurants so very convenient & plenty of parking.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has nice amenities, nice rooms, and the staff is friendly and helpful! Great hotel for the price! They have an outdoor firepit, and a nice lobby lounge. The rooms have a small kitchen area with a refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and dishes.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel as my pregnant daughter and hubby stayed for a month at this location, while they had to tear out their kitchen due to a mold problem, 2 years ago. Fast forward, we took our 2 yr old grandson to stay at hotel as both his parents had the flu and we did not want the child exposed. He puked in the lobby right as we were checking in! Manny, at the front desk, immediately came to our rescue! He was so kind and helpful! He was extremely accommodating to our needs our entire stay. Wesley also was very nice and helpful! The room was a great setup for us with the kitchen and living areas. The hotel is in a great local, close to restaurants and shopping. My only complaint would be the thin floors as you can here the footsteps above. But...I had a 2 yr old stomping around too, so sorry to those below us! :) Thank you management for being so genuinely kind and helpful!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like HILTON properties and when I have the opportunity to try some of their newer designs I enjoy it. This location was one of the better Home2 Suites I’ve stayed in. The staff was above average. The exercise area was clean (but lights go off and on when exercising). I’ll stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our corporate office is in the vicinity of this property, which means there are many hotel options. The Home2 Suites - Austin/Cedar Park has won my business. The hotel is clean, great service, convenient and cost effective. It is everything I need a a good price. Two thumbs up!!!!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is located next to a Plaza and Mall however provides a very quiet experience. They're all sorts of restaurant options within walking distance, and Alamo Drafthouse for entertainment, and HEB grocery store stock up on supplies. The rooms were very clean and spacious and the staff were very friendly and made checking in and checking out a breeze. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, very friendly! Beds were super comfortable....even the pullout couch and the rollaway bed!!! The front desk was very helpful! We asked for late checkout and it was granted without question! The free breakfast was great!Really nice hotel!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During a recent trip to Austin, I found this location for myself as well as three business partners. It was our first time staying here and I cannot say enough about the exceptional customer service we found at this very clean, well maintained, and inviting hotel. From housekeeping to security to everyone we met at the front desk and breakfast bar, all of our party's expectations were exceeded. I wish to especially thank Assistant GM Manny for ensuring that every single part of our stay was a pleasant and efficient one. We travel regularly to Austin and we have found a new home. Thank you hilton for this wonderful site!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During a recent group stay with friends we had a great time at this location. Located near alot of food and retail stores within walking discount. Lobby was amazingly clean the front desk was helpful and the hotel was quiet.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 20 days! This was not our original plan as we were closing on our new home and planned to only be there for a week, tops. The staff was extremely professional, personable and accommodating. They new every guest by name and greeted you every time you walked through the door. Manni, one of the managers, needs to be given an award. That guy never stops working. There around the clock and always with a smile on his face. To top it off, my fiance proposed to me on Christmas and they help coordinate it. I had our 140lb rottweiler with us and they treated her so well. At one point I was going to make her the mascot. The hotel is super clean as well. Nothing bad at all to say about this play. I encourage you to book!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing but good things to say about this hotel! Rooms were very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The manager, Manny, was exceptional. It is enjoyable to stay somewhere you are welcomed and treated well!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel for families. Excellent on every aspect except a bit on breakfast, which felt like having airplane food with pre-fab omelets and other fare needed to be microwaved. Other than that, would recommend to anybody.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Appearance of hotel was excellent. Staff was helpful when needed. Breakfast definitely needs an upgrade. Not sure I appreciated microwave breakfast of eggs/sandwiches. Waffle maker and oatmeal were available. Room was clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again due to cleanliness of the hotel and location near theaters and eating places.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Asst. Mgr. Manny took really great care of us, going above and beyond our expectations and we travel a lot so this was a very pleasant surprise! The suite was very clean and comfortable and all the staff was friendly and helpful. Overall a very enjoyable stay! We will be back!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is our preferred hotel in the Cedar Park area of Austin. We travel here two or three times a year. We just spent almost two weeks here and it was superb. Not only is it centrally located, with easy access to shopping, dining, and family, it is the best customer oriented property we have experienced in our travels. The staff is friendly and willing to go above and beyond expectations to accommodate customers. Thank you staff and especially Manny who always met us with a smile and called us by name!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff, very friendly and always smiling. Stayed 2 nights, and had no problems. Large room, good breakfast, lots of restaurants and shopping near by, and a movie theatre right across the street. Would stay again.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and very fun, friendly staff. The gym amenities were nice and just across the street are several great places to eat and shop. There is also a movie theatre in the same shopping center.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don’t know I had such a strong preference for beds, pillows, and linnens until I experienced the ultimate worst in all 3 here. Didn’t sleep a wink. Pillows were cheap and lumpy, sheets felt like Velcro hard to move and roll over and the bed was terrible. All else was clean and nice.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Linens and pillows......I stay at a lot of Hilton properties and I have to say that the linens and pillows at this place are 'sub par'......2 small pillows (maybe twin size on a KING bed) that were, to say the least, soft and felt like they belonged at a Motel 6 or maybe were a few YEARS old ? I'm staying at an Embassy tonight and came in to 4 fairly firm pillows on a king bed......Next the sheets were not soft....don't know if it was a 'lesser' quality of linen or if it was they were cheap and slightly course......Just not what I expected....The rest of the hotel, location, appearance, etc. were as expected, but I wasn't happy with my sleep.....
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel definitely doesn't dissapoint in the looks department. It is clean and very well maintained. Also, the staff is friendly and engaging. The complimentary breakfast was decent, but a little lacking. Still I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a modern, comfortable place to stay away from home.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I reserved a king, when we checked in they only had single queen beds. We had to be moved into a new room. The room we were moved in to the water pressure in the shower was basically non existent. The shower head on the hose fell off multiple time hitting me in the head. The pillows suck, you need at least 4 pillows to yourself to some what be comfortable. Overall not the best experience.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can not say enough about the Assistant GM at this hotel. He was very helpful in making sure my digital key worked correctly and the check-in process was very smooth. Even though I was only there for one night, he remembered the reason for my visit the next morning and wished me well on my day. That kind of attention to detail is wonderful and shows he and his staff really care about their customers. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superior location (HEB, Alamo Drafthouse, restaurants, access to main expressway) with friendly, competent staff. I visit Austin several times a year, and I always go back to this Home2Suites. I love having a small kitchen within my room.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was convenient to relatives. Room was spacious and very clean. Loved the full size fridge and dishwasher. Bed was very comfortable . Plenty of linens. Breakfast was good and was glad it was available until 10 am
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room I had, had a thin queen mattress and the roll bed on the couch also had a very thin mattress. You can easily feel the frame on the roll out bed and had some major lumps. All towels felt like hard and a bit gritty. The rooms advertised looked less on online until you check out. It goes up an extra $80.00 when you get your receipt. Great location tho.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for two weeks while I was relocating to the area. The property was clean and the room had everything I needed. Everyone I came in contact with from the hotel was welcoming and friendly. The breakfast was great each morning with a nice selection of foods to choose from. Wonderful location with easy access to shopping and restaurants.
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Home 2 suites in cedar park is great. Love the place being is so clean. The front staff next morning greeted me with a good morning and the impressive part was that they knew my name. I enjoy stayin there
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second time staying at this property and once again it met all our needs and then some! It’s very convenient to where our son lives, so I am sure we will be staying here every time we visit!!! Staff is very professional and kind! The person at the front desk remembered me from our trip in July! Thank you once again for being our home away from home!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very highly satisfied with our stay I would totally recommend this hotel! Personal are very helpful the rooms had everything we expected and very clean. Breakfast was real good as well! The fire place outdoors makes you feel at home!
hotelName:
11    Home2 Suites by Hilton - Austin/Cedar Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Emily, Karina, Irene and Michelle are the best!Every time I come for breakfast the service is excellent, the food is delicious and the way the employees handle everything is so professional. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone, definitely try the malted mini waffles!!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you go to the G Bar & Bistro make sure to ask for Anthony! Anthony provided attentive and excellent service!! She brought our drinks in a timely manner and the food as well. Very sweet young woman.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I met a young girl while I was out eating with my kids , her name was Anthony and I can’t express to you how wonderful this young lady served me and my children. She catered to my needs and was very respectful. I am beyond amazed, and will be staying here again !
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superseded my expectationMore of a Corporate/Airline hotel, saw many Southwest personal on siteGreat locale to airport Complimentary Shuttle Clean, clean and cleanProfessional StaffSpacious RoomsAffordableRestaurant although small and limited choices was really good. Chicken Sliders and Pizza go a long way with a teenDefinitely one of the better managed hotelsWhen in Austin again this hotel will be where I stay.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The food at this hotel was fantastic! I had a made to breakfast every morning that was healthy and extremely fresh. I have never experienced this quality of food at a hotel!The entire staff was extremely helpful and friendly! I was there for 6 nights. The room was clean and spacious. The pool was very clean and well taken care of.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While this hotel isn't located in the middle of action it is a great spot. Close to the airport and the main roads at an affordable price. Free wifi, free parking, a bar/restaurant w 24 hour grab and go access for basic food and drinks, friendly staff and clean! The only drawback was the that it was a bit noisy ...you can hear traffic, other room's plumbing, hall doors slamming shut, and the ac turning on woke me up a few times. Would definately go back, but with earplugs.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Toni welcomed us with a bright smile and helped us out with checking in after a long night of flying. Great service and welcoming staff. Hotel is very clean and organized. Great place to crash for a layover
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This holiday inn is one of the top of the IHG holiday inn range. It’s a fairly new building and all is clean and fresh. Staff is friendly, accommodating and professional. Rooms are posh and comfortable. A corner couch is available. Bathtub / shower combo. A long desk/ cabinet with microwave and mini fridge. Bed is comfortable and gave me a good sleep. A couple of reviewers commented about the freeway noise. I’m a light sleeper and I heard none of it in my room. When outside by the pool, yes, the roar of the freeway is heard. There are many many new hotels on this side of the airport and all front the freeway. The biggest downside is that every added amenity costs. There is not even any free tea or coffee in the lobby.
