You can get free lemon water from a dispenser, but only a cone cup is available.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New property! Caleb and Dee at front desk Awesome. Airport Shuttle one of the best Restaurant best in Holiday Inn chain Rooms immaculate clean Great Place. I will definitely recommend and stay again !!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm rating this property keeping in mind that it is a 3-star hotel. Positives:- Promptly picked up at the airport at 2 am- Check-in took less than 5 minutes- Rooms/facilities were clean and modern = great night's sleep- Was given a late check-outNegatives:- Gym was very basic; no free weights
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are very loud, from next door to the highway outside my window. Breakfast overpriced for a mediocre buffet, WiFi RARELY worked and for 200$ a night I’d hope that wouldn’t be an issue for a major hotel chain. The rooms were nice enough and the front desk staff were very polite and helpful but if I could choose I would’ve switched locations.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late at night, exhausted but found it hard to sleep. After waiting for the 2nd shuttle and the very nice driver to also check me in, I was given a room on the 1st floor. I could hear every truck that passed by on the nearby highway. The room was new and clean, but at $300.00 for one night it should have been. The staff is nice, the rooms large and clean, but you can hear water running next door.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent one night at this hotel, the rooms are large, clean and in excellent condition. The pool area has comfortable seats and there is another outdoor area for smokers. The location of the hotel is good and the staff was very polite.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was fantastic!! Management truly cares and makes sure you are completely taken care of. I will be back for sure, especially while Joshalyn is there. She rocks!! Keep up the good work y’all
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To find a hotel near the airport with incredible service is rare! The staff was extremely friendly, polite, and patient. I felt very welcomed. The rooms were incredibly clean which is also rare at an airport location. All the staff seemed to have the uncommon Joy about them that other places just don’t. 100% would recommend.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always stay at this location when I visit Austin. They are very accommodating and clean. The rooms are a great size with comfy beds. Very quiet- I always get a good nights rest. I've never had an issue here and I will continue to stay, when I visit Austin. I would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent services!! Staff is very professional and friendly!! Food is beyond awesome!! I love the bar and most of the appetizers are off the charts! I would stay here anytime I return to.Austin the prices are affordable and well worth the stay!!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Joined a few friends at this central location to our homes. We loved it! Staff was so accommodating and the food and drinks were awesome! Definitely going to take a weekend get away here again soon! It was too cold during our stay but will be back to enjoy the pool area. It looked so inviting You all are awesome!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel prior to our flight to Orlando. It was me my wife and my two children. The rooms are spacious with two queen bed‘s this is a relatively new hotel it is clean and well taken care of and convenient to the airport. Our plan was to stay at the hotel prior to a trip play out the next morning. In the IHG® brand this is the holiday inn they have a restaurant on property we ate breakfast the morning of our trip sounded to be very good for a buffet it is not your typical Holiday Inn express and suites they have a real eggs not hard today is a better quality of bacon and other items in the breakfast bar you also have the option of ordering directly off of the menu for hot food. The rooms are clean everything was in working condition. The staff was polite, And professional overall how great this property and 4 3/4. Parking on site as ample parking lot is well lit and there’s usually Security or an off-duty police officer on location.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pro: Fanciest Holiday Inn I’ve ever stayed at. Super close to airport. Shuttle runs 24/7 every 30 minutes—sign up at front desk. Con: Check in: very unprofessional staff. This was the afternoon of February 17 and three staff members were there (2 males 1 female) and all three were so nonchalant and uninterested in making me feel welcome. In fact, I had to keep reminding myself that I was still in Texas! Another con: tea, coffee, sodas, everything costs to purchase. The only free item was ice water and you had to drink it from a small paper cone cup! Pro: nice, spacious room, very clean, bed very comfortable.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very nice and brand new. We had an adjoining rooms. There were plugs everywhere to charge all Elton is. The staff was really friendly. Will definitely be staying there the next time we are in town. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was traveling alone and felt so safe staying here. Plenty of safe, well lite parking for my rental car. Front desk beyond warm, friendly, and helpful. Rooms clean and nice. Breakfast was nice with lots of choices. After a busy day, the bar food really hit the spot. Plus the airport shuttle was amazing with the nicest driver at the crack of dawn.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed one night at this hotel, but we really loved it! Quick access to and from the airport. The hotel seems on the newer side with practical and modern touches, and clean. We had a King room that had a corner sofa and an extra vanity area outside the spacious bathroom. Towels were soft and bed was comfy. Really no complaints at all other than we had no luggage racks in our room so we had to use the sofa for our bags. We did not try the onsite restaurant. All in all, we'd definitely stay here again if we came to Austin and needed to be near the airport. This is what hotels in this class should look like!!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very clean and modern. Upgraded to king suite based on elite status. Restaurant food was good, staff attentive. Nice shuttle driver in the mornings, believe his name was Rigo. Had to book my reservation as separate nights, process in morning to check out and check back in was very slow. Nice guy, just slow. The afternoon/evening staff much faster to process requests. During the 4 days there, aside from the room upgrade (most appreciated and important), not a single recognition of Spire Elite status.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great I love it so much ! We always come back to it! Special thank you to Bri ! You pampered us. This girl right here went above and beyond to make sure we had a great meal. 5 out of 5 for the service !
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an all out great experience. The Entire hotel staff did a great job. They were super friendly, helpful, and professional. The rooms were comfy and clean. The property was clean and well kept. We went for a film festival which was held in their meeting rooms. They went out of there way to make everyone comfortable. Cant wait to go back next year.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everytime a go to Austin I stay at the Holidays Inn Airport. The rooms are very clean, the staff is great, they have that old time respectfulness and courtesy. And the breakfast is outstanding. They really know how to make you feel at home.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We made a last minute reservation set for an unplanned stop in Austin on the way to Houston. The location was clean and the staff were very friendly....and the breakfast station was very clean and the items were fresh! I thought I would be disappointed with the scrapes since I didn’t make it to breakfast until 10:30am, but the staff was very nice with my requests and other items were filled and ready to serve. I look forward to setting up a reservation here again for the same great experience!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was in Austin for a conference and decided to stay at the brand new Holiday Inn Austin Airport. When we landed we called the hotel to inquire about a shuttle...we were told it would be about 15 minutes...it actually took about 5 minutes for a beautiful new bus to arrive. Check-in was equally convenient as it took about 3 minutes for both me and my business partner to get our keys. Upstairs, my room was perfect. Clean and comfortable my well designed and very quiet room was ideal. We had drinks and dinner at the hotel’s restaurant our first night. Our experience at the restaurant was fine, but the menu is a bit limited and the restaurant a little too “family friendly”...very brightly lit and too much brightly colored Formica. But...for a drink or two and some re-heated appetizers it was fine.Getting to downtown was a breeze. We used Lyft and never had to wait more than 5 minutes on either end of the trip.The only real negative was it’s isolated location. There really wasn’t much within walking distance...Basically...it’s a nice place for a few nights...very clean and friendly.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the risk of sounding like a hotel snob, I typically stay at 4/5-star hotels and have tried all of the local high-end Austin options. But on this quick 1-night trip, I wanted something easy and inexpensive without hassle. Thanks to TripAdvisor, I simply chose the #1 (and the rate was fantastic) and went with it. And this hotel just NAILS it. No need for me to reiterate all of the info from the previous reviews --- the hotel is just that good. For the hotel class and price point, it doesn't miss a detail. Plus it's impeccably clean and the staff is great. I will be recommending it to everyone I can!One location note -- although the name suggests it's an airport hotel and it's plenty convenient for that, it is VERY convenient for a typical Austin traveler who is ok with being out of of the Downtown/SoCo action and will receive a tremendous value as a result. I had dinner in a popular area of South Lamar the night I stayed and it only took 10 minutes door-to-door to get there. It's only about 5 or 6 miles to the heart of South Congress! So while it might feel or map out to look a bit off the beaten path, it's not!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long day dodging the storms in Austin. We were thrilled to check into this lovely Holiday Inn at the airport. Wonderful reception at check in. They had even called us earlier to inquire whether we needed anything special. The room was super spacious, clean lines and comfortable bed. Chic attractive restaurant/bar---good food.We especially compliment Caleb for helping get us UBER and Jessi for the shuttle service.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, easily located hotel on main route between the centre of Austin and the airport. Reception staff were helpful once off the phone. Beds were on the small side. Breakfast staff were frankly insolent and it truly felt we were being treated as an annoyance (unsure if it was because we were not local or because we were a family). Disappointing.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having to catch an early flight, my husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Austin Airport for one night. The staff was great..friendly, professional, informative. The bistro was good...happy hour with great wines and a long list of craft beers for half price! The food was tasty and the server in the bistro was a doll! The rooms are very clean and very modern. With the comfortable rooms and beds, we got a great night's sleep before our flight!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is immaculate, the amenities are wonderful. This is perhaps the nicest Holiday Inn I have ever been to. The rooms were spacious , great lighting and the comfort of the king size bed surpassed many hotels I have stayed in .
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night in August. Hotel was great super clean and quiet. Staff was welcoming and friendly. My rate included breakfast and it was also excellent. Best breakfast I have had in a long time. The restaurant staff was so friendly. If in the area I would make this my top choice to stay at. I tried the Home2Suites near the airport but I like this one better. Will be back. Room was super quiet also.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk professionalism and helpfulness was refreshing.Waitress was so attentive and quick with service and follow up that made dinner fun.Chef Guerro/Hilario prepared outstanding chicken nachos and more importantly the “best” chicken tenders I have EVER had, (really) such quality I asked for chef to come out and I tipped him personally, only the second time I’ve done this. Seriously, ask for the chicken tenders awesome.This the first review I’ve ever written
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great! Pool was what we were looking for, bartender Laurie was amazing, and very nice rooms! Thanks for accommodating the connecting rooms we asked for! We will definitely be back!Housekeeping was also great!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Flew in from California and had the best reception at this hotel. Caleb the front desk person was so nice and welcoming. And upon dropping off luggage at room had the best service at the bar from Laurie M. Service was fantastic, food delicious and Laurie was just a pleasure. Will definitely be back!!!!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very nice very clean. Everyone is friendly! Mia in the restaurant is awesome make sure you look for her! The pool was always clean, food was good, and room service was always accommodating! Couldn’t have asked for anything else.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There were a couple of things I was disappointed in with this hotel. At check in we found out we do not get hotel points if we book through Travelocity. No use using the sight of we don't get credit with the hotel. We also didn't get breakfast vouchers. Breakfast was average. Coffee expensive, breakfast buffet $12.95 we ordered off menu and it came out wrong. Gratuity added to bill 18%. Waitress did not earn her tip. Attention to detail not necessary if tip is already included. We can go to a less expensive hotel and get a better breakfast for free.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at hotels across this country and this is the first time anyone has called me before I check in to ask if I needed any special requirements in my room. Also when i checked in they asked if I was a coffee drinker and offered me extra coffee for my room. Great check in experience. When I asked if I could have a room close to the elevator they gave me one close but she said "not so close that you will hear the ding of the elevator". That was so thoughtful. Thank you to the staff for everything!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After my quick one night stay for a business trip, I want to come back here for every journey that takes me to Austin! The staff was AMAZING! From check in, to the restaurant/bar, morning room service, housekeepers, and shuttle transport.. Everyone was friendly and helpful. In particular Nicole went out of her way to make my trip extra special! Thank youHoliday Inn Austin Airport for the wonderful yet short stay, I wish more hotels treated guests the way you do!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had quick overnight stay at this hotel. The front desk clerk was very friendly and helpful. I picked this hotel due to the close proximity to the airport and the 24/7 shuttle service. Check in was smooth and signing up for the morning shuttle was easy. My room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. I slept very well and didn’t hear any noise in the hallway. I really liked the modern decor in the room and the USB ports. The driver was on time in the morning for the airport shuttle service and got everyone there quickly. I will definitely stay at this Holiday Inn again when flying out of Austin airport.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been on this hotel exactly one year ago, and of course we were very anxious to see if everything that we thought perfect continued to be as this. We were very happy to see that the hotel and staff continued to be on a path of excellency and great customer service. Rooms are comfortable, quiet and very very clean. The hotel smells good, very good. The staff are awesome. We would like to mention two staff: Jessy Hughs and Mia Dennis for their outstanding service to us. Jessy brought us from the airport and from that moment on, my family was well taken care by her on anything we needed. Mia took care of us every morning during breakfast. She was a blast on making sure we have got everything we needed to start a good day. I am sure we will come back often to the hotel.Congratulations to all the staff.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent staff, room was amazing....comfortable, clean and quiet. Room service and food was the best! Pool was clean. Breakfast buffet was great. Will certainly stay again. Close to downtown, State Capital.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a Marriott PP member, but enjoy staying at this hotel. It is always clean and the staff is great. Very nice gym and a nice area outside to sit and have drinks from the bar. I was upgraded to a suite. Bed was very comfortable.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were upgraded to a very nice double queen suite on the 4th floor. The hotel is very clean, very quiet.The restaurant was excellent; we ate breakfast there.Plenty of parking. We were in town for the Paul Simon concert and the hotel was only a few miles from the arena.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During a recent business trip. Travel was particularly challenging. Caleb provided a smile and a great sense of personality. Laurie Murphy was the very best. She created a fun and relaxing and knew what we all needed. Laughter was found at all of her tables. I wish I could pack her into my suitcase and brought her home. Thank you Laurie
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A quick night at the Austin airport for an early flight was an absolutely lovely nights stay!! We were pleasantly surprised by a wonderful dinner at the bar!! Our precious server, Bailey was an absolute ray of sunshine and such a delight! The cheeseburger, fries and wings were delicious! And to top it all off...the Oreo brownie waffle Sunday was the best dessert I've had in such a long time!!! We were shocked by the fabulous food the cook, Mia made for us!!! The check in was effortless and easy and the rooms very clean and comfortable!! We were blown away by the service, comfort and wonderful meal!!! I have stayed at five star hotels that haven't even come close to this stay!! We will be back for sure!!!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I rented a ballroom space for an art show and several rooms for my staff. The rooms were very cozy, extremely clean, updated and very comfortable. The hotel itself seems new as it's very contemporary and attractive. Emily was the event coordinator and Miss D was the food and beverage manager. Both were unbelievably wonderful - extremely professional and helpful, cheery, and made everything so convenient and accommodating. The front staff was equally terrific and Sean the maintenance man was there in a heartbeat to help with any set-up, lighting, air temperature, etc. I would absolutely recommend this Holiday Inn for anyone wanting to stay or hold an event. I am so impressed that I will continue searching Holiday Inns for future travel and event shows we put on.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I couldn't tell if this is a brand new hotel or they completely remodeled the place. It felt like a very nice resort. Rooms are VERY nice and new. Comfortable beds and pillows. Workout room is nice. Staff is friendly. Restaurant and bar will take care of all your needs. Your only choice as far as food in walking distance.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like the place, like the quiet night policy, although the walls are paper thin and was enthused to get back to HGI. But $3.25 for a small coffee in the morning and $3.25 for a small bag of cookies at night. Along with $2.00 waters and a tiny glasses of wine for $9.00. Having a tough time with it. Knit picky, bate and hook stuff. Your gonna lose people.Too bad. Don't know if it's worth it.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one night and caught an early flight the next day. the restaurant/bar area was convenient and the food was great. The pool and lounge area was comfortable. The room was very large and comfortable with a Keurig coffee maker and refrigerator. The check in staff were very nice and accommodated my request for early check in. They even called me in advance to be sure they had my requests on file.I took a very early airport shuttle that worked out great!
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived, it was apparent that this Holiday Inn property was new. The lobby was clean and welcoming, and overall, the hotel looked nicer than other more expensive hotels I've stayed in over the years. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful as well.The rooms were spotless and the beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were nice as well, although the towels left a little to be desired (not the best quality).I only have one negative item to bring up, albeit it's not that terrible overall. On the last morning of our stay we were greeted by the housekeepers shouting conversations to each other across the hallway while cleaning different rooms. Obviously, we wouldn't expect them to clean rooms in complete silence, but this went on for at least 10 minutes right at 8:00am.Overall, this is a fantastic hotel, and its proximity to the airport can't be topped. It's also only a 10 minute drive northwest to downtown Austin, and about 15 minutes to the amphitheater and F1 race track to the southeast. It's certainly the nicest Holiday Inn I've ever stayed at, and this stay has positively changed my opinion of the brand overall.
hotelName:
12    Holiday Inn Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hampton Inn & Suites is what you would expect. Room was clean, staff friendly, no complaints. Located in a great area. Many restaurants within walking distance. Close to convention center. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the rooms and hotel was very clean. The staff was very friendly too. Internet was stable and fairly fast. The breakfast was okay and the valet parking seemed rather expensive.The location was perfect for the convention center and the price was the great compared to everything around there.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The central location of this hotel is a definite plus...close to dining, shopping, drinks, you name it. Easy to walk all over downtown Austin! Very likely you won't need your car until it's time to head home!
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived in the evening and soon realized my cell phone was still in the taxi. I did not have the taxi number or driver name (lesson learned!). Kristen, Ramon and others worked for several hours to track down the taxi driver and I got my phone back - whew! The staff was amazing. The newly renovated rooms are great, very nice breakfast area with outside dining. Outside pool is small but refreshing. Excellent location for 2nd Street restaurant/music club scene, and the bats under the Congress Street bridge, and only 1 block from the Convention Center. Had great brisket at Lamberts! I cannot wait to return to Austin and highlty recommend the Hampton Inn.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff did a.great job. Very clean and comfortable room even with the remodeling that was going on. This will always be my first choice to stay in Austin. Great location in town for commuting to any type of activities.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, but valet at $41 a night a bit much. No on site parking. Good location near convention center. Price seemed to be high because of convention. Breakfast very average. French toast strips were cold and chewy. What can you expect from a hotel breakfast?
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a Diamond member with Hilton and so I think I have a reasonable frame of reference from horrible to excellent hotel experiences. I typically stay at Embassy Suites, Hilton and on occasion the Hilton Garden but rarely the Hampton because I rely on a few amenities that Hampton doesn't have. Everything was sold out in mu usual hotels and so I booked a room at this Hampton. The front desk folks were spectacular in wanting to make my experience great. They did. The bfast was a nice surprise too in that there were healthy options. Restaurant options are all around and the area has a nice vibe. I would stay again.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hampton Inn is located right in the middle of it downtown Austin. The hotel is great and the staff go above and beyond for you. Located 3 blocks from 6th street and the river with great food all around.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I missed my checkin for a prepaid room by one day due to flight change issues. Upon arriving, they had cancelled my room with NO REFUND and sold it to someone else. So, I had no room available AND I was out over $700. Hampton must be old english for "we're going to rip you off and do not really care if you're a gold customer". Well...I book about 50-75 nights a year. I won't be using Hampton anymore EVER
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week in April. We had a junior suite which was nice and roomy. Bed was lovely and comfortable. Slept like a baby. Breakfast had something for everyone (loved the Texas shaped waffles!). Staff were friendly.There is a pool but its very small and the sun doesn't come round to it until 3pm so is very cold.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are nice, but maintenance is poor, and you can notice.Breakfast is the worst I've seen in a long time. Everything is extremely artificial food, self service with paper and plastic dishes.They have a nice pool, but you can't use it before 10am.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So we travel to Austin a couple times a year and this location is amazing! It’s in a great downtown area and walking distance from a lot of different restaurants and the river. The bats are always fun to see with someone that hasn’t.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a conference and it was great. Much cheaper than many of the conference hotels, and still close to everything. The nice thing about Hampton Inn is you know what you are going to get, and this was no exception. Comfortable bed, room was well set up and the breakfast area was large. Nice bonus was the nightly happy hour! Would return for sure
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was visiting Austin for the first time for, yep you guessed it, a bachelor party. After the party ended I figured I would stay for a few extra days to take in the sites. I saw that this hotel looked like it was in a good spot and since I have had good experiences with Hampton Inns in the past, I picked it. After staying here I have to say it is in a GREAT location. Very close to 6th St, pretty close to Rainey St, and in a central location to much of downtown. The hotel has a nice looking lobby and dining area with outdoor seating. All of the staff that I talked to were very friendly and very helpful. My room was a good size, clean, and had a decent view. The next time I'm back in Austin I will definitely stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: located within walking distance of Ladybird Lake, Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown matches all the normal Hampton Inn features including comfortable beds, good breakfast and decent (if not above average) workout facility.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose the Hampton Inn for my sister's bachelorette group. The rooms were clean, the staff was super helpful, and the location was perfect. We could walk to all of the action. There was a lovely complimentary breakfast every morning and the wifi is free (many higher end hotels charge). I would recommend this hotel if you're ever in Austin. We were a group of 8 women, ages 27-38.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in an excellent spot Central to everything. Congress Kayack's, and River Walk is 2 blocks away. 6th Street Bars is within walking distance. Everything else you can access by scooter or electric bike including the Capital and UT Campus. We really enjoyed the Penny Lane Bar accross the street with live music and inexpensive cocktails. The Veranda on the Hampton is probably the best feature of the hotel where you can sit outside and people watch while eating breakfast or having a cocktail in the evening.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located in the downtown core of Austin. It is within easy walking distance of restaurants and some of the tourist sites in the city. The bedrooms are somewhat dark due to the small window.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient convention center hotel with friendly, professional staff. Nice variety of breakfast items, and I appreciated the extended hours: 6-10 am. The beds seemed rather low to the ground and could use better (firmer) mattresses, but I noticed a sign that an update was imminent.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in town for an event at the Circuit of the Americas. Wanted to be downtown to be able to walk about and listen to some live music. Hotel was pretty close. Would have been nice to have a lounge on site. And parking was $41 with no other options offered.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location and walking distance to many fun restaurants and bars. It's a longer walk to the fun Rainey Street area but do-able on a nice day/evening (it's about a mile) or using the street scooters found on most corners. This is the nicest Hampton Inn I've stayed in: the amenities felt more upscale than other HIs I've stayed in. Staff were super friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We zipped up on short notice to visit some family. We wanted a central location and this one was excellent. Everything was great, I just wish it were less expensive. But the price is in line with other hotels nearby.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived very early but were allowed to check in when we arrived. Room was nice and comfortable. This is the perfect location for a quick trip to Austin. Lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance. A few short blocks to Austin City Limits so you won’t need a car if you’re in for a concert.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Headed into town for the Indy Car Race. Krendon, Jake and Greg were awesome in valet, the front desk team was amazing, and breakfast was awesome at the hotel. So many good places to eat and drink close to the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives -1. Excellent location, within walking distance of 6th Street, Rainey Street, and the bat bridge. 6th Street includes numerous bars and live music, and is closed to traffic at night on weekends. Rainey Street also includes numerous bars, but has more outdoor bar areas. The bat bridge is a bridge where a ton of bats live and is big tourist draw, as the bats fly out from under the bridge at night. 2. Free breakfast included.3. Area is safe, and includes several quality restaurant and bar options across the street. 4. Room was clean and modern.5. Quality fitness center included.6. Property includes small outdoor pool. 7. Happy hour with free drinks offered Monday - Thursday.8. Hotel was quiet at night.9. Excellent staff. 10. Noon check out time instead of 11:00 am check out time. Negatives -1. Valet parking only, no self parking option available.2. Pool is not heated, so swimming in March is tough.3. No hot tub available.Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend due to excellent location, nice staff, and free breakfast.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location in downtown Austin, walking distance of all great restaurants, bars you would want. Easy as well for getting to Round Rock via Uber. I highly recommend and would stay here again. Enjoy your visit to Austin!
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and spacious room with modern interior, kind staffs but had to wait valet staff more than usual while check-in.(Valet parking only property.)BTW, why digital key by HHonors app does not work? (iPhone)
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is so friendly and it feels genuine. The location is perfect as you're central to everything including some great food spots. Lastly, the rooms are very big and come with a fridge and microwave.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't wear makeup and hadn't used that towel found a good sized makeup smear on two of my towels. Poor quality of food and poor response to my complaint about the towels in my room. They want way too much for the room with this type of service.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didn’t choose the hotel, which was chosen for us by our host company. Far from the airport and their offices and was not very nice, especially for the ridiculous price (including outrageous parking fees). One thing it kinda had going was central location to restaurants and bars, but also multiple homeless, too. Didn’t feel too safe at night.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As others have said, this property is in a great location for walking the city. However if you have a car, be aware of the steep parking costs which seem outrageous when you are paying to stay at the property but all of the area hotels seem to be the same! This is a busy place - we were not able to get into our room until several minutes after 4pm check-in and when we requested a later check out, they were only able to give us 30 minutes due to sold out conditions. Several events were happening, including their marathon & a soccer tournament, which explains that. I did not think the front desk staff was overly helpful or friendly but rather just ok. Our room (corner room 1513) was quiet and spacious. The decor was tasteful, although somewhat heavy and dark for me. It was clean overall - the microwave and refrigerator could have used extra attention. I liked the fact that there was a dedicated recycle vs trash container, however it was too small to be super useful. The bed was comfortable, the linens especially nice, and we love the neutrogena products. The breakfast was good and provided a lot of variety. The folks working in the breakfast area did an especially nice job of keeping things full and tables clean. We did not try the on site restaurant but visited the Royal Blue Grocery store that was close by - a great place to pick up anything you could want/need!
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great looking hotel, unfortunately the operations are not cuswtomer friendly from a hospitality perspective and do not consider this hotel to be well run. There are some wonderful people working here and others that fall off the scale. Be sure to double check your pricing if you book directly with the hotel as discount rates may not have been entered and the numbers tend to change on check in.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a room with a credit card but then didn't have that credit card at check in. As a result, they have charged both my credit card and the debit card I had on me. I still haven't gotten a refund.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights on business. Great location close to the uni, capital building and bullock state museum. The rooms were clean, quiet and breakfast was a good spread. I could walk basically everywhere from this location
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tried to cancel days before arrival. Refused to grant refund. Had to stay there and my friend went to another hotel and paid less for a better hotel (Van Zandt). Did not care about customer, did not offer any help with the situation.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good property with excellent access to downtown Austin. Very good buffet breakfast with good variety of food. Very clean lobby and dining area. Valet parking at $43 (including tax) per night a little high even for Austin.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this Hotel is good. The staff is good. The rooms need serious attention. The beds are uncomfortable, the linens are scratchy and old. The towels obviously were not dried with a dryer sheet or any kind of fabric softener. Way overpriced for what you get at this location. Breakfast below average.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was average. Breakfast was better than at some Hamptons. Water was not very hot for showers. You had to run it 10 mins to have hot water for a shower and take the shower on full hot. The front desk staff did not seem able to remedy this problem. I told them twice. Then when I checked back later in the day they seemed to have no specific action that was taken but told me "it must be all taken care of". Lots of nice talk but no actual action to fix a problem. Would not stay again.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had no room for me upon late arrival even with reservation, did not move my entire reservation to another property as promised, forced to move hotels twice, did not comp my room as promised, no hot water in bathroom sink.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is 3rd time we stayed here. Good price, great location and very nice accommodations. Still clean and well kept, good breakfast option or just a cup of coffee etc. Hilton honors members should definitely stay here!
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The parking rate at $41 a night which was expensive, however it is probably the going rate. Clean comfortable rooms and a very nice staff made our three nights enjoyable. The location is nice for site seeing around th city.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location near restaurants is fantastic! I don't prefer high rise hotels and this Hampton Inn is perfect. It is my favorite place to stay in Austin when visiting for business or pleasure. Treat yourself to an amazing hotel!
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 01/05/19. Had a room on the 7th floor. Room was recently renovated. The bathroom was tight. Had a tub rather than a walk-in shower as some of the remodeled Hampton’s. No robust coffee in the lobby. Breakfast to go bags available (fruit, breakfast bar, pastry and water). Friendly front desk staff. Valet parking available. Good location; walking distance to all the great restaurants and bars.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, but being right around the corner from the new Hyatt Place doesn't make the service or furnishings seem better. We had housekeeping issue and the mattress was so soft it was unreal. Breakfast area was a highlight, as the staff were welcoming and the food was better than the usual fare.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt like we were sleeping on concrete. I can not imagine what the design team was thinking - The mattresses are on top of a wood platform. Any movement and you could hear the wood shifting. Great location for us. Although we will not stay there again. Walked to nearby restaurants. The Stay and Park was a great option.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved my stay at Hampton Inn & Suites. They take great care of their guests.Added plus of Austin being a great city. Keepin' it weird!! As they say ..Would love to come back for personal with wife and kids. Hiking in the vicinity looks awesome!!
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown is a great location for a stay in Austin. Staff is professional, helpful and considerate of their customer's needs. The hotel is always clean & well kept. I've stayed here several times and will again.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hampton Inn's always provide a decent value. The location of this hotel is perfect. Walking distance to almost anything. Convention center is very close. Few blocks from all the live music and food you could want.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon trip around the USA. We visited Austin in July 2018 and loved every moment. The hotel was perfect for what we wanted, the room size was ample and the rooftop pool was perfect after a day out. The evening social 5.00pm-6.30pm was a lovely added extra with free snacks and drinks. The rooms were spacious and clean and it was handy to have an onsite snack shop. The hotel's location was perfect as it was just off South Congress Bridge to see the bats and an easy 5 minute walk to 6th Street. The hotel is also within walking distance to Rainey Street which has the most amazing bars.We want to say a huge thank you to the staff at the Hampton Inn Suites Downtown, in particular Courtland on reception who was exceptionally friendly, welcoming and helpful. Austin has a special place in our hearts and was our favourite place that we visited on our trip, we can't wait to return and we would definitely stay here again.Thank you from Danielle and Luke.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in a perfect location for a couple of nights on the town. Within walking distance of the funky 6th street scene and great music as well as great food selections. Easy on and off freeway location. Be ware you WILL pay a hefty valet parking fee but that's the norm for a city like Austin. Valet service was a little on the weak side - there seemed to be only one attendant at times. Breakfast was the usual continental fare although considerably better than some Hamptons. Also a great balcony for dining when the weather is nice.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Typical Hampton Inn. Service was good from the front desk and the breakfast room. Nice happy hour beer, wine and snacks also. Pool looked inviting but I didn’t have time to try it. There isn’t a bar in the hotel, but plenty of options nearby.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent four days at this Hampton in the heart of Austin. It is perfectly located for events at the convention center, about a five minute walk. The hotel was clean and the staff very accomodating. The evening reception was pleasant with food, wine and beer readily available. There is a balcony where one can eat and drink on the second floor and watch the city walk by. We were particularly impressed when we had a problem with the in-room safe, apparently putting a wrong code so we couldn't re-open it. This was after hours, and the fellow capable of opening it was due to arrive at work at 8am. We were concerned since we had medications in the safe, but at 8:02 the following morning he arrived and opened the safe using a secure code and electronic device, truly excellent service to their clientele. We would definitely stay here again if visiting Austin. Only complaint is that the closet in our room was designed for Barbie clothes, very, very small, so prepare to leave some clothes hanging around the room; not sure if all rooms have such a small closet, but be aware. Otherwise, a fine choice if you want to be in the action while in a secure and pleasant establishment.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You won’t find a better location for a hotel in downtown Austin. It’s next to the river which has miles or walking/jogging trails all around. And near dozens of great restaurants within walking distance. Staff is fantastic. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Fridge in room. Very updated and new rooms and bathrooms. Very quiet. Enjoy the free happy hour between 5-6:30. Loved the bbq and drinks. Thanks Hampton! I will definitely highly recommend this place and hope to be back soon.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and they are very helpful and friendly. A big thanks to Ann on reception who had answers to all our questions and advised accordingly.Complimentary breakfast has a vast spread which is most welcome.
hotelName:
13    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean, the location was great, the staff was friendly, it was great. My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights as a little birthday trip for myself, and we were very satisfied with our room. It was extremely comfortable and if we decide to come back to Austin any time soon, we’ll probably be booking this hotel again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room, larger than expected. Best so far of the dog friendly room I have stayed in. Accessable to all parts of Austin. Friendly staff. Parking was excellent. The hotel was very clean and well maintained.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay. Wish to thank Ashley and Jo for a great visit. Would absolutely stay again. Had an absolutely horrific experience with a car dealership in the area and the staff turned the whole day around. P S stay away from Southwest Kia.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Easy access from major highways and restaurants. Hotel staff were great. Easy check-in/check-out process. Quiet area. Wished the pool was indoor. It was extremely too hot to swim outdoors. Overall, great place.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had just come from another vacation where we stayed and other hotels, this one was super spacious, super pleasant, and overall great experience! Whenever we travel, we will be on the lookout for places like this going forward for sure
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a credit to the Hyatt brand. Nice decor, clean rooms, good breakfast! An easy walk to the Alamo and the wonderful Riverwalk. They were helpful with food recommendations & places to visit. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beds were comfortable and the room was spacious. Breakfast was hot and filling. It wasn't the normal cold boring breakfast. . The customer service was awesome! The person that checked me in was helpful and positive. I had a minor problem with a light and it was fixed quickly and without drama.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a nice place to stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was using a school travel credit card and there was a little hiccup at check-in, but the staff took care of it quickly and capably. The breakfast left some to be desired, but the bed was comfortable. I was a little surprised that, while there was a mini-fridge, there was no microwave in the room. The room was clean and comfortable, though, so I still give the overall stay a four out of five stars.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is super, and the room are quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast was hot cooked food with sausage and bacon( when asked for) and the flavor was delicious. The cost was great for the quality of the staff, they all made us feel like 5 star hotel guests!! Highly recommend this location as a place to stay.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for New year's eve. We liked the location, the surroundings. The breakfast was a self service, but tasteful and has a good variety such as eggs, potatoes, bacon, and so on.The rooms are confortable and clean.My girls loved the beds, and the little living room space.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here. Very clean and quiet with a comfortable bed. Looks recently renovated. Breakfast was excellent. Also offer free bottles of water. Perfect location that is easy to get in and out of. Adjacent to Hwy 183 and Loop 1. Restaurants also adjacent to property.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet and convenient location close to freeway. Friendly staff and clean facility. One of the days housekeeping knocked several times for early servicing of the room. On second day, we left the room early and when we returned to the room at 3 pm, the room was still not serviced. Consistency in housekeeping services would be appreciated.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are clean and well appointed. Staff was great. Breakfast is above average. Free onsite parking. Not downtown, but easy access to highways and fairly short commute. I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am impressed by the breakfast. It includes all the food I need. Milk, meat, egg, fruit, etc. It is so great! It's the best breakfast for me ever!The room is quiet and clean. I did have a good sleep.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My overall stay was excellent! Special thanks to Farrah and Phillip for providing a warm and comfortable stay in my 11 days stay pending my birth of my newest grandson. The overall location was convenient and excellent while visiting my son. The gym was perfect very clean. The morning breakfasts were great and well thought out. Looking forward in my future stays at the Hyatt Place!!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hyatt Place was very clean and comfortable! The staff was very friendly and helpful! About a 10-15 minute drive to Downtown Austin. The location was great, right next to a Dave and Busters, and clean neighborhood! Really enjoyed my stay and will definitely be back!!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I generally like Hyatts and am trying to move more toward them now that Marriott and SPG have spawned Bonvoy... This was my second time at a Hyatt Place. The rooms are as you'd expect of a Hyatt Place. The staff, however, really made the difference by going above and beyond with helping me find coffee in the morning (after breakfast was closed) and hydration/electrolytes at night. I'd stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is super nice but unfortunately this hotel is just in shambles. Some A/C units are being run off a generator, rooms are humid, used condoms in the hallways, rooms are old & not well taken care of, parking is awful, and it isn’t worth your money.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have always had a positive experience at this Hyatt location. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and the location is convenient to shopping, dining and entertainment. The staff provides a nice welcoming atmosphere and we feel at home away from home. I would recommend this location.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast was better than expected. Everything was very clean. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. Location was excellent for us. Surrounded by good restaurants and next to a mall.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel because of affordable prices and safe location. The rooms are in need of updating. Our bathroom tiles were loose, refrigerator did not get cold and our room keys did not work properly for interior or exterior doors even after they were replaced. Bathroom and closet were very small, with no dressers or drawers for our clothes. Several days, housekeeping left dirty rags in our room and we did not have toilet paper. The hotel was a considerable drive to downtown, South Congress and other Austin locations. The advertised "lounge" is several bar stools at the check in counter. Pros were comfortable beds, an awesome breakfast, ample parking and close proximity to Whole Foods. We would choose a different hotel and location for future visits.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wish I could say that our visit was a pleasant one, but unfortunately I was disappointed with the lack of safety in regards to the way the umbrellas were anchored to the tables at the pool. I was hit in the chest with the umbrella from one of those tables, and let me tell you it was painful. The umbrella pole isn’t light and is made with solid wood. I blocked it with my hand and yet it still managed to hit me. The pain was excruciating and the bruising and swelling set in the following day. I called the front desk right after it happened and maintenance came and properly screwed in two of those umbrellas and the third umbrella that didn’t have an anchor, was taken away. Another guest saw what happened to me and as the wind blew she tried to hold down her umbrella but ended up leaving for fear of getting hit. I am not sure if an apology was given, but one of the maintenance workers did later give me a $15 coupon. Which to me, was inadequate. For the price I payed for this two night stay I would expect to have a safe place to rest and play for me and my children.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only spent one night at this location &was very impressed. Beds were great, breakfast was better than any Marriott chain. I will stay here again when coming to visit family. Plenty of restaurants nearby if not there is a restaurant and bar .
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first stay at Hyatt Place. I received hospitality, an excellent and comfortable room, at a reasonable rate. The location is easy to find, close to nice restaurants, and I felt safe in the parking lot and hotel. I will definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stays at a Hyatt Place in two different locations. The staff was friendly and quick on check in Austin. The layout of the rooms works well and breakfast is provided. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location this Hyatt was ideal, as it was far enough away from traffic to be quiet yet close enough to major highways to be convenient. The restaurant and bar offer what I needed after my business day. The staff are AMAZING! Farrah, Jennifer, and Sebastian offered the best service I have seen in 22 years of travel. The room was quiet, clean, and well furnished, with a couch, large TV, and plenty of room to work. I brought along 2 co-workers, and they agreed that this is the place we should stay from now on.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first visit to Austin.Beautiful city.We had never stayed at a Hyatt Place.What a nice surprise.It was in a very lovely area of Austin.Close to everything.Our room was impressive: artwork, layout, & design.Comfortable beds. Staff was welcoming and helpful.My husband commented on this as well, especially the man working the front desk.He was from Milwaukee.We were impressed.We hope to visit Austin again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first visit to a Hyatt Place and we were not disappointed. The hotel is located well of a busy highway (Mopac, Loop 1) and the room was quiet. (Someday hotels will learn how to have doors that don't slam every time someone leaves their room.)I booked this hotel due to its location in the Arboretum area and the price. We planned to visit local breakfast haunts and didn't want to pay for breakfasts we wweren't going to eat. However, we were pleasantly surprised to learn that Hyatt World members actually do get a free breakfast. It was fine even though we only ate there on the last morning of our six-day stay.All in all, a surprisingly good hotel and a great value. We'll be booking other Hyatt Place hotels in the future!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights the first week in April. Room is very big. Has a couch, bar area with coffee machine & mini fridge, small round table, desk, & then 2 queen beds. Closet space is pretty small & there aren’t many drawers for clothes. I didn’t unpack my suitcase so i didn’t use any closet space. Sink is outside of the bathroom. I had never seen that before. As a Hyatt member I was able to get free breakfast. It definitely wasn’t the greatest but it was good. I tried to use the shuttle service but there was never anyone available to drive it which was pretty annoying. The only reason i didn’t give 5 stars is because my room was only cleaned once & i found a bug/cockroach on the sink as i was brushing my teeth! I did let the front desk know & they offered to switch my room, however, i was checking out the next day so i didn’t see a reason.Overall i would stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were very large and clean. Everything worked well, even the drains, which are often slow. Water pressure was great and water was soft. Staff is really nice. However, beds were doubles and really need to be queens at this level. Finally, food was a level higher than Comfort Inn or Holiday Inn but the hot breakfast was not very hot.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service was great! Rooms were stylish, roomy, and immaculately clean and comfy. Heating and air system worked well. The location is great with a shopping center nearby. They have a free parking lot and you don’t have to pay to park your car. What I loved about this Hyatt is their customer service, they were super helpful and had great attitudes. I would rate them very high for customer service. What I liked least was they served Pepsi instead of my favorite Coke products, however, that is just my personal preference and does not take away anything from the company or the rating.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great area. Close to lots of shops & restaurants. I was very happy to find a movie theater very close by. Staff was nice & check in & check out were quick & easy. The only things I did not like are my normal for hotels, the bed was hard & the shower pressure was not strong enough. But I stayed in the King room & there was a very comfortable couch that allowed me to relax & read & not have to sit on the bed or in a hard office type chair. I did not really use any of the services. Breakfast was good & they do offer food 24hr a day, but I did not use this service during my stay. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My experience was all that i expected. Having received a few dinner options turned out to be a pleasant dining experience. Staff was informed and willing to share which was definitely a time saver for those of us who have not visit the city.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was exceptional! The food was awesome. My room was not as clean as I would have liked. Also, the workout room was dirty. I went at 5AM so I am not sure what was up with that. The equipment needed deep cleaning and the treadmill was off balance. I did not use the mats on the floor because they were wadded up instead of rolled up. That indicated to me they probably were not clean. Also, the free weights were rusted. Infection waiting to happen.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were very clean how ever one day they forgot to wash glasses in room. Front desk was very helpful and the breakfast was so good everyday they had something a little different and choices for vegetarian. I would love to come back to Austin and stay again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a good stay at this hotel. Staff was very friendly.It is centrally located in the Arboretum area and close to major highways.Rooms were clean and breakfast good as well. first time i receive an email from the manager inquiring to our stay.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From booking to staying every thing was very nice the room was spacious clean and very thoughtfully and strategically planned good and enough lighting As well. The breakfast selection was the best I have Had so far in hotels in the US Hyatt will now be my first choice to stay
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hospitality, great service!!! I recommend this place to anyone coming in to stay in Austin and to those that want to get away, this is the place!!! Farrah was awesome!!! We need more of her and her beautiful smile!!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beds were comforatable and the evening staff was very friendly. Couldn't get the AC right in the middle of the night... it was either too cold or too hot. The big issue was that the TV wasn't working. The front desk lady came up to help us turn it on (so sweet) but when she left, we still could not get it to connect to any channels. Coffee bar and the morning breakfast needs a little upkeep. Especially when breakfast is not free!! The breakfast fee was definately not worth it.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a business trip and the location was great, the service was wonderful, the breakfast was one of the best I've had. (Get the chocolate cupcake from the front desk. So good!). The room was comfortable and I just really enjoyed my stay here.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night as part of a business trip with three colleagues, so we didn't spend much time in the area. Check in was slow and confusing, and it took three tries to get the person checking us in to understand that all of our rooms needed to be on separate credit cards, not the card used to guarantee the reservation. Room was fine - lots of room and a nice workspace (although the outlet closest to the desk wasn't working - not a big deal). We sat down for drinks after getting back from dinner, and it took 20+ minutes for four of us to be served (after placing our order at the bar). The consensus was that the drinks were not very good = watered down and bland. Breakfast was what you expect at these chains - OK, but nothing special. All four of us had to specifically ask for a copy of the bill when we checked out. I get that the world is trying to go paperless, but sometimes you need that document. Overall, it seems like a good location and perfectly acceptable... but nothing special.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are offering a lot of spam but they need to be renovated. Especially bathrooms. AC is also quite noisy (and since you can't open the windows, you almost have no choice to use it).The staff is very helpful and nice. That's making a big difference in the overall experience.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and comfortable. The front desk was friendly. We didn't run into any problems or need any help during our stay. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was pretty small and cramped, but it worked.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My best friend and I stayed here for a girls weekend. The service and professionalism that we received from Farrah at the front desk is hands down one of the best experiences that I have had in all of my years of travel. She made us feel like we were royalty in staying there. I HIGHLY recommend staying here not just for the excellent staff but the location is wonderful also. Easy to get anywhere that you want to go!!! 5 + stars for the whole experience. I will definitely be back.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like to breakfast, cleanliness of the room, soft pillows. Friendly help desk and fresh real coffee! (I don't like to be given a minimum limit of 200 words!. That was not nice and definitely not the decision of Hyatt Personnel. If you don't like it, don't use it. this is a voluntary time spent. I hope you are happy to ask for more text here!)
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I never fill out these stupid things... I mean it hate them.... this hotel staff... all of them... Are nothing short of AMAZING! If I ever come to north Austin again, I will Never stay anywhere else. Phil who I believe is the greatest thing to his hotel has ever had has been the best business travel I have experienced in 20 years!! Bryan the general manager is out of there this world. Anything and I mean anything that goes wrong if it should happen is their priority! There is no place you should stay in north Austin but here!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a little off the main drag, yet still close to everything. The rooms feel like a small apartment - spacious and quiet. The staff is friendly, bar is convenient for a nightcap, and breakfast was fantastic. There was a selection of items for everyone - eggs, bacon, make-your-own granola, steel-cut oats with all the toppings, fresh juices, almond milk...details count! I'd stay here again!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I were in Austin for a family wedding. I wanted a hotel,that was affordable, close to downtown Austin and to family in north Austin and Hutto. The Hyatt fit the bill. The room was clean and roomy. Breakfast was good. My only complaint was that there were only 3 dresser drawers and the c,onset was on the small side.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff! Good breakfast, clean and comfortable rooms. Accommodated a sports team with seamless check-in, use of conference room Would definitely return to this hotel anytime while visiting Austin.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very comfortable, the service excellent with friendly, professional staff. The layout of the room is excellent with the exceptional counter space quite convenient. Overall, a great stay.The staff was professional and welcoming, always friendly. We were impressed with the great lighting in the room and in the hallways. Breakfast good, room layout great. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our hockey team visits this hotel when we are in Austin. Great customer service, emaculatly clean hotel and rooms, friendly staff and very accomodating to whatever you may need. We will be back soon!!!
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Be prepared to eat all your food if you dine out. There are no microwaves in rooms to heat up left overs. Make sure you check the utensils for cleaness as there were food on several so say clean forks and knives.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff always acknowledges you. The breakfast every morning is the best with lots of choices. The hotel and the room could not get any cleaner than what it already was. There are always different drinks and foods available.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, very friendly staff. Shout out to Farrah for being awesome! Even with a broken ankle and having to get around in crutches, she was incredibly positive and welcoming. Would recommend this to anyone traveling to the Austin area. Made our first trip to Texas a positive one and would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hyatt Place Austin/Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was extremely clean and perfect location. We were about 10 minutes away from downtown perfect location right on 35. Lots of restaurants and things to do around that location. Will be visiting again very soon.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was on the 3rd floor and my air conditioning unit was so noisy that I could not sleep. I am a fairly heavy sleeper in addition to being very tired. Except for the A/C every thing else was nice. I wish I would have recognized the problem with the A/C before laying down.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a Horrible experience with booking made on Airbnb(We had to cancel after we check in), we found this cool place to be an excellent and value for the money. Never believe the pics of Airbnb and better to stay with Hotels like this when you go with families..
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room had smell. Property was extremely old and tv was not working. Carpets were extremely old. I would highly recommend the owner to consider upgrading this property to attract customers. There is other options otherwise
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are excellent, very modern, spacious, and clean. Have your World of Hyatt membership. lined out before you get there or you risk a delay and not getting free breakfast. Newspaper selection was good. Having the WSJ was a treat in addition to the local paper and the usual, boring USA Today. The breakfast was top-notch and plentiful. Some of the staff were rude or lazy. The security guard despite having seen us all check in together repeatedly approached both of my female companions when not with me. He would ask them what room they were in, ask to see their keys, but did not do so when I was with them. And he did this on multiple occasions both nights! They are both very attractive and felt harassed. And the lady working the second night was less them helpful; I told her we were out of clean towels and needed to take a shower. She came back with a towel. I had to ask again for a washcloth, again for hand towel, yet again for shampoo and conditioner and lotion. Then when I asked for a cookie, one of the large ones they sell, she just handed me the cookie, No nbpkin, no plate, no fork, or offer to heat it. I had to ask for each one in turn and hen was given a dismissive point to the microwave, I think I had interrupted her nap in the alcove behind the front desk.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here two days for business travel and enjoyed everything from the great customer service at check-in to the clean comfortable room. The location was off IH-35 which was very accessible to restaurants and my business meeting locations.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The trip overall was great... The breakfast was more than I expected.... I appreciated that Rudy at check offered us the membership... Ill be staying at the Hyatt from now on..... I was very pleased with everything overall
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very nice. I thought the bathroom was a tad bit small though. Maybe invest in an outdoor grill area or two and lounge outside. Was a little annoyed with the biker group that showed up because they blaired their music very loudly at 12 at night. My room was in the front of the building so the music could be heard extremely loud.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room smelled like cigarette. Breakfast ends at 9:30 AM but in realty by 9:30 the kitchen is empty. So good luck if you believe you’ll be getting anything past 9:15 AM. Housekeepingg and front desk do not communicate.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located behind a buffalo wild wings and chili's. Hard to find but quiet. Normal breakfast fare. Food is good but not a lot of selection if on specialized diet. Only major complaint was no anti slop mat or strips in the tub
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
