review_body: What a great stay we had. Great people, attractions and food. Would recommend Austin to my friends. We had a great time. People were so friendly and helpful. Weather was hot but bearable. Thank you Texas!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about the stay was great from check in to the Room to the food. We will definitely be back. Everybody was accommodating. They even started breakfast a bit early for us so our basketball players could eat before their games.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hyatt Place Austin-North Central was a great place to stay. It's right off of the highway and close to a lot of things. The hotel itself was very clean. All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was dirty and the air conditioner had mold in it. It smelled like mildew. The outlets would not hold the plugs so everything kept falling out. The tv remote did not work very well and the picture was so bad you could not tell what was happening.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff so accommodating here. We were in on business, had to ship refrigerated samples ahead of time. They took them, stashed them, managed them, and our call was very successful because of it. Yes the hotel is older, and could use a face lift but it was totally acceptable.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first stay at a Hyatt Place and won’t be our last! Check in was quick and the employee courteous and friendly. Our room was comfortable, clean and spacious, there were 3 of us so we needed the space. The highlight of this hotel was the breakfast! It was not your average free breakfast, the first morning we were offered carnitas, eggs, pork belly bacon, and fried potatoes and sweet potatoes perfectly seasoned. As well as fresh fruit, plain yogurt, various cereals and breads. Very nice! If you need a reasonable hotel in this area of town I highly recommend.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service. Really enjoyed the stay at the Hotel. Always someone there to assist with any questions. Very quiet at nights. I had great sleep without any disruption. Great location for my business trip.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with a friend for a yoga training. I liked that there was extra space in the room since there was a couch area so we weren't on top of each other like most hotels where there are just beds. It was close to the studio which was important. Breakfast was free but the coffee was undrinkable, so we had to go to Starbucks anyway. There were often large trucks taking up several parking spaces in the back at night which was inconvenient and made us feel unsafe to walk so far in the dark. I feel like they should have parked further away instead of taking all of the spaces near the door, but I guess the hotel can't make its guests be considerate. Overall a decent hotel at a decent price close to everything we needed.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My new regular stay! Excellent staff, great food, and always very clean and accommodating. I have stayed at this location 10+ times and I highly recommend it. Rooms are quiet and well insulated from outside noises, and very spacious.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Management is super rude and I would say racist. Just based off the way he looked and talked to me. Very unprofessional manager and staff. Breakfast was terrible and front counter was hard to find. Confusing set-up for sure. Also room had a fowl oder kinda like a wet dog. Definitely want stay here or with this company ever.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room, good location, friendly staff and I would stay again. Forat time I ever stayed in a hotel that all the pillows were not super soft. Also didnt expect to see the old school A.C unit under the window for the cost of the room I thought they would have an upgrade. But overall it was nice.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked out at 3:00PM as a Hyatt Member and was charged for the night. I proceeded to the airport then after four hours on the tarmac my flight was canceled. Thinking already paid for the night would be allowed to stay or provided a credit at another Hyatt hotel. NOPE!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable and quiet. Nice small suite for room. Friendly, helpful staff. Check in and check out easy. Congenial bar tender and pretty good breakfast. Would definitely stay there again. Would also consider other similar Hyatt’s.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed my stay. Staff was friendly and helpful with any questions or concerns. The room was bigger then expected and was very clean. The beds were so comfortable my co-worker asked who they were made by. Breakfast was a great spread with lot's of options. Would staying here again!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located just off the highway but it was quiet. Plenty of free parking. Chain restaurants and some shopping nearby. Just a few minutes to the city. Nice clean rooms and they were a great size. Friendly staff. Just what you would expect from Hyatt.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I checked in I was given a double bed even though I booked a king. Was told the next morning I would get into a king. Then, the next morning I was still not given a King bed, and they don't care. As long as the hotel has your money they won't accommodate the basics of what was paid for. I even talked to the manager. Why book a person if you don't have the hotel available? I booked for 8 nights but I don't think I will be able to stay all 8.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a business trip. My two nights at this hotel suites my needs perfectly. I enjoyed the cocktail hour. The breakfast was very nice and had a great selection of items. The only thing that was not great was that I could hear water from another room as it went down the pipes but it wasn’t too loud. I still recommend this hotel for location, comfort and value.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The woman who checked me in was very rude and judgemental. Claimed to be a manager but had no customer service skills. I’m a 28 very young looking black woman. College graduate... she treated me like I was a child. No respect. I paid $500 for 2 nights and get treated like that. It’s a shame.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pleasant check in, clean, breakfast lacked a bit (no forks and few choices), but overall great value. It was convenient to our destination - great location. I wish beds were larger (full instead of queen), and the tv could not move - so you had issues watching it from both beds. However, room was clean - much of what I expect from a Hyatt.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt place for three nights and it was a terrible experience. As a Hyatt explorerist member it was the worst experience I have ever had at a Hyatt place. When I got to my room it was smelly and there was a black dirt substance on the bed. The air conditioner was blowing out dirt onto the bed. I went to the front desk and asked for a room change and was told that it was not possible. That night I had to sleep on the pull out couch because the dirt was all over the bed and the hotel said mainatnce couldn’t look at it until tomorrow. The next day I asked for a new room and was once again told they were booked. I showed pictures of the dirt on my bed and the front desk said it’s no big deal. I asked them would they like paying $200 a night to have dirt blown on the bed?
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and her 2 kids accompanied me to Austin as I had a two day meeting on UT campus. I've stayed at this hotel twice now. The staff are friendly and professional, the hotel and rooms are clean and comfortable.My sister enjoyed the breakfast, I was not able since I had to be out so early. I wish on Sat yhey would serve breakfast earlier than 7am. But I would stay here again.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is older and a bit shabby, but clean. The staff was very friendly which was nice. The internet was not working at all the first evening and I spent at least 30 minutes on the phone with technical support the second evening to get it up and running. It seems like the problem was reported by several rooms, but i was the one that had to fix it. When a problem is reported by more than one person, hotel staff should take over responsibility for working with technical support.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall the experience is as my expectation, good location and service. But, Breakfast is not as good as I expected.The room serviced good and clean. There is no broken devices and everyone function correctly. The sleep somehow bothered by outside light and curtain cannot completely block it.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights for a family wedding. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, making restaurant suggestions and providing extra room keys when needed. Breakfast was delicious every day. Rooms were large and had the bathroom sink separate from toilet which is nice. My son slept on the pull out sofa bed and was very comfortable. The Coffee in lobby was terrible. Also, there wasn’t coffee and water provided for free in the lobby throughout the day. You had to pay $3.50 if you wanted a bottle of water.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast choices were limited and what was available was not good at all. I had to drive around the interstate twice because I missed the little sign the first time. There was no way to turn back around. They need a larger sign from the road.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Customer satisfaction mean nothing to this hotel management team.I am a Hyatt globalist. Last week, in the overbooked situation, Hotel cancelled our reservation without Even trying to notify us. we were denied check in around 10:30Pm that night. Without further offer to relocating, it left us under great distress trying to find another place to stay at midnight. Upon complaint, Hotel GM emailed back(see screenshot) with her reasonings:1. We do not know your Hyatt status at first2. Even now we know you are a globalist, you are still a general member to us. 3. Let’s do the lengthy math, we calculated a “generous” offer : 10K points for all this inconvenience/extra expenses .After I indicated not completely satisfied with this offer, Guess what, the general manager just completely ignore my email and never bother to reply again.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Were in Austin for heart surgery, excellent place to stay in every way! Very good breakfast, clean comfortable rooms, and wonderful staff. Amanda at the front desk went above and beyond to take care of our special needs, and was helpful with directions to near by groceries exct.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast was great. It is free if you are a Hyatt member, which is free to join, so why not? Clean room, good rate, quite location. Employees very kind and professional. Very happy with this stay.They do have umbrellas up front if you need them. Good location for my needs.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: had a business meeting. nice place with good location. the weather is very nice. good for relaxing. nice time with the staff at the restaurant. the room is nice too. must visit for this place again with family.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was in a ver central spot for my business. I was greeted with a smile. I was also advised to update my Hyatt Gold, which I forgot to do so I could receive breakfast. Even the housekeeping staff welcomed me with a smile.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Running late and running around on daily activities being in the area we stopped by Hyatt Place which we were greeted with a smile. Q and A the gentleman answered everything and provided all information promptly and was considerate on time response. graciously made reservation and with a smile. room, service and parking was on point, seeing we were tired and late... the receptionist extended the warmth and hospitality of the hotel by allowing me to leave my car parked on driveway so i wouldn't go out in the cold. touché Hyatt... touché. she was on FIRE that night!!! i know where ill be staying moving forward in Austin, TX.Thank You Hyatt Place team members
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is always super friendly. I love the location and stay here often so that you are within walking distance of several good restaurants. Breakfast is now only free if you book directly with them effective November 2018. Breakfast is not worth the cost savings you get booking through a 3rd party - so I'd swing through fast food instead. Oh - Wi-Fi is free always as well.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Solid hotel choice and value for the area but note that breakfast is no longer free unless you are a rewards member and book direct with Hyatt. Older hotel but well maintained and clean, simple accommodations.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice spacious hotel room in Austin. We always enjoy staying at Hyatt Place properties on our travels and this one was no exception. The lay out of the room provides extra space to relax during down time or allow a place for family to visit with us in our room. The hotel is conveniently located and provided easy access to local highways. The staff was great and accommodating. Breakfast was delicious. Wonderful value!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The friendliness of the staff and comfort of the room made my stay enjoyable. The Hyatt Place NC provided a stress-free and quiet environment that was much needed. The breakfast choices were excellent.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had our Australian Cattle Dog with us, and were welcomed and greeted with dog cookies! Excellent area to walk our dog. Everything was delightful. Just an excellent experience in every way. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The smell in the lobby was ridiculous. It was a grapey-smokey smell like a high school bathroom where the kids are vaping. It wasn't classy or lovely. Really bothered me! I was also really taken aback by people violating the hotel rules regarding the open carry of firearms. Guys with guns and extra clips should not be in the hotel lobby (especially the way the lobby was organized-people were eating breakfast with small children).
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We make a point to stay here whenever we visit Austin. It's convenient to all local athletic facilities and to UT. The staff welcomes us and even remembers our preferences--I really appreciate this. Plus they serve REAL bacon!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was in a location that was not the best. The room were not clean. I used my own cleaning supply and went through it all in one day. The food st breakfast was not fresh and hot. Housekeeping failed to clean my room!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visit Austin often and every time I visit I stay at this hotel. It is close to downtown and great restaurants nearby. The price is unbeatable and service there is amazing. Room is cleaned very well and they make you feel at home while there. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel room was large and very spacious. Only negative was wish the closet had been larger so that we could have left our open suitcase in it. Very convenient location about 5 miles from downtown. Close to expressway but no road noise heard while sleeping. If you are a light sleeper they do provide ear plugs. Breakfast is free if you are a Hyatt member. Plenty of breakfast items offered and everybody should find something. Great stay!
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hyatt Place is clean and comfortable, with rooms that are surprisingly spacious. The bed, desk and sofa each had its own section of the room, so that I never felt cramped or crowded. My only quibble is that the bathroom light was a bit dim.The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I was there during a citywide problem with the tap water, and the hotel gave out bottled water for free - a big relief at the time.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service was not good and the rooms adequate. Heating and cooling system smelled stall, individual units in each room. Beds are clean, TV didn’t work correctly. Clock didn’t work. Stains on furniture. Asked for hot water at breakfast and it never came.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was ready when I arrived. It was everything I expected. Staff was friendly. There are no microwaves in the rooms. The room was spacious. The grounds were clean and there was plenty of parking.
hotelName:
15    Hyatt Place Austin-North Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My experience staying at this hotel is always top notch. The staff is very accommodating and the rooms are comfortable. I travel quiet a bit and I have found that the Hampton's are the best value and you get so much more than you pay for. The price is the best in town.T Foster
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was incredibly easy to get to. Conveniently off a major access road. Staff was friendly, breakfast was hot and fresh. The entire hotel was so clean. We booked based on reviews and it was well worth the stay and very accurate.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had read good reviews on this Hampton Inn and liked the location, so I decided to try it. I spent four nights here and everything was perfect, from the Front Desk staff to the spacious room to the uncrowded pool/hot tub. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and the lobby was attractive.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are locals who have been displaced from our home for few days. I decided to stay at this location mainly based on price and had low expectations. I was wrong. The hotel is clean, the staff is attentive, and we had a great stay. There is a variety of dining nearby, it is an easy hotel to get to, and is in a quiet location. Unlike most hotels that are adjacent to a highway, this sits off of the major roads. Made the stay even better.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 weeks at this establishment in May and it was perfect. The room is always clean, front desk so friendly and the cookies in the evening is a extra perk. Melinda is so sweet on the evening shift and there is also a guy who works in the morning I forgot his name but he is awesome and one day it was raining and he walked me to my car with an umbrella. Staying here you will not be disappointed!
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 20 minutes away from the University of Texas stadium. The staff was amazing, very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was good, we really enjoyed the waffles.Great clean hotel with an amazing staff. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has exceptional customer service. This is coming from someone who rarely travels. The price could be a bit less but this is just me not needing all the extras they offered. Very clean. Very accomodating. Very everything! :-)
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel a lttle challenging to get to even though just off the highway. No good signage i think because of construction of new hotel right next door. Staff was the most friendly we've encountered. Hotel and rooms very nice and clean. Overall great value! Definitely a place we will go back to when visiting friends in the area.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was Great! Room was clean. Beds were so comfortable. Didn't eat breakfast, but the coffee was amazing! Check in and check out was quick and great service overall. We do plan to stay here o. Our trips to Austin from now on.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a problem with the hot water in room 205. We had to run the water in the shower and the sink for about two minutes to have hot water in the shower. Water at the sink was cold unless we had just taken showers. The staff was very nice about trying to solve this problem but was unable to do so. The view from our window was of the side of another hotel. That said, everything else was excellent -- the breakfast, cleanliness and comfort of the room, etc.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, clean room, nice complimentary breakfast. Only issue we had was the lighting in the room is poor- even with all the lights on, it was very dark in the room. Location was easy to access and room rate was better than other areas of Austin due to spring break and sxsw.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a wonderful experience at the Hampton Inn at Cedar Park in Austin. Everyone who worked at the hotel was incredibly kind and caring. I was here for heart surgery and the hotel became my home away from home. The breakfast was excellent each morning. The room and entire hotel was very clean. Rupal Chaudhari really stood out and I thank her very much for all her help. She couldn’t do enough for us. She was delightful. She gave us excellent choices of restaurants and things to do in the Austin area. Rupal made our visit a very pleasant experience. We will stay here at the Hampton Inn whenever we come back to Austin to visit.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was traveling on Business, I arrived very late, the night audit person was extremely welcoming and I was in my room in no time. The rooms are very clean and nice. All staff that I interacted with was extremely welcoming and Nice.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At this Hampton Inn & Suites, I was able to check in very quickly, and didn't have to wait in line. Very helpful front desk staff, room were very clean and comfortable. It is located near many restaurants.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked in late and Gregory at the front desk was so kind and helpful! Hotel is very clean and close to so many things. Thank you Gregory for being so friendly and pleasant and getting us situated so quickly!
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hampton is a pretty nice place. Like the rest. Usually quite comfortable, nice decor, and friendly staff. We were without any water for 6 hours. Turns out they knew about it but didn’t disclose it. Not good when people are using the same toilette and can’t flush or wash hands. Unfortunately, there was no compensation either. Also, to leave a single evening and night person on to deal with the surprised and unhappy customers is not fair to staff. A manager should of been on staff to help out and take the heat.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quick Trip - Easy Check in - Beautiful Hotel - Wonderful StaffWould definitely book again. Room was awesome,. Front desk staff was knowledgeable. Coffee service was available 24 hours a day. Had a very nice selection of items in their snack shop.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was Great. Very clean and modern. The entrance was set up nice so you could get coffee or tea as you were checking in and or out. The entire place was clean and had everything you would need. The complimentary breakfast was awesome, like have a buffet at a fancy restaurant.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for five nights and it was good! the receptionists were very friendly .rooms are spacious and clean, there’s even an atm machine at the lobby. Free breakfasts were excellent , so many choices than other starred hotels.there were no loud sounds nearby. free coffee, tea and hot chocolate at the lobby 24/7. a walking distance from a nearby commercial center.it was a very good stay
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second visit to this location. Chose it again, because of familiarity and the exceptional service that I received on the first visit. Wasn't able to partake of the complimentary breakfast, as I left in the wee hours of the morning, but everything else about the room and the counter service was fantastic. Will definitely stay at this location again in the future!
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Cedar Park-Lakeline in Austin recently. Have stayed there many times when I visit Austin. As always my stay was very enjoyable. Staff is awesome, breakfast is great. Feels almost like home. Highly recommend it.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff and the rooms were great. Rooms were very clean and bed comfortable. The breakfast bar was clean but the fresh fruit was soured. Eggs were almost like a powdered egg mix. Should have gone with the waffles.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The king suite was clean, inviting and relaxing. The comp breakfast was freshly made and perfect for a complete breakfast. The staff really made our stay wonderful - very accommodating to everything!!
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like this motel because of its proximity to everything Cedar Park area offers. The place is clean, the staff friendly and helpful, and the parking lot is secure. There is something new being built across the drive from the existing building and hopefully this doesn't change things.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 30 days at the Hampton Inn Cedar Park -Lakeline, Texas and enjoyed every day! G. Mgr. Sanjay Chaudhari, has an allstar line up of employees that take pride in wonderful customer care that we received. "First Class Service!" Margaret Greco, very prompt in notifying us of each and every in bound pkg shipment. Housekeeping fantastic, daily breakfast featured, "quality fresh food," NO water down coffee here. Pool & Spa "sparkling and well maintained," by Mike (Engineering). The business center, is well stocked with an abundance of business supplies and very helpful during our 30 day stay. Hotel security, important and TOP Notch here ! We did consider other long term facilities for our summer stay, however Hampton Inn Cedar Park, was our FIRST CHOICE, as we have received wonderful service, from previous stays. Recipients of our "High 5 Award," for wonderful customer service, include Sanjay, Margaret, Melinda, Mike, Rachael, Adel, Tommy, Vickie and the entire Housekeeping Staff.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was clean, with attention to detail and the staff very friendly. The breakfast bar included some items that kept us on our keto eating plan. The location suited us perfectly, being close to family and also easy access to main thoroughfares to get us around town. The only negative was the hot tub, which was not hot - the water was tepid and a child in a swim-diaper was in and out of it, which was quite disgusting.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect place to stay! It is off the main street which made it nice to be away from the traffic noise. The staff were very friendly, the rooms were clean, and breakfast was great! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I purchased the Ultimate Escape. Staff did not know the details of the package. They were nice but did not know about it. Room nicely decorated and clean. Bed was comfortable. Floor damp feeling. Nice bath products. Outdated shower that needs repair. Good breakfast. Cookies and coffee at evening check-in are good. Hotel a little hard to find. Ok visit but they need to work on these few problems.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not a worthy stay .Expected a lot from Hampton inn but they terribly failed in delvering the service I expected from such a reputed hotel. Was completely dissatisfied by the service and price. Not worth paying that much money when the other hotels are offering the same service for a comparatively low price.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy w/ the hotel and the staff. Great breakfast. Very nice rooms. Only complaint was the air flow in the room. One side was very cold and the other side too warm. Other than this it was a great stay.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very clean, well kept, and staff was very friendly. Location was good, there was some construction next door but other than that it was good. Although I did not eat breakfast, I did check it out, it looked better than most hotels.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is close to everything in Austin but tucked into a quiet area north of town. The lobby and room was very clean and quiet. Melanie, who works up front, is the most wonderful staff I’ve ever met. She is always smiling, and makes sure you are happy and enjoying your stay. This hotel is perfect.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room and lobby. Friendly staff. Breakfast was pretty good. Overall this was a nice hotel to stay at. The view from our room was of the new hotel going up next door, but that didn't bother us. We were't in the room during the day anyway.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed at this hotel many times when traveling to Austin. It’s about a 20 min drive from downtown but there are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Newer hotel that is very clean and has a decent free breakfast in the morning.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a typical Hampton Inn as far as the property goes. The woman at check-in was outstanding and the check-n process was very efficient. There was some construction going on behind the hotel, but it did not affect me and I wouldn't hold it against the hotel.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great near Lakeline mall and several places to eat in the Cedar Park area. It does need updating, the shower wall and base were separating, the wall paper and carpet had seen better days but the bed was comfortable and it was typical Hampton Inn amenities.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wasn't planning on waking up to the clanging of earth moving equipment and multiple dump trucks at 7:00 am. Construction was on both sides of the hotel. Guess they are squeezing in new hotels on either side of the Hampton Inn. Yikes! One will overlook a neighborhood full of homes. Great restaurant next door but slipped in the pile of mud blocking the sidewalk under construction on the way there.The construction workers had a good laugh though! Won't be back!
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel sign very difficult to see, A.C. was noisie/ loud , parking was difficult because of construction. Hotel very nice inside, people very friendly that worked there. Room was clean and updated recently furnishing very nice.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its been a while since my last stay at this hotel and the over experience was very good. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is located approximately 5 minutes from Lake Line Mall. The breakfast was okay. However. It was noted that the elevator needed additional cleaning. The landscape needed additional attention. Good location close to 183 freeway.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its been a while since my last stay at this hotel and overall experience was good. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were attentive and friendly. However, the elevator needed cleaning and landscape need additional attention. The breakfast was okay. The hotel is located very close to the Lakeline Mall. The parking lot spaces has been reduce due to construction.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had another great stay at this hotel. We have stayed here multiple times during both business and personal visits to the Austin area. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The rooms are well appointed and the bathroom is very spacious for two people. The King bedding was very comfortable, the TV large, the seating very comfortable and our room included a refrigerator. The staff is customer-oriented and the complimentary buffet breakfast is very good quality offering a diverse selection of choices. For evening dining, there are good establishments very conveniently located, some within easy walking. And there is complimentary coffee in the lobby at all times with a generous supply of newspapers.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location with easy access. Very friendly staff and lots of good places to eat nearby. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Austin. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a good choice.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with the family for a couple of days. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check-in and Check-out was simple and fast. The rooms were quiet and clean with plenty of space. The breakfast was average but served it's purpose on getting us fed.When I return to Austin in the future, I will most likely be staying here again. The location is good and it is just an overall nice hotel.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's rare you get to review a person, but we had do that this time. Melinda at the front desk is just as legendary as we read about. She's in every other review in TripAdvisor. She's very nice and helpful.The next day Margaret helped us with some Neosporin because our baby got a little scratch on the face at Zilker Park. Staff: 5/5Like we said Melinda and Margaret are super awesome and really care about people. Even at 11 p.m. Hotel: 5/5This place has just about everything you need and then some. It was recently renovated and everything is fresh. It is in a nice quiet corner with a private parking lot that's safe. It's reasonably priced and the free breakfast and amenities are great. I stay at a lot of high-end Ritz and Marriotts for work, and I liked this one a lot.Location:Quiet Corner near Lakeline Mall and decent amount of interest in eating. All the hot spots in Austin now have multiple location so you can find some up here. It's also really close to Lake Travis.Breakfast: 5/5Everything from your waffle maker two eggs and yogurt and fresh fruits. They have oatmeal and a lot of items.They also have coffee 24/7 by the front desk.Room: 5/5Our room was a sweet and had a nice sofa and desk area. the TV was pretty good and they got all the channels including HBO one and two and Showtime one and two. The bed was comfortable and I liked the light blanket thing with the texture pattern. The bathroom and shower were good and so was the kitchen fridge sink area. Pretty much everything you need for a quiet getaway.Really nice place if you want to stay in North Austin. Would definitely do it again.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently spent two nights at this hotel while visiting our son and his family who live in the Anderson Mills area. It's a great location for visiting them, but it is a ways away from downtown Austin, if that's what you're wanting to see.The hotel is really nice with a recently renovated lobby area and upgraded rooms. My room was adequate--had everything I needed. The bed wasn't as comfy as I'd hoped, but I was happy with the rest of the accommodations.The front desk people were so wonderful to work with, and although I had gotten a really fantastic rate, they were able to cancel one night for me without penalty so that I was able to stay closer to the airport in an ice storm before I left.The free breakfast was very good as far as those go and I loved the atmosphere in the breakfast area. My room was lovely, and the bathroom was quite spacious. I will definitely stay here again when I'm visiting family.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent property. Had never stayed at a Hampton property before. Used my AAA number and received a discount. The value is unbelievable with the above average complimentary breakfast!.....
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this Hampton Inn twice and have been impressed each time. It is a good value in a quiet location in a very busy northwest Austin area. Check-in was quick, the front desk personnel were always friendly and very helpful, the rooms were nice, and the WiFi was reliable during our entire stay. The complimentary breakfast was consistently good and the breakfast area was always neat and clean.We would not hesitate to visit again.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went for a birthday party and dinner. The food was great and the service was awesome. Consistently good food and reasonably priced. The atmosphere is light and we all had a nice evening. Yes Haw!! Yew Haw!!!
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location for my trip and in close proximity (walking distance) to a decent restaurant for a meal. Overall satisfied with the room and the usual Hampton amenities. Definitely a good value for the price and the people were very nice.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ‪Warning to all visiting Austin, TX. Do not stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites Cedar Park Lakeline @10811 Pecan Park Blvd. 78750. Horrible experience there! Still dealing with problems and cannot get the manager; full week of calling several times. #Hilton #hamptoninn&suites1. Mattresses hard as a rock2. Run horribly with virtually no customer service. 3. Left my medication in the room and have been trying for a full week to have them mail it to me. I got a call from a man, that was not with Hampton or Hilton that couldn't speak English very well, and wanted $50 to mail it to me! $10 trip charge, $35 shipping cost plus tax on all. Sanjay is the manager at this location and I'm assuming this person is a relative trying to make a buck on a $5.00 regular mail package. I don't understand why this Hilton property could not put the pill case in an envelope and mail it. No return calls! I will NEVER stay at this location again and as a Hilton Diamond member am seriously reconsidering Hilton Hotels in general.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this hotel for the AARP rate and location. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast was quite good. We had a king studio suite which was quite spacious with a sofa, kitchen sink/counter, microwave, and fridge.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was great for our trip to Austin since most of our events were a bit North, but close enough to get downtown. The check in was done online with just a quick stop at the front desk for our key cards. We can not say enough of Melinda who was a wealth of information, kind, and very friendly. The remaining staff that we interacted with equally friendly and helpful but not quite Melinda. The property was clean and quiet with large rooms. The breakfast had plenty of protein and hot items unlike some of the "Other" free breakfasts. Close to freeways with out the traffic and noise. Will stay again next trip. There are laundry facilities within the hotel.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We go to Austin often to visit our son and his family; they have a cat and we're allergic to cats, so we stay in a hotel. The closest one is the Hampton Inn on Pecan Park Blvd. Sometimes there are no vacancies and we have to stay elsewhere, in equally nice places and some even less expensive, but none are so conveniently located. It's reasonably priced, very comfortable and clean, and the staff is terrific; it's always our first choice.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There were not enough towels provided. The staff were very polite and professional. They are building another property so maybe this one is a little dated. The sink would be better if it were located out of the toilet and shower area. The restroom should have a nightlight.
hotelName:
16    Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Cedar Park - Lakeline
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The photos do a great job showing the property. It is a funky & eclectic property that is prefect for lazy days when you want to unwind and relax. The entire outdoor area was a great touch. The pool & deck were great for cooling off as well as doing a bit of yoga.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 nights in the garden room. It was a pretty private stay although we could hear people through the door that a-joined our room to what we think could have been a kitchen. House keeping everyday was great, they would refill the pastries, coffee juice, etc... The bed was big, but an extremely firm mattress, which was tough on the hips and shoulders. We didn’t have a view from where we stayed, but as soon as you drive out of the trees, the views were spectacular. Overall we had a great stay but would probably try choosing another room if we returned.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I live in Austin and my best friend came to visit for a girl's weekend. We LOVED our stay at Casa del Sol! Everything was so special. From the morning breakfast pastries (which they accommodated my gluten free request) to the organic orange juice, yogurt & granola! And the gluten free pastries weren't stale, out of a box junk you wouldn't buy for yourself. No, they were the most luscious raspberry almond giant muffins! All of the attention to detail, like our welcome sticky note on the door, little chandeliers hanging throughout the property, sitting areas, floating water fountain in the pool, and lots of bug spray options both deet and deet-free, really showed how much love & thoughtfulness the property owners had put into this beautiful place. I would stay here again in a heart beat. We loved the Golden Sun Casita.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: About half an hour more or less depending on traffic from South Congress Street in Austin and about 15 minutes to Lake Travis. Quiet, great pool and hot tub, lovely foliage and outside places to sit. Very relaxing as others have said. Only 5 units so did not see other people much. We had the pool and hot tub to ourselves. Organic orange juice and homemade delicious yogurt in our fridge as well as pastries, milk, fruit, and granola and good coffee. I hope to return!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great, and relaxing weekend at the Casa del Sol and would highly recommend it. I’ll probably be back, next time I’m in the area! It was close to where my family was gathering for the weekend. The weather was rainy but the room was cozy and beautiful, the view was great.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the peace and quiet...the sound of the birds singing in the morning... especially on a nice walk or run around the neighborhood. You can cool off in the afternoon in a nice clean swimming pool. We stayed in the cute Armadillo trailer, small but cozy and comfortable..The wonderful inn keepers provide the perfect getaway.. highly recommend for those wanting to get away from it all... just far enough away from busy Austin.. but many fine things to do and places to eat in and around the area... Will be back!!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying in the quaint and cozy little airstream.The gardens surrounding the airstream were beautiful which included woods all around, a swimming pool and a small view of the lake. The hospitality was amazing. Loved the fresh baked goodies for breakfast. Would love to stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found this gem on Trip Advisor and booked the Moonlight suite. A second couple decided to join us and then a third,who due to late booking ended up in The Airstream. All 3 suites were impeccably decorated and maintained. The views amazing, the beds so comfortable, the coffee and pastries decadent. The surrounding area offers so many fun outings. The hosts are friendly and accommodating but not in your face. We all highly recommend!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights in the Sunshine (king) room. The room was nicely furnished with very comfortable bed, good shower, stocked fridge/kitchen, good wifi and cable TV -perfect in all regards.. The property was serene with lots of wooded privacy, partial lake view, deck with hot tub, ample parking, and a very nice pool. Breakfast was good and provided in the room (fresh baked items and fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee) Service was excellent without being intrusive and the owner was welcoming, informative, and a cheerful joy. We would definitely recommend Casa del Sol and stay here again when in the Lake Travis area.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the sun cottage and really loved it. We toured all the rooms and all of the rooms would be nice but we think the cottage was the best. This property is quiet and peaceful and has a terrific view of Travis Lake. There's lot of sitting areas around the pool and outside the cottage.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed at 'fancier' places at Lake Travis, but never one more beautiful. Cata has created a perfect little getaway at Casa del Sol. This place is an irresistible moment of Zen. Exactly what we needed. Thanks! We'll be back
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time staying at a bnb, so we weren’t sure what to expect but everything was perfect! The ambiance, location, room, everything was great! We fell in love with the beautiful and peaceful scenery there. We didn’t want to leave. Will definitely be going back soon!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: View was nice. TV didn't work. It's nice to have real plants, but clean the dirt around them.Jacuzzi was filled with leaves and the water was green.No key or key code given, leaving my possessions at risk
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying in the Armadillo airstream this past weekend and my only regret is that we couldn't stay longer. The little trailer is straight out of a Pinterest dream and the accompanying pastries and roses waiting for us, solidified our joy. The little details found all over the property truly made this b&b a treasure and you can tell that the owners have put their heart and soul into making Casa Del Sol special. We have already told multiple friends who plan on staying here and we are planning on our return trip when it gets warmer so we can enjoy the beautiful pool and try another one of the rooms (although it's going to be hard to top the Armadillo).If you have any hesitation about the idea of staying in a trailer (like my husband initially did)....please don't think twice! You wont be sorry!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Casa del Sol is my favorite getaway and the best kept secret in Texas. It's hard to describe how special the vibe is -- peaceful but not boring, friendly but not intrusive, and just very, very chill. I've stayed there four times, once with my husband and three times by myself, and my husband has also been back by himself for a little solo vacay (well truthfully, he went with our dog--they're very close ;). I love all the rooms, each one is unique and charming without being kitschy, and stocked with everything you need to kick back and relax. My new favorite is the Armadillo, a little airstream that is just snug for one person and a perfect spot to get some reading or writing done. And the gorgeous private deck overlooking the lake with pool and hot tub is just a spectacular place to hang out. It's also very convenient--good restaurants and groceries minutes away, nearby trails to hike, and all the delights of Austin within a 20 minute drive. In short, when we need to get away--this is where we go.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One word: mold. I tried to wipe up the floor after a shower (in a stall about the size of an RV shower) & got black mold from the baseboards. There were things that needed to be fixed, like the shower drain, that kept falling off as we used them. Only 1 burner on the stovetop worked. There were see-through curtains on the the windows in a courtyard that other guests walked right by--nowhere near private enough for us on our honeymoon. Ths location is beautiful. ..if you can see past the room itself.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first solo vacation in 7 years after the sudden passing of my husband. The original B&B I booked cancelled my reservation after going on the market for sale. I started looking on Google and came across Casa del Sol. It looked nice so I took the plunge. Sometimes a higher power is leading you to where you should be. The Lavender suite is soooo beautiful. The property ambiance is truly magical and it's the most peaceful place ever. The special touches such as organic fruit, juice, & dairy, plus homemade granola and pastries are just wonderful! I loved it so much, that I extended my stay a few extra days. I'm coming back for sure!!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited for our anniversary and had an amazing time. We had an in room massage from Jamie that was so relaxing. The lavender suite has a living area large enough to set up the couples massage. The rooms feel private enough to enjoy romantic time together. We hope to make this a regular visit! We loved our time here.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The little details are what make this place great! From the nice soaps in the bathroom to the organic orange juice on the continental breakfast, great care has been given to making your stay comfortable and enjoyable. The grounds were lovely and the hot tub was fantastic! Pet friendly, which was a bonus. The neighborhood was quiet and allowed for dog walks. Gorgeous view from the balcony by the pool. There's a hammock on the porch, as well as rocking chairs to relax in. The lovely chandeliers that adorned the grounds added an eclectic artistic touch. Great place to stay if you're going to be out and about in Austin and the surrounding areas. Lots to do, and this retreat is the perfect place to come back to after a full day. Don't skip the pastries at breakfast. They're worth the extra cardio!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love, love, loved the Casa del Sol. I stayed in the Lavender room. It was beautiful, comfortable and very clean. The breakfast was delicious. The owners thought of everything. They even provided real half and half instead of that powdered stuff you get at most hotels. Next time I visit my grandchildren, I’ll be back.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quaint and lovely with touches such as delicious pastries, delicious coffee and lovely soaps etc. comfortable and clean. Beautiful pool and landscaping. Great location. Combine with a visit to nearby Oasis on Lake Travis. Relaxing and wonderful weekend.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place was amazing and the staff was very friendly! I would definitely come back to stay in some of the other rooms! We stayed in the moonlight suite with the private hot tub and it was fantastic. I highly recommend!!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made the mistake of reserving a room through Hotels.comBecause of that, and due to making a last minute reservation (nearly all rooms booked), I ended up being assigned to the 'overflow' space a vintage Aero-Stream camper out back of the property. The website (Hotels.com) does not make any attempt to inform the buyer of the situation. All the images presented at the time of making a reservation were the beautiful sites and views of the main property. I think Casa Del Sol is a great B&B - hopefully some day I might get to experience the real deal! I highly recommend Casa del Sol! I highly recommend not using Hotels.com
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable, clean, relaxing and beautiful! Great location near Lake Travis. Very private, kind hosts, lovely private outdoor sitting area and beautiful pool common area. Highly recommend for couples. Perfect continental breakfast. Everything you need.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great getaway for our anniversary. The room was cozy and private. The pool and hot tub were beautiful and a relaxing way to spend an afternoon. Good restaurants are near by. Only complaint was that there was not really enough road to get in a good walk or run.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very small quiet place. Nice pool. Comfy bed. Only 1 bedroom you walk into & then a very small side room with a small country and a pantry. Continental breakfast was low budget but great granola. Small bathroom. But peaceful. Not much to do but sleep and chill...
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great place to just get away and relax. A Clean, quiet bed and breakfast with a beautiful view of Lake Travis. Wonderful to wake up hearing the birds singing as the sun comes up over the lake. I so much enjoyed a fresh hot cup of coffee sitting by the pool every morning. The inn keepers do a fantastic job of meeting any needs you have. They have a nice continental breakfast for you every day, fresh juice and fruit, and a delicious assortment of sweets. You are in the great town of Lakeway which has many great restaurants and places of interest. There are numerous parks within a short driving distance. The housekeepers do a fantastic job of freshening up your room everyday. Definitely worth the trip!!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely LOVED it. Everything was perfect and felt like we were the only two people around for miles. The room was amazing and just felt like home. I will for sure be making a trip back as soon as I can
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed every bit of this trip ! Our room was so relaxing, we had a beautiful view ! We enjoyed the hot tub and swimming pool ! I definitely recommend it here ! Already planning for our next stay !
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved everything about this place and I’m ready to go back soon. I live in Austin and would go here for a “Staycation”. It’s amazing how well they have decorated everything and you feel like you are surrounded by vegetation!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I haven't had a kid-free getaway in years. Case del Sol was perfect for us...nature lovers who don't want to completely rough it. And on a budget! We stayed in the little airstream trailer. It was comfortable, had a lovely porch to sit on and we spent at least half of our time in the pool. Wonderfully relaxing, the hosts are lovely and we will definitely come back the next time my mom can watch our kids!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on a Saturday night after being on Lake Travis all day. It was perfect. Gatti's Pizza was just down the street too! I would definitely recommend and also return to this bed and breakfast. We loved the pastries left for us on the counter.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful place the owners didn’t get unset when I vomited red wine on their white bed comforter. Didn’t get an extra charge for that or being a little late checking out. Breakfast was ok but the owners treated us like royalty. 10 plus because they treated us very well. If you needed anything they would help get it right away. Loved the pool and hot tub. It was quiet and very much a home feeling.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Airstream. We could not have asked for anything more. Unfortunately we only had a one night to stay but in October we will be back for a 4 day Expo. We will book real soon. Great view, Wonderful hosts in Cata and Doug and the pool and Hot Tub were a real hit for us. And the price so low for all this entire facility entails is unbelievable. We will be back again and again! Dan & Sheila
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed overnight for a short weekend getaway. The place is really quaint and very cute! We stayed in the moonlight sweet. It’s adjacent to the owners house but we had total privacy. The bed is comfortable. Kitchenette has all you need! The view of the lake is great and you can lay in bed and see everything! The best part was the private hot tub! It was a chilly 35-40 degrees when we stayed and having the hot tub was great. Very relaxing and the scenery is nice. We loved staying here and can’t wait to come back for a longer stay!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My significant other and I booked a trip to Austin and were researching where to stay. We found this in our research and she saw the Armadillo - an airstream trailor - and got really excited. I’m a bit of a hotel snob and wasn’t on board with it, but in her excitement, I booked it anyway and am glad I did. It was a unique experience which we greatly enjoyed.I got a call a couple weeks before from them confirming that I knew I booked an airstream trailor. I confirmed.We arrived to find a brilliantly renovated little trailor turned into a quaint hotel room. It was clean, well maintained, and well kept. It had a lot of cleverly placed storage with a mini kitchen and tiny bathroom. It has a large deck with seating for plenty of space to relax. We had access to a hot tub in their pool area and that was a wonderful part of our experience. It was too cold to access the pool.Breakfast is daily fresh pastries and fruits. It was plenty for the two of us. Some things to consider:- The bathroom is small with a tiny shower. There is only a curtain separating the bathroom from the rest.- Heat is provided through space heaters. The space heaters were plenty good for us.- You are in what seems like the hills and far from everything, but you are really a short drive from just about everything.If you are open minded and looking for a unique rustic experience, I would highly recommend. If you are looking for luxury and space, find somewhere else and prepare to pay a bunch for it.We loved it and would not hesitate to do it again.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is said that you shouldn't judge a book by its cover; well that also applies here. Casa del Sol has a beautiful website, with appealing images and well-written text. The reality is much more funky and ready for some freshening up. No amount of knick knacks and wall hangings can cover up the need for a coat of paint. Speaking of wall hangings: We stayed in the Golden Sun Cottage. Very comfortable bed and quiet surroundings made for a great sleep. But waking up to the diagonal array of three crosses on the wall next to the door was a bit weird. I am not a Christian, but the crosses did not really offend me. But I found the choice to put them there an odd one for the innkeeper to make, considering that it could be offensive to many guests. Then we entered the kitchenette to prep breakfast (a very nice selection of pastries, fruit, etc.) to see, not one, but two images of the Virgin Mary on the wall! If the intention is to provide lodging for Christian guests, that should be made clear on the website.It was also odd to have no face-to-face contact with either innkeeper (except once by phone and once via handwritten note!) through our 4-day stay. In fact the place was deserted for the first few days with no other guests.That phone call, placed upon arrival, questioned the fact that we were told when booking that they are within 20 minutes of downtown. In reality, we never made it to most sites in the city in less than 35-40 minutes. Not as convenient as we hoped.The note made a specific request for a breakfast item and it was provided promptly. But, speaking of breakfast, I believe there needs to be some rules as to what constitutes a B&B. I've stayed at many B&Bs and the range of breakfasts provided is very wide: from gourmet 3-course meals to crappy, cold pastry and cereal. Case del Sol provides an excellent continental breakfast, with quality items, and plenty of it. But is that really a B&B? Maybe. But, where's the line?As I've said throughout, on most counts Casa del Sol was a good experience. Comfortable and quiet. High-quality continental breakfast. But, although the location in Lake Travis is itself very nice, it is not convenient to downtown Austin. And it's way funkier than the website might convey!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the airstream Tiny trailer. I have always wanted to try a tiny home. This one was fabulous! beautiful decor. Refrigerator stocked with items for a continental breakfast.large clean built in pool and hot tub on the grounds. Pretty white lighting at night all outside. If you prefer a larger room, the others looked just as nice! Spacious with outdoor seating, and fire pits! secluded yet close to the attractions in the area! The Innkeeper is especially kind and helpful! loved our stay!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Moonlight for 3 nights. Everything was, fantastic. The views of the lake are great. Doug and Cata are very nice and accommodating. Casa del Sol is tucked away off on a small side road but it's close to everything. We had a wonderful time and highly recommend a stay here.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to Austin for work 1-2x per month and have made Casa del Sol my go-to every time I come. Nothing is worse than staying at a stale hotel that magnifies that you aren't home and Casa del Sol is the opposite of that.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved everything about this place. Very serene, watching the sunrise over the lake was spectacular , my roomHad a private jacuzzi, that was nice, I also loved the pool area. Very close to lots of things to do. I will surely be back!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the moonlight room. Amazing! owner thought of everything. pool was awesome. We had a private hot tub off our baclony which overlooked lake travis. this was a super romantic weekend, candles everywhere! Breakfast left in your room which i enjoyed because you could eat at your oun pace. we will pass the word on this hidden gem!!!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived, we had the most wonderful stay at in the Moonlight Suite at Casa del Sol. The carpet was plush, the room was beautifully decorated, and the kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed. The hot tub was lovely and we enjoying watching the fireflies as we relaxed in the evening. We highly recommend staying here if you're in Austin and are looking for a quite romantic getaway!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fabulous bed and breakfast. The owners were so kind and casual. We loved eating a quiet breakfast (provided in the room) and dining out on the picnic table at night. The linens and little details were lovely.A drive into downtown Austin is about 25 minutes.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I absolutely loved the moonlight suite! It was the perfect getaway for us as we just got married the night before! Casa del Sol was our minimoon and we could not have been more thrilled to find such a great place to relax. Will be back!It is clear that Doug & Cata care a great deal about what they have created and the experiences that people have during their stay. All the little details provided were noticed and well appreciated!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our favorite place in Austin. It is very romantic and peaceful. We love the owners and the ambiance. The views are gorgeous and it close to a lot of neat places. Every room offers something new and unique. Casa del Sol is a little piece of heaven on Earth
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is absolutely perfect. We visited for Valentines Day and the room was charming and beautifully decorated with exclusive detail and character. The deck over looking lake Travis was absolutely stunning. Hot tub was a treat in itself, secluded in the woods. Nice sitting/eating area outside to enjoy a meal or cup of coffee. It has everything you need in it. And the breakfast with fresh milk was a bonus. This place is a gem and I cannot wait to go back!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for the F1 race weekend.It was such a relaxing place.The owners were very helpful. They even did a small load of laundry for free!!!The view was great and we had a private hot tub.Its a perfect place to relax and be near Austin.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Casa Del Sol's Moonlight Suite was a perfect location for our quick trip to Austin. The room was inviting and comfortable. Spectacular views from the spacious and peaceful balcony deck were enjoyed with a glass of wine in the evening and a cup of coffee in the morning. The forethought of details included in the room accommodated all our needs. We had a fantastic time and hope to come back with our entire family for a Hill Country trip and book each suite!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Moonlight Suite over the long 4th of July weekend. This room has the best views of the lake, (even from the bed). An extensive balcony with loungers and chairs, and a nice private hot tub at the bottom of the stairs which we enjoyed each morning. A shared pool is down a path from the suite, where the other rooms are located. Cata and Doug are very nice hosts. We had a very relaxing stay.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this bed and breakfast while looking for places on the lake. We loved the pictures but they did not do it justice. What a great place to relax. Although it is in a neighborhood it is very private. My wife was here for business but I got a chance to relax. The management did a great job of taking care of us. We will go back. I may just spend all of my time at the pool and hot tub.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here numerous times in several of the suites & the ambiance is a force to be reckoned with. The pictures don't do this place justice, it is breath-takingly beautiful. Cata & Doug are sweet, fun & kind hearted. These two know Austin & can recommend some of the neatest places to see. I highly recommend this place & I promise you will not regret giving it a try!
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this place randomly thru Trip Advisor based on the dates we entered and feel so fortunate we stumbled upon it. We have stayed at many Bed & Breakfasts and this one tops our list! We liked the fact that we could socialize with the other guests poolside and then escape to our own private deck if we chose to. The evenings were especially nice with the lighting that was placed here and there on the trees and throughout the grounds. We threw some steaks on the grill then had dinner outside at a table just a few steps away that had a cute-as-can-be rustic chandelier hanging from a tree just above. That and a few glasses of wine, it couldn't have been more romantic! Loved our room, our bed...We absolutely loved this place~
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did not want to leave. Beautiful living area, fireplace, set rt out to hot tub, romantic, comfortable bed, decorated just beautiful perfect for a couple, and plan to spend time on grounds, use the grill, relax..must return! Only regret is we only booked one night in Lavendar room.
hotelName:
17    Casa del Sol Bed and Breakfast at Lake Travis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have only praise for this hotel. The staff were anxious to please and very friendly. Breakfast was plentiful with a lot of good, varied options. The sofa bed in our suite was very large. There was plenty of lighting; interestingly it was all by room lamps rather than ceiling lights. Spacious bathroom. Fair price. Liked being on the first floor.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were extremely friendly and the room was fairly updated and clean. It was a comfortable stay. The free breakfast was also surprisingly good and varied. I would definitely recommend as a good value.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Austin for a wedding and a number of the guests were staying here. It is right on IH 35 and very handy for getting around Austin by car. Clean, spacious rooms. Good, friendly service. Very good morning breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff are very friendly, and that’s a good thing, because the place has little else going for it. It’s an old property in need of a makeover. You’re going to be elated or nauseated when you arrive. Fox News is on the big TV in the lobby. Lord help you if you ask to change it. I don’t know why they just can’t have something else besides cable “news” playing. Customers will be very polarized. Interstate 35 is 200 yards away, and the noise was unbearable from my original room. If you HAVE to stay here, ask for a lower-numbered room (x19 or lower) to be farther away from the din. Note that rooms x22 and x24 are in between the two elevators, so avoid those as well. I will not be back.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying at the SpringHill Suites was a pleasant experience. We got checked in fairly quickly, although we got 2 queens instead of 1 king. That meant we had very little space in this room for our opened suitcases and they ended up in the kitchen and under the desk. The hotel was a bit noisy because of the constant traffic on the IH-35. Speaking of which, it's a very short drive from the parking lot to the freeway and that proved quite a challenge since you have to cross 3 lanes on a busy frontage road. The 2 beds we got were comfortable, we had 2 extra pillows on each bed. The shower was hot and powerful. The toilet seat on the other hand was too loose and we reported that when we left. Breakfast in the lobby was more than adequate and the staff was very friendly during our stay. So we mostly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
