review_body: Just outside of downtown, a short UBER ride are way. Terrific staff in convenient location. Has the basics of complimentary breakfast, small gym and WiFi. Clean and comfortable. Air conditioning is amazing!!
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Good: Smooth check-in, comfortable bed, coffee service but no tea bags in room, decent towels, excellent shower and water pressure.The Bad: No vent in bathroom (I hate steamed up mirrors), several loose corner wall moldings that need maintenance. Mushy pillows.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very impressed with how large the rooms were and what a great night of sleep. Doesn't always happen at other hotels. The free breakfast is more than just typical. Super friendly! The elevators were a little slow but that's why they created stairs :)
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off, the positive....the breakfast was quite good and nicely stocked. The young lady who takes care of it does an excellent job. The areas were kept very clean and she was a delight. The rooms appeared clean and the beds were comfortable. I wish I could say the same about our room, overall. We booked a king and were given two doubles (not queens). We were not even told about this and didn’t know it until we arrived in our room. When we trudged back downstairs with all our belongings, we were told they were overbooked and a King was not available. We also were not happy that our room was RIGHT by the elevator but this really was not an issue at all and the elevator noise didn’t bother us. The trudging back downstairs was an issue as the elevator button for the third floor didn’t work. They did get it fixed the next day and I understand things break but this wasn’t the only issue. (Also, the elevators were pretty dirty and slow.) The ice machine on our floor didn’t work so we had to go to the first floor for ice. This was not fixed. Nor was the air conditioner/heater in our room. It took forever to heat the room and once it came on, it never shut off automatically. So we were either too hot or too cold. Speaking of too hot, weirdly, we had no cold water at either of our sinks. It took a while for the water to ever warm up but, once it did, it was burning hot and there was no way to adjust it down. I mean, NOTHING came out when the faucets were turned all the way to the right. We mentioned these issues on our way out for the day and was assured they would be addressed. They were not, nor were we ever contacted. I’m not even sure if anyone came to our room to check them out. If they had, they would have noticed the room was not made up, even though we were out of the room by 10 am. And no, we didn’t hang the be green notice on the door (but did hang up our towels to be reused the next day ). Also, the refrigerator did not seem very cold but we didn’t really use it all that much. We did receive an apology from the desk clerk when checking out but it did not seem like he really cared all that much. We travel a lot and understand things happen but this was a pretty long list. And we really expected more from the Marriott name.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just tried to alter travel arrangements we made for one of our consultants at your Austin location, and instead of helping me, the woman manning the reservations desk at your location just hung up on me. No attempt to help at all. Just hung up. I wasn't being combative or rude or anything of the sort. I am so confused by this treatment.I will update this review if / when this unfortunate issue has been dealt with. If you're reading this, you'll know they chose to ignore it.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived after a late drive from Houston on Friday and was greeted Michael and Ceptember. Both were truly exemplary in their service and informative! Over the course of the trip, Michael remembered us by name, offered recommendations and went the extra mile until he became a household name for the 4 room block we booked. The room was without flaw and all requests were met timely. Breakfast pretty good and remained stocked well with freshly prepared food. Great rates, great location ($10 Uber into downtown) and for the service we received, we would strongly recommend choosing this hotel.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL BRANCH! The Hotel housekeepers went into our room and ROBBED US while we were on vacation!! My wireless charger and my wife's Macbook Air laptop worth $1,700 were stolen.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Miss D and Tony the bartender were the best experience at any hotel we've stayed at. Polite and knowledgeable. Words cant explain how wonderful they were. Clean place and wonderful amenities.Housekeeping staff were very helpful too. WIll be coming back in the future.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here to be close to the airport for our morning flight. We had a suite, which was nice. The hotel was fine, but we could hear the freeway noise. Breakfast was good and since we went earlier it wasn't too crowded. Not too far from the Capital and many restaurants.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed this weekend. When we arrived there was hair in the bed. Not a big deal. The front desk manager assured me it would be changed while we were headed out for the evening. When we returned, the bed was made and there was a note with an apology.What she didn’t know was that there was also pink makeup on the sheet closer to the foot of the bed. Well it was still there. Our sheets were never changed, I’m guessing she picked the hair off.. I called and she came back up to our room. She stated she had inspected the room but the cleaning lady must have been ready to go home. So are the sheets from the prior guest even being removed or do they just make the bed if the sheets look clean. I find this deceptive and disgusting...
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent place to stay that is located close to downtown but not nearly as expensive. Hotel and rooms are recently updated (I stayed on the 4th floor) and it was clean and well maintained. Staff was professional and courteous. Breakfast was good and plenty of room to sit. A full service Marriott is across the parking lot for full meals and lounge. 6 miles (15min drive) from airport. Good for business, good for a family stay-indoor pool!
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in without any problems. Put our stuff down, went to eat. Came back to hotel and overheard a customer talking to front desk complaining about bugs in bed. She showed us the bite on her leg. Looked more like a welt. Immediately went up to room, checked the bed, saw at minimum 10 bugs (we stopped looking-they were everywhere). Grabbed our stuff and left. I give it one star simply because the front desk staff was very friendly and did his best to take care of us. We were not offered a refund (sad), but we were put up in another Marriott hotel. We do have video if management desires to see it. Horrible experience.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, quiet room, comfy bed...couldn’t ask for more! Would definitely stay there again. They offer free breakfast and are close to South Congress and downtown. Right off I-35. Room had fridge and microwave.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable room and public areas. Good coffee and breakfast. Staff was one of the better I have encountered. Easy to get in and out of and there is Dining at the adjacent Marriott. Centrally located to downtown Austin.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only negative point was the lack of the ability to use the room TV as a second screen for a laptop. The location of the TV makes this impossible. The older suite décor used to have a TV on a podium on wheels which could be pivoted.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the room online with Amex and paid for it in advance. I got there, and Next dey evening I saw a charge for a room on my card I called and asked them hey why are there charges on my card? They had already charged me online. She said oh no that would come off it's just a hold. One week later I called And said this is a charge will you refund it please they said we will after having a long conversation. Well, 2 months later after 3 more times calling talking to the manager NAME TAYLOR ( he kept me on the phone for 45 minutes on hold on March 9th, 2018 ) Still there is no refund. I am disappointed with their service. Congratulations to the management and good luck with Amex dispute.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Austin South Springhill Suites. Now that I am retired I have high expectations as I spend my own money vs. my companies money on lodging. This hotel exceeded my expectations with their excellent service and hospitality. Our check in was handled by Foteini who was very friendly and hospitable. She did well to recognize my status as a Gold Member of Marriott Rewards and thanked me for my loyalty to Marriott. She found a commonality for conversation and building of rapport during our check in, she used our name 3 times during the check in. She explained the amenities of the hotel including the times of the breakfast. The front desk was always very friendly and greeted us every time we entered the hotel as well as departed using our name numerous times. Another associate at the desk that we would like to recognize for her hospitality is Hannah. Our guest room was spotless clean and everything was in working order. The bed was comfortable and the linens crisp. Wifi worked great in both our room and in the lobby.Kinja was our room attendant and although we never met her she kept the room clean. The breakfast buffet was pretty much Springhill standard. We were dissappointed that they ran out of bananas a couple of times during our 4 day stay. The buffet attendants worked hard to keep the buffet stocked with supplies and replenishing food. When engaged they smiled and carried on a conversation with you while restocking. 4 miles to Congress Avenue makes this a convenient short hop to Austin city as well as only 8 miles to the Airport. The hotel is next to a full service Marriott where you can enjoy a drink at the bar and sign it to your hotel room.My only complaint is that they no longer have any copies of the USA Today for guests. For me I just walked over to the Marriott and grabbed a copy for my persual. All in all, a great stay and we can highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Washer machines are not worth being free. Bleach must of been in the system not present to the eye our clothes were ruined. Beds we lumpy and uncomfortable. Hotel was 4 star rated it expected a little more
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I work for a hotel front desk so I know what to expect when arriving upon a hotel. The front desk Guy who checked us in was not very informative. he did not give great directions, hotel amenities, and no information. The not so fluent English speaking lady at check out was way more professional. Upon walking inside the room it was really nice and spacious but that was it. The music on was soothing but when looking on the bed there were black marks on the sheets and the pillows, maybe indicating that the sheets or cover were not washed properly or replaced. The house keeping lady “Issef” or something was very nice and quick to respond to a request. The breakfast was okay but did also not provide shuttle service which is fine. I would rate my experience 3/10 unfortunately.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property backs up to Interstate 35 so the noise levels are very high, making sleeping difficult. I stayed on a high (fifth floor) room, so perhaps the noise was amplified. Also, the price increased significantly during the mid-week. On the positive side, the breakfast service was very good.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will use this facility from now on, As a retiree, I appreciated the high quality for a very reasonable price, particularly for the Austin market. I did not feel that I was in a cut rate hotel at all.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean, safe and secure feeling. Overall great stay, rooms are smaller than most Springhill Suites. We have found that the Austin North and South SHS are rebranded hotels not originally SHS there for the rooms aren't as large are other SHS hotels visitors might be used to.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel with kind and helpful staff! The international interns that at check in were friendly and excited to share information about the local area. The room was clean and comfortable with easy to set temperature. Hot showers and breakfast everyday, this place had everything I needed to focus on enjoying my vacation.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights and everything was awesomeWe called for early check in and it was not a problem. We had a suite which was hugeGREAT BIG BUFFET breakfast which was awesomeNear the highway so easy to get too.Beds were super comfy as well
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The overall stay was good. The staffs were very friendly. Parking was easy and had plenty of spaces.The room size was decent but the bed was just facing the bathroom which was little weird. The complimentary breakfast was ordinary. They had scrambled eggs and sausage. It would be nice if they can also have some veggies like mash potato or hash browns etc.,
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very clean,quiet,comfortable room, with friendly, helpful staff. The bathroom was large and had ample counter space. The room was large yet the furnishings were conveniently placed. I will stay here again next time I'm in town, an absolutely stress free stay.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very clean, well-maintained Hotel. The staff was friendly and attentive. The breakfast room was very clean and there was a good variety of breakfast foods available. The king suite we stayed in is large and nicely arranged. The bed and sleeper sofa were comfortable. The kitchen has a microwave and mini refrigerator. The king bed has two nightstands, each with 2 drawers for clothes or other items. The closet contains an iron and ironing board and bedding for the sleeper sofa. There's also a drawer in the TV stand. We had a very nice stay and will return.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Property is well kept and quiet. Staff went beyond to accommodate me, and kept me comfortable. Breakfast was good . Not continental bread and coffee. This will be my place to stay everytime I come to Austin.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I write this while sitting in the room. We booked the King suite with sofabed including our 2 kids. The facility is fairly updated and recently renovated.1. The tiniest room I've ever been in... no room to walk around the king bed. Once the sofabed is pulled out there is no place to walk around - we had to climb over the pulled out sofabed to get to the other side which is where the king bed and bathroom are.2. As if that wasn't bad enough, there is no place to put your clothes and stuff. When we mentioned it to the front desk they said we can put things in the closet - which was about 3 feet wide and had just a couple of hangers. Do I put underwear, t-shirts, etc on hangers? The guy at the front desk said there was a table in the room! Really! Put my clothes for 4 on the table next to the mini fridge?3. At time of booking we booked 2 adults and 2 kids. Yet, when we returned from dinner really late our first night and opened the sofabed there were no sheets, pillows, etc. When I called the front desk, they said I could come down and pick them up at the front desk. If they knew (and saw) 4 guests, they should have made sure there was enough bedding for all 4 guests!Needless to say, we will never come back to a Springhill. This was my first stay and will be my last! I would rate this space zero if I could. Surprised that folks rated it 5 stars...
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my favorite hotel when I need a place to stay before an early morning flight. Rooms are spacious, and the price is reasonable. It is close to a gas station to fill up quickly right before that early flight! I highly recommend this hotel, as I keep coming back myself!
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this SpringHill Suites while visiting our daughter in Austin and it was a nearly ideal hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable, with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker (although coffee was also available in the lobby 24/7). Our only minor complaint about the room was the lack of drawers which would have come in handy during our 6-night stay. The free internet was speedy and the free breakfast was quite extensive. The hotel was close to the airport and shopping, and we were able to complete a number of day trips while our daughter was working. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. This is definitely a place we’ll stay at during future trips to Austin.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pluses * friendly staff* updated, modern common areas* room has a refridgerator and microwave* room was very clean* free breakfast was very good, but not if you have dietary restrictions* good parking & no fee parking* easy access to i35Minuses - breakfast not celiac friendly (not gf friendly)- room is dated, not the level we're used to for Marriott. We expected more modern.- TV didn't have a great angle from the beds.- Didn't care for the unusual room layout, restroom and sink vanity were separate. We didn't like the bathroom or room layout at all, but it was very clean
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall good value for the price. Comfortable and clean. Busy in the morning due to large groups. Quality of breakfast was a nice surprise. Lovely staff who shared local information and replenished breakfast.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff, Shayan Abbasi at the front desk was polite and offered the showing of both king and double room to chose from. Clean property with ample parking space.Mattress was great, neither hard nor extra soft. The management should think about updating TVs in rooms.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel, overall, is clean, and the location is good. However, I guess when I was looking for rooms, I missed that the rooms here are not really suites. Guess I’m old fashioned, but when I was growing up, a Suite meant there really was two rooms - with a door between. I would call these studio suites. Since my wife goes to bed early, I couldn’t watch TV. Kept the light off and just read on my iPad. Now, with that in mind, like I said, the hotel is clean, and the staff members were nice and pleasant. Everything in the room was clean and worked as it should. Bed was comfortable. Dressing area is small, so don’t try getting two people ready at the same time. We skipped housekeeping two of the three days, but the third day the room was clean. Breakfast was so-so, but that could have been because it was Thanksgiving week and it was crowded. The ladies working the meal were really earning their pay. The book detailing the hotel said there were daily newspapers, but we never saw one. A small peeve of mine was that they don’t sell Coca Cola products. Had to do with Dr. Pepper. So, if you don’t need a true suite, then this would be a good place to stay and I would recommend it. Stay weird, Austin!
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay very much. All the staff was super nice and helpful. I extended my stay by emailing one of the employees and it was set up for me hassle free. My late check out was not ruined by housekeeping busting in like in many other places I have stayed in, i greatly appreciated that!! It was clean over all. The tubs could be a little cleaner but not bad. The room service was very nice in not messing with all the makeup and computer stuff I left out on a rushed morning. I will definitely be staying here from now now for all my Austin trips!
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was comfortable and vey clean. Everything in the room was conveniently located to access with ease. Breakfast in the morning was delicious. Food was hot and a variety of items to select from. I'll be back.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this hotel was fantastic. Clean Lobby, Nice rooms - Comfortable and Quiet. We booked last minute and they were out of king rooms, but the GM was very accommodating and got us the available double bed for the same price. The Property is in a good location about 8-10 mins to downtown, which to us is pretty good distance. Great front desk staff, Mr. Montgomery checked us in fast and was very professional. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we will definitely be coming back!
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positive: great front desk staff, good breakfast, quiet property.Negative: Older property that needs a lot of updating. The carpets in the room were stained, the water in the bathroom sink would not get hot, the bed was hard, there was woefully inadequate light, and the a/c unit is RIGHT next to the bed, blowing air right at you. I was glad we were only there one night.NOTE: GPS directions will take you to the wrong side of the freeway and because of a lot of construction going on, getting back to the other side is difficult. Beware.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the main reasons for picking this hotel was for the pullout couch. Unfortunately the configuration of the room makes it impossible to actually use it. The TV stand prevents you from opening it. Moving the couch makes it impossible to open the refrigerator or for anyone to get to the door. The staff was sympathetic but there was really nothing they could do.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading lots of reviews from several hotels in the area, I decided to stay at SpringHill Suites Austin South through word of mouth of a friend that stayed there last month. Best advice ever! This hotel has it all... including extremely clean rooms, very friendly staff, and a fantastic breakfast. Who doesn't want a Texas shaped waffle after a great nights sleep!? I'm passing the word to anyone I know that is visiting Austin.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upholstery needs to be cleaned. Stains needed to be v lesned. Beds too soft. Room was very tight, restroom sink area too tight. TV was very small. Breakfast was adequate. Staff was friendly, greating was a good experience.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding stay at the SpringHill Suites Austin South in Austin Texas! Great staff and a nice room. Overall I had an outstanding experience, and the price was very reasonable. Very easy to get in and out of the city from this location,
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three of us stayed four nights for the fantastic COTA formula one weekend. The hotel is a great spot between downtown Austin which is fab and the race track. The hotel staff at check in and breakfast were excellent and the room was serviced spotlessly daily with two comfortable beds fridge and microwave. However the bath and floor had some water damage from the shower and a bit of a damp smell. If it had a new new bathroom this would get 5 stars but really the bathroom would take this down to a three, but we felt the great room service and breakfast service made it up to a four. The bar opposite in the Marriott was also very good with nice beers and bar snacks.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights on a work trip. Room was clean, quiet, and inviting. Great location to Congress & has a $5 shuttle (includes round trip) to 6th St. Expected more from the bed; too many dips and divots. Most of the staff was great, but while checking out at 4:30am, the front desk clerk was nowhere to be found. When she finally emerged from the office, she was terribly rude, did not acknowledge me, and appeared inconvenienced when I asked to check out. Asked her to mail a postcard for me (already stamped) & 4 days later, family has yet to receive it... needless to say, the last impression left a lasting impression.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very basic and no fancy amenities or any extra stuff were offered but the room was very clean and quiet. The hotel offers complementary breakfast. There is no restaurant or bar in the hotel but you can purchase small snacks and soft drinks at front desk. It is located next Marriott Hotel and you can walk to its restaurant.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed in many hotels while traveling to Austin, but this SpringHill Suites has set the bar high. The breakfast was top notch. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The hotel was centrally located to everything you would want while in Austin. Overall, we'll be staying here with no questions asked. Thanks for the great experience!!
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So I travel a great deal, and I generally choose Marriott properties. My expectation is 1) they are clean, 2) they have good customer service, and 3) they make an honest effort to recover - if there is an issue. I also use Hilton, Hyatt, and Sheraton (now also Marriott) properties, so I do make it a point of complaining if an issue is askew. This property had human body hair in the bathroom, It also smelled musty and had a fragrance used to 'mask' the musty smell. I tolerated it, since I had a late night and early morning, and left, responding to the questionnaire from GM Mike Montgomery honestly - well, unlike other Marriott properties, he replied with a form letter which said he would 'bring it up with the staff'. No offer of points, nor anything else.Anyone interested is welcome to reach out for electronic copies of our chat.So, Montgomery does not respond like other Marriott brands have responded. This is your warning - if something goes wrong, expect to be IGNORED.Choose another property.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a good location relative to downtown. It is reasonably priced with free breakfast and wi-fi. Functional, not fancy.The hotel staff was friendly and cooperative. Reserved parking spots for Platinum members.
hotelName:
18    SpringHill Suites Austin South
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've tended to have good experiences with Hampton Inns and this one was probably the nicest one of the bunch. They were able to check us into one of our rooms early and the made a nice first impression by having in the lobby cucumber water, lemonade and cookies.The room was well designed and the beds were comfortable. Front desk was helpful and provided us a list of restaurants when we asked where to go to lunch. Easy parking. At breakfast, they had an ADORABLE Texas-shaped waffle maker. The only negative is that the signage at the entrance was definitely lacking. They had 2 red flags but otherwise no big sign or flowers or anything that would indicate the entrance to a hotel. We sailed right past it, even using a gps because the entrance was so non-descript. It required a couple of awkward turns and added 5 extra minutes with the traffic light and odd separate left hand turn lane to get our way back to the entrance, so be on the lookout when you're driving there for the first time.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was very friendly. Hotel was clean. Breakfast was good. The only negative I have is the location. Traffic makes it very difficult to turn left on 290 which is the direction we had to go each morning for games. Be sure you use Waze for alternate routes. Overall we had a nice stay for two nights.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay was amazing, staff was fantastic! Top notch! I wish I was still in hospitality, I would try to relocate Sarah, as she was a dream come true! Keep up the great job, as you all have a wonderful team at Hampton Inn Austin Oakhill!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with easy access to Austin and Dripping Springs area. Clean hotel. The self check in process was great, just walked up and picked up the room key. Would recommend for those you want to visit and plan to drive around the neighboring hill country sites.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the time we checked in to the time we checked out the staff greeted us and was extremely friendly! Our rooms were super clean and very cold when we walked in from a very hot baseball game! They were very understanding when we had to cancel a few rooms due to a family emergency! Bravo Hampton Inn Oak Hill!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my third stay with this hotel - its close to friends and family, convenient to many things. This stay was excellent - checking was easy and Elijah at the front desk was great! I love that the rooms are quickly cleaned in the mornings. Plus the lobby accommodated many of our friends as we socialized, snacked and laughed our way through.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: as previously stated Super Sarah rocked our stay and made us feel like guests in her home. i can’t say enough good things about her her sense of hospitality. i will definitely recommend this hotel thanks
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was impeccable, the bed most comfortable. My room attendant, Rosa, was wonderful, she kept my room so clean with personal touches. The complimentary breakfast was great, I'm a bagel and coffee person, but they had fruit, eggs, bacon, and fresh waffles. Coffee was excellent.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in town for a wedding in Dripping Springs and this was the perfect hotel. The rooms are basic, nice rooms, clean and comfy beds...no robes and turndown service but if that isn't important then take note that there is always hot coffee and warm cookies in the lobby, and a free breakfast in the morning. The staff is friendly and accommodating. We have stayed in many 4-5 star properties that aren't as nice. I highly recommend this property.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great with amazing customer service and staff. The rooms are clean and nice as well. The breakfast was good and the set up was clean and easy to navigate. recommend and will stay again in the future.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There always seems to be something wrong with every hotel. But I can't think of anything wrong here. We even got a free breakfast in the morning. The bed was good, the air conditioning was good, plumbing was good, etc.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here three nights on our trip to Austin and the hill country. The downtown lodging seemed overpriced so we chose this because of its location outside of the downtown and it was actually very easy to make a couple trips into the city. We felt this was a good value. We had a nice room on the third floor with comfortable bed and overlooking the pool which is the quiet side away from street traffic. We had their complimentary hot breakfast and each day it was different. There's a lot of lodging to pick from and I would recommend this one.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An overnight stay in busy Austin area to attend a UT function at a facility that was pleasant and well maintained. I would recommend this hotel to all. The staff was great and I had a very pleasant night of rest.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty good experience. Check in was super easy. The room and bed was great and bathroom was spacious. Lots of towels available and iron and iron board already available in the closet with hangers too. Just wished for better breakfast items. The meat wasn’t all that great particularly the bacon strips wasn’t good. Also wished there was gravy, biscuit or hash browns but that may be my affinity toward complimentary breakfast gravy speaking. Haha. But still good stay and loved the cookies and lemonade in the lobby.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The title says it all. Slimy water to the point of not wanting to use it to brush my teeth. I have experience the extremes of both "hard, and "soft" water, and this was neither. Everything else during my stay was fine.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the friendly front desk and the spa cucumber water to the heated plate for the cookies- it was such a nice welcome. Parking for Diamond members. Normal HI breakfast- although they did get frisky and add strawberries and blue berries to the fruit mix. Rooms- clean, nice bedding, large/huge walk in shower. Ac worked great and has continuous option for those white noiser/ cold sleep appreciators!! Nice big gym! Pool too. They don’t heat them in Texas and it was chilly so didn’t get to use. If you need GREAt Restaurant close by go to JACK ALLENS! awesome happy hour for food. Would definitely stay again!!!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oakhill Hampton is at the edge of Austin and the facility isn’t the easiest to find and access, but worth the extra effort. The location is located in a quieter area that is not saturated with other hotels and event venues.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very clean although a bit pricey. However, you get what you pay for. The room and breakfast were excellent. It is very close to the Salt Lick BBQ in Driftwood, TX. Turning left out of the hotel to get to the Salt Lick on Fm 1826 is a bit dangerous as you are crossing Hwy 290. Turning right is difficult as well due to road construction on the Mopac Expy. It’s a 20-25 min. drive.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In town for a wedding, booked here because of the proximity to the event. Elijah greeting us warmly upon arriving and checked us in a bit early (thank goodness as the wedding was at 4!). Room was very clean and had plenty of towels, more than I have ever had in a room before! Amenities included Neutrogena products, and even had makeup remover wipes which I have never seen in a hotel before. Nice touch! Elijah greeted us again the next morning as we stepped off of the elevator and offered us donuts before directing us to the breakfast buffet. Buffet was plentiful - included eggs (scrambled or boiled) and sausage, make your own waffles, oatmeal, cereal, toast and english muffins. 2 blends of coffee as well as decaf and apple and orange juice. Tons of places to eat and shop nearby, and several breweries also very close. I would stay here again, and would recommend to others. One tip - property is at the very end of 290 and no visible signage other than a couple of Hampton Inn flags at the entrance, so watch closely when approaching destination.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to the staff for an easy check-in and clean room. The location, just off US 290, is quiet, but a little tricky to find the driveway at night. US 290 can be hard to make a left turn in or out of the property Another option is the side driveway off McCarty Lane.Minor issues were the pool is outside. We were hoping for an inside pool so we could use the hot tub after a day of hiking. :^( I was also sad to see the eggs empty at breakfast, but otherwise the breakfast layout was great.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing, i was so pleased with everything, it made those 10 days i stayed there less stressful. Thanks again. I honestly cannot write how much, Sara was so helpful. Im not exagerating either... thank you!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel for the price. For a business traveler who wants a clean and comfortable room as a home base, this is perfect. For free breakfast, they offered enough of a variety. The free internet service was sufficient for what I need to work in my room. Great value all around.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Clean and efficient. The staff was help as well as friendly. Don’t miss the complimentary breakfast, not your typical cold cereals. Fresh food, served hot, area was super clean. Best I’ve ever had!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We blocked rooms for our son's wedding at this hotel because it was close to the wedding venue. We also, always, try to stay at Hamptons. This hotel did not disappoint. As the groom's parents, we had to arrive early on Friday. The front desk was so kind to let us have early check in so we could get settled and relax before our big weekend. Our room was fresh, clean, roomy and up to date, style wise. The bedding was clean and the bathroom was easy to maneuver with two people in it trying to get ready. The complimentary breakfast was tasty and offered quite a variety. The hotel staff was amazing. I had many requests and they exceeded my expectations on each one! We were so pleased with our stay.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked three rooms for the judges at our event. I selected this hotel because it offered an airport shuttle. In accordance with their instructions, I scheduled the shuttle trips a week in advance. When our guests were at the hotel, ready for the shuttle, they were told that the shuttle did not operate on Sundays. I had multiple conversations directly with the hotel staff to schedule the airport shuttle on Sunday. You would think that someone would have said - oops - there is no shuttle on Sunday. That would have been good to know. Total lack of professionalism. Shame on you.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: in town for christmas with family. very clean room and bathroom which i really care about. breakfast was standard hampton inn. personnel very friendly. stayed at this hotel because of location and will stay again
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay super comfy beds and breakfast is really good!!! The staff was super nice and helpful! The location is okay.. you have to deal with traffic and it is next to a graveyard. I really like our stay!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is friendly and helpful Rooms are clean and breakfast is free: eggs, bacon, waffles, muffins, bagels, fruit, coffee, tea, etc.Restaurants and malls are pretty close by. If you are a Hilton Rewards Member you have a better price room.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a great value and very comfortable. It was convenient to family that we were visiting. It’s near a busy intersection, but the building and the driveways are not easy to see from the road. So take your time and stay safe in the Austin traffic.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are not enough words to describe how the Hampton Inn family hotels continue to maintain the best customer services, cleanliness, value, locations, rooms and sleep quality that you can experience from an hotel chain.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We liked location being close to our relative’s house. Food offered was good. Front desk staff were friendly and professional. We did not like being able to hear our neighbors in rooms next door and above us.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This unique Hampton Inn is tucked away behind 290 and William Cannon among some trees. Nice location, great & helpful staff. Try it out for a difference next time you're in Austin. It's handy to everything.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't understand why this hotel has been given fewer points than it deserves. This is a great hotel. It has an easily accessible location, albeit a bit hidden from sight as it shares a driveway, It is impeccably clean, with large clean windows in the rooms and visibly well maintained, the staff is exceptionably nice, helpful and positive, I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and it was quiet, utterly relaxing with a much better than usual breakfast for an informal prepared included breakfast.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean hotel with a friendly staff. We attended a wedding in Dripping Springs and this was a good location. There are restaurants and shopsnearby but it was easy access to the wedding venue. Nice sheets and pillows.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The sheets in my first room had visibly not been washed. They gave me a second room and a gift card to apologize for the inconvenience. The sheets in the second room were also visibly soiled. So I asked for clean ones and made the bed myself. Great stay and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. But just double check the sheets before you hop in bed.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was coming to Austin for a concert at the One World Theatre and this was the closest Hilton chain hotel. Front desk staff went out their way to research and answer one of my questions. Hotel is clean, quiet, and a good value.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and wonderful staff made my stay a pleasure. Facilities are in excellent condition and rooms are modern and clean. Daily breakfast includes many great options to start the day. Overall great stay and I look forward to the next one!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I work a lot of conferences which means 4 and 5 star hotels. While the room was smaller than a fancy hotel. The service was as good as or better than the fanciest hotel I have ever stayed in. And ... lower cost, free breakfast, free parking, free wifi and free coffee 24/7.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is not really near downtown Austin, so people using it are presumably doing so because, like us, they want to be in this part of town. It is a standard Hampton Inn, with good-sized rooms, a decent free breakfast, and friendly and efficient staff.The only problem I can point to is that the left turn into the hotel, when coming from the Austin direction, from a busy road is difficult and not well-marked.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Austin for a wedding weekend in late July. Needless to say, it was hot and the pool was cool and very inviting. The rooms were chilled like a fine glass of wine and the amenities were just as one would expect. It was convenient for our venue and easy to find. The only negative is the navigating the Austin traffic if you try and go left out of the parking lot. I would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We experienced a racial interaction with some guests at the pool (where they were drunk and smoking), when we reported them to the hotel management (front desk), they did zero, we did not even get a sympathy, we did not feel welcome in this hotel even though we are member of Hilton honors.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, clean rooms, and good breakfast. Price was a little higher than expected but ok. Internet worked ok but not on some devices. Should of asked for help but it was no big deal. Pool is nice and hotels.com mentioned a bar but I didn’t see one.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet and updated; they fixed the problems that most hotels still experience in the area of quietness and showers. YEAH! No slamming doors, and real showers without having to climb in and out of a bathtub.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a well-maintained hotel, very clean with an accommodating staff. The only real complaints about this hotel have to do with the entrance being hard to see and the exit being tough due to traffic.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to Austin to see family and friends. This hotel was close to all the events we attended. Close to airport. Lots of restaurants near by. Took a side trip to San Antonio River Walk, awesome place. Hilton Hotels never disappoint!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ........to Austin without all the higher prices of Austin Hotels. Convenient to Lake Travis, Dripping Springs and the Hill Country South and West of the Lake and all it has to offer. Self parking is a big plus. Just 15 - 20 minutes to 6th St and more restaurants and Bars than just about anywhere else
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Inside of being hidden a little out of view, this is an outstanding hotel with terrific service and a friendly atmosphere just perfect for breakfast and a family meeting area for our large group of about of 51. It was awesome! We are very happy with this location!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think the price was a little high for what you get. The location is great, but the traffic is horrible. It's hard to get in and out, expect delays. I had stuff stolen out of my truck. My fault for trusting humanity and they do not have parking lot cameras. The staff is by the book. If you need extra amenities for your group you better plan way ahead. They did the best they could, but would not budge on anything extra no matter how much I offered.The breakfast is so so. Not a big selection, but it was free and it filled the void. Another thing, if you use the shuttle service you also better plan way in advance because you may just have to wait a while or not get a ride back.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are generous in size. Centrally located in Austin. Room layout is not great and outlets do not all work. Housekeeping was not adequate - please replace shampoo and replace towels that have been used. Comfortable bed. Unremarkable.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at another Hampton Inn in Massachusetts that was also good. Rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast included, staff is friendly and helpful, and it is not too expensive.This location is not too far from the airport or downtown Austin.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location for a weekend getaway. The location is central to the south end of Austin and the hill country. Friendly staff with a great breakfast included with the room. One of the best values for the money with clean rooms and amenities.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property was well-located for our night’s stay. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly, but I’m still pondering the fairly high room rate (and I’m a Hilton Honors member). I stayed in the luxurious Austin Renaissance the following night for only $25 more!
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Typical Hampton Inn which I have found to be very accommodating in my experience. The staff were very friendly and affable. They even went out of their way to deconflict my reservation, as I had 2 different reservations for the stay. They let me stay in the same room, despite my reservations being for 2 different rooms.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Austin for a family wedding, and picked Hampton Inn because we prefer Hilton Properties.The Hotel location was great, just a few miles south of the river & Austin, rooms were good sized & comfortable, the included breakfast was quite good and parking was excellent as well.If you are looking to go west on 290, you have to use the Texas reverse direction technique, or take a side road west and rejoin 290, but that wasn't a problem.
hotelName:
19    Hampton Inn Austin/Oak Hill
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay. My family had a blast in the pool. We were a bit confused because we read it was an indoor and outdoor pool but it was only indoor. Other than that, the staff was great and the rooms were comfortable.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is within walking distance of restuarants and a 7-eleven. It is close to the highway but far enough off the road so you dont hear the road noise. Great water pressure and plenty of hot water.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was very good - they didn't replenish the coffee during day - so I had to get my own coffee replenishment at night when I came back - this is a big thing for me since I drink coffee in room while other's sleep in the morning. But overall the hotel was very good.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Business trip was made very comfortable. Very much appreciated restaurants and business within walking distances. Facilities were well taken care of. Bed was a little firm. Inside pool only. Nice fitness area and great breakfast.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I almost never leave reviews. The folks at this hotel were outstanding. We came down to visit my dying mother-in-law one weekend. Came back the next for the funeral. They were caring, considerate and gave us a bereavement rate, which was an amazing touch given that we only stayed there one other time ever before. Outstanding breakfast and great service all weekend both weekends. Can’t wait to come back during happier times .
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel many times but it had been a few years since our last visit. For the most part it is a very nice place to stay. I just noticed a few nits (many of you will think I'm just being petty here) that made me pause. To start with, I don't know why they can't give you a soap dish at the bathroom sink. It really bothers me for the soap to slide all over the counter. It also bothered me that the tissue in the box provided started out white but became blue during our stay. It was the same box because we didn't have the room serviced for our stay. That means they are refilling the tissue instead of putting out new boxes. That makes my skin crawl a bit. Finally, the main reason I am only giving 4 stars was the last night we were there, at 2:45 am, the fire alarm sounded. We jumped out of bed and opened the door to see if it was just the alarm in our room, it wasn't the hallway alarms were sounding as well. We started to get dressed and the alarm silenced. I called the front desk and after some time I was told it was a false alarm. We later found out it was a disgruntled would be guest who pulled the alarm on his way out after being denied a room. Now, I know this was beyond the control of the hotel staff but I expected some sort of an apology. I have stayed at hotels where the fire alarm was activated and the staff went out of their way to apologize. I have stayed at hotels where the power went out and the staff went out of their way to apologize. I expected more than a cursory "Thanks for staying with us. Have a great day." when we checked out.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service from check in to check out! Hotel is clean and breakfast was great. Staff is really focused on what they can do for you to make your stay better. It is refreshing to see this still exists.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was okay. Staff are lacklustre, but it’s fine. I asked for a quiet room and was put on the ground floor right next to a large room for hire which was not quiet.Breakfast was self service, but that didn’t stop the waitresses putting requests for tips in leather folders on the table for every member of our party (4!) before we had even started eating. All we asked for from them were pots of tea, and apparently they had no lids for the teapots.I’d stay here again, but only if it was booked on my behalf.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've never had a bad stay at a Hilton Garden Inn and this one was no exception. Extra clean room, staff was very friendly and helpful. Its in a good area, plenty of restaurants in the area in addition to the bar and grill in the hotel. Nice, well equipped exercise room and indoor pool. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service at this hotel is past outstanding. Excellent staff and all go out of their way to serve. I stay here often and it is like coming home to family when I arrive. Convenient location, with a very good restaurant plus two
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was nice and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Our only issue and the reason we will not stay there again, was that on our second night our car was broken into -in the parking lot. The vandals broke two of our car windows and wrecked the metal of the door frames with a crowbar (our guess). Another car was also broken into. The staff did not seem surprised. The hotel has no security cameras. Staff gave us a free breakfast and helped us vacuum the glass out of our car, but we had to drive home to Allen, TX, with 2 broken windows. Thankfully, the weather cooperated. Several items were stolen, but most of our valuables were in the hotel room with us. We understand that the hotel isn’t responsible for the break in, but if this is a common occurrence, they need to upgrade their security. We expect to have better security for the price we paid.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was extremely friendly, acknowledging you each time you came in the lobby. Very clean room. Excellent breakfast with very helpful and accommodating service workers. Location in same parking lot as Papadeaux's (shrimp w/ cheese grits - the best) and Bone Daddy's (memorable BarBQ); 3 malls w/in 15 min (one was only 5 min. away (The Arboretum), a tavern across the street. All in all a very pleasant experience
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and welcomed with a friendly smile as I arrived. Spacious well appointed rooms although there is some road noise. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. There's also a good assortment of restaurants and bars within one mile and it's convenient for getting to see the sights of Austin.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an excellent stay at this hotel! The staff was friendly and even went out of their way to make us feel welcome for my mom's Birthday weekend, room was clean and quiet. We will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: our car was broken into overnight.No security cameras on the outside of the building, and very poor lighting.The ONLY way we would EVER stay here again is if additional lighting and cameras are added.Both are very cheap in comparison, and easy to install
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adult family met here for a mini vacation, the hotel was very clean, staff very courteous, helpful and friendly. Exercise room and equipment just what we needed. We enjoyed our stay. Close enough to everything we were planning on visiting in the area. Wonderful restaraints close enough to walk to or a short drive.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel and staff are nice and the room was clean and comfortable. The A/C unit is quite loud however and we had to have maintenance fix it before it started to cool the room. It's in a good location to be able to visit Austin without paying as much as you'd need to if you stayed downtown.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel can be a little tricky to spot off the road but the staff are very friendly. This is our third time at this location and we will not hesitate to book future trips here. Overall, a very good hotel.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful service, clean rooms, AC and heat work perfectly, and the beds are comfortable with extra long pillows along with a few standard sized. Breakfast cost $10 plus, but it was delicious and there were plenty of items in which to choose.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Austin on a three day weekend looking for relaxation. This place was easy to find, the room was clean, the bed was really comfy, and the staff was friendly. We didn’t eat here, so I can’t comment on the food, but their coffee was excellent. Mission accomplished! :)
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room. Comfy bed. Close to true Austin restaurants and access to MOPAC, Hwy 183, and the great shopping and movie theater at the Arboretum!Staff was congenial and Hilton Honors members received bottled water in room.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Keeping with the high standards I associate with Hilton and Hilton Garden Inns this hotel is my go-to location when I am in Austin, which is on a monthly basis. Clean rooms and very helpful staff make a huge difference when staying at a hotel.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member I have come to appreciate the consistency of HGI, of all the Hilton properties HGI is my favorite of late. Check in quick, they accommodate my profile preferences and keep it cheerful and efficient. This is another great HGI property, worth staying at if your in the area.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When visiting friends on the Northwest part of Austin I occasionally stay at this property. The rooms are clean and well maintained and the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms have a sufficient number of easily accessible electrical outlets, a small refrigerator, a microwave, and a coffee maker. The only thing I found missing in the rooms were drinking glasses; all that were available were paper cups, which are not conducive to drinking a good single malt. Parking is accessible and there are a couple of restaurants adjacent to the hotel.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff, from initial greeting until departure. Quiet location located off freeway service road. Clean large room, A couple of restaurants within easy walking distance out front. And out back, sidewalks for walking near quiet office park especially on weekends,
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We previously stayed at this hotel because it's close to our relatives. However, nothing has improved over my last review. The hotel employees are mostly Hispanic and they are very rude. They will point at customers, laugh and generally make fun of them. For breakfast the employees will serve whom they want and ignore others. One evening we ordered a pizza and stayed in the lobby to eat it while watching TV. We were approached by the bartender who told us we couldn't eat there (even though we were in the dining room) because we had brought the food into the hotel. Not a rule, according to Hilton corporate. Don't stay here.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed twice already for work trips here, as it's got places nearby for food & shopping if needed, plus easy to reach from the airport. Very good service, clean, along with good amenities where it's a place I'd tell my coworkers to stay during their time in Austin.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room smelled really bad, almost like mildew, and the beds were really uncomfortable. The staff was awesome, which made the stay more pleasant. I like Hilton, but we will not stay at this location again.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service, room was clean and updated, great options at breakfast and service was fast and pleasant. Didn't have opportunity to eat lunch or dinner there, or check out the bar, but nice to have that option in the hotel. Thank you!
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel whie visiting UT of Austin. The front desk was THE friendliest I have ever met! There were just a few things that would have made this the PERFECT visit for us... everyone has their own opinion so take mine for what it is worth. First, the beds were harder than usual. They changed the beds to have wooden side slats and frames... they were not the most comfortable accommodations. Second, the towels were rough and stiff. It was like they had not been used in a while, maybe got damp from steam, then air dried. Finally, eggs were watery and no grits. Now if that is ALL I had to complain about... you can bet this was a GREAT VISIT! We will definitely be back!!! Thanks Hilton!
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for the weekend for my fiancé’s birthday which I noted in our reservation and the staff surprised us with balloons, candy and a card upon our arrival in the room. It was an amazing touch and really meant a lot to us!
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My hubby and I stay here a couple of times a year when visiting family and always enjoy our visits. The breakfast service seemed particularly good this time. The hotel is clean, the staff is professional and the price is right. We liked room 509.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I came out for the football game, other than the game, the rest of our experience in Texas was wonderful! The people, the staff, all were amazing. The staff remembered us as we would come and go. Very enjoyable!
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great quiet, clean, and pleasant hotel. The staff were attentive and very efficient and were always willing to chat. I wish I had this experience at all my stays. The property is In a nice location with easy freeway access.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, quiet, clean and well kept hotel. The room was a good size, the bed was big and comfortable. The shower was great and the cleaning staff kept the room well.It's a bit out of the way so you will need to uber to get downtown. There's a fish place and steak place next door, which are good.The hotel bar is tiny and closes very early.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel for business, minutes by car to tech park and corporate campuses. Very friendly staff, Nathan at front desk was very helpful and friendly. Lack of vegetables at breakfast hindered otherwise wonderful experience.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this HGI locates a few times and every stay was consistent. The front desk and housekeeping staff were presentable and professional. I am a gold member and received the complementary HH breakfast and it was a delight. From the lobby entrance to the corridors and room, it was clean and well kept. Room service was typical HGI service and was tasty. I recommend this hotel based on my four stays I have had with them this year. Thank you for hosting my business trips.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always a great place to stay for business when I visit Austin. Staff is helpful and always available. Nice bar, restaurant, lobby, comfy bed, decent workout room. There's plenty to do around the area and even a nice area to get a morning run in!
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was clean, breakfast was great and loved hanging out at the pool over looking the lake. This was my third time to stay at this location. I used my Hilton Honors points which made the room quite reasonable.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great Hilton property, and very reasonably priced. I really liked that it has big oak trees around the property, and a nice pool. So many newer hotels now are just right by the road; not this one. They did built a Pappadeaux restaurant in front of the adjacent property about a year ago, but that's not a detraction. So great dining is nearby (or hotel has a restaurant). Rooms were very comfortable
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did not have towels when first arriving. The front staff promised to bring them, but never showed. After calling a 2nd time with no results once again, I went down to get the towels myself. The attendant did give me towels at that time, and told me she'd give me a discount because of the situation. However, upon departure, the front desk said there were no notes made on my account about the discount or towel issue, and she'd consult a manager at a later time. It's not the end of the world if you don't have towels, but it is certainly something that is expected during a motel stay. The feeling portrayed by the staff was one of not really caring about their guests. I will stay at other Hiltons, but probably won't stay at this one again.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was hard locating the hotel/sign with address.The two restuarant over shadows the hotel.Guest room had cobwebs at the ceiling. Contenital breakfast had same selections every morning. Receptionists are nice and welcoming Room is spacious
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, close to many upscale restaurants and minutes away from downtown area. Staff and property didn't disappoint. Rates were very reasonable for the Austin area. Will stay again next time in the Austin area.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It would have been nice to sleep past 9AM but one of the housekeeping staff decided to bring her toddler to work and proceeded to let her scream in the hallway while she cleaned the room next to ours. Completely unacceptable! The next morning the housekeeper opened our door without even knocking, luckily I was right by the door and pushed it back closed while I repeated no, no no. It was a cluster f***.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was immaculate and the bathroom was very clean. The staff was very friendly in the front desk. Breakfast service was good and they had a good selection of items on the menu. The coffee was just ok but they would make eggs to order if you wanted an omelet to order. I would recommend this hotel and return again.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location with reasonable value. This webpage is demanding a longer review, so I'll just add that I've stayed here multiple times and will return again. Nothing special. Nothing bad. Just a solid experience.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice lobby with complimentary coffee/tea/water. Friendly staff. Clean lobby and rooms. Quiet location. Free parking and guest wifi. Two restaurants right in parking lot- Pappadeaux seafood and SaltLick BBQ. Hotel room service available also as well as a paid breakfast in lobby and small convenience store. I would return for my future business trips.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a business trip. Conveniently located. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a little on the small side, even for the concept. Even had a nice little walking trail on the back of the property.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hilton Garden Inn is very nice and in a great part of Austin. It is easy to get to all of the city from there and is a great value for the price. We came for my son's graduation from UT-Austin and was able to make all events easily and on time from this location.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wedding to attend and this was the recommended Hotel. A bit far from the center of Austin it was still a very good deal and location. Staff was helpful and made sure everything was handled well.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room, a double deluxe, was large and comfortable. Employees here are friendly and anxious to ensure that guests have a nice stay. Wi-fi works well, even if premium plan not selected (basic connection is free for Hilton Honors members). The parking lots are huge and tree-lined, and best of all, complimentary self-parking--hard to find in Austin--is standard. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here during reggae festival weekend. Not too far from downtown. This place in my opinion is a 4 Star not 3 Star I was quite impressed with the property . The check In process was smooth. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable. Only little issue is the walls might be too thin. One can hear conversations going on in the next room.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful. It has everything that you would expect from a hotel aesthetically. The beds are comfortable, but that's about where comfort ends. The doors in the hallway are EXTREMELY loud when they shut and will keep you up all night long.You can hear people talking in the hallway even when they are speaking with a regular tone. I do not recommend this place for a good nights sleep.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location outside of downtown. Near the NW Hills. Love the way the location has so much convenience. The scenic views are addicting. I just didn't want to leave Austin. The staff was so nice and respective.
hotelName:
20    Hilton Garden Inn Austin Northwest / Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would actually give 3.5 stars. Limited breakfast after advertised as cooked to order. Pool was very warm and the pool area was messy with leaves everywhere. Could easily connect to internet but only for browsing, so couldn't use tablets for Netflix or the like..Staff and room was great!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights over the 4th of July weekend and overall it was great!! PROs: We are family of 4 with children ages 5 and 7. So, the two bedroom suite was perfect! King sized bed and full bathroom downstairs and queen sized bed and full bath upstairs made our stay very comfortable. The stairs are very steep so people with younger children may want to be cautious. The beds were comfortable despite many reviews saying they were not. Breakfast is vegetarian but very tasty. There is a rotating menu with 3 items to choose from but they always have biscuits and gravy, oatmeal and other bread items. They also have fresh fruit. I found the breakfast to be a thoughtful touch to this hotel. The evening reception is very nice! Drinks and snacks from 5-7pm most days. The price is very reasonable!!The hotel grounds are clean and very quiet and peaceful. The staff were attentive and courteous! Thank you!!CONs: The rooms themselves are VERY outdated. There were huge cracks in the bathroom tiles. The sinks come up to your thighs and I am not tall at all. The shower is very strange-the hot water never really got hot and the nozzle didn't work properly. The shower head is very low with light water pressure. The appliances all work but are very old school. I didn't even know how to use the microwave honestly. It had dials on it. The TV was fine but no access to apps which is not a big deal but I was hoping to catch up on some Netflix.The pool is nice but small so gets crowded easily.The hotel is in a very run down area so nothing is within walking distance.Overall, the experience was nice. For me, the pros definitely outweighed the cons. I likely will not return unless they update. I don't regret going at all. Just will want a different experience next time I'm in Austin.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was asked what my service dog did for me in front of other patrons. Not only is that against ADA regulations, it is extremely embarrassing for me to answer that. It was HORRIBLE!!!! I truly hope their employees learn the laws.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The suites are older refurbished apartments that are quite nice. Nestled into the heart of all of the crazy this property has a calm and relaxing environment.
