Walking the gardens and swimming in the pool were my daughter's favorites. I enjoyed those, along with the breakfast and the comfort of the suite. Definitely the only reason I'd go back to Austin.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great value for the room needs a few improvements. I would stay here again none the less. Plenty of room for the family. The air conditioner did not work well nor was the shower temp able to be adjusted but I'm sure a simple phone call may have corrected the issues.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first rooms AC was freezing even on 76. It felt like we were in a deep freezer and at night the AC stopped working and it got very hot.There was leaking water in the first room causing us to move room. The lady at the desk told us it would be 15 mins for a new room. It ended up taking almost an hour and no one wants to spend an hour of their honeymoon waiting on a room, we came to enjoy the city. Then we were told we couldn't have late check-out, although we opted in for it when we first reserved the room.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay. If you are not a morning person, do not stay in building 1. The housekeeping quarters are right there and they start work early, also the pool is very close so you hear all the commotion.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Habitat Suites is a fine place to stay. The rooms are spacious, with a separate bedroom and living room/kitchen. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well.The place offers a substantial breakfast included in the room rate. My only criticism was the location - it's really not close to anything. You'll need to have a car or take Lyft to get around town.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a great deal, and the suites are spacious - it's a great place to stay with kids. However, I'm taking off one star for the uncomfortable beds, outdated/worn-out accommodations, and dirty pool. During our stay, the pool water was covered in debris (including dozens of large beetles). I skimmed as much off as I could so my kids could enjoy the pool, then checked the filter pot and it was completely filled with debris. I'd advise the hotel management to clean the pool more thoroughly and frequently, as it's pretty unsavory for guests.Overall, I love the concept, and it's walking distance from a Tesla Supercharger which is convenient. The hotel also has an EV plug-in station. But a cleaner pool will make for happier guests!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is really very nice. Tucked away off a main road. We used Lyft for all trips to the tourist areas because we did not have a car. So, location may be an issue if you don’t have a car - but the Austin Lyft drivers were great!Amazing got breakfasts, made to order. Starting to show it’s age- this not a “5.” Shower temperature was inconsistent every time. Paint in my room was in need of repair. Room was very dark but my daughter’s room had a great torchiere lamp that helped immensely. I was told they are putting them in all rooms eventually. Front desk day person was efficient and tried to be helpful. She printed me walking directions to a nearby restaurant but when it said “go West out of the parking area” and I asked which way that was she didn’t know any more than I did. Figured it out eventually!A walk to Easy Tiger is easy and worth the effort,Really, you would enjoy staying here.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a previous apartment now turned hotel so nice that there is a kitchen in every suite. Happy hour is awesome and they have quiet hours too. Boy is it quiet! Vegan breakfast ... well... no sausage or bacon but it is free! Oatmeal is awesome and their products are local! Great for families. Needs update/remodel but if that doesn’t bother you, it is a great place. A little loud if you are downstairs and someone upstairs is taking a shower.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The setting is lovely, the location is convenient, and the room was cozy, comfortable and well-equipped. Enjoyed eating freshly prepared breakfast on the charming terrace . Most of the staff were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Habitat Suites are not overly fancy but they are a great value for families. The complimentary breakfast is amazing. The location is great; just minutes from UT. The property is kept clean. I went for a walk and loved the beautiful landscape of native flowers.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were visiting Austin for a quick vacation and loved staying at Habitat Suites! The rooms were a little dated but still clean and comfortable. It's a great value considering you get an entire apartment for the price of a typical hotel room. The grounds themselves were beautiful and it felt like we were in a small oasis in Austin. It seems like the area is really up and coming and will maybe have more restaurant options in the future. I absolutely loved that my stay was essentially waste free since even the napkins at breakfast were cloth! Breakfast was probably the best hotel breakfast I've ever had. Each guest gets a "main dish" option with your typical buffet offerings as well. So glad the coffee was fair trade and from a local coffee company. I could go on and on about Habitat Suites, we will definitely stay here if we ever visit Austin again!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is out of the way to some people, but was fine for us for each area we needed to go to. Does not look like a regular hotel - more of a boutique. Very, very nice. This was our second stay. We like it because it is 2 bedrooms (one upstairs) which allows our grown children their own space with included pull out sofa. The breakfast is great - if you only want biscuits and gravy or bagels or toast, they have that with all the fixings. They also have 3 meals on the menu that you can order and have prepared and brought to you - still no charge. Each evening they have complimentary beer and wine inside as well as out by the pool. Hubby remarked that the bed could've been softer, but we still slept well.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been staying at Habitat Suites for more than 20 years and it is always a pleasant experience. From the quiet location to good breakfast and happy hour, it's a great place to stay for business or pleasure.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Habitat suites is near our house so we have family stay when they come to visit. They have always been satisfied with their experience. We will sometimes come over and use the pool with our toddler and it's been clean, fun and not too chlorinated, which is a bonus. I love that it is a green-friendly hotel, the staff is always very nice and the rooms are clean, beds are comfy. I personally got to stay one night by myself for a little time away and I got room 3213 (pool courtyard upstairs) it was dreamy. I could hear the sound of the fountains from the pool, there was a sweet blue jay on her nest right outside my window and I was surprised by all the channels I got on the TV. My one complaint was that they would not let me have a wine glass in my room from the kitchen. They only provide regular drinking glasses and mugs. I had a friend come by to have a glass of wine with me and it would have been nice to have the fine wine out of an actual wine glass. So maybe providing a couple in the room?. But overall this place is great, very quiet, serene and the grounds are truly well kept and lush. Thank you!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel offers free breakfast and daily happy hour with friendly staff with access to most major highways and access roads with numerous food establishments nearby however limited pool and outdoor on the property.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found Habitat Suites to be a warm and welcoming place with excellent personal service. Further, the rooms are more than ample in size, comfort, and cleanliness. This business is built on principles of preserving the environment. And they provide a great breakfast service, geared toward those who appreciate organic offerings. Surprisingly reasonable rates. Would not hesitate to book again!! Highly recommend.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay here as often as we can when we visit the city for trips throughout the Legislative session. We are never dissatisfied with our stays- the beds are extremely comfortable, the breakfast is fantastic and the coffee is delicious. Def a home away from home!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good food, pool, free breakfast made to order, evening refreshments with wine/beer, location was good, private and quiet. Staff couldn’t have been more polite and friendly. I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has been my fourth visit to this hotel in three years. It is always my go to when I am in the area. The rooms are well kept and stocked with soaps, dishes, and appliances. The breakfast and dinner appetizers are always spot on. The guest services staff are always very courteous and helpful. I stayed there for four nights this visit, and I found it very comforting as a home away from home while at my conference.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fan is needed in the bedroom especially in warmer months in Texas.And, a floor lamp is needed by the couch to allow someone to sit on the couch and read. We've stayed before and wanted to come back...just fix these items. Please.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this place because of the price. Love this place for lots of reasons I didn't know about at the time: the made to order free breakfast, the free evening hospitality beverages (wine and beer); the oh so comfy beds; the recycling and green aspect.....
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible place in the core of Austin. We were very positive impact in general for the "green concept" of the place; very nice and 100% recomendable; very nice ratio of quality-price. Thank you everyone there.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went for a 2 night-3 day trip hoping for a mini vacation but only ended up staying for one night. We had issues with sugar ants as well as roaches. The room was not very clean, which I was semi-willing to overlook as we had asked for an early check-in. (Until the bug issue.)
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay exceeded expectation in every regard. The suite was excellent. The custom breakfast was superb. The happy hour was generous. However, this does not capture the "top drawer" feeling we had in everything from the glassware, service, appointments, and the peace and quiet. Excellent.My wife and I have traveled extensively and this is one of the best values and accommodations that we have experienced.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff, cleanliness, location, value excellent. But serious shortcoming of long, exterior, staircase to suites in dangerous disrepair makes rating unacceptable for children and seniors and just slightly better for able bodied adults. "Tired" rooms could use updating.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely setting with plants and trees everywhere. Pool felt like it was in the woods. Rooms are suites with kitchen and living room, so very practical. A comfortable and peaceful stay. Hope to get back soon!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms here are very large, with stoves and fridges for cooking, and a living room area with fireplace. The hotel grounds are well maintained and very green and cozy, despite the location near an in-transition redevelopment area. The breakfasts are very fresh, cooked to order and included in the price of accommodation, as are daily afternoon wine and light hors d'ouevres. The rooms are clean and there's a small swimming pool. Our room was getting a bit worn looking - the rug and the kitchen cupboards, for example - but it wasn't really an issue as we didn't use the kitchen. However, management should do some upgrading before soon. However, service was great and housekeeping kept everything very clean. One other issue is that the hotel is not within walking distance of downtown, but it's really a great value and only about 10 minutes drive to downtown.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent fresh, homemade food for breakfast as well as social hour. Spacious rooms with kitchen and living room. The pool and gardens are beautiful! Staff friendly and accommodating. Good, central location.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 5 nights here while visiting Austin and races at COTA. All I can say it is an excellent choice for the value for the money. You get a 1 bedroom apartment for the money with breakfast. While the furnishings may be a bit dated, the room was immaculate, the housekeeping superb and very quiet! Every single person on the staff is welcoming, friendly and courteous. The breakfasts are vegetarian and have set choices of egg dishes, there's terrific coffee, teas, greek yogurt, cereal, biscuits and gravy & breads. You also get a happy hour of wine, beer & snacks every evening except Sunday.You also have a kitchen and can cook your own. Go shopping at Ranch99 Supermarket (Chinese foods!) which is 5 minutes by car.While it is in north Austin, it is the perfect place to visit UT. If you want to go downtown you can get there by walking 5 minutes to the Metrorail in 15 minutes (#.50 each way/daily pass for rail and buses $7). There's several very good restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Vivo in particular is excellent.We travel quite a bit and look for good value. You'll find it here at Habitat Suites. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bed was bad, toilet had no running water, night staff was horrible and breakfast disappointing. For the price stay at the Hyatt house. For the quality stay at extended stay America, it is much less expensive and toilet will work.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I brought my parents in a last minute trip to Austin from the Dallas suburbs. I did not know that the hotel was so eco-friendly. The landscape incorporated edible plants and there were many nice touches. The breakfast was healthy and yummy.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visit austin frequently for business and pleasure and always try to stay at habitat suites. It's clean and quiet and reasonably priced. Very comfortable. And the Buffett breakfast is included it's not downtown but it's only a 10 - 15 minute drive from downtown
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Value for money. Excellent service!~ Very clean/ Excellent location for our workshop. Quality of bed and sleep exceptional, Very good service for daily cleaning. Rooms are perfect. Very well designed with great comfort.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service is fantastic, from the moment we arrived everyone went above and beyond to make it easy for us. From the first smile of your front desk employee to the final smile of your front desk employee, this was the perfect stay. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, the breakfast provided healthy choices. Kitchen staff were friendly, helpful and a joy to converse with they also accomoldated us when we overslept due to the time change. Although this is not one of the newest examples of your choices in Austin, it is a refreshing example of what a great place to stay for a great rate is and should be.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed at the hotel three consecutive years for SXSW. The area is very much improved since the first stay. Many new restaurants in the area and the addition of the Austin Film Society theatre. The hotel is perfectly fine and is a good value.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This quiet, relaxing hotel is tucked away in a former shopping mall. The property used to be an apartment complex. There is plenty to do within a short distance, and this hotel is only a ten minute drive to downtown. The neighborhood is filled with restaurants, cafes, and other shops. Additionally, the staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. I particularly enjoyed sleeping in their bed, which was incredibly comfy. Best pillows ever! Last but not least, I was very impressed with the breakfast. There were a lot of options to choose from, and you even have a choice of a hot breakfast made to order. I’ll definitely be back!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a bit out of town, but drove in to have appetizers & drinks at the beautiful Driskill Hotel. Then headed down 6th St. to listen to some fun live music. It was nice & quiet back at the Habitat. We really enjoyed Austin!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the professionalism at check-in to the fire crackling in the fireplace, this would have been an absolutely perfect stay except for the lack of hot water to take a shower. Highest quality bedding made for great rest. I just wanted to have a shower and couldn't stand the cold water.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spend the money and stay at a Hilton or Marriott. You would be more comfortable and have more amentities. I booked for the size of the room and overall it was really nice to have extra space but everything else was just blah and boring. The carpet was dirty, stinky and damp. They couch had a unpleasant odor, the fridge was old and had some questionable splatters on the door. The towels had hair from a previous guest all over them. They had a room service menu in the room but yet don’t serve dinner and lunch nor do they have room service. Next time my family will be staying at a Hilton or Marriott.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked for 3 nights but decide to leave after 1 night. The rooms were outdated and kind of scary.The tv was way too small for a 2 bedroom size. However the breakfast was good and very friendly staff. Just hoped the rooms were cleaner and updated. It felt kind of scary.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here at the mid-point of a two-week drive across the Southern US. It was the best hotel we stayed in, by a long shot. The place had a similar feel to resort-style accommodations in the Rockies. Private gardens, a beautiful pool, and walkable grounds. Great restaurants a ten-minute walk away. The rooms are very comfortable, with a separate bedroom. A high-quality fresh vegetarian breakfast as well. We are looking for an excuse to go back to Austin just to stay here! Pool is seasonal.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so pleased with guest services. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted right away with a warm smile. I felt welcomed and at ease since it was my first time to Austin and, of course, Habitat suites. The property is quaint and lovely. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Even though, the facility is older, it has been very well kept.I enjoyed it!
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recommend Habitat Suites for a spacious, easy place to stay while in the Austin area. Easy parking, welcoming hospitality, great breakfast were all included. Nearby restaurants and a quick drive or taxi to Austin sites.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We need an affordable, safe, comfortable, and convenient lodging option close to the UT campus. Habitat Suites provides that. Only 10 minutes from UT and downtown Austin, this property is just off I-35 but feels like it is in the country. The prime location and uniquely landscaped grounds create a remote, quiet, and relaxing environment that is enjoyable to return to. Not fancy, but the rooms are clean and well-maintained. A complimentary and excellent hot breakfast is provided in the poolside restaurant, plus a daily happy hour cold buffet. The grounds are a special treat with lemon trees, palms, roses, pomegranates and other plantings. You can't beat it for the money.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They serve a very good hot breakfast with choice of healthy foods. Friendly, helpful employees. Plenty of parking. Quiet rooms. Within 0.5 miles of Highland Metro station.Austin has a lot of road construction ongoing, but the Habitat Suites has pretty close access to the I35.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon our arrival the room was disgustingly dirty . Condom on the floor, cups with liquid in them, dust, etc.When I asked to speak to the manager, I was told that she was busy and would call me.When she finally called, she accused me of fabricating the story and never came to look at the room.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the room and location were exactly what I wanted the other aspects of this hotel make it a stay away. Was made to wait for a room at check in and promised a call when it was ready that never came. Finally came back on my own two and a half hours later and it had been ready for some time. Also a staff member opened my door without knocking and with the do not disturb sign on the door. The front desks response was that was "just housekeeping". I would not feel comfortable having my wife or daughters stay here. I was also told they would email a receipt at checkout which did not happen. Its a shame they are lacking as the room was large and the area quiet and central.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service. Close by to some the of the bigger Austin districts. The area around the hotel was still in development but I can't wait to see it expand. Definitely worth the price we paid. Will be coming back again.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honest, open and accommodating. Habitat suites are quiet, and off the main drag which I like. I am happy to see all of the new development in the area. I think new signage would benefit the property. Not sure how the fee estate is setup there, but it works for me. Thanks
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at Habitat Suites Hotel. The landscaping promoted an oasis feel while still being in the city. The room was comfortable, clean, and functional. The cabinetry and appliances were dated, but clean. There was simple cutlery and dishes available in the room. The breakfast was a step up from other hotels we have visited. I enjoyed the availability of vegetables as well as gluten free bread as options for breakfast. I was able to put together a well rounded breakfast that met my dietary restrictions. My only complaint was that the bed pillows were all very thick. I did not ask at the front desk if they had different pillows as I was able to use a sofa pillow. I suggested that they consider providing pillows in a variety of thicknesses in their rooms.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Home away from home. Attention to detail to include the benches outside the doors. Enjoyed the breakfast each morning. Loved the ambiance of the evening social hour. Staff were friendly and catered to requests.
hotelName:
21    Habitat Suites Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has been here for as many years as I've been in the Austin area I think, around 9 now. You would never know that the lobby would have an atrium from the outside. When i booked, I didn't know dogs were okay until I saw a few. I never heard or smelled any so that was a good thing. Nice furnishings and the place is well taken care of. Keep up the good jobs folks!

review_body: In Austin to visit family for Mother’s Day weekend, we got a good online deal on this hotel. We did not know before booking the room that Wyndham had acquired La Quinta’s brand in 2018. But upon arrival Wyndham’s influence was evident. In our experience, LQ has usually been a safe, clean moderately-priced option for lodging on the road, so we would’ve likely booked it no matter what, and we have no way of knowing what the property was like before the Wyndham buyout, but this place was genuinely the nicest LQ property we’ve stayed at anywhere.The lobby area/front desk was clean and well-appointed. Modern and bright, it offered a great first impression of the hotel. The check-in process—primarily completed and paid for online—was easy and painless…and the hotel staffers in the area were very friendly and engaged us in nice conversation. They accommodated our early arrival too. (Check-in time is 3 pm CT.)Still, the first impressions and friendliness of the staff won’t cover up a bad room for long…so we were anxious to see the accommodations. Room 253, on the courtyard (interior) side of the hallway, was our destination and it was not a disappointment. The room itself seemed big and not cramped. The design of the room provided for good room for two double beds while still leaving plenty of room for movement by a couple of folks sharing the space. A nice desk/work area was situated in a corner next to a window, which was a nice touch. Anyone actually having to do work from the room would have the luxury of pulling back the curtain and taking advantage of the view.The mattresses on the beds were a little bit softer than we usually like—but our tastes are for firm beds. But these were not mushy by any stretch of the imagination and very easy to sleep on. TV was mounted on a swivel base to make it easy to watch from any corner of the room. Channel selection was limited, though…don’t go looking to spend time surfing a ton of cable channels. There was also a room refrigerator and coffee maker.The bathroom was roomy and clean. The shower provided a strong flow of water and plenty of hot water too. However, the toilet did make an odd sound (possibly air in the pipes??) when flushed. It wasn't a one-time deal either. It wasn't a problem for us, but we could see how it might be a nuisance for someone who needed to take care of business in the middle of the night while others were sleeping.The property itself is located adjacent to The Domain, an upscale shopping/dining/entertainment/residential/office area on the north side of Austin. If you were coming to town for a getaway weekend, this hotel is literally within walking distance of some nice retail shops, restaurants and movie theater. We had tickets to the Round Rock Express baseball game at Dell Diamond and the location of this property made it very easy to get to and from the stadium in approximately 15-20 minutes each way (although it might take longer if you look to avoid toll roads).Since we do have family in the immediately vicinity, we frequently travel to Austin. And we will definitely be booking this spot again when we do. Great experience!

review_body: We had planned on coming to Austin for the birth of our 6th grandchild but our son's first child. We received a call saying that they might need to induce for medical reasons. We drove all day and into the night from New Orleans to Austin. We made it in time for the birth of our grandson. After being up for 30 hours, we grabbed some breakfast and while eating started looking for a place to stay. We found an online deal, paid for it and headed to the Staybridge Suites at 1611 Commerce Drive in Austin. We were pleasantly surprised. The manager, Angelica, helped us check into our room early. Our room as well as the overall hotel was extremely clean. The staff was very helpful from recommending local eating places to helping us extend our stay. I would recommend staying at this location whether for business or pleasure.
hotelName:

review_body: We arrived early afternoon from the the airport and quickly got checked into the room. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very sweet employee that answered questions about food and activities to do around us. I slept on the pull out sofa bed and believe it or not, I slept amazing. I woke up the following morning hit to on site gym facilities and took a swim in the pool followed by a light breakfast. I will definitely be staying here next time I am in Austin.
hotelName:

review_body: Had the pleasure of staying here the other night with a group of friends after a concert in town, and the staff was fantastic! I called earlier in the day to let them know that we would be arriving a bit late and they had our keys prepared and our rooms all checked in so that all I had to do was sign a few dotted lines and we were in the rooms within 5 minutes, which was great! The rooms were spacious and clean, with soft pillows that were not worn out, fluffy towels, and a super comfy bed.Breakfast was great in the morning, hot fresh waffles are always the best!! The breakfast area was bright and airy, with a great selection of hot and cold breakfast offerings (cereal, oatmeal, waffles, fruits, yogurt, and on and on) and the staff was very attentive so tables were clean and nothing got cluttered. All around a fantastic stay, definitely recommended!

review_body: I was pleasantly surprised at how roomy and clean the room was! The carpet was a little old, but otherwise everything was great. Breakfast had decent choices (scrambled eggs, sausage, yogurt, cereals, muffins, breads), but the coffee was the weak link -- one of those push-button automatic machine things, and was not very flavourful or strong enough (even on the "strong" setting). But staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall great value!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to the Staybridge Suites by Austin Airport because of location and mid-range price. I was pleasantly surprised with everything that we received for the price. At check-in we were greeted by a really nice gal & it happened to be her birthday. She was working on her birthday but so cheerful. Our room or "suite" had a king bed in a room with a door and bathroom. There is a living room, writing table and kitchen area with a full-sized fridge, stove, microwave and sink. The kitchen has table service & cooking supplies. There is a tv in bedroom and living room. The bed is comfortable and tub is nice sized. Everything is very clean. The "free" breakfast really is a full breakfast and even includes coffee, tea, sodas, juices, milks, fresh waffles, fruit, biscuits w sausage gravy, oatmeal, muffins, yogurts, etc etc etc....It's a lot of food to choose from. There's a business center here which we found very useful and free wi-fi and free parking. This really did feel like a home away from home. I think the only hotel we've stayed at where the staff were friendlier might be Disney (except our check-in gal even beats Disney). This was a close and convenient hotel to everything we needed. You can drive about 1.5 hours and go to see the Alamo and Riverwalk----worth the drive and close to UT, Downtown Austin, and so much more.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The lobby wasn't very impressive, but beyond that, I was very impressed. The room was clean and comfortable. The room had a mini kitchen, couch, queen size bed. Furnishings were nice, comfortable, and the room was clean. Public areas were clean and well maintained. Dinner and breakfast was included with the room. For dinner, one night was sub type sandwiches, chips, and salad. The second night was bbq quesadillas, chips, and salad. Sodas and beer was included, but I don't drink alcoholic beverages. The hotel was quiet. Very comfortable business center and common area with fireplace. The hotel was just a short drive to restaurants and shopping. Any time I am in Austin, I will plan to stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travel a lot and Staybridge was a wonderful break from the monotony of your standard hotel. It's really nice to have a full kitchen and space to stretch out and relax. This hotel was quiet, clean, and well maintained. Proximity to the highway was convenient and the location seemed safe. Staff was also very friendly and welcoming. Next time we come through Austin we will most certainly stay here again!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found this nice hotel on line after the convention hotel was booked up. Hotel was only 4 miles from the convention and had easy access to and from the convention. The breakfast was very good with waffles, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, and fruit along with other items that were available. Room was a 1 bed queen, good TV, microwave, ice box with ice maker, kitchen pots and pans, and coffee pot.Front desk personal were very friendly. Unable to try the pool because of weather. available pool side they have gas grills for some grilling if desired.i'll probably stay here again at the mid-winter convention.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In all my years, I have never been to such an amazing hotel. They let me check in early. I was kind of in an awkward situation and the manager “The Kevin” was very compassionate and let me check in early. He just charged a small fee instead of charging me for a whole other night. He had a great attitude even though it was so early.Breakfast buffet hit the spot and got me ready and wanting to start my day. Free Cheeseburgers and Beer for dinner? Places like this exist? What?Where has this hotel and these people been all my life?!I love it so much I extended. The bed is so comfortable Perfectly placed in a clean room. The room has everything I could possibly need! A hotel room with a bed room makes it feel just like Home.Kevin even hooked me up with a balcony suite. I have never felt so special. Thank you so much Staybridge Suites!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is always a pleasure coming back to this hotel. I happened to have arrived too early prior to regular check-in time; the manager allowed me to check-in early. That made it a whole lot of a difference because I was traveling with family. I was able to attend my meeting without worrying about my family. The rooms were awesome and above all, the staff of the hotel. The staff are very professional and friendly; they made my stay very pleasant.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very impressed with this hotel. We always book a Staybridge in whatever city we are visiting. We were celebrating a birthday and the hotel staff put balloons and a little birthday bag of goodies in our room for when we arrived. The room was very clean and staff very nice!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms. The beds are comfy and the shower head pressure is good. The breakfast had lots of options to choose from which was a plus. I would recommend to others for future stays.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times and each time has been excellent! The rooms were nice and clean, amenities were great, and staff was very friendly. Kevin at the front desk was also very helpful during my stay! I will definitely be back next time I'm visiting Austin :)
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I made the reservation I was a little concerned because I could find out much about the location, but when I arrived hotel was conviently located closed to my destination. This place rocks with breakfast, drinks during the week and delivery service when you forget your running shoes in your room. thanks staff and especially Kevin for getting my shoes back to me.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our flight to the east coast was cancelled and the supervisor at Southwest Airlines gave us a voucher to stay overnight at Staybridge Suites, a 5 minute drive from Austin airport. We were picked up from the airport by the hotel shuttle van driven by Eunice, a front desk staff. Very pleasant and nice, Eunice was hopefully going to be a an indication of what our overnight stay would be. Eunice also handled the booking & room assignment. She did everything efficiently. By the way, after parking the van in front of the hotel, Eunice also brought the luggage cart, there was no bellhop or doorman to assist us. We had 5 pieces of luggage & 2 smaller bags and we had to load the cart, push it into the elevator to our 3rd floor room with a view, again courtesy of Eunice. The room is nice, clean, had a small pantry with microwave, a ref, a coffeemaker, an 2 burner electric stove. Big bed, a cable TV, it’s own AC unit.From 5:30 to 7:00 on Wednesday, burgers & salad, fruits, fried, soda or beer or wine is available for guests. Other days, some other food offering. It’s a no frills hotel. It has a small gym with a treadmill, a stationary bicycle, weights and another out of order machine. It has an outdoor pool, don’t know if it’s heated. The following day, we took the hotel shuttle to the airport. It’s a nice hotel, friendly staff and very close to the airport.Highly recommended if you need to be near the airport.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay here the rooms are clean, smell clean and the customer service is great. I stayed in the studio it had fridge stove and microwave with everything you need to cook and eat with.The breakfast served here is very good. I strongly recommend this place its non- smoking and quiet.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A few weeks beef this I stayed at the HI just down the road (See review). That was a fantastic property so the bar was pretty high. Understand that they are different (i.e. this is an extended stay) and with this said it did not disappoint. Awesome feature, early free breakfast. Awesomer? They start even earlier than that say. Make eating before a flight possible.Oh the room, predictable, clean, ample room for business stuff. Quiet and relatively up to date. This hotel is a good option, especially if you Wish to prepare some of your own food. Polite staff, which I usually find in Texas!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Please let Kevin know how his professional and compassionate assistance turned my day around. My flight was delayed and United Airlines provided a reservation at Staybridge Airport location. Kevin greeted me with a smile and handled every concern. Arranged shuttle return for next morning and packaged breakfast to-go. The shuttle drivers were so polite and efficient.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here is great, pleasant, and handle things in a timely manner! There is no possible way I could complain. Kevin made sure to inform us of breakfast times, and local events going on. They helped my stay in Austin be that much better!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first stay in any Staybridge Suites but will not be my last. The weekday social was an unexpected perk to go along with clean comfortable rooms and a friendly staff. Breakfast was there but very limited options.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a stay at Staybridge and accidentally went to the wrong one! The Kevin, was so friendly and so helpful. He not only gave us some water for our way, but also helped us figure out where we were going! I would have stayed if I could. Thanks (the) Kevin!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One night only. Check in quick, room huge and clean, nice set up. Staff helpful at front desk, beds comfortable, bathroom fantastic . Close to airport and motorways. NO NOISE and perfect for a commuter or overnight stay.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My airline dropped the ball on a promised comped room and Jose worked directly with the airline company, on my behalf, to get me a last second room. He spent over 30 minutes speaking to multiple departments and waiting on hold while seamlessly checking in guests and cleaning the lobby. He even ensured that I got freshly brewed and warm coffee. Quick, upbeat, polite, and genuine. This will forever be my go-to when visiting Austin. Thanks Jose.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a former flight attendant for 18 years, I have stayed at hundreds, if not thousands of hotels. The Conference at which I was a speaker paid for my stay at this airport hotel. I didn't have huge expectations, but then the hotel van picked me up. Olivia was one of the most positive drivers I've ever had, and so uplifting after a long day of travel. The front dest staff (Christian and all of the ladies he worked with) and the other drivers like Angel and Esperanza were super. I think the Staybridge Suites HR department hit the jackpot at this property. Nice work!!!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in with Cristian on Thursday, didn't see him again until Sunday morning where he greeted me by name. Who still does that?! Our shuttle drivers, Miguel and Angel were polite and prompt and Olivia was a bright and happy welcome first thing in the morning on our way to the conference and at the end of the day in the afternoon. There are ways to provide service, and then there are ways to exceed expectations. This crew goes above and beyond. I'd be happy for my travels to bring me here to this hotel again.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly attentive staff go out of their way to accommodate reasonable needs (& at times going above & beyond!). A very clean comfortable place in a quiet out of the way location that even offers free dinner & beer 3 nights a week.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Staybridge Airport, close to airport and downtown, very convient location. I was impressed with the great service and staff. They were very courteous and answered all my questions. I had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: How is this hotel not Top 10? I used to stay at the Microtel. Little did I know, Austin's best kept secret was right across the street. Staybridge Suites has everything you need for an Extended Stay. My favorite amenity has to be the barbecue pit. I also appreciate the top notch service from Haley and The Kevin and Cristian, Jose, Eunice & Nora and everyone. Don't forget housekeeping, the unsung heroes. I'll be back next week 8D
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our flight home was delayed so that we were going to miss our connection, and the airline provided us a night here. The room was spacious and comfortable albeit a bit dated, and the hotel was close to the airport and only a short ride from our favorite patio. We didn't take advantage of the hotel amenities as we were only there about 12 hours in total from check-in to check-out, but the shuttle to the airport was great and the staff was all friendly. My only complaint is that the air conditioning unit was very loud and I'd misplaced my earplugs, so I didn't sleep well.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel offers all the amenities you are looking for when traveling!Kitchen – just like home only smaller. dishwasher, fridge, and microwaveDVD player with movies in the lobbyhigh speed Internet serviceThe desk has power outlets above the desk.Flat screen TV with swivels to watch on the couch or bed.Nice breakfast with coffee, waffles, toast, cereal, eggs, bagels, 3 way juice dispenser (apple, cranberry, orange), yogurt, canned fruit, muffins and soda fountain.The location was very convenient to us. We mainly came here to shop and relax, and found that everywhere we went was no more than a 10 to 15 minute drive (including downtown). There isn't a lot around the hotel, except maybe for a few other hotels and the airport.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay here was amazing I met really nice workers there I really enjoyed the wonderful friendly service I got from Olivia she's absolutely the best. I am happy we decided to stay here the complimentary breakfast and dinner was off the chain
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was in town for a quick getaway and booked my room at Staybridge Suites by the Airport. Spoke with Kevin at Staybridge to make reservation, super friendly btw, and once I arrive, was really happy to be greeted with a friendly face and a super quick check in. Loved my room, breakfast was awesome, and Kevin really made my vacay that much better!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice place to stay in Austin. It's well located and a good price for an Austin hotel. The customer service is great though, especially Jose at the the front desk. He consistently went above and beyond to meet the needs of my family. And the ladies in the dining area are super nice and we're always helpful. I recommend staying here for work or leisure.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel staff was very accommodating, treating me and my wife are a valued guest. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was hot and fresh with no need to stop again until lunch.Would recommend anyone needing overnight or more to stay here.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recommend the Staybridge Suites Airport to students coming to our training classes as well as overseas colleagues. They have a shuttle to pickup folks from the airport as well as dropping them off at the hotel or grocery store. Jose at the front desk is cheerful, attentive and dependable. He takes good care of our guests and delivers items in a timely manner. The Staybridge is a nice, cozy, homey hotel.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jose, the manager on duty, was very helpful in fixing a reservation problem that would have negatively effective our whole experience. He truly went above and beyond to ensure our happiness. Room was clean and cold. Would stay here again without hesitation.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great services and easy access by complimentary hotel shuttle to the airport. The shuttle will also take hotel guests to places within three miles from the hotel. That is enough to cover many malls and eateries along the main artery East Riverside Drive.We returned the rental car two days before our departure but that didn't stop us from going downtown by catching the metrobus 100 on East Riverside Dr just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Nice short ride around 15 minutes to Congress avenue and costs $1.25 per person but requires exact change.If not, take advantage of the recent return of Uber and Lyft to Austin and their promotion codes for free or discounted rides.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was comfortable and a nice size, including a kitchenette (which we didn't use). We appreciated having the sink and mirror separate from the toilet and shower so we could both be getting ready at the same time. The free breakfast had many options and plenty for our varied tastes. Location was good and convenient to the places we visited.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Due to work I spend about over 100 hotel nights per year mainly at Marriott, Hyatt, Hilton, or Sheraton so I would call myself a experienced guest . However, this stay at Staybridge Suites was for a sport event my son and I visited in Austin. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel, the staff was on of the nicest and helpful I have met in a long time, very clean and quiet rooms, comfortable beds, great breakfast. I'll for sure use the hotel again for next years visit.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything I need and more. Shout out to Eunice and The Kevin. Let's not forget Haley!! They do it right. I'll never stay anywhere else again. Not even the other Staybridge will cut it. I like the views and the BBQ Pit. Yummmmmmm
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at a staybridge suites before at another location which was great. But the staybridge suites austin airport has kicked it up a notch! The Kevin who works overnight shift is on point! I leave for work very early in the am at 02:30, Kevin makes sure there is hot coffee ready for me and a breakfast to go. All the staff here is very friendly and have plenty of recommendations for things to go do in the austin area. Definitely would recommend anyone to stay here if your in austin for an extended stay!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying at the Staybridge off Airport Commerce on business over 5 years. Although staff may changed over the years, the service of staff and their friendliness is always constant. The rooms are aways clean and the beds very comfy. Totally love the little kitchenettes, such a plus when not up to driving in Austin trafffic. I can go to a local store and stock up and cook or microwave food. Of course there is the meet and greet which offers wine for those who would like to unwind after a long day or just enjoy gathering to meet friendly folks and a meal to big to call a "snack". So look forward to staying whether it be business or family fun...
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When my husband and I made a quick trip to Austin for a fundraiser, I was a little dismayed to see that he had picked a hotel near the airport. Usually I like to be somewhere within walking distance of shops, restaurants, etc. The hotel shuttle picked us up within 10 minutes and the ride to the hotel was short. The front desk staff was welcoming and friendly and very informative. Our room was clean and comfortable and very quiet. When we asked about local restaurants we found that there was only one within the three mile distance the free hotel shuttle can take you. Since we are explorers, we decided to walk a few blocks each way and see what we could find. We found a bus stop within half a block of the hotel and my husband checked his phone for a schedule as advertised at the stop. Since it was our first night in town, we decided to not venture much further and out of curiosity went to the the JD Market #5 just across from the hotel on E. Riverside Dr. To our delight, there was a hot food bar with delicious tacos, enchiladas, and sautéed vegetables. There was a Mexican bakery, snacks, fruit and full strength beer and wine. We ordered take out dinner and bought a bottle of wine for a delicious, relaxing first night in our hotel. All rooms are equipped with dishes, flatware, glasses, etc. After a wonderful and varied breakfast the next morning, we took the bus into downtown Austin and started the weekend. We didn't have to get up at the crack of dawn the day we left as the hotel shuttle took us straight to our airline gate. We also took advantage of the "Uber" type rides offered; check the front desk for a $5.00 off your first ride card. We also found out that Staybridge is part of the Holiday Inn hotels, (The IHG rewards club) so we accumulated points for future stays at various hotels.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at this location. The staff was friendly, room was clean and good size. The hotel also had a free washer and dryer. There is a full breakfast. Overall, we were very pleased with our experience.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel a lot and Stay Bridge is always a great bet. It's really nice to have a full kitchen and space to stretch out and not feel cooped up. This hotel was really really quiet and very clean. The staff knew exactly what they were doing and that isn't always the case at ever hotel. Everything was well maintained and well kept. The weather was chilly so I didn't get to spend much time in the outdoor space but it was really nice. The pool looked awesome and there was a nice fire pit. The breakfast was top notch and the sitting area and lobby near the breakfast area was a great space to eat and relax. not just table and chairs but nice gas logs and high top tables and stools and different kinds of seating. I would rank this hotel a 10 for 10. It covered all the bases and was well priced. I was really pleased and would definitely visit again.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I returned last weekend for yet a second stay and was even more impressed than my first stay. Walked in to check in said my name and I was done in under a minute. They remembered me from my last visit and even gave me the same room. I guess all the beds are the same but for some reason I love the bed in room 32- I'm not giving you the number because I want that room next visit hehehe. I'm a night owl but this is one of the few hotels that I'll wake up for breakfast and yes it's probably because of the Texas shaped waffles. This is my hotel in Austin. Oh and Breakfast is free.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room; the fitness center were outstanding. The staff provided excellent service during happy hour; food and beverage was excellent. The type of service provided during happy hour is better than those in restaurant were you actually pay for the service.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the best experience ever.The staff was very attentive and friendly. The rooms were very clean and spacious. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying near the Austin airport.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Staybridge Suites Austin Airport location in a new and spacious hotel located within minutes of the airport. This place seems quite new and offers a ton of amenities. There's a very large courtyard in the middle of the property that includes a pool, full-size gas grills, and tons of seating. There's even a basketball court! Great for relaxing after a long drive day or getting out of the room if you're here for a while. We especially enjoyed the size of the rooms. Ours was a suite with a couple TVs, DVD player. couch, desk/work station and then a separate bedroom. The beds were super comfy and the kitchen had a enough room to actually cook in. With that said, why cook when you don't have to! Staybridge offers a complimentary evening meal during the week. We enjoyed the salad bar and meatball subs after we checked in. There were also dessert options, coffees, teas, and sodas available. There was even beer and wine available -- on the house! This place offers a lot, but one thing to note in particular is how close it is to the Austin Airport. We're talking 5 mins. Great if you've got an early flight or late arrival. We were driving, but there's also a free shuttle available. Staybridge Suites Austin Airport has all this and more, including free wi-fi, breakfast, and a very well equipped fitness room. Don't think about it. Stay here!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I keep coming back for nice service and smiles I get during my stay. Liz always provides the up most professionalism during my stay from customer service to providing hotel amenities superbly. Thank you Strawbridge staff for all you do.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could live at this hotel. Really comfortable, large rooms, very quiet. Free dinner with really good food and the complimentary breakfast is excellent, lots of options, very healthy. The staff is above and beyond helpful and friendly, everyone I interacted with was absolutely lovely. You can really feel the extra care that goes into making guests feel at home. The pool and courtyard area are really nice, and they even have a basketball court! Close to the airport and downtown, the location was convenient and parking was a breeze. Will definitely stay again when I;m in Austin. Love it here!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stay was amazing, with a very clean and organized room, closed amenities and great customer service. We definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying here at least twice a month. Front desk was always available and very friendly.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gina was working the front desk and was extremely rude to us. We were here with a party of 5 and had requested early arrival ahead of time and Gina denied it and when I told her that it was something previously arranged she pretended to ask her boss and came back and said that they hadn't gotten calls that day, so a couple of us had to wait hours for the rest of the party to arrive before they would admit us. Otherwise they demanded a new credit card. Gina and her "manager" were entirely uninterested in helping us and had terrible customer service. I would never stay in another Staybridge again or any of their affiliate hotels if this is their standard of care.
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay this week, Nov. 7-10, 2016. Great customer service at check in, clean room, good complimentary breakfast and social. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others. Thank you very much!
hotelName:
23    Staybridge Suites Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was a great place to stay. I stay in hotels almost every week and I must say the staff was one of the best. The rooms were very clean and had all the tools you will need for a longer stay. Thanks
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice place, friendly staff that goes above and beyond. Room was clean couldn’t ask for more from this stay. We parked our trucks & trailer here for 4 days and came back to say here for the 2 days we had left in Austin, cancelled our reservation for a different hotel because our experience here was great.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night before an early morning flight out of AUS. The hotel is clean with large rooms equipped with dishwasher, fridge and freezer, and microwave. Lots of desk space to work or set luggage. Complimentary breakfast was helpful but I’ve had much better quality complimentary breakfast at Best Westerns, thus, I’m giving this 4 stars.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in advance of a medical visit in Austin. Have stayed at a Home2Suite before, but this one was outstanding. Great workout room, nice outdoor area with good seating and bbq grills - didn't use grill, but did enjoy just sitting outside in this area. Available fruit infused water was delicious; lots of beverage options available 24/7. Breakfast selections were varied and quite good. The decor was very recent, cheery and colorful. Had a wonderful stay
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is newer and staff was very friendly. Bathroom was a little on the small side and room had no extra pillows but the room was clean that is more important to me. Free breakfast and good location.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shaira did a fantastic job at check in. She accommodated my request for a 1st floor room which was very appreciated. She always smiled and said hello when I walked by. Charles was the most personable maintenance person I've ever seen at a hotel. It's obvious he took pride in his work and he even came outside when I was loading up disappointed to see me leave and took the cart back into the hotel for me. Jarroe the night auditor was also very friendly and we frequently talked in the mornings. The hotel was fantastic for me. My only quibble is that the area needs some quality restaurant options.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location of this hotel! Staff was friendly. Hotel was quiet. The breakfast left something to be desired, but it wasn't horrible. The room was massive, which was nice! I will likely stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The suite set up for a king room was very nice especially for someone there for several days for work. Also, the complimentary hot breakfast was excellent with lots of choices. I would stay there again for a work trip!
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in 1 bedroom suite. Love this concept by Hilton. Excellent value. Having a separate bedroom makes it great when someone gets up much earlier than other person. This location looks pretty new. Front desk staff was great. Very clean rooms. Beds very comfortable. Bathroom was big with plenty of counter space plus couple of drawers to put stuff in. Breakfast choices were good. Chose this location due to family close by, but found no issues with the location getting anywhere we wanted to go quickly. Very convenient to toll road around Austin which is the best way to handle Austin.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed one night to catch an early flight and were impressed with the size and cleanliness of the room. I would recommend picking the top floor. I purposely did not, fearing plane noise, but instead heard the person above stomping around late into the night. I also think the rate is high for the level of hotel.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel based on age, brand experience and location. Stayed one night to make it to an appointment early the next morning. Loved the 24/7 drink offerings and the complimentary breakfast. Nice, modern decor with pleasant lobby. Stayed in a studio; nice closet space, kitchen with micro, fridge and dishwasher. Pleasant, well lit bathroom. Would be a great place for a longer term stay.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is just one step better than normal motel in us.breakfast is slightly better with some fresh fruit but no fresh juice / no hot meal. Gym is large but with not so many tools. room are big but air con is extremely noisy. nothing special. is in the middle of nowhere too far from the city downtown.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel manager & staff FAR EXCEEDED ANY & ALL REASONABLE EXPECTATIONS. I pointed out a nit-picky thing (because I'm type-A and travel almost every week) and the hotel manager's response was off-the-chart/over-the-top fantastic, even leaving a small gift for me in my room. She & the staff were the most pleasant people to talk to and her response was better than I've received at even 5-star luxury resorts. She earned my loyalty and I encourage everyone else to use this property because customer service like that, blowing away expectations, deserves to be rewarded. This manager should be offered the top management position at a Hilton luxury resort somewhere, because her attitude is just that good.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: That place is AMAZING !not only because is new but because the way staff takes care of every little detail ...cleaning and supplies ... even silverware was arranged with careful detail .Front desk, shuttle , kitchen ....every worker there really make effort to make you "be home " !
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could happily stay here for a week. Whoever designed this room must have sat around for days thinking, “Is there anything else we could possibly add that people might want?” Large refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, dishes and silverware...more storage space in the room and bathroom than I can remember seeing in a hotel...good lighting...plenty of outlets...great air conditioning...wonderfully soft sheets...nice staff! Breakfast was not as extensive as some but it was good and there were plenty of choices. I saw a reviewer complaint about airplane noise but our room was very quiet. A minor issue is that the pillows were a little bunchy because they seemed a bit big for their pillow cases. Also, there are not many restaurants nearby and if you arrive at rush hour, you may not want to re-enter that mess to go find one. The hotel staff recommended Javi’s, a Tex-Mex restaurant that we enjoyed. Listen carefully to the directions to get there though. It’s only across the freeway but if you get in the wrong turn lane, like we did, you could be there the rest of your life. It’s only because of the kindness of strangers that we finally escaped. :) Another staff recommendation was the restaurant inside the nearby Hilton Garden Inn, which gets good reviews on TA. A suggestion would be to offer guests a menu to see, especially since it’s in one of their sister hotels. But bottom line: Home2 Suites is a marvelous hotel near the airport that more than exceeded our expectations. Way to go, Hilton!
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One always assumes that when near the airport it might not be that nice. Wrong!!! Beautiful and clean.. Melody who checked me in.. was a wonderful and gracious host. We will definitely be back! Thanks so much guys!
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful, clean hotel. I really like the Home2 Suites hotels. I like the layout of the room, the kitchenette, the bathroom with amenities, the style, etc. I had one issue -- don't stay in room 414, because there is a loud humming noise, I'm guessing from some equipment on the roof. I was too tired and had a time crunch, but otherwise I would have asked for a different room. I had to use white noise to cover it up, and still I sort of felt it all night. Everything else was perfect.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent area, exceptional customer service, beautiful hotel inside and out, impeccable room suites, quiet hotel guest, breakfast sandwiches reminded me of Starbucks, plenty of parking. Friendly staff
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love staying at Home2Suites! The staff is always helpful and very attentive. I’ve never had an issue with this hotel or any Hilton’s. Beds are super comfy, room is always clean and tidy! Great for family or solo trips.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff, close to the airport and downtown. Our room was very clean, the linens soft and comfortable. the breakfast was great--fresh fruit and healthy choices. The hotel was quiet and very good to get a good night sleep.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We choose this hotel since it was close to the Circuit of Americas for an event we attended. It was a short drive and the hotel is newer. So it was very clean and the staff was very nice. The occupancy was low for our visit so that was a plus and it wasn’t too bad to get downtown or on a highway. Breakfast was they typical Home2 which is very good in my opinion. A big thing for me is eating on clean tables and this was kept up nicely. On the street it’s on, it was mostly hotels and it felt safe. Will definitely be staying here again.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here over the weekend for an event at Circuit of the Americas. It's close to the airport and about a 20 minute drive to downtown Austin. The "free" breakfast was actually one of the best free hotel breakfasts I've had. The king bed was also very comfy. Would stay at hotel again if I go to Austin. At $91 a night on Priceline I couldn't not stay here. Best price I could find.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night before an early morning flight. The room was clean and comfortable. Left too early to partake of breakfast. Despite being close to the airport the room was surprisingly quiet. The front desk staff was very helpful in suggesting a place for dinner. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and Close to the airport for our 6 am flight. The staff was friendly and check in was easy and quick. This is a new hotel so everything was in great shape. I will definitely come here again. Best of all the price was reasonable.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These Suites by Hilton are really nice to stay in for traveling. I loved the kitchen area and the hotel was really clean and easy to get to. This was the third of three Home2 Suites we stayed at during the week.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed twice on two different dates in on week. Both times staff was great however the second time the desk clerk seemed highly confused, also the second time not one mention that I am a silver honors member. or any welcome back at all. Now the rooms. Rooms are nice and clean no issues. Well other than the second time I checked in and was given the room I had selected on the app. Went to the room and someone was in it. Surprised both me and them I am sure. Went back to desk had to wait like 3 minutes for someone to appear. Got it resolved was given a second room that had a connector door. I hate rooms with connector doors. Anyway they finally got me a room that was fine. When asked about the room mix up the clerk said well the people in that room extended it and we just found out. Hmmm Anyway hotel was nice and quite with clean rooms. Breakfast was ok no issues other than you never see any breakfast staff and also they let the tables stay dirty with used dishes. Having stayed in the Holiday Inn down the street for one night I would probably have to choose them over this hotel next time. This one was close but needs to fine tune a few things.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Up to date hotel, delicious complimentary breakfast and good location. Upon check in I was given a parking tag to display on my dashboard. Traveling solo, at the end of a long drive, after I had schlepped all my bags inside, it was slightly annoying to have to go back out where my car was parked to put the tag in my rental car. Maybe it’s been an issue for people to leave cars parked onsite for long periods? I’ve never been asked at other Home 2 Suites properties to display a parking tag so I’m guessing it’s been a problem at this location. Other than that very minor complaint, stay was flawless.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great new hotel! Environmentally green, lovely seating areas inside and out, clever touches in furnishings, great pool and waterfall, and fun items at the breakfast bar, plus occas cookies,etc!
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first stay at Home 2 Suites, and we were very satisfied. It is clean, bright, and comfortable. The room is big enough for two people, with a sitting area for TV or work, and I like that they have a very usable kitchen. The bathroom was spotless, and I like their green approach to room cleaning, lighting, recycling, etc. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this property a couple of times but only for one night each time. The hotel is clean and well kept. The staff was friendly and engaging. The room was spacious so you did not feel cramped. I would consider using this property as an extended stay for my Austin trips. I like the way the outside seating is arraigned around the fire pit. Also, the seating inside was great if you just wanted to sit alone and read or if you wanted to cluster as a group to chat. One a personal downside. I found the bed to be very firm, in fact too firm for my comfort. In addition, the night stands seem to keep getting smaller and smaller. It makes it cramped to place my CPAP.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: I was impressed with everything in this Hotel except the complimentary breakfast. It had prepackaged omelettes, biscuits with eggs and sausage and things like that that had to be warmed in the microwave, but the rest was good, but it was served on real dishes.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: The room is much larger than we expected. The kitchen area was as big as a standard apt. They have a curtain dividing the living area from the bed area. The window covering is fantastic - you can block out all the light even in the afternoon. No strange lights or beeps or buzzing sounds to keep you up at night. I will stay here every time.

24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: Home2 Suites by Hilton in Austin Airport is home away from home. I will definitely consider of staying in this hotel whenever I travel. It was a great experience! I miss the complimentary breakfast now that I'm back home.

24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: I was very happy with my stay. The front desk clerk was friendly and processed my check in quickly. The hotel is still new and was very clean. The room was very comfortable and had good sound proofing and black out shades. The breakfast was better than most for hotels in this price range. The waffles were especially good!I highly recommend.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: Everything we needed at a great price. Close to airport, clean and nice rooms, and shuttles to and from airport. We left our truck here for a week. We would stay here again. Shuttle wasn't able to pick us up so they refunded us for a taxi.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: The location is minutes from the freeway and 10 minutes to downtown. Clean and spacious rooms. I love having a full sized fridge, microwave and utensils/dishes stocked in the kitchen area. Great breakfast selection. Everyone was happy!
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: A great, clean spot for business travelers and families with great proximity to both the airport and downtown. The blackout curtains worked phenomenally and the staff were incredibly helpful. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
