review_body: I stayed here for a week in June and this was the perfect place to be. Our flight arrived very early in the day and we went to the hotel with the intention of storing our bags until the room was ready. Instead, the desk attendant not only checked us in early, she upgraded our room. It was spacious with everything we needed, including a very comfortable bed, ample desk and counter space, and a full kitchen. Complimentary breakfast options were great whether we were sitting down to enjoy the hot food, or grabbing coffee and something small to take on our way out for the day. It was a short Lyft or Uber ride to everywhere we wanted to go. The pool was a great way to end each day, especially since it was in the high 90s/low 100s while we were there. Surprisingly, even though you're near the airport, it's pretty quiet at night. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Austin.One thing to note: it's a fairly new area, so the little streets/driveways can be tricky at first and easy to miss.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, bed was very comfortable. Like having the mini kitchen. The room is bright and cheery not so dark and drab. Would stay again. Staff was very helpful. The location was perfect close to downtown.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport

review_body: I had a great experience. Staff was helpful and the room was very clean. I would recommend this hotel for business or personal travel. The staff went above and beyond for an atypical request that I had.

review_body: Hotel well located near the airport. Facilities are good with all needed amenities. Nice reception area and a more than adequate breakfast bar. Rooms well appointed and comfortable with a full sized frige and microwave along with a dishwasher. Overall very satisfactory.
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were happy to use this new hotel for a park and fly experience to the Austin airport. The rooms were laid out nicely with so many wonderful features (refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishes, toaster, and 2 cup coffee maker), and layout worked nicely for our family of 4. The sheets were so comfortable and the size of the suite was quite spacious. The room we stayed in on our arrival night had an a/c unit that made a high pitch whistling sound every time the unit turned off, so that did take a while for us to adjust to, but eventually we slept through it. We alerted the management as we checked out, so hopefully they were able to fix the problem. Erkan at the front desk went above and beyond to help us with a shuttle situation and we were able to arrive in plenty of time for our 6am flight, in spite of the shuttle arriving late due to car trouble. He was super friendly and helpful. On our return night, we got a different room, and I can happily report the a/c unit was quiet, so we got a good night's sleep. The shuttle that night was broken down, but the hotel paid for our cab ride, so I can say the company does a great job of getting you to and from the airport, no matter what their shuttle situation is. I would definitely recommend this hotel for travelers who need a nice place to crash before or after an airplane trip!
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights at this relatively new hotel near the Austin airport. The staff were all cheerful and helpful, with Zed on the front desk in particular going out of his way to make us feel welcome. That said, the hotel does have some issues which bothered us. The room air conditioners are window units which are mounted right at bed level, with no way to adjust direction of air flow. We asked about options for diverting air flow and were told there was nothing they could do other than move us to a suite -- which they did at no charge, which was great. The suite had window units in both rooms with separate thermostats which I assumed would rectify the problem. However we never did understand how they worked as we turned off the unit in the bedroom but it still came on intermittently throughout our stay anyway, with no apparent correspondence or coordination to when the unit in the other room would come on. The other issue we had was with the seemingly poor construction of the building as we heard kid(s) in the room above ours running and jumping for prolonged periods of time. I called the front desk twice and Zed reported making trips to the room above both times, but with limited success. Thankfully the running and jumping stopped after several hours -- probably from the offenders being worn out -- but it was very annoying while it lasted. The hotel gave us bonus Hilton points for our experience as a token of apology, which was very nice. This was also an advance purchase stay for which we were overcharged two nights, but they refunded the difference when we called this to their attention. So they are definitely trying hard to please and earn a good reputation and the reason I gave them something higher than an "average" rating!
hotelName:
24    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Will definitely save this one to stay at EVERY time I'm in the area. The pool was great. The staff were friendly and the beds were soft and comfy. Even breakfast was unique and delish. Thanks to the staff and Hilton.

review_body: Room was clean and spacious. Very comfortable beds and a/c worked great. Went for a concert at the 360 amphitheater and stayed the night after. Would definitely go back but will be putting the “do not disturb” sign on the door.

review_body: Although my stay was for business, this hotel ranks in my top 2% of hundreds of hotels I've stayed in the past 2 years. review_body: Very clean hotel, with professional and friendly staff as well. You get a lot for the price that you pay. Wish I had gotten up earlier than I did to make it to breakfast -they have a great setup that is complimentary. Definitely will be back!

review_body: I've stayed at one other Home2, and had a great experience there as well. This particular property is located in an ideal space if you're doing anything north Austin or downtown. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I haven't stayed at any other hotel in this area, but you surely can't go wrong choosing this one.

review_body: Our stay was fantastic. We have never been to Austin, so we were unsure of the location of anything when we arrived. The location of the hotel was convenient, located just across from shopping and restaurants. The staff was friendly, my complimentary water bottles for being a Hilton Member was already in our room when we arrived, with my name on the bag. That was a great personal touch. The hotel room was very clean and comfortable. Lots of options for storage, the bed was very comfortable, great coffee (usually hotels have horrible in room coffee), and the black out shade was amazing.

review_body: I stay in Home2 Suites By Hilton between 20 to 22 March 2019 as provided by Amazon for my onsite interview. The rooms provided is large and spacious. Although it is puzzling, there are 2 televisions in the room, with a full feature kitchenette. The service crew is always friendly and approachable. I can approach them to change my morning wake-up call, approach for nearby amenities enquiry, and facilities usage. The only lacking lacking is a bath tub in the room. Other than that, the whole stay is enjoyable.

review_body: Staff is friendly and helpful at all times. Attentive and always cheerful. The hotel's ambience and environment made us feel like home and the facilities are very new and well maintained. The parking space is also huge and always available which is very convenient to us. Will stay in this hotel again when we are back to Austin for business or leisure.

review_body: Hannah was the best and most friendliest host I've ever encountered within hotel stay she made sure everything I needed was tended to. she should be promoted promptly, it would be in the hotel best interest..I will only stay here when I visit Austin!

review_body: Very nice building and very good location. Extremely friendly staff that is very helpful also. I was very impressed with the room size and amenities. I would for sure suggest this stay to anyone looking to stay in Austin!!

review_body: Hotel is relatively new. It was very well-maintained and very clean. The only negative I have is that a lot of the plugs in the rooms either connected to a lamp or to a charge station, did not work. The bathroom had some minor wear and tear but nothing that would cause a problem. They have a free breakfast which I haven't had yet! I would definitely stay here againm

review_body: The entire team was awesome. Veronic lead the way with her inviting personality that made you feel as if you were a member of their family. Due to unforeseen circumstances, they had to shut off the water @ 11:00p-5:00a, so the plumbers can fix an issue. Unfortunately, the noise from them working on the plumbing, prevented a good night's sleep. The team did everything they could to please us, and most importantly, Veronic took the time and explained to us why the work was completed at night, which was important. This let us know, the staff was about being transparent, and we appreciated that. They let us know it was only for the one night.Veronic and the other team members are awesome, and we'll be back.

review_body: I have been visiting the domain every month for work and since I am diamond member, Hilton properties are my first choice. Home2 Suite is my first option here with its proximity to domain. The staffs are friendly, rooms are clean and spacious. Everything is 5 star. However I just recently found out that Hilton Honours member only earn 5 points per dollar spent at Home2 Suite, compared to other properties, so reluctant to give 5 stars. I must stressed that this particular hotel is excellent but no longer my favorite as I want to maximize the point earned.

review_body: A few friends wanted to have a "Domain Night" where we could visit a few places in the Domain and have a some adult beverages and stay as late as we wanted and not worry about driving home to our husbands. We planned out a trip and apparently Domain hotels fill up fast, but this hotel had a few rooms on a night we were all free. It wasn't as close to the restaurants as we wanted but we figured it wouldn't be too embarrassing to just take an Uber to cross the street. Anyway, after making the reservations online, I called to make sure we could get the rooms next to each other. There were five of us so we got two two queen bed suites and were told we could not get an adjoining room since one of the rooms was not a king but she told us would do her best to save two rooms next to each other. The day of our trip, I called again and they already had saved our rooms next to each other. One of the members of our group got there about 4:30 to check in and the front desk staff couldn't have been nicer. As each person arrived, they were met with the same friendly attitude. The rooms were just as nice. They were very roomy and smelt delightful. There were plenty of accommodations too. You could tell that everything was clean. The beds were supper comfortable and I slept like I hadn't in years. The air conditioner did a great job. There was no noise from outside the room that was noticeable even though we were slightly near the elevators. I thought about having breakfast but when I went down, it was rush hour and I didn't feel like waiting but everything on the breakfast bar looked neat and no food messes anywhere around. Overall, we had a really nice time and enjoyed our stay. And I'm sure anyone in my party wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
25    Home2 Suites by Hilton Austin North/Near the D...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So...Smart travelers, you can either stay in a hotel, a motel or Home 2 by Hilton and enjoy all the warmth of you home. It only make sense, right? We chose a Queen Suite which came with a full size refrigerator, microwave oven, dishwasher work station/desk, WiFi and a sleeper sofa which was great for watching TV. We chose this hotel because we were traveling with family from out-of-town. This Home 2 Suite was less than 30 minutes outside of Houston Hobby airport and not far from Kemah, TX, a "Must" for relaxing, dining and enjoying family time. A full breakfast was included in our stay and served in a spacious dining area. Though we don't smoke, there is a very nice area outside with couches to accommodate guests. I used the fitness center, which was cleaner than our gym at home. If you're looking for the luxury of the Ritz Carlson with fresh flowers in your room every day, this is NOT your place to stay, BUT...if you appreciate value, a friendly staff, a comfortable bed and cleanliness, you'll love Hotel 2 by Hilton. Save money, stay safe & sound in your home away from home.
hotelName:

review_body: Whether you’re looking for a weekend getaway or long-term stay, Staybridge (North Palmer) is a great choice. Very clean, roomy, and awesome amenities like the pool and fitness area. The staff is so friendly I felt like I was surrounded by family. Carolyn always made sure we were ok, I was even able to grab some extra cookies for my late night Netflix watching in the spacious living room area :) . You can’t go wrong with Staybridge, you’re also surrounded by many stores and restaurants and only fifteen minutes away from downtown Austin.

At one point we needed extra comforters and Nikki brought it right up. The complementary breakfast was great. And the made sure to switch things up. There was a variety of choices of breakfast something for everyone. All the employees were kind and friendly. You can't go wrong staying there. Will definitely reccomend.

review_body: I stayed here for several days recently for business. The location was great as I needed to be in North Austin. While it's not downtown Austin in terms of excitement, the convenience was a major plus. The hotel is also adjacent to a Wal-Mart if you need to pick up supplies. The rooms seemed very new and spotlessly clean. They're also very quiet which was nice when I needed to get work done. Even though there was someone in the adjacent unit with a dog, I never heard a peep from them. +1 for good construction.The included breakfast buffet was another major convenience which allowed me to get a quick bite before I headed out to the office. While the eggs could have been better (they seemed like they sat out for too long), for free I really couldn't complain. There is also a good spread of fruit and pastries.The staff were all super friendly especially the women at the front desk. I hope to stay here again the next time I'm in Austin for business!

review_body: Starts with front desk, their agents. Most accommodating, great presence, demeanor. Clean hotel which is always a plus. Breakfast options are quite good and just enough, filling. 1BR Suite is spacious, clean, with full kitchen with all appliances, even a DW. Full sized fridge and freezer. Plenty of cabinet and counter space. Dishes, and not the cheap plastic patio kind either, sets of glasses including wine, pots pans bowls, large micro. Coffee maker and not the usual single serving kind either, rather you can make a pot/12 cups. Beds are comfortable. Vanity space outside of bathroom/shower. Two TVs. Comfortable sofa/sofa bed. Just really very comfortable and relaxing and I see no reason for guests not to give SBS a try, seriously.

I have seen her every morning of my stay and she personally checked in to make sure my room was OK and if I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. I rarely write reviews, but Kayla went out of her way to make me feel welcome here at Staybridge! I will be back! Also, my room was perfect - clean and spacious. Fitness center is bigger than most. Breakfast was delicious.

review_body: Closing an F1 racing weekend it has been a very positive experience at Staybridge Suites Austin N-Parmer Lane. Since we arrive Niki at the front desk was just exceptional with her kindness helping us to relocate to a more comfortable suite with shower, no bathtub and giving us greeting on our anniversary. Breakfast was good, Marco’s service during the breakfast was also a highlight, nothing was missing and everything was just in the right temperature and serving. The tempered pool was another highlight, for the hotel. Easy to access from the highway, with restaurants and supermarket very close. Just happy to recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
26    Staybridge Suites Austin North - Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived late Sunday evening and checked out the following Friday for a work trip. Nikkie sweetly greeted me by name each day. She genuinely cared when she asked me how my day was, and I impressively observed her as she walked around to every individual offering coffee, hot water, or just anything on the nights the social was not going on. Victor was very kind and eager to help others in the restaurant/lounge area. He graciously handled each persons needs every night. Kristen was there to greet us each evening we came back for work with a smile. She too was engaging, kind, and genuinely interested in the people that were staying there. Also, the rooms were amazing. It was homey, fresh, and spacious. Not to mention the AMENITIES! I truly loved everything about this hotel, and I am so thankful the staff added to the comfort of my stay as well. THANK YA'LL!!!!-Alyssa Martinez
hotelName:
26    Staybridge Suites Austin North - Parmer Lane
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my only 2nd stay with staybridge suites. First time was great and second time was greater! All because Nikki made the difference by her Awesome customer service. It was my daughter's 13th birthday and she went out of her way to make it special especially after working a double shift. Because of my great back to back experience with staybridge I will continue to book with them in the future. Very homey suites too!

review_body: So we spent 3 nights at this suites hotel and they were awesome. Location was very good if you want to stay close (15 min away) to main attractions in Austin but far from weekday’s traffic at downtown. Staff was always friendly, courteous and attentive since check-in to checkout. The suite was super comfortable: you have a kitchen with all basic appliances, a mini- living room to hang out and watch TV (good cable choices), the room was big enough for the 4 of us not to feel claustrophobic at any time, WiFi was fast, queen beds were super comfortable. Breakfast was included with reservation, and it was very good. I think there were some supper options for a fee but we were usually out at that time. All in all, it was a great stay. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, specially for group and family trips.
hotelName:

review_body: My family drove from Keller, Tx to see a heart specialist in Austin for our daughter. Upon reviewing hotels I came across Drake, the General Manager for Staybridge Suites in Austin off of Parmer Lane. I can't say enough about the way Drake and the hotel staff helped my family. In one way, the staff helped take the stressfulness of my daughters heart procedure off our minds with a very quite and calm room on the 3rd floor. The staff was GREAT when we stayed. The price of the 3 night stay was hands down the best. Our room was very clean. The breakfast buffet with the Texas shaped waffles were amazing. The evening reception was also top notch. My family will definitely stay again very soon.

review_body: Awesome hotel!! From the second I walked in the door I was impressed! I was greeted by Iris at the front desk who was both friendly and helpful. She made sure to learn my name and even remembered me the following morning. Such a nice gesture that I don't feel happens very often these days. The hotel itself was gorgeous with a very clean and classic look! It had a luxurious feel to it that made me wish I was staying for more than one night. The bed was comfy and the breakfast was good. This will definitely be my go-to hotel anytime I'm in the area.

review_body: The hotel overall was nice but the welcome was terrible. There was never a mention of my IHG status. He just took my deposit, gave me my room keys, and pointed to where the elevator was. Housekeeping never left fresh towels. They just took the ones in the room out. I had to go to the front desk to get towels. My trash was not emptied and the sink was not wiped down. They did make the beds. I'm not sure I will stay there or recommend this property to anyone.

review_body: This is a very modern, clean, and quiet hotel. The room I stayed in had two queen beds, a kitchenette area, large dining table, large bathroom with walk-in shower, and a very spacious closet. If you have the Marriott app, you can check-in, use your phone as a room key, ask for amenities, and check out all from your phone. The breakfast is nothing to write home about, but you should not leave hungry. I did not utilize the pool or work-out area this trip, but both looked nice. All interactions with the staff were very pleasant. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel for business or leisure.

review_body: The room is spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was roomy and clean. Two queen sized beds were comfortable and were positioned where there was no problem walking around them. Nice kitchenette with full sized refrigerator, microwave two burner stove top, stainless steel sink with garbage disposal, coffeemaker, and pop-up toaster. Large dining table with four sturdy chairs for seating. Smart TV and wifi.Hotel amenities were great, pool looked clean and well maintained. Small work out facility with towels and water. Available business center with computer, complementary breakfast had many items that looked appetizing. Coffee, tea, and hot water available in the morning...6 am to 10 am, A few negatives: 1) microwave oven is placed so high from the countertop that there is great counter space and room, but very dangerous for a shorter person to remove hot items from the appliance.2) Both of the electrical outlets in the kitchenette area were dead - so we could not use the coffeemaker or toaster unless they were placed on the dining table. (This item I reported to the front desk upon checkout so maybe they will be repaired, soon). The garbage disposal worked fine that was on the same junction box, so I am not sure why the outlets wouldn't work.

review_body: This is a relatively new hotel in Round Rock. We had three rooms for seven of us who were in to visit my granddaughter and go to her graduation from Texas State. The staff was fantastic and could not have been more accommodating. We sort of took over the Lobby on Friday night and Saturday night with family and friends, and the staff was very helpful and even joined in when it came to eating some of the desserts. All of us remarked how well layed out the rooms are, how clean and how convenient everything is. The free breakfast was well stocked, with a good variety of items including cheese omelets, turkey bacon, sausage patties, oatmeal, cold cereal, waffles, fruit, yogurt, and most importantly, fresh, hot coffee. We lost power in the area on Sunday morning for several hours, but they still managed to get out a good breakfast and were very helpful to guests checking out. I will definitely stay there again when next we visit our granddaughter.

review_body: Marriott is my chain of choice, but I usually stay at a Residence Inn when I deploy for business. My trips are normally 30 days or more, so I'm looking for amenities and comfort during my 12-14 hour days, 7 days per week. My needs consist of a clean, very comfortable bed, an accessible bathroom, and if possible, room to navigate around my lodging with a rolling walker, because of my diminished mobility. This was my first TownePlace property, and because of my wonderful experiences here, I may choose not to go back to the Residence Inns around the United States.The rooms are spacious and bright, very clean and updated, and the King sized Marriott bed is legend for complete comfort and a great night's sleep. Because I had requested an accessible room, I was pleasantly surprised to find all of the furniture, cabinetry and kitchen utensils located within reach of anyone traveling alone needing to reach things from a wheelchair. Pots, pans, plates, and all dinnerware were conveniently located at a level about waist high on a standing person. The specialized cabinetry allows a person seated in a wheelchair or rolling walker to pull up underneath the kitchen and bathroom sinks, and be comfortable using these facilities. However, should you not have a disability requiring these amenities, you would not be uncomfortable in this room either. Even the garbage disposal can be worked from a seated position. There is a wonderful, pull out table/desk in the oversized room, about 5 feet by 3 feet, that quickly pushes out of the way to allow for wheelchairs, luggage, a 60 pound dog and a 15 pound cat. Yes, we're a traveling business family.The bathroom has to be approximately 15X10 feet with a roll-in shower, solidly placed grab bars on each wall as well as in the shower, and an attached, fold down shower chair that swings out of the wall for quick use with just one hand. The whole room is done in non-slip ceramic tile, and two floor drains installed so that any water escaping the shower area will quickly drain away and the floor will be safe to use barefoot. It is an AMAZING bathroom, and one of the many reasons that I have stayed here for the past 5 months. (And will continue to stay until my job is completed in August. That will be a whole year!)Just when you thought that this pet friendly, new property couldn't get any better, let me mention the wonderful, outdoor firepit area out front, where you can spend a lovely Texas evening or two sitting around the fire and/or using the huge Weber gas grill put there for guest's enjoyment. There is a nice sized, outdoor pool behind the property, fully equipped with both in-pool stairs and a motorized chair on the pool deck, allowing for people with disabilities that might not be able to have entrance or egress to the pool any other way. The fenced pool area comes completely stocked with very comfortable lounge chairs ringing the pool. Rather spend your time indoors? OK, overlooking the pool is an indoor workout room, but I have admit that I have yet to try it out.There is a nice breakfast in the morning, and it smells delicious. But, again, if I can spend another 20 minutes in that bed, I'm never going to know delicious breakfast actually might be.All that's left to talk about now is the staff, and I can promise you that you'll not find a better one anywhere. From Thomas, the General Manager, on down to Maria who is in charge of Housekeeping, there is nothing that you could possibly want/need that these folks can't provide. Amanda greets you by name as you walk in the door, Jeremy makes sure that you get a slice of his pizza when you didnt get lunch, and Ms. Jody will give you sage advice on what may be making your pet behave strangely after arrival. Joel, the building engineer, singlehandedly brought my belongings to my car when I went home for 2 weeks at Chistmas. By far though, I'll have to admit that Ms. Margie and her husband Robert are the two people that have made this stay memorable. Margie has done all that she can to help acclimate my pets to TownePlace, and Robert unselfishly takes my aging dog out 2 or 3 time per night so that I can get some well needed sleep. They both brought my belongings back into the hotel for me when I returned, all without being asked, while I made my way back to my room with my pets. WHERE do you get service like this????I'm telling you, if you're in the Austin area, and you don't spend at least one night at this property, then you're missing out on a really great stay. Do yourself a favor and make your registration today.
hotelName:
27    TownePlace Suites Austin Round Rock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has great employees, from Thomas (GM),JoDee (Director of sales),Joel (Maintenance), Maria,( Housekeeping) and Barbara who cleaned our room, Cecilia and Ana, (breakfast staff) to all the Front desk personnel, including Margaret, Jeremy, Amanda, Margie, and many other employees at this fantastic hotel, all made an unpleasant time in our lives more bearable. Friendly faces speaking our names with kindness and always a smile on their faces helped to make our days here a little brighter despite the circumstances we found ourselves in. My elderly parents lost their home and car in Hurricane Harvey’s floodwaters. I drove them here from the Houston area because my hometown was flooded by Harvey as well. Both IH-10 and highway 90 were flooded from Houston into Jefferson County so I was unable to get my parents from the Houston area (after they were rescued) to my home. This, of course, also meant that I couldn’t return to my own home either. Consequently, we ended up fleeing the greater Houston area to the Austin area, where we have been ever since we left their area. We have now been here in this area since September last year and my parents home is still being repaired !Now let’s discuss the hotel itself. This hotel is beautiful inside and out and has a smart TV in the room. There is outdoor furniture and a grill in front of the hotel. Furthermore, there is a nice fire pit in front of the hotel too. We are staying in a handicapped accessible room so there are handicap bars in the bathroom on the walls and in the handicap accessible bathtub/shower. Also, in our room there is a two burner stove top built in the countertop, a vent hood, a microwave on the countertop, a dishwasher,and a full size refrigerator too. There are also kitchen cabinets on the wall, a sink area with a disposable and countertops all the way down to the refrigerator. There is a coffee pot in the kitchen, a toaster, dishes, pots and pans, silverware and other kitchen items in the drawers and cabinets. This hotel also have a nice workout area on the first floor and an outdoor swimming pool as well. Furthermore, there is plenty of space to walk your pets around the hotel and they provide doggy bags to clean up after your pet ( and garbage cans below the waste bags to throw the bags in too). They have several Tesla charging areas on the backside of the hotel where you can plug your car in to charge (if you have such a car and are staying at this hotel).If you need anything while you are here, the staff is great so they will try to accommodate your wishes ! There is a map on one of the walls with things like the location of a grocery store close to this hotel clearly marked on the map. This new hotel is beautiful, very safe, in a great location, has the latest tech in the rooms (you can plug then charge your cell phones with a cable). Furthermore, their technology is top notch too because their elevators require you to scan your room key card in the elevator to travel to the 2nd, 3rd or 4th floors.If you want to stay at a beautiful hotel, with great technology, in a great location, with fantastic customer service, then this is the ONLY hotel you should stay at when you are in this area. Take my word for it because after 5 months you get to know the employees and I have observed that working in this hotel is not just a job to them. Every employee shows their commitment to excellence by their work ethic in this hotel. Their actions here have shown me that they are commited to serving all customers; whether they are like my parents who are displaced Harvey survivors, business travelers, family members just having a get to together/reunion here, soccer and volleyball traveling teams and people that were just passing through this area and spending one night here, we are all greeted warmly and treated with the utmost respect no matter who we are and why we are staying in this hotel. If you stay here, I assure you that you might have checked in here as strangers but when you leave, you will leave as family!
hotelName:
27    TownePlace Suites Austin Round Rock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was coming in late to check-in and called ahead to confirm my stay. A staff member, Margie, answered the phone and was pleasant and professional. Once I arrived from a long night of driving through snow storms, with a trailer in tow, I was greeted by Margie who again was very pleasant and professional in checking me in, telling me how to find the website to pay tolls (I hit a few cameras for tolls on the way in), reminding me about breakfast etc. The real issue came with my trailer. I had to park across a few parking spots to fit. Margie was helpful in having me park in the front lot so she could watch my truck and trailer while I slept. She then opened the curtains to the lobby so she could see my vehicle - she truly showed she cared. The rooms were clean and comfortable; there was a bathroom with a great shower; the breakfast was tasty etc but in the end professional helpful staff is was really makes the stay for me and Margie was top notch - Thank you Margie!

review_body: This was a last minute, drive to Austin, work long hours, three day tops (which turned to 5), business trip. review_body: Your hotel graciously helped out our softball team with 10 rooms reservations- the day of needing them!
