Rooms are large and you are accessible to all highways. The staff was amazing. Thanks for Jeremey at the front desk for his hospitality and customer service. He took great care of us.
hotelName:
27    TownePlace Suites Austin Round Rock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Headed to the JW Marriott, but decided to leave a day early. Found the TownePlace suites last minute and booked a room. Did not realize it was a brand new hotel and just opened on Tuesday. We stayed one night on Thursday. One of the first few guests here and first to sleep in our room. Very clean and perfect. I expect that of a brand new hotel. Check in was flawless and easy. Room was better than expected. Room has all kitchen utensils and supplies should you need to stay here for an extended time. Being that I'm 6'4", I appreciated the larger shower with the tall shower head. Staff is very courteous, friendly, and eager to please. Some definite kudos are the high thread count sheets (unexpected), down filled comforter, and most importantly, soft toilet paper. Not the cheap cardboard stuff you would normally get. I would definitely recommend staying here. I could only imagine it would get better over time.
hotelName:
27    TownePlace Suites Austin Round Rock
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome place to stay. Clean and very nice people. I love the happy hour. Free food, wine and beer. Nice way to end the day. Also, breakfast is included. Room is very nice with a great view. I will come back again.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Left a pair of new shorts in dresser drawer & called 4 times to have someone check the room but response was the new couple wasn't answering phone to check dresser. Bottom line, 2 days passed & hotel NEVER once called me back to give me a update. No surprise as other hotels have same attitude if a customer has left behind a item, at least in my experience.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My experience with this Staybridge Suites was excellent. I stayed there while my house was being remodeled. I was accompanied by my Miniature Schnauzer who also enjoyed her stay. Our room was always spotlessly clean, and we enjoyed the food offerings as well as the laundry facilities. It is a very nice place to stay and met our needs perfectly!
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked my Regional Manager at this location not knowing it was a Holiday Inn Product which was a plus because of points. The staff was very friendly and attentive to his needs.DJ is truly a people person and very customer service oriented to a point that my manager wanted me to recruit him just for people skills.GOOD JOB STAYBRIDGE!!!!
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient Location; Staff helpful and friendly; the entire hotel air conditioning system seemed to not be working as the hallways/ guest lobby/ dining area were always warm, and my room never seemed to cool off which made sleeping troublesome. First room, there was some type of fungus growing around the doorframe of the bathroom, toilet - see photos
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling with my boys. Picked up hire car after night mare wait at Austin airport bc the luggage belt broke!!! Drove to this hotel and kids were straight in pool. It’s hot here. Pool small but really nice. Suite was plenty big enough. Like an apartment. Two rims with two big beds and living area and kitchen area. Might be good idea to get food in on the way if wanting to use kitchen. Jet lagged kicked and everyone was asleep by 730. Friendly front desk staff and met Simon the Brit at 3am when my 6 year decided it was time to get up.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel had had a flood and our suite was not available but they gave us two smaller suites .i was delighted that they had not decided to turn us away as we had been travelling for 28 hours .reception staff were always friendl. And helpful . There is a mini store open 24 hours a day excellent for the jet lagged .the suites were clean and well equipped .breakfast is open at 6.30monday to friday and was always fully ready .there was nothing i could have wanted not availalbe from oatmeal to eggs and yoghurts .one could take breakfast back to ones room if one wished .i have stayed in far more expensive suites and this was just as good perhaps friendlier staff ,the laundry room was always clean . I will look for other staybridge suites when next travelling to the states
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped here after our Hill Country road trip and before we head back to Houston. This hotel concept probably caters to those who stays for a couple of weeks each time. It has lots of conveniences without extra charge: microwave, plates, silverware, laundry baskets you can do laundry yourself in the gym area. A whole food is minutes away with added food options. A relatively up scale mall also in very close vicinity. Hotel is unpretentious, meet all the needs a travellr could hope for. For us it is simply a stopping point. We needed things quickly and the surrounding stores and hotel itself offered just that.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first stay at the Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum, and it was relatively positive. This property was close to a number of dining venues. In addition, there is a reception each evening where food and drink are provided. Each morning, commencing at 6:30 AM, breakfast is served which caters to diverse tastes. The rooms are large and are equipped with a coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, and assorted supplies. I would be inclined to stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Heavy smell of perfume trying to cover animal smells. Maybe they think it works?Speaking of animals, huge dog constantly barking for over an hour at 11PM. Management took an hour to deal with it.I have stayed at other properties in this chain without these problems. Maybe this one is older?For those who don't like animals to begin with and instantly smell them - not a place for you. Unfortunately, most hotels have turned into kennels.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place for extended stays; it has a very good location as well, specially if you have business near the arboretum area (northern part of the city). It is very close to the main highway in Austin which gives you an advantage if you want to go around the city.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made our pre-paid reservation with the Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum – Domain on October 19th 2017 for three nights at Thanksgiving. I had stayed there before and was impressed by how accessible my room was. I’m handicapped and need a roll-in shower. I made the reservation directly with the hotel so that I could verify the availability of a room with that shower. I was assured by the desk clerk that there was one available for that period and it would be saved for me.We arrived at the hotel to discover that the room I had been promised had been given to someone else. The clerk was very nice and offered us another room on the second floor with a roll-in shower. We went to the room but it was regular bathtub with a shower. He gave my husband the key to another room with what he assured us was a roll-in shower. It wasn’t. He offered us half off the room for that night and suggested we discuss the situation with the day staff. It was after midnight so we accepted.We went down the next day to talk to the desk clerk. She told us that it was hotel policy to double-book rooms! It still makes me mad to remember her saying that. I received the distinct impression that there is only one room with a roll-in shower and they double-booked it – for the entire length of our stay. We went ahead and stayed there because it was too hard to pack up again and start looking for a hotel on Thanksgiving Day. When we checked out on Saturday, my husband asked if they could give a discount for the last two nights since they had given away the room that was guaranteed. They said no. Also, we discovered the first night that the TV didn't work in the "living room". We reported it that night and then we stopped by the front desk the next morning. Since it was Thanksgiving, the maintenance staff wasn't working. The desk clerk discovered the outlet wasn't working so she strung an extension cord across the room. The outlet was replaced the next day.In addition, we read in our room that there is no maid service on short stays. Sure enough, our trash was emptied and towels replaced on Thursday & Friday but the room was not cleaned nor the beds made.After this review was published on the hotel's web site, we were contacted by the hotel's new manager. She offered us points but we weren't interested. She then offered us compensation for the other two nights of our stay and we gratefully accepted and I've republished this review, raising my rating from one star to three.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for nearly a month on business and thought the design of the rooms was pretty good. The kitchen had a nice breakfast bar and full size fridge. The two burner stove and dishwasher made it well equipped for making light meals. We liked that the bedroom was separated from the sitting/ kitchen room. Clothing storage was nice, with plenty of closet and drawer space. The laundry basket and shelves in the closet are good pluses. The rooms were quiet enough but then someone moved in upstairs and we heard a lot of footsteps.The bathroom was a good size but would have benefited from drawer storage and another towel bar. The staff were uniformly cheerful, professional, and friendly. The breakfast and light dinners were nicely done. The only thing that bothered us was that the wireless was not good, very slow and dropped a lot.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first night of 6 and they are freaking vacuuming inside the ceiling outside my room and banging around. It is so loud, I had to hang up my phone call home.This is just insane. This does not appear to be an emergency, so WTF??? You don't do this to customers.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Next door to two fine restaurants. Near shops, grocery stores, fast food and very near the main highways. They have a free dinner and free happy hour. That was awesome. And a great breakfast. If we stayed longer we would have fired up the kitchen with our own food. Very friendly staff.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came in early before a wedding with a large group of family and friends. Close to everything if you did not have a car. Convenient to Hwy's and attractions in Austin. Breakfast menu changed daily and the large dining room was a great gathering spot in the evening to meet with F & F. Rooms were spacious and well equipped. Pool was larger than expected. Staff was very friendly, very helpful and smiled. It had a home-like atmosphere.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our rooms were clean and neat. The breakfast was very good. They kept every thing fresh and the tables cleared. It was too cool to use the swimming pool but it looked like a very nice area. We really enjoyed our stay here.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of 5 stayed here over graduation weekend. I'm rating it 4 stars because it only faltered in one area (see below). We will definitely stay here when we come to Austin again.Hotel: We had a great, spacious 2 bedroom/2 bath suite. Our room was clean, beds were comfortable, and it had everything we needed. The staff was very nice and helpful. They had a heated pool, full-size basketball court, and fire pit outside in a nice courtyard area with beautiful live oaks shading it. Area: Austin traffic is always frustrating, but this hotel is in a great location being right off Mopac (Loop 1), which is a less-busy north/south route through Austin than I-35, and 183 which can get you across east/west if needed. Target is right down the street, and there are several restaurants in the area, too.Cons: The only real con for us was that the hotel breakfast was not as good as other Staybridge's or other hotels in this class. They did have hot options each morning (eggs, sausage, french toast) and the typical bagels, bread, pastries, waffles, etc. However, the hotel was so busy this weekend and they were very low on everything and didn't have the breakfast area staffed well enough to keep things stocked and the trash cans were overflowing. Had the breakfast been better serviced, I'd have given it 5 stars.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We moved to this hotel for one night after a bad experience at another hotel. This was clean and had a nice layout. The snacks in the evening are a great deal. You can eat two full meals at this hotel (breakfast and the 'kick-back') for free. The kick- back included hot dogs, burgers with all the fixings, chips and drinks. Breakfast included the usual things like bagels and cereals and eggs and such. The parking in front of the hotel is scarce, so we had to park near the back and there were a few places where the lot dropped off steeply and there weren't curbs or anything to stop someone from rolling down a hill. You have to be careful backing out at night. Our room was on the side of the hotel with the pool and fire pit and basketball court. We could hear people talking and laughing until late in the night.( The outside area is very nice with a lot of sidewalk space, a deck with a fire pit, and plenty of seating.)Someone called the front desk to complain about the noise thinking it was us, but they were actually hearing the chatter from the outdoor area, because there were a lot of people out there making quite a bit of noise. It was frustrating being blamed for other peoples' noise. That was the only reason I couldn't give the hotel a full five rating. The hotel should have a curfew for the courtyard.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 days with friends and family. It's a great location - close to shopping, restaurants, and easy access to 2 different freeways. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean and updated. We had a one bedroom suite, and having the door separating the living from sleeping rooms was so nice with 2 teenagers that liked to sleep in. The kitchenette had a full size fridge, microwave, 2 burner cooktop (turn the timer knob on the wall to turn them on!), and dishwasher. No oven, though my friend in the 2 bedroom unit did have a toaster oven. I never heard any noise from our next-door neighbors or the hallways. My only complaint is that they seem to completely forgotten sound insulation vertically. A boys high school debate team checked in at midnight one night, including the room above us. It was unbelievably loud. It wasn't crazy teenage boy wrestling (with a son, I know what that sounds like). It was standard unpacking, walking around, talking, etc. At 1:00am, with everything else quiet, I could almost make out their conversations. It began again at 6:00am when they got ready to leave. Honestly, vertical noise transmission is a serious design flaw here.Breakfast was good, though better on the weekdays than the weekend - real plates, fresh biscuits and gravy. The laundry was free to use. We didn't use the pool, but the area looked well kept and clean.Bottom line, I'd consider staying here again, but would request a top floor room.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in Staybridge in other towns when i visit the USA. This one was close to where i had to go for work. Setup same as other Staybridges - nice garden at the back to get some fresh air in. Location close to shopping malls and food outlets.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staybridge customarily offers a comfortable and reliable hotel experience. However, those adjectives can be decidedly elastic at this property depending upon when you stay and there are some aspects where age and inattention are compromising the amenity. The location is 15 minutes north of downtown Austin but access to the freeway is simple. The immediate surroundings are pleasant and there are plenty of places to dine and shop nearby.  The good: the customary Staybridge suite experience is all there: space, amenity and convenience. Most everything was there and some (see below) of it worked as expected. There is plenty of on-site parking and a more-than-usually pleasant, shaded courtyard area with plenty of longing facilities around the pool. The included wifi worked well on all our devices. The weekday breakfast service offers a better-than-average chain hotel buffet affair which is well stocked and cheerfully serviced. The not so good: this building seems to be less than well insulated against the vertical transmission of noise. Even relatively minor noise from the suite above intruded far more than should be expected from a reasonably modern building. The ageing refrigerator in out suite was not functioning when we arrived but was replaced with another – equally antique, but working model – after we reported it. The allegedly hot water in the shower was tepid at best and even when it warmed enough for comfort was subject to sudden and unnerving surges of cold. We though that the HWS might have been overloaded as the hotel was full for the first days of our stay but it stayed that way long after the crowd had departed.The weekend breakfast service plummets to a significantly below-average production-line McBuffet affair taken on styrofoam dishes with floppy plastic cutlery accompanied by service that is surly and lackadaisical. A very disappointing throw-away experience from a hotel that exhorts guest to make an environmental contribution by re-using their towels and touts its “IHG Green Engage” credentials.We might use Staybridge Suites again but never on weekends.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Austin for a visit with a friend. Traveled Solo and thought this hotel was great. I arrived very late (midnight) and departed very early (4am) 2 days later. I was met with very friendly and awake staff. My room was well fitted, clean, modern, and very comfortable. Breakfast was ok but the staff was extremely accommodating. I never felt unsafe.Hotel is walking distance to Target, SAMS, Whole Food market, Panera, Nordstrom Rack to name a few. Also a $9 cab ride to The Domain where there is more shopping and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here on my next trip to Austin.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As soon as I walked into the hotel lobby, I was greeted by Liz at the front counter with a welcome and a smile, as the staff is friendly and professional. The room was spacious and clean. The hotel amenities are superb with full breakfast and an evening social event.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very nice for what we needed it for and good location. Outside of the city to where you're not having to pay for parking, yet only about a 10-15 minute drive into downtown. Walking distance to great brewery NXNW and 1 block away from a Target. Easy access to highways. Very friendly/helpful staff. Clean property and well maintained. Furniture and amenities in rooms were a little outdated BUT one of the most comfortable beds and pillows I have ever slept on! I will even be contacting the hotel to see if I can purchase their bedding.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I travel on business quite often and we stay for rather long periods of time. We prefer Staybridge for their good service. But our latest stay in Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum it has been a wonderful experience, from the front desk, to the rooms, to the Staff, to Maintenance, kitchen facilities, housekeeping, we can recommend it as the best hotel in the area. You feel at home, with kind and courteous people. Special mention to the morning cafeteria, great service, Marcus is the best breakfast person we have ever seen. Overall, amazing place to spend time with family or friends.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and accommodating staff. Clean and nice rooms. Location was great for attractions. Breakfast items wasn't to great. Great for family and small children. Their grounds are family friendly as well.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week as I was attending a wedding in Austin, first time in USA so wanted some familiarity having stayed in Staybridge suits in UK. I wasn't disappointed, the staff were excellent, Sylvia (I think was her name) checked us in and quickly resolved some confusion on the bookings. The room was clean comfortable and the giant fridge was great for storing water and beer etc. The pool was great and was fun watching hotel residents play basketball in the evening on the court. The outside BBQ was a useful area and nice to have the burgers cooked out there on the social evenings. Good local food stores and restaurants, I am returning to Austin in September and wanted to stay here again, however the recent hike in redemption points to 30,000 per night has made that now not possible, have gone to a nearby Staybridge for half the points, this is the only reason I didn't give 5 stars.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this accommodation because of the good reviews, great price and free parking. The location is a little away from downtown, but since we had a car, this wasn’t an issue. Being a bit further out, it also gave my partner a chance to practice driving an American car on the other side of the road without disrupting busy traffic!Our suite was large and very appropriate for business travellers, as it has everything one would need - a full kitchen and laundering facilities. Although a little old-fashioned, it was like staying at a cosy apartment in suburbia.There are several shopping malls nearby, which was convenient and great for shoppers. However, the local dining options are very mediocre. So again, it was a good thing we had a car.We stayed for three nights. Staff were friendly and helpful, and overall service was fine. But my lasting memory of this place will be the giant microwave. If only we’d had a chance to heat up something really, really big :)
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel from March 31 through April 3. When I arrived at the airport I called the hotel shuttle and they where there in 10 minutes. The shuttle driver, Olivia was very informative, professional and courteous. She even took me to pickup some food before checking in to hotel. The front desk clerk, Laneshia was very pleasant and courteous even while multitasking. The rooms was clean and the maintenance staff was detailed in there cleaning. I had a very pleasurable trip and I would stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As another Staybridge I stayed at, this one also had a great friendly staff of dedicated people. A mix up at check in was quickly resolved with a smile.A beautiful outdoor pool with tiered patio, clean rooms updated with fine bedding and modern electronics. There was no charge for exceptionally good wireless internet. While I was their they had free happy hour with hors dvoures and drinks.The area is residential and very quiet. There are two fine restaurants in walking distance. NO hallway noise on the room floors. They also have a great free bountiful breakfast. The rooms have kitchenettes that are full service, including pots, dishes, tableware, coffee maker, refridgerator and dishwasher. Perfectly controlled "no noise" air conditioning.From the desk staff to room attendants--just smiles. Highly recommend when you're in Austin.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Staff of the hotel is awesome. They are always ready to help with anything. The rooms are spacious anyd comes with a kitchenette. The breakfast is filling and they also have appetizers/drinks for dinner on Monday, Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I traveled to the Austin area to enjoy Valentines Day, visit our son and mostly to soak in the beautiful weather (79 degrees in February, you bet!). The hotel is in a quiet location NW of Austin downtown area but close to major thoroughfares. The room was beautifully appointed and the kitchenette was very convenient if you were to stay longer. We were only staying two nights, so we didn't take advantage of it. The hotel would have received a 5 rating, but the breakfast offerings were somewhat sad and poor quality, especially the fried? eggs. Overall the hotel was very nice and I would recommend and stay there again.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was close to my meetings that I was attending for work. It was extremely clean and felt like home. I travel frequently and rarely do I anticipate returning to my hotel room. This one was so comfortable that I was anxious to return. When I am in Austin again, I will definitely return to the Staybridge Suites. The staff was fully accommodating and pleasant.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we come to Austin with our dog we alternate between this and another suite hotel nearby. The staff here are quite top-notch and the facility is just as wonderful as it was last times. I quibble about a pet fee given that our dog is hair and doesn't shed but its perhaps a small price to pay for a lovely, serene location. After busy day in Austin, it's wonderful to come back here - plusses are its lovely pool and back area which even in "texas winter" (I'm from upper midwest), is lovely with a gas-lit fire pit in back. Rooms are wonderful though best to get one facing street as it's brighter. Will keep coming back!
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the Staybridge Suites around 10:00 in the morning. Their check in time was 3:00, but we were able to get our room and go to it at 10:00. The front desk lady was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and modern. Plenty of parking. only downfall was they didn't have a bar. They were also very pet friendly.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived a little worried because the online registration didn't make it clear that all five of our group would be accommodated exactly as we had planned. Amy greeted us with a big smile, said she had seen the reservation and had already set us up comfortably.We enjoyed the (complementary) light dinner and breakfast. Although the hotel looks like any of a number of competing three or four star hotels, I have given the five star rating considering the comfort and size of the rooms, the gym (a little small, but useful), the food, the extremely welcoming team, and the great value.I would also like to thank the dining area and front desk staff. One of our group left her purse on a table at breakfast and was delighted that it had been found and was safe at the front desk.The location is also very good, close to two major malls.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Rm 121 which showed up as room with walk-in shower. It was that and more. I've been on a walker for two years and have found some room descriptions to be less than accurate. However, not so with this hotel. Not only did it have a roll-in shower, it had a folding seat that could handle my 270+ pounds, a "telephone" shower head that could reach the floor. The toilet seat was high and had grab bars. The office chair and the bedroom chair were high enough that I could get out of them easily. I could reach the window treatment so that I could open and close them.The bed was too hard for me but that's just a personal preference.Also the kitchen was well equipped - full size refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, range top, dishwasher and all needed containers and utensils. The LR TV had a DVD player and maybe a VHF player - I didn't try that slot.Also, the staff were super-helpful - someone brought my bag from the car and back - I can't really push my walker and pull a suitcase.. The pantry was very nice-I bought a Stauffers Mac and cheese and heated it in my microwave.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We drove for much of the day October 24 through the rain and some severe thunderstorms at the eastern end of hurricane Patricia. In the dark and rain we arrived on Stonelake Blvd in Austin's Arboretum area. We pulled into the Candlewood Suites and thought that we had arrived at our hotel. The people at the front desk said, "We don't see your reservation but no problem we will take care of you." And they did so graciously.The NEXT DAY we discovered that we were at the WRONG IHG all-suites hotel on StoneLake Blvd. Our reservation was at at the Staybridge Suites, which charged my credit card $186.25 as a no-show. (In addition to our paying for the night at the Candlewood.)Over the next days, I explained what had happened to Rachelle Abbott, the general manager at Staybridge and she graciously refunded the $186.25. I think her action was appropriate under the circumstances, professional and in the best tradition of the hospitality industry.Conclusion: IHG has gracious management people at both their Candlwood Suites and Staybridge Suites on Stonelake Drive in Austin, Texas.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is awesome and free breakfast make it unique. Staff are amazing and helpful. I would like to stay again. Social evening with free snacks and wine is really amazing. Best place to stay in great hills or even austin
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 1 week here with my family and we can't complain. People were friendly and helpful, rooms were nice and clean, beds were great and breakfast was very good. This hotel is located in a nice area of north Austin with good restaurants and shopping.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights on our girls' weekend getaway. There were 4 of us in the suite. We utilized the sofa sleeper which came in very handy. The suite was big enough where we were pretty comfortable when all 4 of us were there. The kitchenette was spacious with a bar/counter and the room was very clean. I was quite impressed since I am a germaphobe. The breakfast area was very spacious and the breakfast spread was very good (I've stayed at a lot of hotels where there are complimentary breakfast buffets and this was a very nice one).If I ever make it down to Austin again, I would definitely stay here again. The Arboretum area is great too. You're within walking distance from several restaurants/bars.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really wished I would of stayed longer. The hotel has the best relaxed feeling. I love how the hotel is snuggled in with a lot of trees. Rooms are clean and well maintained. We stayed in a handicap room. There was enough room for two adults and two teenagers plus one Jack Russell Terrier. Free breakfast was good. Pool is clean, basketball courts are nice and great patio to sit and relax. I want to stay here again and would recommend to everyone.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights with my daughter's sports team. The room was excellent. The breakfast was great. Very convenient to everything. BUT I am still waiting for a return call regarding an outfit my daughter accidentally left behind.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of my favorite chains. The rooms are always large and clean and the beds comfortable. I like having the extra room with sofa and additional seating when I'm in one place longer than one night. The breakfast is tasty with lots of options. The pool area looked inviting but we didn't try it. There was no hot tub at this property which was disappointing. There is an exercise room and a guest laundry. Staybridge offers an evening buffet a couple times a week. We didn't try it this time--not sure we were there on the right days. This hotel is an excellent value for all the amenities it offers. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel last week and absolutely loved it! Upon arrival, we were greeted by Sylvia (I believe that was her name) and she immediately made us feel welcome. The room wasn't quite ready when we arrived, but it didn't take long...maybe about 20 minutes. The room was clean and very large. I got a two bedroom suite since our daughter was with us. Aside from the guests who were above our room, it was a very quiet hotel. I would highly recommend getting a room on the top (4th) floor. Our room overlooked the parking lot but there were trees nearby to block the lights at night. The hotel has a pool, tennis/basketball court, and a large seating area with a firepit. There are also a couple of gas grill available for use. The breakfast was complimentary as well as the evening dinner buffet and drinks. Just keep in mind that the dinner buffet is Monday through Thursday only. I thought the location was ideal. It is very close to the Domain and quite a few nice restaurants. It's about 15 minutes or so (depending on the traffic) from downtown. Whenever we go back to Austin, this will be our home away from home!
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel - everything you need - pool, tennis, basketball, gym. Lots of restaurants and there is good shopping nearby. The front desk staff was very accommodating to us. I would recommend this to any traveler.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here from January to March for training for work. This hotel was excellent and would definitely stay here again. The hotel was clean and well kept. The room was clean and everything worked as needed. I stayed in a suite which had 1 bedroom and a livingroom/kitchen. This room contained everything you would need for any length of stay. The facility is close to a lot of restaurants and shopping. You can walk to a lot of them. In order to make it down town you will definitely need to drive. The one thing I will say about this hotel is the staff is exceptional. The manager and the front desk staff truly make this hotel better than the others. They were very helpful with every request or advice for food and places to shop. They were always there to help.I definitely would recommend looking at this hotel. If you are looking to party and drink down town this might not be the best place due to distance, but for all other reasons I wouldn't look any further.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I have stayed in quite a few Austin area hotels in the past few months, and so far, we liked Staybridge Suites the best. The hotel is classy and clean with everything you really need. The room was comfortable and well-equipped, especially in the kitchen, breakfast and the sitting area was great, and the drive to downtown Austin wasn't too terrible. We also really enjoyed the fruit-flavored water that was always downstairs. We had gone to check in straight from a hike, and I beelined straight for the water when we got there. We liked that this hotel was a little out of the way so we could get away from all the commotion in the city, but at the same time there are still stores and things around. We stayed two nights, and the price was very reasonable for everything you get. My only complaints were the A/C, which at some points of the night would kick on very loudly, but it wasn't much of a nuisance. The other issue was that our iPad would not connect to the wifi in the room, and their tech support wasn't able to assist with the issue. The tech support staff, and all other staff were very helpful and accommodating however.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only have positive comments. Nice room, pleasant and helpful staff, delicious breakfast, clean workout room, and a shuttle bus. Will stay here again next time I visit Austin. Great location near the Domain.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to start by saying we never actually made it to the hotel. We picked it based on location to our event and all the good reviews. Without going into a lot of gory details, we weren't able to come because of a tragic accident with a table saw--digits were lost! Samara at the front desk was able to work some magic and be a bright spot in a horrible situation. She went above and beyond her duties to do something kind and helpful for us. I will be forever grateful for her and the all trouble she went to to help us. Our next trip to Austin will definitely include this hotel and flowers or something for Samara! Thank you again!
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay! The rooms were spacious and very clean. We felt at home right away. The staff was courteous and friendly. Close to the Domain and downtown. We only wish we could have spent more time there. Breakfast was hot and filling. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Rm 106, it was ok but I love the space in the Rm. Great Customer Service and Breakfast was clean and very good! We had a little issue with our neighbor upstairs but management, I think his name is Sean, handle it very good. My family really enjoyed it. I would definitely come back!!
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A calm and spacious suite not far from I-35. Comfortable and the staff made us feel special. Breakfast was not served as early as we needed but coffee was ready, both in room and on the cafe.
hotelName:
28    Staybridge Suites Austin Arboretum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on the fifth floor facing the IHOP on Driskill Street. I was initially concerned about street noise, but it wasn't an issue. The building is very quiet. The unit itsellf was clean and well appointed. Having a full size washer and dryer minimized the amount of clothing we needed to bring. In direct feedback to Locale I suggested that they add a plastic pitcher to make iced tea and rolls of plastic wrap and aluminum foil. Other than those items, the kitchen had the basics (olive oil, salt, pepper, coffee, coffer filers for machine and drip system, large selection of teas and assorted bagged condiments, suger, and non-sugar sweeteners, dishes, cookware, cutting boards, utensils). I noted that the Brita water filter was blinking for a filter change. I texted late in the day and got an immediate respond that it would be taken care of the next morning. I was expecting to find the filter on the counter, but when I followed up, I was told that the filter had been changed while we were out. The gym is small, but adequate. We were able to print our boarding passes in the business center. If you walk down Rainey Street you hit the walking trail by the river. Turn left to walk a loop (part shade, part sun) that takes you back over the Congress Street bridge. The loop took me almost exactly on hour to walk. Trader Joes is about a 25 minute walk away. We walked there and ride shared back. All and all, we had a great stay and I will definitely look for Locale in other cities. Thanks to Locale, keep up the good work.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in Austin for a conference at the convention center and this location was perfect. Tons of bars down Rainey street for late night entertainment. The instructions for the access to the building and room were perfect. Price was lower than the hotels around the area. Lots of space and very modern and clean.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time renting an Airbnb. My experience with this rental was wonderful! Communication was quick and easy throughout. Parking and entry directions were simple and clear. You can’t beat this location - right on Rainey street where it is walkable to nearby restaurants and trendy bars. The lobby is beautiful with a free coffee bar. The facilities were clean and modern with access to a nice gym, and awesome rooftop pool, I also saw a large communal hang out area and a business center. The rental was clean and spacious, decorated nicely, balcony, washer dryer, plenty of bedroom and bathroom and closet space, a large kitchen area great for gatherings with our group of 5. The place was stocked with all necessities, and included coffee/tea and a water filter pitcher which was a nice touch. The beds were pretty comfortable. The only minor critique would be that the shower had low water pressure, and also the pull out bed sheets had a few stains. Also, you can hear a little noise from the highway. Other than that our stay was perfect! Would definitely rent again! Thank you for a great first experience!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was a breeze and it was a very nice property. The workout facility and pool are solid too. Nice to be so close to everything but feel like I had my own space, kitchen etc. There is a little grocery store up he street (5 min walk) called Blue Royal. You can get all of your basic stuff to stock your kitchen during your say. Two thumbs up!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose to stay with Locale on our recent visit to Austin and were so glad we did. We had an extremely comfortable, spacious, well equiped apartment in the best location. Rainey St was such a lively place with so many bars and restaurants and a good deli to buy provisions when we just wanted some quiet time. An easy walk to the river and into downtown. Although we had no face to face contact with the Locale staff they were most helpful in our dealings with them through email and phone. We were even able to stow our luggage after checkout as we had a late afternoon flight. We loved Austin and would not hesitate to stay there again.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Trying to think of any cons to staying here, and couldn’t think of a thing. It’s right at the beginning of Rainey street, which we loved. We walked to the Capital from here and to Sixth street—maybe 10 minutes away? Also walked home after the SoCo bridge bat flight with ease. Uber rides were never more then 5 min wait. Water pressure in the bathroom was great, bed comfortable, although we didn’t need the sofa bed so can’t speak to that. We stayed on the side facing the highway, but didn’t have any issue with highway noise—thought the windows did a good job keeping that out. Nice huge closet right off the bathroom, nice if one person is getting ready and the other still sleeping. Very clean overall, and I’m pretty picky about that. Coffee and nice selection of tea, sugars, cream provided. Really liked the shampoo and soap dispensers in the shower, appreciated that environmentally friendly touch. Even though this building is in a “party section”, there was no noise or mess from drunk people. Absolutely no noise from other apartments. This area was really fun, but we never witnessed any obnoxious behavior. Sunday afternoon was a hoot here. Bangers and Icenours had really fun bands. Super responsive to texts, got replies within minutes, actually took this place instead of another in this building based on that alone. The building seems to be a mix of vacation rentals and full time tennants, which I bet keeps it nice. The pool and gym were fabulous, super clean and well kept. Everything here looks exactly like the pictures.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was exceptional. The customer service was top notch. The pool was amazing. Thank you for making our visit to Austin so memorable. We will definitely be back. I encourage anyone who enjoys luxury to stay here.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the best place in Austin where I have stayed. The location was perfect, right on Rainey street which is packed with all the bars and restaurants one could need, and near Lady Bird Lake with hiking/biking trails and a huge dog park, and within walking distance to downtown Austin and the famous Sixth Street entertainment district. The apartment was spacious, clean, quiet and stocked with everything one would need for preparing meals and entertaining. The amenities in the building are excellent. Check in and out was quick and easy. My favorite restaurant was El Naranjo, traditional Mexican food, pricey but worth it. I would choose Locale Rainey Street the next time I am in Austin.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The customer service was great....we were nervous about not having a front desk, but the person who answered our texts was super responsive. The amenities/space of an apartment was much better than a hotel room....
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Locale Rainey Street was awesome, you walked into the apartment and it felt like home. From the furniture (especially the beds), to amenities everything was perfect. The location is so much fun, Rainey Street has lots to offer and was just a quick walk to downtown Austin. I would 100% recommend to anyone visiting Austin, so much better than staying in a hotel room! The building itself has tons of extras, infinity pool, community room, gym, and Locale staff was very responsive to any needs. We are definitely staying there again on our next Austin trip.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not only is this hotel amazing, (you get a whole apt!), the staff is incredible. Ada is a phenomenal team member, helping me change my reservation the same day, and following up to make sure everything went smoothly. Austin is one of a kind and having a quiet and relaxing place to come back to and recharge after a night of fun made this stay even better. You also can't beat the price for the location. Just on the corner of Rainey so you don't get all the sound of the bars if you choose to head to bed early. Great place to stay like a local with lots of space for new friends or family, I can't recommend Locale enough!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Locale Rainey Street in Austin is a first class experience. I travel globally for work and the normal hotel stays become repetitive and mundane. However, Locale Rainey Street is a few levels above, providing a more home like stay. The best part is the outstanding customer experience, specifically Ada. Learning I grew up in Texas, she left me a wonderful postcard welcoming me home to the Great State I love dearly. The location is ideal for taking in the local lore of Austin with a great restaurants lining Rainey Street. Plus a short jog away and you are on the trail around Lady Bird Lake (aka Town Lake). I'm already looking forward to my next trip to Austin and my stay at the Locale.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've been to Austin many times visiting family, but this was our first time staying at Locale - and we'd do it again in a heartbeat. Our apartment was tastefully contemporary and everything was new, very clean and had all the amenities of a fine boutique hotel to make our stay wonderful. We were provided detailed, easy-to-follow instructions, secure parking, incredible city views. Plus a full size washer/dryer IN the apartment means we can pack less! The location is ideal; just a short walk to Rainey Street and close proximity to other local spots, plus easy freeway access. Excellent and timely responses when I had a question. We would not hesitate to recommend!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Could not be more pleased with Locale Rainy Street - great location, great property, very hip! The Locale team was exceptional - very thorough with instructions, very prompt, responsive and friendly. Will be recommending this property and definitely stay here again when I'm in the area!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Locale Rainey Street was simply perfection and nailed the “boutique hotel” experience. Beginning with detailed and “visually guided” instructions, check in and check out was a finely tuned procedure. We started to enjoy immediately!The space . . . Well equipped kitchen and expansive living space. Nicely appointed seating and entertainment center in living area. Ultra comfy bed with luxe bedding. Spacious bath with soaking tub and wonderful walk in closet. Balcony was an added bonus that gave us a view to downtown Austin. Very, very pet friendly which traveling with our Manolo afforded him lovely amenities.The location . . . Unbelievably situated! Out-the-door access to a vibrant and buzzing Rainey Street. Walkable to every food truck, bar, dining experience imaginable. And a short walk to Lady Bird Lake.The Locale experience . . . quick to respond to all communication and special requests. I admire their partnership with the apartment facility. It was clear that Locale guests were welcome. Hands down, Locale is a great luxury hotel business model. Loved the experience, looking forward to another great Locale experience quite soon : )
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a girls trip to Austin, first time visiting this great city! The building is in an amazing location. Walking distance to many fun areas including having the Rainey Street District right outside the door! The apartment was spacious and clean, very comfortable for our group of four. The amenities are excellent, beautiful gym and rooftop patio and pool. We felt safe and secure. From booking to departure our group could not have asked for better customer service. The Locale team was reponsive, informative and accommodating! Thank you!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for the US Gran Prix for 4 days. We liked the location and had a great time. We had a very nice 2 bedroom apartment with full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, dining room and living room. Everything went great from start to finish. They use all text and email check in no need for a front desk. Parking car was easy as well. We will go back again when in Austin Joe carosella
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: room was excellent..extremely spacious and clean..it was a suite, not a regular hotel room..extremely easy check in and great customer support..washer /dryer in room..full kitchen..many amenities..HIGHLY RECOMMEND
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't say enough good things about Locale on Rainey Street in Austin. Literally, you are staying in a furnished modern apartment with no hassles of a check in and check out like a hotel. The location was right on Rainey St. which has great food and drinks. You are a half mile from 6th St. which again has great restaurants/bars. The building had an outdoor infinity pool on the 8th floor which was amazing. We travel quite a bit and I will look for similar places to stay in other cities. Great experience!!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE! We chose to stay at the Locale (on Rainey Street) for a bachelorette party. We wanted a location that was close to nightlife, had a great pool, and had room to celebrate. We rented two apartments to accommodate 10 people. We loved the space/size of the rooms and the cleanliness. The rooms/furniture were super modern and cute too! The large amount of space allowed us to cook, decorate for the bachelorette (which looked amazing), and celebrate all together. We thoroughly enjoyed the free coffee as well. The pool was the perfect temperature, offered an amazing view, and was so fun. Exploring Rainey Street was easy because it was right out the front door, which was the bride's favorite place. This was the perfect spot!We loved/adored the Locale's customer service! The staff were extremely accommodating. They responded to texts/phone calls anytime of day/night prior to and during our stay. I even received several texts from them asking if we needed anything and/or if we were doing ok. Their friendly demeanor and willingness to help in anyway was outstanding. They went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed. For example, we were given a place to store our bags after we checked out, so we could explore a little more before our flight. Thank you for the amazing trip!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can not say enough good things about this apartment and the location. I had a great time and the place just made my trip THAT much more relaxing and enjoyable. Very clean, very well organized and conveniently located to everything fun around the downtown area. Would definitely recommend to anyone searching for a place to stay in Austin!!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With a no hassle check in system, this location was amazing. The ambiance was relaxing with 3 different swimming pools, an arcade, and a work out station. Community was awesome and greeted us with open arms. Coffee shop downstairs was incredible and never disappointed. Beds were comfortable, room was clean with washer/dryers and a full kitchen. Would I visit again? I would live here! Thanks for the hospitality
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really remarkable place that we stumbled on. Cozy atmosphere that had all the up to date amenities. Staff was very helpful and accomadating. Plan to us Locale in my future travels. Shops, restaurants, and HEB all within 5 minutes of the property. Looking for more than just a hotel stay, go Locale, you won't be disappointed.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely loved my stay in this apartment! The trendy touches and selection of hot sauce (for my bag, swag), were so lovely! I would highly recommend this stay, in a super hip location in East Austin. Checkin was a breeze, with photos to guide you to your door. The building felt secure and well kept, great for business travel. Would stay again!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a bit weary about not having a front desk to help but the phone and online staff was terrific. The location of the 2nd Street locale was perfect for my friends and me;an easy walk to most places and just across from bus stop.The unit was clean and spacious, the pool and gym were good and there is even free coffee in the lobby.We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was perfect and process was ease if you follow the instructions. Locale is located right in the center of Rainey Street where there's bar and restaurants. No need to drive it is walking distance. If you're picky about the noise might want to consider but it wasn't too bad. The apartment was clean and upgraded had washer and dryer for convenience. I highly recommend it.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There's no better place for me than the Locale on Rainey Street. The room is great- it's big, there's a kitchen and laundry. The building has parking so you're not fighting to park on the street.You can walk to a number of bars and restaurants on the block or it's a 5-10 minute walk to get down town.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This sunny apartment had great views, clean modern facilities and was well equipped with the necessities. Parking was easy and all enquiries were answered promptly. The only downer was the roof top pool, which was empty and a pleasure early morning, became a rowdy party on the weekend. There must have been at least 200 people in the area with about 50 standing in the pool. The location was fantastic and nearby restaurants highly recommended, esp Gurag mahal on Rainey if you enjoy Indian. It would be useful to inform potential guests that this is a very large, busy complex and many residents are permanent leasees. Overall, a great stay but would not be conducive to a family with small kids.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found Locale at the last minute of a planned trip to Austin, Texas. I am so happy I found them! Every aspect was top of the line! From the staff being so friendly and helpful, to the easy self check-in, to the apartment being so beautifully decorated. I truly felt at home and like a "local" during my stay. I hope Locale expands to other cities!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Locale on Lakeshore, the building and room were great and the local residents were super friendly (80% of them had dogs so I knew right away this place was going to be great.Location was good, tons of bars and amazing food around, and a very short and easy drive to most things in Austin. Neighborhood looks a bit sketchy but around the apartment itself we never felt unsafe. Parking is a bit of a hassle if you don't like walking or paying for parking. Would recommend shelling out the extra money if you can to park in the gated area. We did not and sometimes had to park on a street across from the actual building. Walk wasn't terrible distance wise, but Texas heat sucks.Room was clean except some wear in the bathtub, and was complete with a extra linens, super soft blanket, little box of condiments and tea, coffee filters, a tin of coffee, dishes, cleaning supplies, and detergent pods for the washer. The check in instructions were very clear, however some of the locks must be different for each room. For instance ours we had to re-enter the code to lock it from the outside when leaving, but the check in instructions had directions for a different type of lock. Not a lot in way of leaving instructions so we treated it like a normal hotel room.The staff were always super reachable via text or phone call and always responded. They even text to check up on you during your visit! I thought that was a very nice touch.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really loved the Stay at the Locale. Room was clean and neat, and check in and out was efficient and simple.But probably the nicest perk of all was the fact that the place is located RIGHT NEXT to a Austin Bcycle bycling sharing station. So you could get out, pick up a bike and get on your way.Pool was awsome too, on those warm days!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well, I don’t have time to describe the check in exactly. It’s done remotely via email. No physical presence of a person. Parking car; get into apartment to get key for your car park. Don’t forget to send rego plate. Different PIN numbers to get in and for apartment. We found it a hell of a palava! Apartment is lovely and location is ok. We overlooked freeway, double glazing welcome.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one night for business and three additional nights with my husband for our anniversary. You can't beat the location right on Rainey. It was lovely to have so much space to spread out as opposed to a traditional hotel room. The residents seemed mostly young and in their 20s...very friendly and helpful with recommendations. The pool area is beautiful, it is pretty busy up there so it's more fun than it is relaxing. Our apartment was very clean and well appointed. Justin at locale was in frequent text commmunication with me ensuring all my needs were accommodated. I appreciated the customer service and knowing if I needed anything, he was there to assist. The only opportunity for improvement would be to supply pool towels and a small cooler to bring beverages to the pool.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time in a Locale property, but it won’t be the last. The location was great, the apartment was excellent, and the customer support was outstanding. Well done, Locale! You hit it out of the park.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the beginning to the end, the apartment was awesome! Beautifully designed with an amazing balcony with seating and beautiful views! The bed was so comfy and I always have trouble falling asleep quickly, with this bed, I had no issues. They have games for you and your family to play, the tv was capable with Roku so you could log on to your Netfilx or Hulu account. They responded quickly to my texts and even left me a bottle of champagne for my birthday! They also have maintenance on call and they come quickly and are friendly. I could go on and on! It was definitely worth every penny and when I visit Austin again, I'm definitely coming back to the Locale!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this place was amazing the view and the treatment from staff was even better. If you needed any help they were one call or text away. The pool area was out of this world. I highly recommend staying at Locale
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Completely made the trip. Best location, unbelievably impressive apartment outfitted with all the necessities. (coffee/tea/blowdryer/qtips/towels/extra blankets/laundry detergent if you want to do laundry..) On the corner of Rainey!! What!! Really wish the weather was good enough to enjoy the rooftop pool...will definitely be back again.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved staying here pool was great, workout room was awesome and great amenities. We were in the perfect location to hit all the hot spots of Austin! There was coffee provided kitchen was great and deck!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, Perfect Hosts, and awesome personal touches!!! This is exactly where you want to be in Austin. Food, Music, People and they even throw in a few food trucks! I highly recommend Mini Donuts!!!
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location on Rainey Street. Easy to follow instructions provided to self check in and get access to the building and unit. Multiple texts making sure all was well. Unit was comfortable and has everything you need.
hotelName:
29    Locale Rainey Street

review_body: Right in Rainy Street. How awesome. We are not as young as many of the millennials but we had fun. Room was nice and very clean. Quiet as well. We did not spend a lot of time there as we were out and about. Roof top pool was super cool.

review_body: The location of the hotel, if you are in the Cedar Park area, is very good. Close to the freeway and toll and around much shopping and restaurants. There is a Sprouts nearby, if you are into health food. I was greeted warmly and made to feel I was expected and welcome. The check-in was quick. My room was large (actually looking like they had removed a second double bed to make room for the fairly comfortable king bed. In the corner was a small armless stuffed chair (not overstuffed and not a recliner), which looked very much out of place in that large area. The A/C was cold, good for Texas summer weather. The bathroom was a good size and probably in the last remodel, they removed the bathtub and replaced the area with a large shower. I really enjoyed this. There is a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. An ironing board and iron are in the closet behind the full-length mirror. There is an ice machine at the end of each corridor. I would have appreciated a bottle of water included but it was available downstairs for a modest price. The tap water is highly chlorinated. There is a business center with two computers off the lobby. I didn't have to use it so cannot tell you if there is any cost involved. There is an outdoors swimming pool. All-in-all, I enjoyed what little time I spent in the room and enjoyed the ease of access to the freeway and home. Still Austin traffic is terrible at any time of day; sadly, the hotel can't do anything about that except soothe your nerves once you arrive.
hotelName:
30    La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Austin NW/La...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Full disclosure: I'm not a fan of La Quinta. I feel their quality has been in decline for many years. However, I used Hotwire to get a cheap room for a quick trip to Austin, and when I saw I would be staying at a La Quinta, the first thing I did was to check TripAdvisor for their rating and reviews. Seeing the 4.5 overall rating and some complimentary recent reviews, I was feeling quite optimistic.While the address is in Austin, the hotel is located NNW of central Austin, so there is about a 20-25 minute drive into the downtown/Capitol/UT area, so keep that in mind. For me, it was a convenient location for my needs on this trip.When I arrived, I received a friendly greeting and quickly was on my way to my room. On entering, I noticed a musty, mildewy smell to it, but I assumed it would diminish after the AC was cranked up. On re-entering the room later that evening, I realized it had not faded, and it persisted throughout my visit. I can only assume that the AC filter had not been cleaned/changed in quite some time.The mildew smell was not the only problem with the room; it was definitely in need of some maintenance attention. The bathroom sink was missing the stopper, and the wallpaper in the bedroom was peeling. However, the most concerning issue was that the smoke detector was dangling from the ceiling by its wiring, and for whatever reason had been wrapped up in a plastic bag. I made the assumption that was the work of a frustrated prior guest, but nonetheless, it should never have been left in this condition. While other visitors have had better experiences at this La Quinta, I was disappointed.
hotelName:

review_body: I had a recent business trip to the northwest Austin suburbs. Booked through the Southwest Airlines site to score some reward points at the same time. The rate of $125/night was a very good value for this quiet clean property in a good part of town (suburbs). General property notes: Grocery stores and restaurants are easily close by and great highway access. A Target is across the street. Lakeline Mall is about 5 minutes drive and is an upscale mall. This hotel sits on a low hill and the parking lot does not form a perfect circle around it – it is more of a horseshoe shape so be aware of this when choosing a parking spot. There are no neighboring businesses next to the hotel.Front desk: Arriving mid-afternoon, Elliott checked me in quickly and with a warm smile. He was friendly and noted that my reservation was prepaid but put a small hold on my card for incidentals. This was expected but it was still a nice touch for him to quietly note it. He also volunteered the operating hours for the daily breakfast included for all rooms. Overall, he made a good first impression for the hotel!Room: The room (Room 303) is nicely sized and had two queen beds with firm mattresses and good bed linens and pillows. The bath had ample towels (bath, hand, and washcloth) for two people. The room carpet was recent, largely clean, and in good shape. The bath had recent tile in it, which is modern and attractive. Shower pressure was very good. Counter space in the bathroom was quite generous, the bowed shower rod was exceptional in making the shower feel roomy, and I liked the Pantene shower products.A few small annoyances: the room doors on our third floor tend to have a hard time closing due to building foundation shift. I noticed that the right sheer panel was ripped so this should be replaced. The upholstered chair in the corner has some major stains on it so this is a bit of a distraction to the overall positive of the room.Housekeeping: Kudos to the staff for a job well done. I’ve made a habit of bringing a spare pair of white socks to wear in room: both to test how clean the carpets are being kept as well as to prevent tracking dirt into bed. I’m happy to report that my socks were largely clean after a two-day stay. The trash was collected each day, the towels and bath supplies replaced, and the floors were swept/vacuumed.Free breakfast: The breakfast had all of the usual suspects on it that you find in American hotels. This hotel’s items were laid out nicely at 630 AM but I’ve also learned to arrive and eat early for maximum peace – then retreat to my room as the crowd battles it out before the closing of the breakfast feedbag. Hours are 6 AM to 9 AM daily. Overall, this property is a GREAT value: clean, decently maintained, good amenities for most travelers, and at a reasonable price despite some small details to fix. I would recommend staying here if you need to stay in the northwest suburbs of Austin.NOTE: If you found this review useful, could you click on the “thank you” button below? It helps me tailor reviews to include things that are useful to fellow travelers. Thank you!

review_body: I stayed for the weekend to watch a rugby tournament and do some local hiking with my senior large dog. What was so great about this hotel was the walking trail around the lake just a block from the hotel. Poop bags were available and people do use them because the path was very clean. Five minutes away is Brushy Creek trail which is a beutiful large park with easy walking trails and again, dog friendly on leash.

review_body: First night I came in I got bite by bed bugs and I barely sleep. I reported this on front desk and they told me they didn’t have additional rooms to change mine. Also they told me that they didn’t find any trace of bugs. My biggest dissapointment was that when I checked the bed, they didn’t even changed the sheets (I noticed it because the sheets had the same holes and stains in same places) When I reported this to front desk, they told me the manager wanted to talk with me in person the next day, the only think she was able to do is to give me new sheets set to change by myself. That day I got bite again. After complaining in the corporate website I got changed to a different room. I requested to change sheets every day just to make sure I don’t get bites again. After too weeks, the last day I found a dead bed bug in the bed. Took photos and sent them to the manager but never got not even an apology for this. Worst hotel experience ever specially after paying more than $1200+ for my stay.
